original: des smras pa /

analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na mna' ma dang sgyug mo dag gcig la gcig lus mnyed cing khrus byed pa'i tshe de gnyis gcig la gcig gsang ba'i gnas dag tu mtshan brtags na 'char bas smras pa bzhin du yod do //

analyzed: khyod kyang 'thab mo rgol zhing bsngo ba'am /

analyzed: skyes pa 'di lta bu dang 'di 'drar byed pa na ci zhes byas pa dang / de lta bu ni yongs ma byas so //
translated: ‘I never did such a thing!’

original: 'o na khyod kyi gsang ba'i bar na mtshan yod pa gzhan gyis ji ltar shes zhes byas pa dang / @89a * //
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi gsang ba'i bar na mtshan yod pa gzhan gyis ji ltar shes zhes byas pa dang / @89a * //
translated: ‘Well, how did someone else find out about your secret?’🔽‘Well, you did it with another man!’🔽“When they make up and become friendly again, they ask each other,

original: 'o na khyod kyis kyang skyes pa gzhan gyis shes so / nam phan tshun du bzod par byas te mdza' bar gyur pa de na khyod la 'di lta bu sus bstan ces gcig la gcig dris na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyis kyang skyes pa gzhan gyis shes so / nam phan tshun du bzod par byas te mdza' bar gyur pa de na khyod la 'di lta bu sus bstan ces gcig la gcig dris na /
translated: ‘Who taught you to do that?’

original: gnyi ga yang mthun te 'char bas bstan to zhes byas pa dang / de gnyis 'phya ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mthun te 'char bas bstan to zhes byas pa dang / de gnyis 'phya ste /

original: bdag cag ni 'char bas ched du bsams te 'thab tu bcug ste zhes smod cing mi snyan pa 'dzer to //
analyzed: bdag cag ni 'char bas ched du bsams te 'thab tu bcug ste zhes smod cing mi snyan pa 'dzer to //
translated: They ridiculed him, saying, We are the ones who brought it up, but you are the one who made us fight!🔽The householder asked, What is this monk like who brought it up?🔽The one who brought it up is a monk who is endowed with moral discipline. He knows the signs of women through the power of knowledge.

original: khyim bdag gis dge slong 'char ba ji lta bu zhes dris na 'char ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ste rig pa'i mthus bud med dag gi mtshan shes so zhes byas pa dang / ci 'phags pa de ltar shes su zin gyis kyang bud med kyi gsang ba'i gnas ngan len smra bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag gis dge slong 'char ba ji lta bu zhes dris na 'char ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ste rig pa'i mthus bud med dag gi mtshan shes so zhes byas pa dang / ci 'phags pa de ltar shes su zin gyis kyang bud med kyi gsang ba'i gnas ngan len smra bar mi rigs so //
translated: They ridiculed him, saying, Even if the noble one knows that, it is not right for him to speak of the impure secret places of women.

original: zhes 'phya bar snyan du bangs nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: zhes 'phya bar snyan du bangs nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Having heard this, he thought,

original: cung zad nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa yang dge slong bud med la chos bshad pa las byung ngo snyam du dogs nas /
analyzed: cung zad nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa yang dge slong bud med la chos bshad pa las byung ngo snyam du dogs nas /
translated: Even if it is a small fault, it is a fault that arises from monks teaching the doctrine to women.

original: dge slong bud med la chos ma 'chad cig ces bkag go //
analyzed: dge slong bud med la chos ma 'chad cig ces bkag go //
translated: Therefore, he prohibited it, saying, Monks should not teach the doctrine to women.

original: slad kyis dge slong dag bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / bud med dag gis chos bshad par gsol ba dang / dge slong dag gis chos ma bshad pas zan ma ster to //
analyzed: slad kyis dge slong dag bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / bud med dag gis chos bshad par gsol ba dang / dge slong dag gis chos ma bshad pas zan ma ster to //
translated: Later, when the monks went for alms, the women asked them to preach the Law, but the monks did not preach the Law and the women did not give them alms.

original: de lta bu snyan du bdas nas bka' stsal pa /🔽chos tshig lnga ste /
analyzed: de lta bu snyan du bdas nas bka' stsal pa / chos tshig lnga ste /
translated: The Buddha, informed of this,

original: phung po lnga bshad par gnang ngo //🔽slad kyis de bzhin du nyung zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: phung po lnga bshad par gnang ngo // slad kyis de bzhin du nyung zhes gsol nas /
translated: authorized them to preach the five parts of the Law.

original: dbang po drug ste tshig drug bshad par gnang ngo //
analyzed: dbang po drug ste tshig drug bshad par gnang ngo //
translated: The women asked for the six parts of the Law.🔽The Buddha authorized them to preach the six parts of the Law.🔽The women asked for more, and the Buddha authorized them to preach the Law without mentioning the six parts.🔽The six monks, without mentioning the six parts, preached the Law in a way that was too long, using similes of monkeys and birds.

original: tshig drug gis kyang mi chog gis da rung ston cig ces bskul ba dang / slad kyis rig pa'i skyes pa zhog la chos shod cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sdes rig pa'i skyes pa med bzhin du spre'u dang bya ba zhag nas tshig lnga drug las 'das par bshad pas na de ltar gyur pa la snyan du bdas nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: tshig drug gis kyang mi chog gis da rung ston cig ces bskul ba dang / slad kyis rig pa'i skyes pa zhog la chos shod cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sdes rig pa'i skyes pa med bzhin du spre'u dang bya ba zhag nas tshig lnga drug las 'das par bshad pas na de ltar gyur pa la snyan du bdas nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Buddha, informed of this, prohibited the monks from preaching the Law without mentioning the six parts and established the rule of training.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: “Bhikṣu” means the group of six bhikṣus.

original: gang gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Or another” means one who has entered this Dharma.

original: bud med ces bya ba ni legs nyes kyi don khong du chud cing don go bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba ni legs nyes kyi don khong du chud cing don go bar nus pa'o //
translated: “Woman” means one who understands the meaning of good and bad and is able to understand the meaning.

original: tshig lnga drug las 'das zhes bya ba ni chos tshig lnga bshad par gnang ba las bsams bzhin du drug tu 'das sam /
analyzed: tshig lnga drug las 'das zhes bya ba ni chos tshig lnga bshad par gnang ba las bsams bzhin du drug tu 'das sam /
translated: “More than five or six words” means that one is allowed to explain five words of the Dharma, but if one intentionally exceeds six,

original: chos tshig drug 'chad du gnang ba las bsams bzhin du tshig bdun du 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos tshig drug 'chad du gnang ba las bsams bzhin du tshig bdun du 'das pa'o //
translated: or one is allowed to explain six words of the Dharma, but if one intentionally exceeds seven words,

original: chos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'o //
translated: “Dharma” means what is explained by the Buddha.

original: ston ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: ston ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: “To teach” means to explain.

original: rig pa'i skyes pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni skyes pa gan na yod pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni skyes pa gan na yod pa'o //
translated: “Except in the case of a learned woman” means in the presence of a man.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Downfall” is as before.

original: nyes pa ni bsams bzhin du @89b tshig lnga drug las 'das sa ma rig pa'i skyes pa med par bshad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bsams bzhin du @89b tshig lnga drug las 'das sa ma rig pa'i skyes pa med par bshad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Fault” means that if one intentionally exceeds five or six words and explains without a learned woman being present, one commits a downfall.

original: mkhas pa phyi phyir dri ba la lan ldon pa dang khrims dbog pa dang kha don la sogs pa ni ma gtogs te rig pa'i skyes pa med par bshad kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa phyi phyir dri ba la lan ldon pa dang khrims dbog pa dang kha don la sogs pa ni ma gtogs te rig pa'i skyes pa med par bshad kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it is not a downfall if a scholar answers questions, gives teachings, or recites texts, and so forth, for the sake of others.

original: ha cang myur ches te tshig thal ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ha cang myur ches te tshig thal ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: It is not a downfall if one speaks too quickly and the words are unclear.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang / cig car chos kyi tshig gis glog tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang / cig car chos kyi tshig gis glog tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the Buddha’s prohibition against reciting the scriptures aloud in the presence of those who have not yet received full ordination took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde rnams bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gcig na chos kyi tshig cig car klog pas skye bo mang po'i sgra mang po tsha tshig bton pa ni dper na bram ze smrang klog pa'am skar mkhan grangs
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde rnams bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gcig na chos kyi tshig cig car klog pas skye bo mang po'i sgra mang po tsha tshig bton pa ni dper na bram ze smrang klog pa'am skar mkhan grangs
translated: At that time, the group of six monks recited the scriptures aloud in the presence of those who had not yet received full ordination. The sound of their recitation was like the cacophony of many voices reciting scriptures or the loud noise of a crowd of people, like the sound of a crowd of people at a festival, or like the sound of a crowd of people counting or the sound of a crowd of people reciting the Vedas.

original: bgrang ba bzhin du sgra chen po grag pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: bgrang ba bzhin du sgra chen po grag pa snyan du bdas te /
translated: The sound of their recitation was so loud that it was heard far away.

original: cig car gdon du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: cig car gdon du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: and not to be given simultaneously.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: “Any bhikṣu” refers to the group of six.

original: gang gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: And also any other who has entered into this Dharma.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag ces bya ba ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma zhes bya ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad do //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag ces bya ba ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma zhes bya ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad do //
translated: “A person who has not completed the preliminary service” means all except the bhikṣu and bhikṣuṇī.

original: tshig ces bya ba ni tshig 'dra ba dang thal ba dang / yi ge mnyam pa dang thal ba'o //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni tshig 'dra ba dang thal ba dang / yi ge mnyam pa dang thal ba'o //
translated: “Words” means similar words, extended words, and equal letters and extended letters.

original: tshig mnyam pa ji lta bu zhe na /🔽slob dpon gyis sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o zhes byas pa dang / slob mas kyang de bzhin du smras pa ni tshig mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: tshig mnyam pa ji lta bu zhe na / slob dpon gyis sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o zhes byas pa dang / slob mas kyang de bzhin du smras pa ni tshig mnyam pa'o //
translated: What are equal words?🔽The preceptor says, “Do not commit any evil,” and the student also says, “Do not commit any evil.” This is equal words.

original: tshig thal ba ni slob dpon gyis sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o zhes ma rdzogs par slob mas dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
analyzed: tshig thal ba ni slob dpon gyis sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o zhes ma rdzogs par slob mas dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
translated: Extended words are when the preceptor says, “Do not commit any evil,” but before he finishes, the student says, “Do good completely.” This is extended words.

original: yi ge mnyam pa ni aa zhes bya ba tshig mnyam du ston pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge mnyam pa ni aa zhes bya ba tshig mnyam du ston pa'o //
translated: The equal letters are the same word, such as “a.”

original: yi ge thal ba ni aa zhes ma rdzogs par aa zhes sngar rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge thal ba ni aa zhes ma rdzogs par aa zhes sngar rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The missing letters are the same letter, such as “a” and “ā.”

original: chos zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The Dharma is any of the three scriptural collections.

original: slob dpon gyis sngar byas nas slob mas phyis byas pa dang kha ton du bton pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis sngar byas nas slob mas phyis byas pa dang kha ton du bton pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: If the master does it first and the student does it later, or if they recite together, there is no offense.

original: nyes pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs par 'du shes bzhin du klog na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs par 'du shes bzhin du klog na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is that if you recite while perceiving someone as not fully admitted to the monk’s level when they are, you commit an offense.

original: the tshom yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: the tshom yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true if you have doubts.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la ma rdzogs par 'du shes na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la ma rdzogs par 'du shes na nyes byas so //
translated: If you perceive someone who is fully admitted to the monk’s level as not being so, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag la gnas ngan len gyis nyes pa brjod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag la gnas ngan len gyis nyes pa brjod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the prohibition against criticizing a person who is not fully admitted to the monk’s level for their moral failings took place in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa dag nyes pa rtag tu 'byung ba dang slad kyis dge slong mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dag las ltung ba'i chos rnams @90a * //
analyzed: dge slong 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa dag nyes pa rtag tu 'byung ba dang slad kyis dge slong mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dag las ltung ba'i chos rnams @90a * //
translated: Monks who are not free from desire and have not abandoned the afflictions are always committing faults.🔽Later, monks who uphold the sūtras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā listen to the teachings on downfalls from those who uphold the sūtras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā. They make those who have committed downfalls amend them in accordance with the teachings.

original: mnyan nas de dag ltung ba chos bzhin du slar byed du bcug pa dang / de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu skra dang / sen mo'i mchod rten la zhal zhal dang dkyil 'khor byed pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan dag la yang chu 'drim zhing bsil yab g-yob pa'i tshe dge slong drug sde dang gzhon nu dag de lta bu'i las mi byed cing 'khod pa dang /
analyzed: mnyan nas de dag ltung ba chos bzhin du slar byed du bcug pa dang / de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu skra dang / sen mo'i mchod rten la zhal zhal dang dkyil 'khor byed pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan dag la yang chu 'drim zhing bsil yab g-yob pa'i tshe dge slong drug sde dang gzhon nu dag de lta bu'i las mi byed cing 'khod pa dang /
translated: They plaster and make maṇḍalas at stūpas of the Tathāgata’s hair and nails, and when they distribute water and wave yak-tail whisks for the elder monks, the group of six monks and the young monks do not do such work.

original: khyim bdag dang bram ze rnams dge slong gnas brtan dag ni khyed dang mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag dang bram ze rnams dge slong gnas brtan dag ni khyed dang mi 'dra ste /
translated: The householders and brahmins say, “Elder monks, you are not like them.

original: dad pa che zhing dge ba la brtson no zhes byas pa dang / drug sde po na re de dag ni dad pa ma yin gyi chad pa'i las byed de /🔽de dag gis nyes pa 'di lta bu 'di dag byas so zhes lag brda bstan pa dang / khyim bdag gis dge slong gnas brtan rgan po dag kyang 'di lta bu'i nyes pa byung zhing 'dod chags skye na dge slong gsar bu gzhan lta zhig ci smos zhes 'phya ba dang dge slong drug sde dag dge slong gsar bu dag la khyed kyi mkhan po ga
analyzed: dad pa che zhing dge ba la brtson no zhes byas pa dang / drug sde po na re de dag ni dad pa ma yin gyi chad pa'i las byed de / de dag gis nyes pa 'di lta bu 'di dag byas so zhes lag brda bstan pa dang / khyim bdag gis dge slong gnas brtan rgan po dag kyang 'di lta bu'i nyes pa byung zhing 'dod chags skye na dge slong gsar bu gzhan lta zhig ci smos zhes 'phya ba dang dge slong drug sde dag dge slong gsar bu dag la khyed kyi mkhan po ga
translated: The group of six said, “That is not faith. They are acting out of fear.🔽They are showing you their hands in the gesture of supplication, saying, ‘We have committed such and such faults.’ ”🔽The householder said, “If such faults occur and attachment arises even for elder and senior monks, what need is there to speak of young monks?”

original: re zhes dris na /
analyzed: re zhes dris na /
translated: The group of six said to the young monks, “What is your preceptor like?”

original: de dag na re khyed dang mi 'dra ste //
analyzed: de dag na re khyed dang mi 'dra ste //
translated: The young monks said, “He is not like you.

original: mchod rten dang gnas brtan dag la mchod pa byed du song ngo zhes byas pa dang drug sde dag na re de dag ni dad pa'i phyir mchod pa byed pa ma yin gyi chad pas bcad de chad pa'i las byed pa'o zhes smras pa dang /
analyzed: mchod rten dang gnas brtan dag la mchod pa byed du song ngo zhes byas pa dang drug sde dag na re de dag ni dad pa'i phyir mchod pa byed pa ma yin gyi chad pas bcad de chad pa'i las byed pa'o zhes smras pa dang /
translated: The six said, “They are not making offerings out of faith, but are making offerings because they are punished and have been assigned this work.”

original: de dag gis mkhan po dag la ma dad cing spang bar 'gyur ba dang mkhan pos khyed su las thos zhes smras pa dang drug sde las so zhes smras pas /
analyzed: de dag gis mkhan po dag la ma dad cing spang bar 'gyur ba dang mkhan pos khyed su las thos zhes smras pa dang drug sde las so zhes smras pas /
translated: The novices said to their preceptors, “We are not faithful and will be expelled.” The preceptors asked, “Who told you this?” They replied, “The group of six.”

original: de dag mi dga' bar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de dag mi dga' bar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The preceptors were displeased and reported this to the ear of the Buddha, who established a rule.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means the group of six and others like them.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma gnyis ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad do //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma gnyis ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad do //
translated: “Not fully ordained” means all except fully ordained monks and nuns.

original: gnas ngan len ces bya ba ni phas pham pa las byung ba dang lhag ma las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ces bya ba ni phas pham pa las byung ba dang lhag ma las byung ba'o //
translated: “Bad behavior” means that which arises from a defeating offense and that which arises from a residual offense.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gnang ba bkol ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gnang ba bkol ba'o //
translated: Except with the permission of the community means except with the permission of the community.

original: mnyan du yod pa na dge slong 'phral po che dang dge slong ma drang mo grong de dag tu log par spyad pas skye bo de dag mi dga' bar gyur pas na de dag gi nyes pa rigs so sor rig par byed cing bsgo ba ni ma gtogs
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa na dge slong 'phral po che dang dge slong ma drang mo grong de dag tu log par spyad pas skye bo de dag mi dga' bar gyur pas na de dag gi nyes pa rigs so sor rig par byed cing bsgo ba ni ma gtogs
translated: In Śrāvastī, a monk who was a libertine and a nun who was a deceiver had sex in that village. The people were displeased. Therefore, except for the case of their faults being known individually and their being expelled,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is the same as before.

original: nyes pa gang zhe na dge slong gis so sor rig par mi bya bar 'du shes bzhin du so sor rig par ma byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa gang zhe na dge slong gis so sor rig par mi bya bar 'du shes bzhin du so sor rig par ma byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the fault? If a monk, perceiving that he should not know something individually, does not know it individually, he commits an offense.

original: the tshom na yang ngo //
analyzed: the tshom na yang ngo //
translated: If he has doubts, he also commits an offense.

original: dge slong gis yang so sor rig par bya ba'i rigs rnams la so sor rig @90b par bya ba ma yin par 'du shes sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis yang so sor rig par bya ba'i rigs rnams la so sor rig @90b par bya ba ma yin par 'du shes sam /
translated: If a monk, perceiving that he should know something individually,

original: the tshom bzhin du so sor rig par byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom bzhin du so sor rig par byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he has doubts, and he knows it individually, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis nyes pa dril brdungs pa bzhin du kun gyis shes pa 'am ri mor bris pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis nyes pa dril brdungs pa bzhin du kun gyis shes pa 'am ri mor bris pa lta bu'am /
translated: There is no offense if the monk is known by all to be like a bell that announces faults, or like a painting,

original: bdag gis shes pa bzhin du 'jig rten gzhan gyis shes pa la ni brjod kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag gis shes pa bzhin du 'jig rten gzhan gyis shes pa la ni brjod kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: or if the world knows him as if he were oneself.

original: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i bden pa smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul yangs pa can spre'u rdzing gi 'gram na'o //
analyzed: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i bden pa smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul yangs pa can spre'u rdzing gi 'gram na'o //
translated: The basis for the rule that prohibits speaking of the truth that is beyond human norms is in the region of Vaishali, on the banks of the Monkey Pond.

original: de na gnas pa'i nya pa lnga brgya po rnams 'bad brtson rtsol bas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom par gyur to //
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i nya pa lnga brgya po rnams 'bad brtson rtsol bas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom par gyur to //
translated: Five hundred fishermen who lived there abandoned all afflictive emotions through great effort and became arhats.

original: de dag sngon mu ge byung ba'i tshe na ni yon tan med bzhin du smras pas phas pham par bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: de dag sngon mu ge byung ba'i tshe na ni yon tan med bzhin du smras pas phas pham par bslab pa bcas so //
translated: In the past, during a famine, they had lied about their qualities and had been given the downfall of a root downfall.

original: 'dir ni bden pa mthong bas na mi'i chos las gyur pa'i bden pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las smras na ltung bar bcas te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bden pa mthong bas na mi'i chos las gyur pa'i bden pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las smras na ltung bar bcas te /
translated: Here, because they had seen the truth, they were given the downfall of speaking of the truth that is beyond human norms to those who had not yet received full ordination.

original: brdzun gyi pham pa ji skad zer ba bzhin du sbyor cig //
analyzed: brdzun gyi pham pa ji skad zer ba bzhin du sbyor cig //
translated: The defeat of lying is to be applied as it is stated.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nya pa lnga brgya ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nya pa lnga brgya ste /
translated: The one called monk is the five hundred fishermen.

original: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: And also those who have entered this Dharma.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The one not fully ordained is as before.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams las gzugs kyi khams bla ma'o //
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams las gzugs kyi khams bla ma'o //
translated: The higher is the form realm higher than the desire realm.

original: 'di ltar sgrib pa lnga ni mi'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrib pa lnga ni mi'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus the five hindrances are called human dharmas.

original: de lnga spangs pa bla ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lnga spangs pa bla ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of those five is called higher.

original: smras zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: smras zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba'o //
translated: To say is to command.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dngos po bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dngos po bden pa'o //
translated: The truth is the true nature of that.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The downfall is as before.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gi 'du shes pa dang / bzod pa dang lta ba ma sbas par lha mthong klu mthong de dag gi sgra thos te /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gi 'du shes pa dang / bzod pa dang lta ba ma sbas par lha mthong klu mthong de dag gi sgra thos te /
translated: The fault is the perception of a monk, and the non-concealment of acceptance and view, hearing the sounds of those who see gods and see nagas,

original: sgra bcom pa nas lha'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sgra bcom pa nas lha'i bar du ste /
translated: from the sound-conquerors up to the gods.

original: de dag mthong ngo zhe'am 'grogs so zhe na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mthong ngo zhe'am 'grogs so zhe na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says, I see them or I associate with them, there is a downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang zag mdza' ba'i phyir bsngos so zhes zer ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang zag mdza' ba'i phyir bsngos so zhes zer ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
translated: The story of the monk who said, “I dedicate the Sangha’s property to my friend” took place in Rajagrha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dge 'dun gyi mal stan 'gyed pa dang zas la bsko bar bskos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dge 'dun gyi mal stan 'gyed pa dang zas la bsko bar bskos te /
translated: At that time, the monk Jivaka was in charge of assigning beds and seats to the Sangha and of assigning meals.

original: gyad bu nor yang dag la bsams pa dge bas na dge 'dun la chos bzhin du zhal ta gus par byed nas /
analyzed: gyad bu nor yang dag la bsams pa dge bas na dge 'dun la chos bzhin du zhal ta gus par byed nas /
translated: Jivaka was a good man. He respectfully served the Sangha in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dkon mchog gsum mam grogs po mdza' ba la ma byin pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum mam grogs po mdza' ba la ma byin pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: He did not keep anything for himself, not even the smallest thing, whether it belonged to the Three Jewels or to his friends.

original: de ltar dbul zhing sbyin pas na rang gi chos gos smad gsum ngan zhing zhig par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar dbul zhing sbyin pas na rang gi chos gos smad gsum ngan zhing zhig par gyur to //
translated: Because he was so generous, his three robes were worn out.

original: de nas dge 'dun rnams kyis bgros pa /
analyzed: de nas dge 'dun rnams kyis bgros pa /
translated: The Sangha discussed this.

original: nam dge 'dun gyis rnyed pa gos shig grub na gyad bu nor la sbyin no zhes snyan du zhus nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: nam dge 'dun gyis rnyed pa gos shig grub na gyad bu nor la sbyin no zhes snyan du zhus nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Whenever the Sangha gets any cloth, we will give it to Jivaka.”

original: phyis rtsod cing 'khrug par mi 'gyur bar dge 'dun spyir gsol ba byos @91a * //
analyzed: phyis rtsod cing 'khrug par mi 'gyur bar dge 'dun spyir gsol ba byos @91a * //
translated: They asked the Buddha, who said, “You must ask the Sangha.

original: shig ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: shig ces 'byung ste /
translated: The text reads śik.

original: de bzhin du dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba byas te byin na phyis mdza' bo dang sa can na re dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa khyed cag gi slob ma mdza' ba la byin no zhes zer nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba byas te byin na phyis mdza' bo dang sa can na re dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa khyed cag gi slob ma mdza' ba la byin no zhes zer nas /
translated: Similarly, if the Saṅgha, having made a motion, gives it to a friend, and later the friend and the benefactor say, You gave the Saṅgha's property to your disciple, a friend,

original: dge slong dag gis de gnyis la khyed gnyis de'i tshe na der ma gtogs sam zhes byas na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis de gnyis la khyed gnyis de'i tshe na der ma gtogs sam zhes byas na /
translated: the monks ask those two, Were you not included at that time?

original: nged kyang der 'dus so //
analyzed: nged kyang der 'dus so //
translated: They say, We were also included.

original: 'o na khyed ci'i phyir 'phya /
analyzed: 'o na khyed ci'i phyir 'phya /
translated: Then why do you complain?🔽 They say, Are we not allowed to grieve?

original: ci nged cag kyang mya ngan byed du yang mi gnang ngam zhes byas pa dang / dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas 'dul ba bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: ci nged cag kyang mya ngan byed du yang mi gnang ngam zhes byas pa dang / dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas 'dul ba bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The monks complain, and the training rule is recited.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can te gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can te gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: A monk means Mitrāvasu, and so on.

original: sngar mthun te rung bar byas zhes bya ba ni sngar tshogs pas mthun par byin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar mthun te rung bar byas zhes bya ba ni sngar tshogs pas mthun par byin pa'o //
translated: Having previously agreed means having previously given it to the assembly.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na'o //
translated: Later means at a later time.

original: 'di ltar mdza' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdza' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdza' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdza' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by because of friendship?

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gnas 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gnas 'cha' ba'o //
translated: A preceptor and a teacher are established.

original: lhan cig gnas pa ni mkhan po'o //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa ni mkhan po'o //
translated: A co-resident is a preceptor.

original: slob dpon gcig pa yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gcig pa yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: A teacher is also like that.

original: rnyed pa ni gnyis te gos dang zas te /
analyzed: rnyed pa ni gnyis te gos dang zas te /
translated: There are two kinds of gain: robes and food.

original: 'dir gos la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gos la bya'o //
translated: Here it refers to robes.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as before.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis sngar mthun te rung bar byas la de'i 'og tu tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar mdza' ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa gang zag bdag gir bsngos so zhes zer na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis sngar mthun te rung bar byas la de'i 'og tu tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar mdza' ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa gang zag bdag gir bsngos so zhes zer na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault is that if a monk first agrees and then says, Because of friendship, the gain dedicated to the Saṅgha is dedicated to me, then in all cases there is an offense.

original: mdza' ba'i phyir bsngos pa bden na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mdza' ba'i phyir bsngos pa bden na nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is true that it was dedicated because of friendship, there is no offense.

original: bslab pa khyed du gsod pa'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: bslab pa khyed du gsod pa'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The origin story of the training rule on dedicating to oneself.🔽In Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong drug sde rnams zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo bstan pa 'don pa'i tshe phas pham pa yan chad 'don pa'i tshe na ni cang mi smra bar 'khod cing dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rtag tu byung bas na lhag ma man chad gdon
analyzed: dge slong drug sde rnams zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo bstan pa 'don pa'i tshe phas pham pa yan chad 'don pa'i tshe na ni cang mi smra bar 'khod cing dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rtag tu byung bas na lhag ma man chad gdon
translated: When the group of six monks recited the Pratimoksha Sutra every half month, when they recited the rules of the Patanyasa, they remained silent.

original: pa 'don pa'i tshe 'di skad zer te /
analyzed: pa 'don pa'i tshe 'di skad zer te /
translated: When they recited the rules of the Sanghashhe sa, they said,🔽“Venerable ones, what is the use of reciting these minor rules every half month?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bslab pa'i gnas phran tshegs 'di lta bu zla ba phyed phyed cing gdon ci dgos dge slong rnams zhum pa dang bag 'khums par gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bslab pa'i gnas phran tshegs 'di lta bu zla ba phyed phyed cing gdon ci dgos dge slong rnams zhum pa dang bag 'khums par gyur te /
translated: The monks became discouraged and timid.

original: rma rub pa kun phyis gzhig ci dgos /
analyzed: rma rub pa kun phyis gzhig ci dgos /
translated: What is the use of reopening all the wounds that have healed?

original: nyes pa kha cig ni bshags kha cig ma bshags pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nyes pa kha cig ni bshags kha cig ma bshags pa yang yod de /
translated: Some of the faults have been confessed and some have not.🔽Since you have brought them up, we have become doubtful.”

original: khyod kyis de dag glengs pas na bdag cag the tshom du gyur to zhes bslab pa la smod cing khyad du gsod pa dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: khyod kyis de dag glengs pas na bdag cag the tshom du gyur to zhes bslab pa la smod cing khyad du gsod pa dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: They disparaged and slighted the precepts. The monks reported this to the Buddha and he established the training rule on the Vinaya.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “A certain monk” means the group of six, and others like them.

original: zla ba @91b phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa nas rtsod pa zhi ba'i bar du gdon pa lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba @91b phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa nas rtsod pa zhi ba'i bar du gdon pa lnga la bya'o //
translated: “Reciting the Prātimokṣa Sūtra every half month” means reciting the five parts of the Prātimokṣa, from the defeating offenses to the settling of disputes.

original: bslab pa'i tshig phran tshegs gdon ci dgos zhes zer ba ni bslab pa spong pa'i rtags sna tshogs smra ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i tshig phran tshegs gdon ci dgos zhes zer ba ni bslab pa spong pa'i rtags sna tshogs smra ba'o //
translated: “What is the point of reciting the minor training rules?” means speaking in various ways to reject the training.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽phas pham pa bzhi 'don pa'i tshe gdon ci dgos zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no // phas pham pa bzhi 'don pa'i tshe gdon ci dgos zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is as before.🔽If you say, “What is the point of reciting the four defeating offenses?” it is an offense.

original: lhag ma dang nyes byas kyi bar du gdon ci dgos zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma dang nyes byas kyi bar du gdon ci dgos zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say, “What is the point of reciting the remaining rules, down to the minor downfalls?” it is an offense.

original: de bzhin du 'dul ba dngos po dang phran tshegs dang / gzhung bla ma dang / 'dul ba snga ma dang / bcu drug pa dang / 'grel pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'dul ba lta bu'i rnams gdon pa'i tshe gdon ci dgos zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dul ba dngos po dang phran tshegs dang / gzhung bla ma dang / 'dul ba snga ma dang / bcu drug pa dang / 'grel pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'dul ba lta bu'i rnams gdon pa'i tshe gdon ci dgos zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if one says, “What need is there to recite the Vinaya, the Kṣudraka, the Uttaragrantha, the Vinaya of the past, the Vinaya of the present, the Vinaya of the future, the Vinaya of the sixteen, the commentary, the nidāna, and the Vinaya?” it is an offense.

original: 'dul ba dang mi ldan pa mdo sde la khyad du gsod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mi ldan pa mdo sde la khyad du gsod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one disparages the sūtras because one does not have the Vinaya, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: brdzun gyi tshogs bcu phung dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: brdzun gyi tshogs bcu phung dang po rdzogs so /
translated: The first collection of the ten on lying is complete.

original: // / shing gcod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: // / shing gcod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against cutting trees is in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na sngon shing mkhan las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong rgan zhugs blun po mi mkhas mi gsal ba gcig gis lha gnas pa'i shing zhig bcad de gtsug lag khang bgyis pa dang / lha de yang rang gi gnas dang rten ma mchis pas srod la bcom ldan 'das kyi snyan du gsol te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na sngon shing mkhan las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong rgan zhugs blun po mi mkhas mi gsal ba gcig gis lha gnas pa'i shing zhig bcad de gtsug lag khang bgyis pa dang / lha de yang rang gi gnas dang rten ma mchis pas srod la bcom ldan 'das kyi snyan du gsol te /
translated: At that time, an old, foolish, ignorant, and unclear monk who had previously been a woodcutter cut down a tree inhabited by a god, built a temple, and the god, having no place or support of his own, complained to the Blessed One in the evening.

original: btsun pa deng song dgun gyi dus la bab ste shing gi yal ga yang gas pa tsam du rlung ldang ste /
analyzed: btsun pa deng song dgun gyi dus la bab ste shing gi yal ga yang gas pa tsam du rlung ldang ste /
translated: The monk said, Lord, now that it is winter, the wind blows so hard that it seems to break the branches of the trees.

original: bdag gis byis pa ni phra bas gnas kyang ma mchis na ji ltar bgyi zhes gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha gzhan zhig la lha de'i gnas byin cig par gtad nas de'i phyi de nyin mo dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus te de'i rgyus zhib tu smras nas shing gcod du mi gnang bar stsal ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gis byis pa ni phra bas gnas kyang ma mchis na ji ltar bgyi zhes gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha gzhan zhig la lha de'i gnas byin cig par gtad nas de'i phyi de nyin mo dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus te de'i rgyus zhib tu smras nas shing gcod du mi gnang bar stsal ba dang /
translated: Since my child is small, he has no place to stay. What should I do? The Blessed One ordered another god to give the monk his abode. The next day, the Blessed One gathered the community of monks and, after explaining the situation in detail, he decreed that trees should not be cut down.

original: 'brog skyes kyi 'brog dgon pa na dge slong las sar pa bdag las mi byed de snyan du bdas nas da slan chad las sar pa'i dge slong gis zhag bdun nam brgyad kyi sngon rol nas shing gi drung du dkyil 'khor dang gtor ma dang mchod pa byas
analyzed: 'brog skyes kyi 'brog dgon pa na dge slong las sar pa bdag las mi byed de snyan du bdas nas da slan chad las sar pa'i dge slong gis zhag bdun nam brgyad kyi sngon rol nas shing gi drung du dkyil 'khor dang gtor ma dang mchod pa byas
translated: In the forest of Aḍavaka, the monk Asara did not work and was reprimanded. From now on, a monk who is an Asara should make a mandala, bali, and offering in front of a tree seven or eight days before,

original: nas chos bshad de gdod shing gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: nas chos bshad de gdod shing gcad par bya'o //
translated: explain the Dharma, and then cut down the tree.

original: mtshan ma lta bu byung na gcod du mi gnang zhes gsungs te de'i tshe bslab pha ma bcas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma lta bu byung na gcod du mi gnang zhes gsungs te de'i tshe bslab pha ma bcas so //
translated: It is said that if one has signs of that, one is not permitted to cut. At that time, the precepts were compiled.🔽Later, in Śrāvastī, the group of six monks themselves cut wood, grass, and flowers with their own hands, or had them cut.

original: phyis mnyan du yod pa na dge slong drug sde rnams rang gi lag gis shing dang rtsva dang me tog rnams rnga'am rngar 'jug / gcod dam gcod du 'jug pas na phyi'i mu stegs rnams 'phya bas @92a * //
analyzed: phyis mnyan du yod pa na dge slong drug sde rnams rang gi lag gis shing dang rtsva dang me tog rnams rnga'am rngar 'jug / gcod dam gcod du 'jug pas na phyi'i mu stegs rnams 'phya bas @92a * //
translated: Since the non-Buddhist tīrthikas criticized them,

original: snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: snyan du bdas te /
translated: they reported it to the ear of the Blessed One.

original: sa bon gyi tshogs nas 'byung po'i gnas 'jig tu mi gnang bar bcas /
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshogs nas 'byung po'i gnas 'jig tu mi gnang bar bcas /
translated: The Blessed One did not permit the destruction of the abode of beings from the collection of seeds.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: The monk refers to the group of six.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: And also to others like them.

original: sa bon la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sa bon la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of seeds:

original: rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong po'i sa bon dang / mgo thogs kyi sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon dang lnga'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong po'i sa bon dang / mgo thogs kyi sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon dang lnga'o //
translated: root seeds, stem seeds, joint seeds, cutting seeds, and seed seeds.

original: rtsa ba'i sa bon ni gla sgang dang shu dag dang yung ba rong dang sge'u gsher dang gzhan yang rtsa ba btsugs pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sa bon ni gla sgang dang shu dag dang yung ba rong dang sge'u gsher dang gzhan yang rtsa ba btsugs pa las skye ba'o //
translated: The root seed is the seed of the root, such as ginger, sweet flag, turmeric, and the like.🔽The stem seed is the seed of the stem, such as sugarcane, bamboo, and the like.🔽The joint seed is the seed of the joint, such as the reed and the like.

original: sdong po'i sa bon ni bu ram shing 'od ma dang / lcang ma dang / gzhan yang sdong bu las skyes pa rnams so //🔽mgo thogs kyi sa bon btab pa las skyes par gyur pa'o //🔽bkas pa'i sa bon ni 'jam byi ra dang ga gon dang / kham rtseg la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdong po'i sa bon ni bu ram shing 'od ma dang / lcang ma dang / gzhan yang sdong bu las skyes pa rnams so // mgo thogs kyi sa bon btab pa las skyes par gyur pa'o // bkas pa'i sa bon ni 'jam byi ra dang ga gon dang / kham rtseg la sogs pa'o //
translated: The seed seed is the seed of the seed, such as the sesame seed and the like.🔽The hidden seed is the seed of the hidden, such as the fig tree and the like.

original: sa bon gyi sa bon ni nas 'bras dang khre la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi sa bon ni nas 'bras dang khre la sogs pa'o //
translated: The seed of the seed is the seed of the grain, such as rice, barley, wheat, and the like.🔽The abode of beings is the abode of beings, such as insects, butterflies, snakes, and lizards. If one destroys, uproots, or cuts down their abode, the tree, one commits a transgression.

original: 'byung po'i gnas zhes bya ba ni srin bu dang / phye ma leb dang sprul dang tree la ta ka la sogs pa ni 'byung po zhes bya ste de dag shing la gnas pas na de dag gi gnas bshig gam phyung ngam bcad na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o// de la gong ma'i sa bon rnam pa lnga po
analyzed: 'byung po'i gnas zhes bya ba ni srin bu dang / phye ma leb dang sprul dang tree la ta ka la sogs pa ni 'byung po zhes bya ste de dag shing la gnas pas na de dag gi gnas bshig gam phyung ngam bcad na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o// de la gong ma'i sa bon rnam pa lnga po
translated: The five higher seeds are the seeds of the five higher seeds.

original: las rtsa ba'i sa bon du 'du shes la //
analyzed: las rtsa ba'i sa bon du 'du shes la //
translated: The root of the action is the seed.

original: sngo la sngon por 'du shes de bcad dam bcad du bcug na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngo la sngon por 'du shes de bcad dam bcad du bcug na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cuts or has cut a green plant, thinking that it is green, one commits an offense.

original: sngo ba la the tshom du gyur na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngo ba la the tshom du gyur na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is in doubt as to whether it is green, one commits an offense.

original: skam po la sngo bar 'du shes te bcad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skam po la sngo bar 'du shes te bcad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is dry, but one thinks it is green, and cuts it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: the tshom la yang ngo //🔽ji ltar rtsa ba'i sa bon la rnam pa bzhir sbyar ba bzhin du sa bon lhag ma bzhi po la yang rnam pa bzhir sbyor cig / dge slong gis sa bon rnam pa bzhi po la mer bsregs te ma rung bar gyur tam /
analyzed: the tshom la yang ngo // ji ltar rtsa ba'i sa bon la rnam pa bzhir sbyar ba bzhin du sa bon lhag ma bzhi po la yang rnam pa bzhir sbyor cig / dge slong gis sa bon rnam pa bzhi po la mer bsregs te ma rung bar gyur tam /
translated: The same if one is in doubt.🔽As one applies the four alternatives to the root seed, so one should apply them to the four remaining seeds.

original: chur bor te ma rung ngam gtun gyi nang du brdungs te ma rung bar gyur na yang ltung ba lnga dang nyes byas lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chur bor te ma rung ngam gtun gyi nang du brdungs te ma rung bar gyur na yang ltung ba lnga dang nyes byas lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk burns the four kinds of seeds with fire, or spoils them with water, or pounds them with a hammer, he commits five offenses and five offenses of wrong conduct.

original: sa bon rnam pa lnga pos skam po la gzhag gam khu ba tsha bas blugs shing gis drud de snad par byas na yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon rnam pa lnga pos skam po la gzhag gam khu ba tsha bas blugs shing gis drud de snad par byas na yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If one plants a seed in dry earth, or if one pours hot liquid on it, or if one pulls it up with a hoe, or if one damages it, it is as before.

original: dge slong gis thabs gcig gis shing gcig bcad na nyes byas kyang gcig ltung ba yang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis thabs gcig gis shing gcig bcad na nyes byas kyang gcig ltung ba yang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk cuts down a tree with one method, there is one offense of wrong conduct and one downfall.

original: thabs gcig gis shing mang du bcad na nyes byas gcig dang ltung ba mang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs gcig gis shing mang du bcad na nyes byas gcig dang ltung ba mang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he cuts down many trees with one method, there is one offense of wrong conduct and many downfalls.

original: ji ltar thabs gcig dang gnyis sam gsum pa'am thabs mang po yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar thabs gcig dang gnyis sam gsum pa'am thabs mang po yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: As with one or two methods, so it is with three or many methods.

original: me tog dang lo ma dang shing gi yal ga yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar @92b te sngon po bcad na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: me tog dang lo ma dang shing gi yal ga yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar @92b te sngon po bcad na ltung ba'o //
translated: Flowers, leaves, and tree branches are to be applied as above. If one cuts down a green tree, it is a downfall.

original: skom po ni nyes byas so //🔽chu'i nang nas skam po phyi rol tu phyung ngam /
analyzed: skom po ni nyes byas so // chu'i nang nas skam po phyi rol tu phyung ngam /
translated: If it is dry, it is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one pulls up a dry tree from the water,

original: sha mo dang pha ba dgo dgo phyung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha mo dang pha ba dgo dgo phyung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or if one pulls up a mushroom or a plant, it is a downfall.

original: 'phya zhing gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
analyzed: 'phya zhing gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
translated: The story of the slander is as follows:

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dge 'dun lam la stan dang zas 'gyed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dge 'dun lam la stan dang zas 'gyed de /
translated: At that time, the Venerable Chudapanthaka was distributing seats and food to the Sangha.

original: de'i tshe na mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis mi sdug pas zas dang gnas khang ma thob bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe na mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis mi sdug pas zas dang gnas khang ma thob bo //
translated: At that time, the two friends, Dhaniya and Upatissa, did not get any food or lodging because of their ugliness.

original: slad kyis gyad bu nor gyis nged gnyis mnar to zhes byas so //
analyzed: slad kyis gyad bu nor gyis nged gnyis mnar to zhes byas so //
translated: Later, they said, “We have been tormented by him.”

original: phyis bsnyen dga' bo'i mdun du khyod kyang mal stan 'gyed par bskos na /
analyzed: phyis bsnyen dga' bo'i mdun du khyod kyang mal stan 'gyed par bskos na /
translated: Later, in front of Upali, they said, “You have been appointed to distribute the bedding,

original: gyad bu nor bzhin nged la mnar bar byed do zhes smras pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo na re khyod gnyis de skad ma zer cig tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor ni mal stan 'ding ba'i mchog tu sangs rgyas kyis bsngags so zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: gyad bu nor bzhin nged la mnar bar byed do zhes smras pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo na re khyod gnyis de skad ma zer cig tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor ni mal stan 'ding ba'i mchog tu sangs rgyas kyis bsngags so zhes byas pa dang /
translated: and you torment us like Chudapanthaka.” Upali said, “You two should not say that. The Venerable Chudapanthaka is praised by the Buddha as the best at arranging bedding.”

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: When they heard this,

original: gsol ba dang las gnyis kyis 'phya bar grangs su chug shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: gsol ba dang las gnyis kyis 'phya bar grangs su chug shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Buddha said, Let it be counted as slander by both the request and the action.

original: de bzhin du 'phya ba'i grangs su bcug kyang phyi phyir gyad bu nor gyi ming nas ni mi smos kyi dge slong kha cig ni de bzhin du nged la ma nar bar byed grang zhes lkog na gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang mngon sum du 'phya bas snyan du
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phya ba'i grangs su bcug kyang phyi phyir gyad bu nor gyi ming nas ni mi smos kyi dge slong kha cig ni de bzhin du nged la ma nar bar byed grang zhes lkog na gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang mngon sum du 'phya bas snyan du
translated: Even though it was counted as slander in that way, again and again, the name of Ghaṭikāra's son was not mentioned, but some monks said, They are doing this to us in secret, and they slandered him behind his back and in his presence.🔽 The Buddha said, Do not slander.

original: bdas te / 'phya bar mi gnang bar bcas 'phya zhing gzhogs 'phyas byed ces bya ba ni 'phya bar bsams nas tshig tu smras na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdas te / 'phya bar mi gnang bar bcas 'phya zhing gzhogs 'phyas byed ces bya ba ni 'phya bar bsams nas tshig tu smras na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Slandering and backbiting means that if one speaks words with the intention to slander, one commits an offense.

original: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'phya ba'i grangs su bcug kyang dge slong de gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las byed pa la 'phya'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung bar re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'phya ba'i grangs su bcug kyang dge slong de gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las byed pa la 'phya'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung bar re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is that even though the Saṅgha has counted a monk as slander, if that monk slanders or backbites the actions of the twelve individuals, he commits an offense for each instance.

original: las kyi grangs su bcug kyang dge slong gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las su bskos pa las mi byed pa rnams la 'phya na ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽dge 'dun gyis 'phya ba'i grangs su bcug kyang dge slong gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las su ma bskos la las byed pa rnams la 'phya na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi grangs su bcug kyang dge slong gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las su bskos pa las mi byed pa rnams la 'phya na ltung bar 'gyur ro // dge 'dun gyis 'phya ba'i grangs su bcug kyang dge slong gang zag bcu gnyis kyi las su ma bskos la las byed pa rnams la 'phya na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one mocks those who have been appointed to the twelve types of monk’s duties, even though they have been assigned to the number of those who do the work, one commits an offense.🔽If one mocks those who do the work, even though they have not been appointed to the twelve types of monk’s duties, even though they have been assigned to the number of those who do the work, one commits an offense.

original: dge slong de 'phya ba'i grangs su ma bcug na dge slong las byed kyang rung mi byed pa rnams la 'phya na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong de 'phya ba'i grangs su ma bcug na dge slong las byed kyang rung mi byed pa rnams la 'phya na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one mocks those who do the work, even though they have not been appointed to the number of those who do the work, one commits an offense.

original: bsgo ba'i lan log par 'don pa'i gleng gzhi ni koo sh'amb'i'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba'i lan log par 'don pa'i gleng gzhi ni koo sh'amb'i'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na'o //
translated: The basis for the story of the monks who give the wrong answer to an order is in the grove of the people of Kauśāmbī.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can la ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du slar mi byed pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can la ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du slar mi byed pas na /
translated: At that time, the venerable Mohavaśa had committed an offense, but he did not make amends for it in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dge slong phan par 'dod pa bde bar 'dod pa dag gis tshe dang ldan pa ltung ba slar shogs shig ces byas na /
analyzed: dge slong phan par 'dod pa bde bar 'dod pa dag gis tshe dang ldan pa ltung ba slar shogs shig ces byas na /
translated: “Monks who wish to benefit and wish for happiness should confess the downfall, venerable one.”

original: @93a * // ltung ba su la byung ba de 'chags grangs ngas ni ltung ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: @93a * // ltung ba su la byung ba de 'chags grangs ngas ni ltung ba mthong ngo //
translated: “I see the downfall that has occurred in you.”

original: khyed kyis mthong bas na khyed la ltung ba byung grang /
analyzed: khyed kyis mthong bas na khyed la ltung ba byung grang /
translated: “You see it, so you have the downfall.”

original: nged kyi rigs las ni byang chub thob pa yod kyi /
analyzed: nged kyi rigs las ni byang chub thob pa yod kyi /
translated: “In our family, there is the attainment of awakening.🔽In your family, there is no attainment of awakening, since you have gone forth from a different family.”

original: khyed kyi rigs tha dad pa las rab tu byung bas na khyed la ni byang chub thob pa su yod des rlom zhing lan log par ldon pas na gsol ba dang las gnyis kyis bsgo ba'i lan log par ldon pa'i grangs su bcug go //
analyzed: khyed kyi rigs tha dad pa las rab tu byung bas na khyed la ni byang chub thob pa su yod des rlom zhing lan log par ldon pas na gsol ba dang las gnyis kyis bsgo ba'i lan log par ldon pa'i grangs su bcug go //
translated: Since he was arrogant and gave a wrong answer, he was counted as having committed the downfall through the two actions of requesting and giving instructions.

original: de nas kyang ngas ni smras pas nyams pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de nas kyang ngas ni smras pas nyams pa lnga ste /
translated: “Then, there are five downfalls through speaking.

original: dper na nags kyi bya yang rang gi skad phyung bas tshig zin pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na nags kyi bya yang rang gi skad phyung bas tshig zin pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is like a bird in the forest that is caught by its own sound.

original: da slan chad su ci zer yang mi smra'o zhes zer nas gzhan tshangs par spyod pa phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa rnams kyis ltung bar bshogs shig ces phyi phyir glengs na bdag nyid mi smra bas na lan mi ldon pa'i grangs su bcug go //
analyzed: da slan chad su ci zer yang mi smra'o zhes zer nas gzhan tshangs par spyod pa phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa rnams kyis ltung bar bshogs shig ces phyi phyir glengs na bdag nyid mi smra bas na lan mi ldon pa'i grangs su bcug go //
translated: From now on, whatever anyone says, I will not speak. And so, when others who are celibate and who desire benefit and happiness accuse him, saying, You have fallen! he is counted as one who does not respond because he does not speak.

original: 'on kyang phyi phyir mi smra ba dang / log par lan ldon pa gnyis byed byed pas snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi phyir mi smra ba dang / log par lan ldon pa gnyis byed byed pas snyan du bdas te /
translated: However, he is repeatedly exhorted, Do not speak falsely, and Do not respond falsely.

original: lan log par ldon du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: lan log par ldon du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: He is instructed in the training of the Vinaya, not being allowed to respond falsely.

original: bsgo ba'i len log par ldon zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba'i len log par glan par bsams nas gzhan la tshig gis rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba'i len log par ldon zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba'i len log par glan par bsams nas gzhan la tshig gis rig par byed pa'o //
translated: Responding falsely to an instruction means, having the intention to respond falsely to an instruction, one makes it known to others with words.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong rab tu byung ba'o zhes dris pa dang rab tu ma byung ba'o zhes zer na ltung ba'o dge slong ltung bzed thogs pa dag mthong ngam zhes zer ba las rkang pas 'gro ba mthong ngam zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong rab tu byung ba'o zhes dris pa dang rab tu ma byung ba'o zhes zer na ltung ba'o dge slong ltung bzed thogs pa dag mthong ngam zhes zer ba las rkang pas 'gro ba mthong ngam zhes zer na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is asked, Did you see the monks carrying the begging bowls? and he says, I saw them walking on foot, he commits an offense.

original: bu ram shing dang rtsa khur khyer ba mthong ngam zhes dris na gzhan du brgyud na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu ram shing dang rtsa khur khyer ba mthong ngam zhes dris na gzhan du brgyud na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is asked, Did you see the sugar cane and the grass? and he says, I saw them go elsewhere, he commits an offense.

original: gshed mas gsong bar khrid pa la snying rje'i bsam pas 'dus byas bdag med par bsams nas ma mthong ngo zhes smras ba ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gshed mas gsong bar khrid pa la snying rje'i bsam pas 'dus byas bdag med par bsams nas ma mthong ngo zhes smras ba ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is asked, Did you see the man being led away to be executed? and he says, I did not see him, thinking, I have compassion for him, or thinking, The composite is selfless, he is not at fault.

original: dge 'dun gyi khri bla gab med pa na gding du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri bla gab med pa na gding du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule that it is not permitted to sit on a high seat of the Sangha in the open is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bla gab med pa la dge 'dun gyi khri dang mal stan rnams bting ste bzhag pa de ma bsdus par khyim bdag gcig gis dge slong rnams spyan drangs na bcom ldan 'das ni mal stan nyul bar bzhed nas der ma gshegs te dge slong
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bla gab med pa la dge 'dun gyi khri dang mal stan rnams bting ste bzhag pa de ma bsdus par khyim bdag gcig gis dge slong rnams spyan drangs na bcom ldan 'das ni mal stan nyul bar bzhed nas der ma gshegs te dge slong
translated: The monks had set up the seats and beds of the community in the open air and had not put them away. A householder invited the monks to a meal, but the Blessed One, wishing to inspect the beds and seats, did not go there.

original: dag gdong ba'i 'og tu sprin kha dog tha dad pa 'dus shing char rab tu nye bas mal stan byul ba dang / kye ma'o yon bdag dad pa ni sha khrag zad zad du sbyor zhing sbyin na dge slong rnams ni tshod mi zin par spyod do zhes nas /
analyzed: dag gdong ba'i 'og tu sprin kha dog tha dad pa 'dus shing char rab tu nye bas mal stan byul ba dang / kye ma'o yon bdag dad pa ni sha khrag zad zad du sbyor zhing sbyin na dge slong rnams ni tshod mi zin par spyod do zhes nas /
translated: The monks saw that under the beds and seats, clouds of different colors had gathered and were about to rain heavily. They thought, “Alas! The faithful benefactor gives as much flesh and blood as is needed, but the monks use it without restraint.”

original: mal stan dang khri rnams bcom ldan 'das phyag dar te nang du bsdus so //
analyzed: mal stan dang khri rnams bcom ldan 'das phyag dar te nang du bsdus so //
translated: They swept the beds and seats and the seats of the Blessed One and put them away inside.

original: phyis dge slong dag lhags pa dang / @93b slan chad mal stan ma bsdus par grong du 'gror mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: phyis dge slong dag lhags pa dang / @93b slan chad mal stan ma bsdus par grong du 'gror mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: Later, when the monks arrived, he prohibited them from going to the village without putting away the beds and seats. He laid down a rule of training.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha is the Saṅgha of the four directions.

original: khri 'am khri'u zhes bya ba ni dngos su zad do //🔽stan nang tshangs can ni shing bal gyis bkang ba'o //
analyzed: khri 'am khri'u zhes bya ba ni dngos su zad do // stan nang tshangs can ni shing bal gyis bkang ba'o //
translated: A bed or bench is a bed or bench.🔽A mattress is filled with cotton.

original: gor bu zhes bya ba ni khri'u g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: gor bu zhes bya ba ni khri'u g-yogs pa'o //
translated: A pillow is a cover for a bench.

original: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba ni steng ma g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba ni steng ma g-yogs pa'o //
translated: An uncovered place is one that is not covered above.

original: gding ngam zhes bya ni bdag gis so //
analyzed: gding ngam zhes bya ni bdag gis so //
translated: To spread means to spread oneself.

original: gding du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
analyzed: gding du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
translated: To have spread means to have spread for others.

original: ma brtul zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
analyzed: ma brtul zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
translated: To have not removed means to have not removed oneself.

original: brtul du ma bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
analyzed: brtul du ma bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
translated: To have not had removed means to have not had others remove it.

original: de nas song zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor las song ba'o //
analyzed: de nas song zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor las song ba'o //
translated: To have gone beyond means to have gone beyond the vicinity.

original: de 'dra'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni khyim pa gnyis shig kho na yod pa las mthu chung ba de rab tu byung ste ljongs rgyu zhing bros te song ba las nub mo lha khang zhig tu dgongs der mal stan dag brnyas nas nyal lo //
analyzed: de 'dra'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni khyim pa gnyis shig kho na yod pa las mthu chung ba de rab tu byung ste ljongs rgyu zhing bros te song ba las nub mo lha khang zhig tu dgongs der mal stan dag brnyas nas nyal lo //
translated: Except in the case of such circumstances means that if only two householders are present, the weaker one goes forth, travels through the countryside, and leaves. In the evening, he arrives at a temple, finds bedding, and lies down.

original: nang par bdag ni 'gro zhes mal stan dag gtad pa las ring du thogs nas /
analyzed: nang par bdag ni 'gro zhes mal stan dag gtad pa las ring du thogs nas /
translated: The householder said, I will go tomorrow. He gave the bed to the monk, but the monk stayed there a long time.

original: khyim bdag des bsnyags pas sleb pa dang brdegs pa snyan du bdas te de lta bu'i nyes pa byung ba dang bar chad chen po brgyad la sogs pa byung na ma brtul bar song yang nyes med ce'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag des bsnyags pas sleb pa dang brdegs pa snyan du bdas te de lta bu'i nyes pa byung ba dang bar chad chen po brgyad la sogs pa byung na ma brtul bar song yang nyes med ce'o //
translated: The householder came and beat the monk, saying, If such faults occur and great obstacles arise, it is not a fault to go without subduing them.

original: mal stan ma rung bar gyur pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mal stan ma rung bar gyur pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of spoiled bedding:

original: rlung dang char dang nyi ma'o //
analyzed: rlung dang char dang nyi ma'o //
translated: wind, rain, and sun.

original: dge slong gis gang zag lnga la stan bcol bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis gang zag lnga la stan bcol bar mi bya ste /
translated: A monk should not entrust his seat to five types of people:

original: ngo tsha med pa dang kho na yod pa dang / rgas pa dang nad pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa thams cad la'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang kho na yod pa dang / rgas pa dang nad pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa thams cad la'o //
translated: those without shame, those with anger, the old, the sick, and all those not fully ordained.

original: gding ba ma bsdus par 'gro ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: gding ba ma bsdus par 'gro ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule about going without gathering up the bedding was in Śrāvastī.

original: lho phyogs nas dge slong gnyis shig bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba mnyan du yod par phyin te /
analyzed: lho phyogs nas dge slong gnyis shig bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba mnyan du yod par phyin te /
translated: Two monks from the south were going to Śrāvastī to pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One.

original: der dge rgan po ni mal stan dang gnas khang yang thob po //
analyzed: der dge rgan po ni mal stan dang gnas khang yang thob po //
translated: The elder monk was given a bed and a room.

original: dge slong gsar bu ni mal stan 'gyed pa'i tshe ma thob nas gzhon nu de yang nus pa zhig pas rtsva brngas te /
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu ni mal stan 'gyed pa'i tshe ma thob nas gzhon nu de yang nus pa zhig pas rtsva brngas te /
translated: The younger monk, not having received a bed, was a young man of ability. He gathered some grass

original: pus mo tsam nub par byas te nyal lo //
analyzed: pus mo tsam nub par byas te nyal lo //
translated: and made a bed for himself, just enough to cover his knees.

original: rgan pos kyang rtsa bting ngo //
analyzed: rgan pos kyang rtsa bting ngo //
translated: The elder monk spread out his grass.

original: de gnyis kas rtsva ma bsdus /
analyzed: de gnyis kas rtsva ma bsdus /
translated: Neither of them gathered up the grass.

original: dge slong grogs po la yang ma bcol bar dong ba'i 'og tu dge slong dag ni khyim bdag dag gi steng du mgron du gnyer to //
analyzed: dge slong grogs po la yang ma bcol bar dong ba'i 'og tu dge slong dag ni khyim bdag dag gi steng du mgron du gnyer to //
translated: After they had left, the monks were invited to the house of a householder.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mal stan nyul bar bzhed nas bshos gtsug lag khang du 'dren to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mal stan nyul bar bzhed nas bshos gtsug lag khang du 'dren to //
translated: The Blessed One, wishing to inspect the beds, was led to the temple.

original: gnas khang de yang tshan yod cing sa snyi bas rtsva de la srin bu zhugs nas khang pa phyin nang du srin bus gang ste ma rung bar gyur to //
analyzed: gnas khang de yang tshan yod cing sa snyi bas rtsva de la srin bu zhugs nas khang pa phyin nang du srin bus gang ste ma rung bar gyur to //
translated: The room was damp and the grass was infested with insects. The insects entered the room and filled it, making it unfit.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis @94a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis @94a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One

original: phyag dar te rtsva de bsdus nas dge 'dun kun bsogs te /
analyzed: phyag dar te rtsva de bsdus nas dge 'dun kun bsogs te /
translated: swept away the grass and gathered it up. He assembled the entire Saṅgha🔽and said:

original: da slan chad rtsva bting ba ma brtul tam brtul tu ma bcug par 'gror mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: da slan chad rtsva bting ba ma brtul tam brtul tu ma bcug par 'gror mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: From now on, it is not permitted to go without spreading grass or without having it spread. This is the rule.

original: rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni de nas slad kyis dge slong ma zhig 'gro ba mang po dang ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba las nub mo gtsug lag khang zhig tu phyin nas rtsva mang zhig bsdus nas bting ste nyal lo //
analyzed: rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni de nas slad kyis dge slong ma zhig 'gro ba mang po dang ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba las nub mo gtsug lag khang zhig tu phyin nas rtsva mang zhig bsdus nas bting ste nyal lo //
translated: With the exception of special circumstances: Later, a nun was traveling through the countryside with a large group of people. In the evening, she arrived at a temple, gathered a lot of grass, spread it, and slept.

original: de dag nang par rtsva sdud cing 'khod pa las ring du thogs nas 'gron pa mang po dang bral te lam du rkun pos bcom pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: de dag nang par rtsva sdud cing 'khod pa las ring du thogs nas 'gron pa mang po dang bral te lam du rkun pos bcom pa snyan du bdas te /
translated: The next morning, the others were still gathering grass, so the nun was left behind. She was separated from the large group of travelers and was robbed on the road.

original: snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
translated: The previous rule was a rule with a fixed basis.

original: 'di ni gnang ba'o zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba'o zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: This is a rule with a concession. This is the rule for training in the Vinaya.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni rgan gzhon gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni rgan gzhon gnyis te /
translated: A monk: there were two monks, an elder and a younger.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Others are similar to them.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha: the Saṅgha of hearers.

original: gnas khang ni gang na spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gnas khang ni gang na spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The dwelling place is where the four modes of behavior are practiced.

original: 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: rtsva dang lo ma zhes bya ba ni dngos su zad do //
analyzed: rtsva dang lo ma zhes bya ba ni dngos su zad do //
translated: The grass and leaves are exhausted in reality.

original: gding ma 'ding du bcug gam zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gding ma 'ding du bcug gam zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: The bedding is spread or caused to be spread means by oneself or another.

original: ma brtul tam brtul tu ma bcol zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan la'o //
analyzed: ma brtul tam brtul tu ma bcol zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan la'o //
translated: Not removed or not asked to remove means by oneself or another.

original: song zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: song zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor las 'das pa'o //
translated: Go means to pass beyond the vicinity.

original: dge 'dun lam bcol zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor na yod pa'i dge slong la'o //🔽nyes pa ni bdag gis ma bsdus sam bsdur ma bcol bar song na nye 'khor las ma 'das kyi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun lam bcol zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor na yod pa'i dge slong la'o // nyes pa ni bdag gis ma bsdus sam bsdur ma bcol bar song na nye 'khor las ma 'das kyi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: Report to the Saṅgha means to a monk who is in the vicinity.

original: 'das na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is a wrong action as long as one has not passed beyond the vicinity, but if one passes beyond, there is an offense.

original: dge slong skrod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong skrod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule about not allowing monks to be expelled was in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas dge slong gzhan dag gi slob ma gsar bu rnams spro bar byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas dge slong gzhan dag gi slob ma gsar bu rnams spro bar byas te /
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayin encouraged the young students of other monks,

original: kha drangs nas bdag cag ljangs rgyu zhing bdag cag gis grags pa ni bsgrags //
analyzed: kha drangs nas bdag cag ljangs rgyu zhing bdag cag gis grags pa ni bsgrags //
translated: saying, “Let us go on a journey. We will proclaim our fame,

original: rgol ba ni tshar bcad /
analyzed: rgol ba ni tshar bcad /
translated: crush our opponents,

original: rnyed pa ni sgrub po //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni sgrub po //
translated: and acquire wealth.🔽You should not be separated from the recitation and study of the scriptures.”

original: khyed la yang lung dpog pa dang klog pas mi bral bar bya'o zhes bsgo ba dang / de dag so so'i mi mkhan po dang slob dpon la gsol te bkag kyang ma btub nas 'char ba'i phyi bzhin du dong ngo //
analyzed: khyed la yang lung dpog pa dang klog pas mi bral bar bya'o zhes bsgo ba dang / de dag so so'i mi mkhan po dang slob dpon la gsol te bkag kyang ma btub nas 'char ba'i phyi bzhin du dong ngo //
translated: They asked their respective preceptors and teachers for permission, but when they were not allowed to go, they followed Udayin.🔽When they had passed the boundary, they were each given a single article of equipment and sent on their way.

original: de dag kyang nye 'khor las 'das pa dang yo byad sna re re bskur te dong ba dang / 'char ba ni lam du khyim bdag dang gtam byed cing 'dug pa dang / lha khang zhig tu gand'i brdungs te 'char ba la 'dong zhes byas na de ni las kyi gand'i zhig gis bdag cag ngal bsos la dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang nye 'khor las 'das pa dang yo byad sna re re bskur te dong ba dang / 'char ba ni lam du khyim bdag dang gtam byed cing 'dug pa dang / lha khang zhig tu gand'i brdungs te 'char ba la 'dong zhes byas na de ni las kyi gand'i zhig gis bdag cag ngal bsos la dong ngo //
translated: Udayin was sitting on the road talking with a householder when the temple bell was rung. He was told to go, but he said, “That is the bell for work. Let us rest and go.”

original: sngar dong du zin gyis kyang khong gis las byed du bcug @94b tu 'ong ngo zhes smras pa dang / slob dpon 'di ni rnyed pa'i gand'i zhig kyang srid kyis 'dong zhes byas na khyed sngar deng la nga'i skal ba yang nos shig ces byas nas sngar dong ngo //
analyzed: sngar dong du zin gyis kyang khong gis las byed du bcug @94b tu 'ong ngo zhes smras pa dang / slob dpon 'di ni rnyed pa'i gand'i zhig kyang srid kyis 'dong zhes byas na khyed sngar deng la nga'i skal ba yang nos shig ces byas nas sngar dong ngo //
translated: The first said, This master may be a key to our wealth. Let us go. But you go first. I will take my share later. So the first went first.
