original: 'char ba ni phyi na gtam la g-yengs te slob ma dag gis stan dang gnas mnos te bsdad na nam sros kyang ring zhig tu ma 'ongs nas sgo bcad pa'i 'og tu 'ongs te 'bod nas nang du 'ongs te /
analyzed: 'char ba ni phyi na gtam la g-yengs te slob ma dag gis stan dang gnas mnos te bsdad na nam sros kyang ring zhig tu ma 'ongs nas sgo bcad pa'i 'og tu 'ongs te 'bod nas nang du 'ongs te /
translated: When it was evening, the other, distracted by gossip, remained behind. When the disciples had taken their seats and places, and were sitting, it was late, but he did not come. After the door was closed, he came and called out. He was brought in.🔽The master said, I have made all the preparations. Go to sleep.

original: slob dpon kun sta gon bgyis lags kyis gzims zhes byas pa dang / khyed cag su zhig la zhus te nyal /
analyzed: slob dpon kun sta gon bgyis lags kyis gzims zhes byas pa dang / khyed cag su zhig la zhus te nyal /
translated: They said, Who are you to tell us to sleep?

original: bdag cag ni slob dpon ring du ma byon nas gcig la gcig zhus te nyal lo //
analyzed: bdag cag ni slob dpon ring du ma byon nas gcig la gcig zhus te nyal lo //
translated: We slept because the master was gone for a long time and we asked each other.

original: zhes smras pa dang / de khros te rim gro med pa khyed la lung mi sbyin gyis phyir deng shig ces slob ma rnams mtshan mo phyi rol tu lhags pa la gzhug go //
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / de khros te rim gro med pa khyed la lung mi sbyin gyis phyir deng shig ces slob ma rnams mtshan mo phyi rol tu lhags pa la gzhug go //
translated: And he said, You are not fit to be my disciples. Go away!🔽 The next day the disciples said, We will go and pay our respects to the Teacher.

original: de nas phyi de nyin slob ma rnams kyis bdag cag phyi phyag 'tshal te mchi'o zhes smras pa dang / khyed ma 'dong bar 'dug shig dang / khyed nan yang ngas nad g-yog bya'o zhes byas na /
analyzed: de nas phyi de nyin slob ma rnams kyis bdag cag phyi phyag 'tshal te mchi'o zhes smras pa dang / khyed ma 'dong bar 'dug shig dang / khyed nan yang ngas nad g-yog bya'o zhes byas na /
translated: The teacher said, Stay here! I will take care of you.

original: bdag cag nad med pa las kyang nad yod par byas na da ni mi na re'o //🔽zhes nas ma btub par mnyan du yod par dong ste lhags pa dang / dge slong dag gis de dag la bde bar 'ongs sam zhes byas na /
analyzed: bdag cag nad med pa las kyang nad yod par byas na da ni mi na re'o // zhes nas ma btub par mnyan du yod par dong ste lhags pa dang / dge slong dag gis de dag la bde bar 'ongs sam zhes byas na /
translated: The disciples said, We are not sick, but you have made us sick. Now we will not stay.🔽 And they went away to Śrāvastī.🔽 The monks asked them, Why have you come?🔽 They told them in detail what had happened. Later, when the monks asked the teacher why he had sent them away, he said, I did not send them away.

original: de ltar gyur pa zhib tu dge slong dag la byas pa snyan du bdas pa dang / phyis 'char ba nyid slar 'khor ba la rmas nas skrod du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa zhib tu dge slong dag la byas pa snyan du bdas pa dang / phyis 'char ba nyid slar 'khor ba la rmas nas skrod du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: And the rule was laid down: You should not send away those who have come to you.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa nas phug gi gtsug lag khang zhig na dge slong mang zhig 'khod pa las sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus te char bab tu nye nas dge slong gzhan ni rdib kyis dogs te phyung ngo
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa nas phug gi gtsug lag khang zhig na dge slong mang zhig 'khod pa las sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus te char bab tu nye nas dge slong gzhan ni rdib kyis dogs te phyung ngo
translated: The phrase except in such circumstances refers to the following. In Śrāvastī, a large number of monks were staying in a temple in a cave. A five-colored cloud gathered and was about to rain. Other monks, fearing that the cave would collapse, left.

original: // nad pa gcig rang 'byung ma nus te /
analyzed: // nad pa gcig rang 'byung ma nus te /
translated: But one sick monk was unable to leave on his own.

original: char gyis sa gas rdib nas dus las 'das te de lta bu'i rkyen zhig gis ma dad bzhin du phyi rol du phyung zhing bskrad pa ni nyes pa med do zhes gnang ngo //
analyzed: char gyis sa gas rdib nas dus las 'das te de lta bu'i rkyen zhig gis ma dad bzhin du phyi rol du phyung zhing bskrad pa ni nyes pa med do zhes gnang ngo //
translated: The rain caused the earth to crack and the cave to collapse. He died. The Buddha said that there is no offense if one leaves a sick person behind and goes outside because of such circumstances, even if one does not have faith in the person who told one of the danger.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
translated: The phrase a monk means a monk who is rising from his seat.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The same applies to others.

original: khros 'khrugs zhes bya ba ni khros pa'i zil gyis non pa'o //
analyzed: khros 'khrugs zhes bya ba ni khros pa'i zil gyis non pa'o //
translated: The phrase angry and upset means being overwhelmed by anger.

original: gtsug lag khang ngam gnas khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhir ldan pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ngam gnas khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhir ldan pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase a temple or dwelling means a place where the four types of daily activities are carried out, as explained above.

original: skrod dam skrod du bcug ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: skrod dam skrod du bcug ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: “Expelled” or “causes to be expelled” means by oneself or by another.

original: rkyen ces bya ba ni bkal ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen ces bya ba ni bkal ba'o //
translated: “Circumstance” means a burden.

original: dge slong snga na gnas shing 'khod pa la phyis 'ongs shing gnon du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong snga na gnas shing 'khod pa la phyis 'ongs shing gnon du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The introduction to the rule is that a monk who was staying in Śrāvastī did not allow a later arrival to stay.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas gzhan gyi slob @95a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas gzhan gyi slob @95a * //
translated: The venerable Udayin invited a student of another and went wandering in the country.

original: ma la drangs te ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba las gtsug lag khang gzhan zhig tu gand'i brdungs pa la sogs pa'i gtam brgyud ni gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma la drangs te ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba las gtsug lag khang gzhan zhig tu gand'i brdungs pa la sogs pa'i gtam brgyud ni gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: In another monastery, the bell was rung, and so on. The story is connected as above.

original: bye brag ni 'char bas thabs kyis sgo phye ste nang bu 'ongs pas slob ma nyal ba'i steng du mnan cing brdzis pa dang / de dag shir dogs nas phyir phyung ste mtshan thog thag phyir rol na nyal bar grang bas nyen nas nang par bdag cag mchi'o zhes phyi phyag 'tshal nas mnyan du yod par phyin te dge slong rnams la smras nas snyan du bdas nas phyis gnon du mi gnang🔽bar bcas so //
analyzed: bye brag ni 'char bas thabs kyis sgo phye ste nang bu 'ongs pas slob ma nyal ba'i steng du mnan cing brdzis pa dang / de dag shir dogs nas phyir phyung ste mtshan thog thag phyir rol na nyal bar grang bas nyen nas nang par bdag cag mchi'o zhes phyi phyag 'tshal nas mnyan du yod par phyin te dge slong rnams la smras nas snyan du bdas nas phyis gnon du mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: Fearing that they would die, he pulled them out and they lay outside all night. Because of the cold, they were in danger. In the morning, they bowed down to him and went to Shravasti. After telling the monks, they complained. Later, it was not allowed to step on the robes.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
translated: The one who is called a certain monk is Udayi.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The others are similar to him.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag gis sam gzhan gyis bdag rim par byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag gis sam gzhan gyis bdag rim par byas pa'o //
translated: As for knowingly, it means that either oneself or another has arranged it.

original: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: As for monastery, it means having the four modes of conduct.

original: snga na 'khod ces bya ba ni snga na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snga na 'khod ces bya ba ni snga na gnas pa'o //
translated: As for those who arrived first, it means those who were there before.

original: gnod par byed ces bya ba ni mi bde bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed ces bya ba ni mi bde bar byas pa'o //
translated: As for harming, it means making them uncomfortable.

original: 'di 'gro zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin par de nyid kyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gro zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin par de nyid kyis byas pa'o //
translated: “He should go” means that he should do it himself, not someone else.

original: ci tsam du dge slong gis su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen de nyid kyis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang na dge slong snga na 'khod par shes bzhin du phyis 'ongs te nyal lam 'dug na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci tsam du dge slong gis su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen de nyid kyis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang na dge slong snga na 'khod par shes bzhin du phyis 'ongs te nyal lam 'dug na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that a monk, knowing that a monk is already staying in a monastery belonging to the Sangha, lies down or sits down with the intention of harming him, he commits an offense.

original: gnod par bya'o snyam nas ched du bsams te gnod pa'i bag byas na ci'i sgo nas kyang rung ste thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par bya'o snyam nas ched du bsams te gnod pa'i bag byas na ci'i sgo nas kyang rung ste thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does so with the intention of harming him, then it is an offense regardless of how he does it.

original: khri'i rtsa ba byung ba sla ba steng gi yang thog tu bzhag nas lcid kyis phab ste 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: khri'i rtsa ba byung ba sla ba steng gi yang thog tu bzhag nas lcid kyis phab ste 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the rule about the legs of a bed being too long took place in Śrāvastī.

original: 'char ba pos sngan chad gzhan gyi slob ma rnams kha drangs shing gtses pas slad kyis tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar dad de gzhan gyi slob ma rnams kha drangs na gcig kyang ma btub nas bsnyen dga' bos bsod snyoms pa rgan
analyzed: 'char ba pos sngan chad gzhan gyi slob ma rnams kha drangs shing gtses pas slad kyis tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar dad de gzhan gyi slob ma rnams kha drangs na gcig kyang ma btub nas bsnyen dga' bos bsod snyoms pa rgan
translated: In the past, Ārāḍa had attracted and harmed the disciples of others.🔽Later, when Venerable Nanda went wandering and had faith in him, he attracted the disciples of others, but not a single one was able to follow him.

original: zhugs zhig dang 'gro bar byas nas /
analyzed: zhugs zhig dang 'gro bar byas nas /
translated: Venerable Nanda went with an old alms-begging monk.

original: bsod snyoms pas kyang bsnyen dga' bo gnas ngan len kun du spyod par grags mod kyi /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas kyang bsnyen dga' bo gnas ngan len kun du spyod par grags mod kyi /
translated: The alms-begging monk thought, “Although it is well known that Venerable Nanda engages in negative actions,

original: bdag gnas 'cha' zhing lung dpog mi dgos te des byar ci yod snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: bdag gnas 'cha' zhing lung dpog mi dgos te des byar ci yod snyam du bsams so //
translated: I don’t need to take up residence and investigate his situation. What is there to do about him?”

original: bsnyen dga' bos bdag cag gnyis kyi thos pa ni bsgrags rnyed pa ni bsgrubs /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos bdag cag gnyis kyi thos pa ni bsgrags rnyed pa ni bsgrubs /
translated: Venerable Nanda thought, “The fame of our learning has spread and we have obtained wealth.

original: rgol ba ni tshar bcad du 'dong ngo zhes nas de gnyis kyang 'grogs te dong nas nye 'khor las 'das pa dang bsnyen dga' bos rgan po la gnas 'char gzhug cing yo byad dag bskur bar byas na ma btub ste bdag ni gnas @95b dben pa 'cha'o //
analyzed: rgol ba ni tshar bcad du 'dong ngo zhes nas de gnyis kyang 'grogs te dong nas nye 'khor las 'das pa dang bsnyen dga' bos rgan po la gnas 'char gzhug cing yo byad dag bskur bar byas na ma btub ste bdag ni gnas @95b dben pa 'cha'o //
translated: We will defeat the opponent. The two of them went together. When they had passed the vicinity, Udayin said to the elder, Let us exchange places and I will carry the requisites. But he could not do it. He said, I will stay in the solitary place.

original: yo byad 'chang ba ni ston pas smad la /
analyzed: yo byad 'chang ba ni ston pas smad la /
translated: The teacher has criticized carrying requisites.

original: bden pa mthong ba la sgrib pas mi bskur ro zhes ma btub pa dang / mi bskur ba ni rigs na khyod kyis ngal gsher ci yod ces bsnyen dga' bo yang khros so //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba la sgrib pas mi bskur ro zhes ma btub pa dang / mi bskur ba ni rigs na khyod kyis ngal gsher ci yod ces bsnyen dga' bo yang khros so //
translated: Since it is an obstacle to seeing the truth, I will not carry them. Udayin could not do it. It is right not to carry them. What is the use of your fatigue? Udayin became angry.

original: de nas bsnyen dga' bo yang lam na mi 'phrad do cog dang gtam zla yod kyi bar du 'khyal zhing 'dug go //
analyzed: de nas bsnyen dga' bo yang lam na mi 'phrad do cog dang gtam zla yod kyi bar du 'khyal zhing 'dug go //
translated: Then Udayin stayed on the road, talking and arguing with everyone he met.

original: de nas gtsug lag khang du phyin du nye ste gand'i brdungs pa dang / gtam sna tshogs la dga' ba ni ston pas smad pa yin gyis gand'i brdungs pa yang rnyed pa'i gand'i srid na 'dong ngo zhes byas na de ni las kyi gand'i te /
analyzed: de nas gtsug lag khang du phyin du nye ste gand'i brdungs pa dang / gtam sna tshogs la dga' ba ni ston pas smad pa yin gyis gand'i brdungs pa yang rnyed pa'i gand'i srid na 'dong ngo zhes byas na de ni las kyi gand'i te /
translated: The monks said, The Teacher has criticized those who delight in various kinds of talk. Since the bell has been rung, let us go to the place where the bell is rung for the sake of gain.

original: bdag cag ngal gyi steng du las kyis bsnan du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: bdag cag ngal gyi steng du las kyis bsnan du 'ong ngo //
translated: The elder said, We are already tired. It would be better not to add to our fatigue by work.

original: zhes ma btub nas bsod snyoms pa sngar song ba las bsnyen dga' bo'i gnas dang mal cha yang nod du bcol lo //
analyzed: zhes ma btub nas bsod snyoms pa sngar song ba las bsnyen dga' bo'i gnas dang mal cha yang nod du bcol lo //
translated: They did not agree, so the elder went to the alms-round first and was given the place and bedding of Upasena.

original: des kyang bsnyen dga' bo'i gnas ni yang thog tu mnos /
analyzed: des kyang bsnyen dga' bo'i gnas ni yang thog tu mnos /
translated: Upasena said, I will take the upper room.

original: bdag gi 'og tu mnos nas /
analyzed: bdag gi 'og tu mnos nas /
translated: You take the one below mine.

original: ring zhig bsdad kyang ma 'ongs nas sgo bcad de nyal lo //
analyzed: ring zhig bsdad kyang ma 'ongs nas sgo bcad de nyal lo //
translated: He stayed there for a long time, but when the elder did not come, he closed the door and went to sleep.

original: de yang nam sros nas 'bod bzhin du thabs kyis sgo phye ste rgan zhugs la mal gar byas zhes dris nas de yang rang gi gnas su song ngo //
analyzed: de yang nam sros nas 'bod bzhin du thabs kyis sgo phye ste rgan zhugs la mal gar byas zhes dris nas de yang rang gi gnas su song ngo //
translated: When night had fallen, the elder called out and Upasena opened the door for him. The elder asked, Where is your bedding? and Upasena went to his own place.

original: de yang rgan zhugs la gnod par bsams nas yang thog nas rgan zhugs la bos pa dang de gang na zer ba'i tha dkar khri'i rtsa ba gzer bu med pa 'byung sla ba'i steng du lcid kyis drag tu phab ste 'dug pas khri'i rtsa ba ltung nas rgan🔽po'i 'phral pa la phog ste //
analyzed: de yang rgan zhugs la gnod par bsams nas yang thog nas rgan zhugs la bos pa dang de gang na zer ba'i tha dkar khri'i rtsa ba gzer bu med pa 'byung sla ba'i steng du lcid kyis drag tu phab ste 'dug pas khri'i rtsa ba ltung nas rgan po'i 'phral pa la phog ste //
translated: The monk sat down heavily on the foot of the bed, which was not fastened down and easily came loose. The foot fell off and hit the old man on the head.

original: gnad nas nad par phyi phyag 'tshal te song nas phyir phyin pa dang / de ltar gyur pa dge slong dag la byas pa snyan du bdas nas khri rtsa ba 'byung sla ba la 'dug tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: gnad nas nad par phyi phyag 'tshal te song nas phyir phyin pa dang / de ltar gyur pa dge slong dag la byas pa snyan du bdas nas khri rtsa ba 'byung sla ba la 'dug tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: He bowed to the old man from the ground and left. When he returned, he told the monks what had happened. The rule was laid down not to sit on beds that were not fastened down.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang nyes pa de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang nyes pa de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means Nanda and others who have similar faults.

original: dge 'dun dang gtsug lag khang ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽lcid kyis phab pa ni rkub kyis btsir ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dang gtsug lag khang ni snga ma bzhin no // lcid kyis phab pa ni rkub kyis btsir ba'o //
translated: “The Saṅgha” and “the temple” are as above.🔽“Sat down heavily” means to sit down with one’s buttocks.

original: nyal zhes bya ba ni lus kyis 'phres pa'o //
analyzed: nyal zhes bya ba ni lus kyis 'phres pa'o //
translated: “Lay down” means to lie down with one’s body.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is the same as before.

original: dge slong gis ci tsam du gtsug lag khang gi khang bur khri'am khri'u rtsa ba 'byung sla bar shes bzhin du lus kyi lcid kyis phab ste 'dug na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis ci tsam du gtsug lag khang gi khang bur khri'am khri'u rtsa ba 'byung sla bar shes bzhin du lus kyi lcid kyis phab ste 'dug na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, knowing that the legs of a bed or bench in the monastery are too long, sits down on it with his full body weight, he commits an offense.

original: spang leb kyis g-yogs pa'am //
analyzed: spang leb kyis g-yogs pa'am //
translated: If the legs are covered with wooden pads or

original: pha gus g-yogs pa dang khri'i 'og tu rkang rten bcug pa dang / khri bkan te 'dug pa la lcid kyis phab kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: pha gus g-yogs pa dang khri'i 'og tu rkang rten bcug pa dang / khri bkan te 'dug pa la lcid kyis phab kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: if the legs are supported by a wooden base, or if the monk sits down on the bed or bench carefully, there is no offense.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu 'debs su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni @96a * //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu 'debs su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni @96a * //
translated: The origin story for the rule against using water containing living beings

original: koo sh'amb'i'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na ste /
analyzed: koo sh'amb'i'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na ste /
translated: was at the monastery of the Kosaṃbī lay brother.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can gyis shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la chag chag 'debs shing 'debs su bcug pa dang / de la dge slong dag gis tshe dang ldan pa mos ba can de ltar ma byed cig ces bsgo ba dang la ni sus kyang grangs kyis ma gtad na /🔽khong nyid lho dang byang dang nub kyi rgya mtsho dang lteng ka dag tu dong na ci nyes zhes zer ba dge slong dag 'phya nas snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can gyis shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la chag chag 'debs shing 'debs su bcug pa dang / de la dge slong dag gis tshe dang ldan pa mos ba can de ltar ma byed cig ces bsgo ba dang la ni sus kyang grangs kyis ma gtad na / khong nyid lho dang byang dang nub kyi rgya mtsho dang lteng ka dag tu dong na ci nyes zhes zer ba dge slong dag 'phya nas snyan du bdas te /
translated: The monks told the venerable Nanda, “Do not do it like that.”🔽“What is wrong with going to the southern, northern, and western oceans and ponds, where no one has measured them?”

original: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The monks ridiculed him, saying, “This is not the duty of an ascetic.”

original: zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Thus, a rule of training was laid down in the Vinaya.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni mos pa can te /
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni mos pa can te /
translated: “A monk” means Nanda.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Others are similar to him.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems can yod par bdag gam gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems can yod par bdag gam gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: “Knowingly” means that oneself or another tells of the existence of living beings.

original: srog chags zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te mig gis sod pa dang chu tshags la chags pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te mig gis sod pa dang chu tshags la chags pa'o //
translated: “Living beings” are of two kinds: those that are killed by the eye and those that are killed by a strainer.

original: chu dang rtsva zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chus spyad par bya ba'i gnas thams cad la bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang rtsva zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chus spyad par bya ba'i gnas thams cad la bya'o //
translated: “Water and grass” and so on refers to all the places that are used by water.

original: 'debs sam 'debs su gzhug ces bya ba ni bdag gis sam gzhan la 'debs su bcug pa'o //
analyzed: 'debs sam 'debs su gzhug ces bya ba ni bdag gis sam gzhan la 'debs su bcug pa'o //
translated: “To pour or to cause to pour” means to do it oneself or to make someone else do it.

original: nyes pa ni srog chags yod pa'i chu la srog chags yod par 'du shes sam the tshom bzhin du 'debs sam spyod na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni srog chags yod pa'i chu la srog chags yod par 'du shes sam the tshom bzhin du 'debs sam spyod na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is that if one pours or uses water that one knows or is unsure about whether it contains living beings, then there is one offense.

original: srog chags med pa la yod par 'du shes sam the tsom na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags med pa la yod par 'du shes sam the tsom na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is without living beings, but one perceives it as having living beings or is unsure about it, then there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: srog chags yod pa'i yur ba'i chu kha bsgyur na sems can ji snyed yod pa shi na ltung ba yang de snyed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags yod pa'i yur ba'i chu kha bsgyur na sems can ji snyed yod pa shi na ltung ba yang de snyed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one turns the water of a canal that has living beings into a place where living beings do not exist, then there is one offense for each living being that dies.

original: ma shi na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma shi na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not die, then there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: chu la ji lta ba bzhin du sa dang rtsva dang srog chags dang ldan pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: chu la ji lta ba bzhin du sa dang rtsva dang srog chags dang ldan pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Just as with water, so it is with earth, grass, and animals.

original: gtsug lag khang rim pa gnyis las rtsig tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni koo sh'amb'i'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang rim pa gnyis las rtsig tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni koo sh'amb'i'i dgra zin gyi kun dga' ra ba na ste /
translated: The origin of the prohibition against building two-storied temples was in Kauśāmbī in the pleasure grove of the lay vow holder Udayana.

original: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde rnams gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i khang pa la 'phya ba la zhugs pa dang / de na dge slong gnas pa rnams kyis khyed nyid rdo gcig bsgreng yang mi nus par gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i khang pa la 'phya ba'i rigs sam zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde rnams gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i khang pa la 'phya ba la zhugs pa dang / de na dge slong gnas pa rnams kyis khyed nyid rdo gcig bsgreng yang mi nus par gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i khang pa la 'phya ba'i rigs sam zhes byas pa dang /
translated: At that time the group of six monks criticized a temple built by others. The resident monks said, “It is not right for you to criticize a temple built by others when you cannot even erect a single stone.”

original: de dag kyang mos pa can spro bar byas nas mos pa can gyis koo sh'amb'i na khyim bdag ser sna can phyug po zhig 'dug pa btul nas gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i nor sbyar nas gla can kun bsogs te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mos pa can spro bar byas nas mos pa can gyis koo sh'amb'i na khyim bdag ser sna can phyug po zhig 'dug pa btul nas gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i nor sbyar nas gla can kun bsogs te /
translated: The faithful were inspired by this and the faithful gathered all the wages and materials for building a temple from a wealthy miserly householder in Kauśāmbī.

original: gtsug lag khang zlum po stor khung la sogs pa ma btod pa cig nyin gcig @96b gis zin par brtsigs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zlum po stor khung la sogs pa ma btod pa cig nyin gcig @96b gis zin par brtsigs so //
translated: The temple was built in one day, round, without windows, etc.🔽The rest of the story is to be supplied in detail as in the Nidana of the Vihara.

original: rgyas par lhag ma'i skabs su gtsug lag khang gi gleng gzhi bzhin du rgyas par sbyor cig gtsug lag khang 'di yang 'jig par thugs su chud nas sangs rgyas kyis lha rnams la srod la chos bshad do //
analyzed: rgyas par lhag ma'i skabs su gtsug lag khang gi gleng gzhi bzhin du rgyas par sbyor cig gtsug lag khang 'di yang 'jig par thugs su chud nas sangs rgyas kyis lha rnams la srod la chos bshad do //
translated: The Buddha, knowing that the temple would be destroyed, preached the Doctrine to the gods at dusk.

original: nam phyed na char bab nas zhig ste sa'i phung por gyur nas drug sde rnams kyang 'bros pa dang / yon bdag zas dang bcas te gtsug lag khang du 'ongs par bcom ldan 'das kyis mi dga' ba med par spro bar chos bshad do //
analyzed: nam phyed na char bab nas zhig ste sa'i phung por gyur nas drug sde rnams kyang 'bros pa dang / yon bdag zas dang bcas te gtsug lag khang du 'ongs par bcom ldan 'das kyis mi dga' ba med par spro bar chos bshad do //
translated: At midnight it was destroyed by rain and became a heap of earth. The group-of-six monks fled. The donor came to the temple with food. The Blessed One preached the Doctrine to him without displeasure.

original: de nas yon bdag dga' bar gyur pa dang / drug sde yang slar lhags so //
analyzed: de nas yon bdag dga' bar gyur pa dang / drug sde yang slar lhags so //
translated: Then the donor was delighted and the group-of-six monks returned.

original: yon bdag gis de dag la gos phrugs re re zhig bskon pa dang / drug sde rnams kyang ngom pa dge slong rnams kyis 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas gtsug lag khang brtsigs na pha gu dang 'jim pa rim pa gnyis gsum las lhag par rtsig tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: yon bdag gis de dag la gos phrugs re re zhig bskon pa dang / drug sde rnams kyang ngom pa dge slong rnams kyis 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas gtsug lag khang brtsigs na pha gu dang 'jim pa rim pa gnyis gsum las lhag par rtsig tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: “When building a monastery, one should not build more than two or three layers of walls, including the outer and inner layers.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: “Any monk” means the group of six,

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: and so on.

original: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni spyod lam bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Monastery” means having the four modes of conduct.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Large” means two things:

original: sbyin pa dang / tshad che ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshad che ba'o //
translated: the size of the donation and the size of the building.

original: brtsigs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //🔽sgo khang dang gtan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni sgo khang dang gtan pa'i gnas snga nas gdod pa'o //
analyzed: brtsigs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so // sgo khang dang gtan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni sgo khang dang gtan pa'i gnas snga nas gdod pa'o //
translated: “Built” means by oneself or by others.🔽“Doorway” and “window” means a doorway or window that has not been there before.

original: snang ba gdod pa'i 'du shes bya ba ni skar khung dang chu khung gdod pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba gdod pa'i 'du shes bya ba ni skar khung dang chu khung gdod pa'o //
translated: “The perception of a new opening” means a new window or a new drain.

original: rmang nas bzung ste rim pa gnyis sam gsum rtsigs shig ces bya ba ni pha gu dang 'jim pa nyis rim dang gsum rim las rtsig tu mi gnang ba'o //
analyzed: rmang nas bzung ste rim pa gnyis sam gsum rtsigs shig ces bya ba ni pha gu dang 'jim pa nyis rim dang gsum rim las rtsig tu mi gnang ba'o //
translated: The phrase up to two or three stories means that it is not permitted to build more than two or three stories of mud bricks and wooden beams.

original: 'das na ltung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das na ltung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If one does, one should understand that one has committed an offense.

original: spel zhes bya ba ni 'ji ba dang / pha gu che chung dgon pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: spel zhes bya ba ni 'ji ba dang / pha gu che chung dgon pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The word increase is a synonym for mud and wooden beams.

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa'i gtsug lag khang ngam so phag dang rdo las byas pa'am gtsug lag khang gi bdag pos myur du byos shig pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa'i gtsug lag khang ngam so phag dang rdo las byas pa'am gtsug lag khang gi bdag pos myur du byos shig pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If the monastery is built of brick or stone, or if the owner of the monastery quickly builds it, there is no offense.

original: sa bon gyi tshogs kyi ltung ba'i bcu phung gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshogs kyi ltung ba'i bcu phung gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: The second chapter on the group of ten offenses related to the collection of seeds is completed.

original: // / ma bskos par dge slong ma rnams la chos ston pa'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: // / ma bskos par dge slong ma rnams la chos ston pa'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin of the teaching not to instruct nuns without being appointed is in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong gnas brtan rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams la res kyis lung ston cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sde rnams kyis res mos la bab ste de dag cung zad cig lung bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong gnas brtan rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams la res kyis lung ston cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sde rnams kyis res mos la bab ste de dag cung zad cig lung bstan nas /
translated: The group of six were next in the rotation. After giving the Dharma instructions for a little while,

original: dge slong ma rnams la rtse 'dzin snyogs pa snyan du @97a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la rtse 'dzin snyogs pa snyan du @97a * //
translated: they made the bhikṣuṇīs memorize the verses of the Dharma instructions, and they recited them in their ears.

original: bdas nas slan chad drug sde bskor mi gnang ste /
analyzed: bdas nas slan chad drug sde bskor mi gnang ste /
translated: “From now on, do not appoint the group of six.🔽If you explain the Dharma to the bhikṣuṇīs without being appointed, you should request the saṅgha to do it with a two-part ceremony.”

original: ma bskos bzhin du rang dge slong ma rnams la 'chad nas slan chad gsol ba dang gnyis kyis skos shig ces 'byung ba dang / drug sde nyi tshe mtshams kyi phyi rol du gsol ba byas nas gcig la gcig bskos nas dge slong ma rnams la chos 'chad do //
analyzed: ma bskos bzhin du rang dge slong ma rnams la 'chad nas slan chad gsol ba dang gnyis kyis skos shig ces 'byung ba dang / drug sde nyi tshe mtshams kyi phyi rol du gsol ba byas nas gcig la gcig bskos nas dge slong ma rnams la chos 'chad do //
translated: The group of six requested the saṅgha to do it outside the boundary. They appointed one another and explained the Dharma to the bhikṣuṇīs.

original: de yang ma gnang ba dang mtshams kyi nang du nad pa rnams la ni dad pa blangs gzhan ni brel ba'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: de yang ma gnang ba dang mtshams kyi nang du nad pa rnams la ni dad pa blangs gzhan ni brel ba'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: The Buddha did not allow that. “You should request the saṅgha to do it inside the boundary. If you do it for the sick, you should request the saṅgha to do it. If you do it for others, you should do it in the midst of the saṅgha.”

original: dge slong ma rnams la chos 'chad pas nad phyin chad dge 'dun tshogs pas mtshams kyi nang du gsol ba dang las kyis dge slong ma'i ston par ma bskos par ston du mi gnang bar bcas pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis dge slong ma'i ston par dge slong mi mkhas mi gsal ba dag bskos pas bdag mi shes bdag ma dul bas na gzhan zhi bar bya ba'i gnas med pas na de nyid nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la chos 'chad pas nad phyin chad dge 'dun tshogs pas mtshams kyi nang du gsol ba dang las kyis dge slong ma'i ston par ma bskos par ston du mi gnang bar bcas pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis dge slong ma'i ston par dge slong mi mkhas mi gsal ba dag bskos pas bdag mi shes bdag ma dul bas na gzhan zhi bar bya ba'i gnas med pas na de nyid nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks appointed monks who were not learned and not clear to be the teachers of the nuns. Because they did not know themselves and were not disciplined, they had no way to pacify others. Therefore, that became a basis for criticism.🔽The Buddha said,

original: chos lnga dang ldan par skos shig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: chos lnga dang ldan par skos shig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Appoint someone who has five qualities.”

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / gnas brtan rgyal po lta bu dang / grong khyer gyi skad shes pa dang / dge slong ma rnams la lus mi spyod cing sun mi 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / gnas brtan rgyal po lta bu dang / grong khyer gyi skad shes pa dang / dge slong ma rnams la lus mi spyod cing sun mi 'byin pa'o //
translated: He has ethical discipline, is learned, is like an elder king, knows the language of the city, and does not have sexual relations with the nuns or disparage them.

original: tshul khrims dang dan pa ni phas pham pa ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang dan pa ni phas pham pa ma byung ba'o //
translated: “Morality and good conduct” means not having committed a defeating offense.

original: mang du thos pa ni so sor thar pa rgyas pa 'chad nus shing kha ton du shes pa'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa ni so sor thar pa rgyas pa 'chad nus shing kha ton du shes pa'o //
translated: “Much learning” means being able to explain the extensive version of the code of conduct and knowing it by heart.

original: gnas brtan rgyal po lta bu ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo nyi shu lon pa'am de las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan rgyal po lta bu ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo nyi shu lon pa'am de las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Like an elder king” means having been fully ordained for twenty years or more.

original: grong khyer gyi skad shes zhes bya ba ni mi mang po'i skad shes pa'o //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi skad shes zhes bya ba ni mi mang po'i skad shes pa'o //
translated: “Knowing the language of the city” means knowing the language of many people.

original: dge slong ma sun ma phyung ba ni lus kyis mi sprod pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong ma sun ma phyung ba ni lus kyis mi sprod pa yin te /
translated: “Not having caused a nun to be expelled” means not having had sexual intercourse with a nun.

original: chos lnga po de dag dang ldan na ston par bsko'o //
analyzed: chos lnga po de dag dang ldan na ston par bsko'o //
translated: If someone has these five qualities, he should be appointed as a teacher.

original: chos de lta bu dang ldan na ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa lam bstan bcom ldan 'das kyis rdul phyag go //
analyzed: chos de lta bu dang ldan na ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa lam bstan bcom ldan 'das kyis rdul phyag go //
translated: “Except if he has qualities like those” means that the venerable Upāli was appointed by the Blessed One as the one who knew the Vinaya.

original: zhe sdang gi rdul phyag go zhes chos tshig gnyis zla ba gsum gyi bar du bslabs kyang ma lobs pa las phyis bcom ldan 'das kyis lam bstan yongs su sbyangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rdul phyag go zhes chos tshig gnyis zla ba gsum gyi bar du bslabs kyang ma lobs pa las phyis bcom ldan 'das kyis lam bstan yongs su sbyangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: The Buddha said, You should train in the two Dharma phrases, 'the dust of anger is the hand' for three months, but she could not learn them. Later, the Blessed One taught her the path, she purified herself, and actualized arhatship.

original: lam bstan dge slong ma'i ston par bskos pas dge slong ma rnams bden pa la bkod do //
analyzed: lam bstan dge slong ma'i ston par bskos pas dge slong ma rnams bden pa la bkod do //
translated: Since the path was taught, she was appointed as the teacher of the nuns, and she established the nuns in the truths.

original: 'khor rnams kyang dgra bcom pa nas rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad du thob par byas pas na snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnams kyang dgra bcom pa nas rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad du thob par byas pas na snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
translated: Since the retinue also attained from arhatship down to stream entry, the previous one was prohibited,

original: 'di ni rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: but this one is permitted.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The one called monk is the group of six and others like them.

original: ma bskos zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun @97b gyis gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis ma bskos ma bskos pa'o //
analyzed: ma bskos zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun @97b gyis gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis ma bskos ma bskos pa'o //
translated: Not appointed means not appointed by the Saṅgha through the act of requesting and asking.

original: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one called nun is one who has entered this Dharma.

original: 'doms zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyis chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'doms zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyis chos ston pa'o //
translated: The term instructs means to teach the Dharma by means of superior morality, superior meditative stabilization, and superior wisdom.

original: chos de lta bu ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong zhing 'bras bu yod par bstan pa ni lam bstan lta bu ste ma bskos kyang gnang ba'o //
analyzed: chos de lta bu ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong zhing 'bras bu yod par bstan pa ni lam bstan lta bu ste ma bskos kyang gnang ba'o //
translated: The phrase except for such teachings of the Dharma refers to the situation in which a monk who has seen the truth and who has attained a result teaches the Dharma to others. This is similar to the teaching of the path and is permitted even though he has not been appointed to instruct others.

original: stud ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: stud ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The term exhortation is as was explained previously.

original: nyes pa ni gang zhe na dge slong dge 'dun gyi mtshams kyi phyi rol du bskos kyi mtshams kyi nang du ma bskos na dge 'dun la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gang zhe na dge slong dge 'dun gyi mtshams kyi phyi rol du bskos kyi mtshams kyi nang du ma bskos na dge 'dun la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: What is a fault? If a monk is appointed outside of the boundaries of the saṅgha but is not appointed within the boundaries of the saṅgha, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct in regard to the saṅgha.

original: ston pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he teaches the Dharma, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: mtshams la ji lta ba bzhin du dge 'dun ma tshogs pa dang gang zag yon tan lnga dang mi ldan pa bskos nas gang zag la ni rnam pa lnga po re re dang mi ldan par bskos na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams la ji lta ba bzhin du dge 'dun ma tshogs pa dang gang zag yon tan lnga dang mi ldan pa bskos nas gang zag la ni rnam pa lnga po re re dang mi ldan par bskos na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as there are boundaries, in the same way, if a monk is appointed by a saṅgha that is incomplete or by a monk who does not possess the five qualifications, then for each of the five ways in which he is not appointed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge 'dun la ni re re zhing yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun la ni re re zhing yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: But for each monk, there is a minor transgression.

original: nyi ma nub kyi bar du chos 'chad du mi gnang ba ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: nyi ma nub kyi bar du chos 'chad du mi gnang ba ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The Buddha did not allow the teaching of the Dharma until sunset in Śrāvastī.

original: sngon chad dge slong ma rnams la chos ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'chad do //
analyzed: sngon chad dge slong ma rnams la chos ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'chad do //
translated: Previously, the Blessed One himself taught the Dharma to the nuns.

original: phyis ni dge slong gnas brtan dag la dge slong ma dag la chos ston cig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: phyis ni dge slong gnas brtan dag la dge slong ma dag la chos ston cig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Later, he ordered the elder monks, “You must teach the Dharma to the nuns.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la chos 'chad pa'i res la bab nas chos shod cig ces bsgo na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la chos 'chad pa'i res la bab nas chos shod cig ces bsgo na /
translated: When it was the turn of the venerable Nandaka to teach the Dharma, he was ordered, “You must teach the Dharma.”

original: bcom ldan 'das zhal bzhugs so zhes nas ma btub po //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhal bzhugs so zhes nas ma btub po //
translated: But he said, “The Blessed One is present,” and he was unable to do it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyi sgo nas dge slong ma rnams la chos 'chad du bcug pa dang / dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog chos mkhas pas slar dri pa mang ste nam sros nas slar 'khor ba dang / lha khang gi sgo bcad de ma thar nas mnyan du yod pa dang mi ring ba zhig na kun dga' rab zhig yod de mtshan mo phyi rol gyi shing khung der dge slong ma gnas shing 'khod pa dang rkun po lnga brgyas kyang glags bltas pa dge slong
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyi sgo nas dge slong ma rnams la chos 'chad du bcug pa dang / dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog chos mkhas pas slar dri pa mang ste nam sros nas slar 'khor ba dang / lha khang gi sgo bcad de ma thar nas mnyan du yod pa dang mi ring ba zhig na kun dga' rab zhig yod de mtshan mo phyi rol gyi shing khung der dge slong ma gnas shing 'khod pa dang rkun po lnga brgyas kyang glags bltas pa dge slong
translated: The Blessed One had the nuns expound the Dharma from his own mouth,🔽and the nun Utpalavarna, being learned in the Dharma, asked many questions. When it grew late and they returned, the temple door was closed and they could not get out. Not far from Shravasti there was a pleasure grove. At night the nuns stayed and sat in the hollow of an external tree.

original: ma autpa la'i mdog gis brtags te tshor nas 'phags skyes po'i dmag tu sprul pa dang / g-yon can rnams kyis skabs ma rnyed de slar dong ngo //
analyzed: ma autpa la'i mdog gis brtags te tshor nas 'phags skyes po'i dmag tu sprul pa dang / g-yon can rnams kyis skabs ma rnyed de slar dong ngo //
translated: Five hundred thieves also looked for an opportunity, but the nun Utpalavarna examined and knew. She emanated as Virudhaka's army, and the deceitful ones did not find an opportunity and went back.

original: phyi de nyin par nang du song ba dang / mu stegs can la sogs pa dag dge slong ma rnams chos dge ba dang mi dge ba 'dren mar spyod de /
analyzed: phyi de nyin par nang du song ba dang / mu stegs can la sogs pa dag dge slong ma rnams chos dge ba dang mi dge ba 'dren mar spyod de /
translated: The next day they went inside, and the tirthikas and so forth said, The nuns practice the Dharma and non-Dharma in a mixed way.

original: 'phyon ma la dong dong ngo //
analyzed: 'phyon ma la dong dong ngo //
translated: “You’re a prostitute!”

original: zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas nyi ma nub kyi bar du dge slong ma rnams la ston du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas nyi ma nub kyi bar du dge slong ma rnams la ston du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: They chased him away from the ears of the nuns, and he was not allowed to teach them until sunset.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed do //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed do //
translated: The monk named Venerable Nandaka.

original: @98a * // dge 'dun gyi bskos zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang las kyis dge slong ma'i ston par bskos pa'o //
analyzed: @98a * // dge 'dun gyi bskos zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang las kyis dge slong ma'i ston par bskos pa'o //
translated: The Saṅgha’s appointee means someone appointed as a teacher of the nuns through a formal act consisting of one motion and three announcements.

original: nyi ma nub ces bya ba ni de ltar bskos kyang nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma nub ces bya ba ni de ltar bskos kyang nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sunset means that even if he is appointed, he commits an offense if he teaches after sunset.

original: dge slong ma la 'doms zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma la 'doms zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum bshad pa'o //
translated: To instruct the nuns means to explain the three trainings.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽nyi ma nub pa ni nyi ma nub par 'du shes sam the tshom za bzhin du 'chad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no // nyi ma nub pa ni nyi ma nub par 'du shes sam the tshom za bzhin du 'chad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is as before.🔽Sunset means that if he teaches after sunset, but he perceives it as before sunset or he is unsure of it, he commits an offense.

original: nyi ma nub pa la ma nub par 'du shes sam the tshom za na smad de nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa la ma nub par 'du shes sam the tshom za na smad de nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is sunset, but he perceives it as before sunset or he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: mtshan thog thag chos ston tam gtsug lag khang gi sgo drung na 'dug gam grong khyer gyi dbus na 'dug ste /
analyzed: mtshan thog thag chos ston tam gtsug lag khang gi sgo drung na 'dug gam grong khyer gyi dbus na 'dug ste /
translated: He may teach the Dharma all night, or he may sit in front of the temple gate, or he may sit in the middle of the city.

original: sgom bcad pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sgom bcad pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in cutting off meditation.

original: kha zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma rnams la ston to zhes smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: kha zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma rnams la ston to zhes smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against saying, “I teach the nuns for just a little food,” is in Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la khyod kyis dge slong ma rnams la chos shod cig ces bka' stsal nas goo ta ma'i skye dgu'i bdag mo 'khor lnga brgya dang bcas pa dga' byed las chos mnyan pa dang / de nas dga' byed kyis chos zab pa'i tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis chos bshad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la khyod kyis dge slong ma rnams la chos shod cig ces bka' stsal nas goo ta ma'i skye dgu'i bdag mo 'khor lnga brgya dang bcas pa dga' byed las chos mnyan pa dang / de nas dga' byed kyis chos zab pa'i tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis chos bshad de /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Nandī, “You should teach the Dharma to the nuns.” Then Gotamī, the mother of the Buddha, together with a retinue of five hundred, listened to the Dharma from Nandī, and Nandī taught the Dharma with words and letters of the profound Dharma.

original: bud med ni yong gis kyang shes rab chung bas khong du ma chud kyang slar 'dri ma sbobs so //
analyzed: bud med ni yong gis kyang shes rab chung bas khong du ma chud kyang slar 'dri ma sbobs so //
translated: Women are naturally of little wisdom, so they did not understand, but they were not confident to ask questions again.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du song nas phyag 'tshal na bkas rmas pa dang bdag cag ma 'dris pas na 'dri ma spobs te /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du song nas phyag 'tshal na bkas rmas pa dang bdag cag ma 'dris pas na 'dri ma spobs te /
translated: Then Māyādevī went to the Bhagavān, bowed down, and said, “I was wounded by the words of the Bhagavān. Since I am not familiar with you, I was embarrassed and did not understand the Dharma teaching.”

original: chos bshad pa khong du ma chud do zhes gsol pa dang / 'dris par bya ba'i phyir mtshan mar zas sam rdzas cung zad byin cig ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi gan du skye dgu'i bdag mos dge slong ma zhig 'o thug skyel du btang ba dang /
analyzed: chos bshad pa khong du ma chud do zhes gsol pa dang / 'dris par bya ba'i phyir mtshan mar zas sam rdzas cung zad byin cig ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi gan du skye dgu'i bdag mos dge slong ma zhig 'o thug skyel du btang ba dang /
translated: “In order to become familiar, give a small amount of food or goods as a sign,” the Bhagavān said. Then Māyādevī sent a bhikṣuṇī to bring rice porridge to the venerable Nandaka.

original: dze ta'i tshal gtsug lag khang gi sgo na tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo 'chag cing 'dug pa mthong nas ci yin zhes dris na 'o thug yin te /
analyzed: dze ta'i tshal gtsug lag khang gi sgo na tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo 'chag cing 'dug pa mthong nas ci yin zhes dris na 'o thug yin te /
translated: When she arrived at the door of the Jetavana monastery, she saw the venerable Upāli walking around and asked, “What is this?”🔽“It is rice porridge.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la 'bul lo zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo na re tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la chos ston to zhes smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la 'bul lo zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo na re tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la chos ston to zhes smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks with few desires criticized him.

original: de skad smrar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de skad smrar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Buddha laid down a training rule to prevent this kind of talk.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsten dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsten dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: A monk means a monk like Nanda, or another monk like him.

original: kha @98b zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga ste gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: kha @98b zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga ste gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: A small amount of food means five kinds of food and five kinds of drinks.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i shes rab la bya'o //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i shes rab la bya'o //
translated: Explains means explains the precepts and explains wisdom.

original: ltung zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Offense is as above.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong rnams la kha zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma rnams la chos ston to zhes zer na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong rnams la kha zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma rnams la chos ston to zhes zer na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is that if a monk says, “I teach the Dharma to the nuns for the sake of a little food,” he commits an offense in all cases.

original: kha zas cung zad kyi dbang du byas te bshad pa bden na smras kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: kha zas cung zad kyi dbang du byas te bshad pa bden na smras kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If he says this truthfully, meaning that he is teaching the Dharma for the sake of a little food, there is no offense.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la chos gos sbyin du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyen du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la chos gos sbyin du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyen du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin of the rule that prohibits giving Dharma robes to nuns who are not relatives occurred in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe khyim bdag rgan rgon khyo shug gnyis shig nor phyugs dang ldan zhing longs spyod dag che ba las phyis longs spyod dang nor phyugs dag kyang 'grib par gyur nas khyo shug gnyi ga yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyim bdag rgan rgon khyo shug gnyis shig nor phyugs dang ldan zhing longs spyod dag che ba las phyis longs spyod dang nor phyugs dag kyang 'grib par gyur nas khyo shug gnyi ga yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ngo //
translated: At that time an old married couple who were very wealthy and had many possessions later became poor and had few possessions. The couple went forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: khyim bdag ni yo byad dag dang ldan te 'byor par 'gyur /
analyzed: khyim bdag ni yo byad dag dang ldan te 'byor par 'gyur /
translated: The householder had possessions and became wealthy.

original: chung ma dge slong ma ni chos gos dang yo byad dang mi ldan ta chos gos kyang med do //
analyzed: chung ma dge slong ma ni chos gos dang yo byad dang mi ldan ta chos gos kyang med do //
translated: The bhikṣuṇī was not endowed with robes and belongings, and she had no robes.

original: dge slong ma des kyang bdag ni rnyed pa chung ste chos gos kyang med do zhes smras pa dang / dge slong des kyang chos gos sbyar ma dmar ser zhig dge slong ma de la byin nas /
analyzed: dge slong ma des kyang bdag ni rnyed pa chung ste chos gos kyang med do zhes smras pa dang / dge slong des kyang chos gos sbyar ma dmar ser zhig dge slong ma de la byin nas /
translated: The bhikṣuṇī also said, “I have little gain and no robes.” The bhikṣu gave the bhikṣuṇī a reddish-brown robe.

original: de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor rnams dang yul rgyu zhing gshegs pa'i tshe 'khor gyi nyan thos rnams la slar gzigs nas dge slong de stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs nyi tshe dang 'ong bar gzigs nas ci 'di'i dbyar 'di na gnas pa'i tshe dge slong rnams🔽rnyed pa med dam zhes smras pa dang / btsun pa mchis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor rnams dang yul rgyu zhing gshegs pa'i tshe 'khor gyi nyan thos rnams la slar gzigs nas dge slong de stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs nyi tshe dang 'ong bar gzigs nas ci 'di'i dbyar 'di na gnas pa'i tshe dge slong rnams rnyed pa med dam zhes smras pa dang / btsun pa mchis so //
translated: Later, when the Tathāgata was traveling through the country with his retinue, he looked back at the śrāvakas in the retinue. Seeing that the bhikṣu was coming with only an upper and lower robe, he asked, “In this summer, did the bhikṣus

original: zhes kun dga' bos gsol te /
analyzed: zhes kun dga' bos gsol te /
translated: have no gain?” Ānanda replied, “Yes, they did.”

original: 'o na ci'i phyir dge slong 'di gos byar ma med /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir dge slong 'di gos byar ma med /
translated: “Then why does this bhikṣu have no robe?”

original: dge slong ma sngon gyi chung ma rnyed pa la stsal to zhes byas pa dang / ci gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la byin zhing phas kyang len tam /
analyzed: dge slong ma sngon gyi chung ma rnyed pa la stsal to zhes byas pa dang / ci gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la byin zhing phas kyang len tam /
translated: The Buddha said, I gave it to the nun who was his former wife.🔽 The Buddha said, Is it that you gave it to a nun who is not a relative and that her father took it?🔽 The Buddha said, It is not permitted to give to a nun who is not a relative. He then laid down a training rule for the monks.🔽 The Buddha said, Monks, if a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, it is to be forfeited and there is an offense entailing confession.

original: stsal zhing len to zhes gsol pa dang / gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la sbyin du ma gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: stsal zhing len to zhes gsol pa dang / gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la sbyin du ma gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so // yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, if a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, it is to be forfeited and there is an offense entailing confession.

original: rgan zhugs so //🔽gnyen zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i zung bdun rgyud tshun chad do //🔽dge slong ma ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgan zhugs so // gnyen zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i zung bdun rgyud tshun chad do // dge slong ma ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, if a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, it is to be forfeited and there is an offense entailing confession.🔽The Buddha said, Monks, if a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, it is to be forfeited and there is an offense entailing confession.

original: gos ni rgyu rnam bdun no //
analyzed: gos ni rgyu rnam bdun no //
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, if a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, it is to be forfeited and there is an offense entailing confession.

original: sbyin zhes bya ba ni gtan du byin pa'o //🔽ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyin zhes bya ba ni gtan du byin pa'o // ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, if a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, it is to be forfeited and there is an offense entailing confession.

original: nyes pa ni gnyen ma yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes dang the tshom na ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽yin @99a * //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gnyen ma yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes dang the tshom na ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽yin @99a * //
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, if a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, it is to be forfeited and there is an offense entailing confession.

original: pa la ma yin par 'du shes dang / the tshom na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la ma yin par 'du shes dang / the tshom na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one perceives it as not being one’s own, or is unsure of it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gos rkun pos khyer ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa na byin pa na rin 'og tu byin pa dang / chos legs par bshad pa la byin pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la spyir byin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gos rkun pos khyer ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa na byin pa na rin 'og tu byin pa dang / chos legs par bshad pa la byin pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la spyir byin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the robe is stolen, if one gives it to a fully ordained monk, if one gives it to a person who gives in return, if one gives it to a person who explains the Dharma well, or if one gives it to the community of nuns.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i chos gos byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i chos gos byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin of the prohibition against nuns making robes for those who are not relatives took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong ma sbed ma zhes bya ba chos gos lnga char ngan te ras shig btsal te rnyed pa dang / btsun pa 'char ba la drug tu bcol ba dang / 'char bas bsams pa ma drubs na ni mo yang gos kyang med dge ba'i bar chad du yang gyur pa'i steng du kha zer /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong ma sbed ma zhes bya ba chos gos lnga char ngan te ras shig btsal te rnyed pa dang / btsun pa 'char ba la drug tu bcol ba dang / 'char bas bsams pa ma drubs na ni mo yang gos kyang med dge ba'i bar chad du yang gyur pa'i steng du kha zer /
translated: At that time, the nun Siṃha had five poor robes. She sought out a piece of cloth, and when she found it, she asked Venerable Udayī to make it into six pieces. Udayī thought, “If I do not sew it, she will have no robe, and in addition to being an obstacle to her virtue, she will gossip.

original: drubs na ni slan chad kyang bcu bdun sde dang kun 'chol zhing 'ong gis thabs shig bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: drubs na ni slan chad kyang bcu bdun sde dang kun 'chol zhing 'ong gis thabs shig bya'o snyam nas /
translated: If I weave it, the group-of-six will again come and disturb me. I must find a way to avoid that.

original: slad kyis drug sde rnams kyang 'ongs te /
analyzed: slad kyis drug sde rnams kyang 'ongs te /
translated: Later, the group-of-six came.

original: gos kyi dkyil du tshon sna lnga'i skud pas sngon 'char ba dang sbed ma gnyis gcig gi mgul nas gcig 'khyud cing 'dug pa drubs nas blta ba bzhin du dge slong ma rnams la bskur ro //🔽slad kyis dge slong ma dag gis bltas na de ltar 'dug pa mthong nas /
analyzed: gos kyi dkyil du tshon sna lnga'i skud pas sngon 'char ba dang sbed ma gnyis gcig gi mgul nas gcig 'khyud cing 'dug pa drubs nas blta ba bzhin du dge slong ma rnams la bskur ro // slad kyis dge slong ma dag gis bltas na de ltar 'dug pa mthong nas /
translated: She wove the cloth, and when it was finished, she placed a five-colored thread in the middle of the cloth and then placed a pair of dolls, one with a male face and one with a female face, with one doll embracing the other around the neck. She then sent the cloth to the nuns.

original: aa la la phu nu mo zhes gad mos btab nas 'char ba sped ma gnyis ring zhig lon na dag dod phrad do zhes skye dgu'i bdag mo la byas pa dang / drug sde rnams ni rang bzhin gyis gnas ngan len spyod pas 'di 'dra'o zhes 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad de bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: aa la la phu nu mo zhes gad mos btab nas 'char ba sped ma gnyis ring zhig lon na dag dod phrad do zhes skye dgu'i bdag mo la byas pa dang / drug sde rnams ni rang bzhin gyis gnas ngan len spyod pas 'di 'dra'o zhes 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad de bslab pa bcas so //
translated: Later, when the nuns looked at the cloth, they saw the dolls and said, Oh my! They laughed and said, If the two dolls, one male and one female, meet after a long time, they will have intercourse. They told the story to Mahāprajāpatī, and the group-of-six said, This is what they are like by nature, acting in a bad way. They spread the story and criticized her in many ways, and the training rule was laid down.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
translated: The term monk means one who is rising.

original: gzhan yang dge slong ma zhes bya ba dang / gos dang bal zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong ma zhes bya ba dang / gos dang bal zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the term nun and the term wool are as above.

original: byed ces bya ba ni drub pa'o //🔽gnyen ma yin pa la 'du shes dang the tshom bzhin du byas na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni drub pa'o // gnyen ma yin pa la 'du shes dang the tshom bzhin du byas na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The term to make means to have it made.🔽If one has the idea that the person is not a relative, or if one is unsure of it, then there is a separate offense for each.

original: gnyen ma yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes dang the tshom na yang nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes dang the tshom na yang nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has the idea that the person is not a relative, or if one is unsure of it, then there is a separate offense of wrong conduct for each.

original: dge slong ma'i 'gron mang po dang 'grogs shing lam du 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i 'gron mang po dang 'grogs shing lam du 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the prohibition against a nun traveling with a group of many travelers is in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams kyis bsams pa don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba na yang rnyed pa mang du rnyed cing 'ong na bdag cag ni khron pa'i sbal bu bzhin du gar yang ma phyin cing rnyed pa nyung na
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong drug sde po rnams kyis bsams pa don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba na yang rnyed pa mang du rnyed cing 'ong na bdag cag ni khron pa'i sbal bu bzhin du gar yang ma phyin cing rnyed pa nyung na
translated: At that time the group of six monks thought, “Monks who have few concerns get a lot of gifts when they go out and come back. But we, like frogs in a well, have not gone anywhere and have few gifts.

original: bdag cag rnyed pa sgrub cing ljongs rgyur 'dong na bdag cag gi srid mo bcu gnyis sde yang de bzhin du byas pa dang / khyed dong na ni bdag gi @99b yul dang gtsug lag khang dang chos ston pa yang med do zhes dus nas /
analyzed: bdag cag rnyed pa sgrub cing ljongs rgyur 'dong na bdag cag gi srid mo bcu gnyis sde yang de bzhin du byas pa dang / khyed dong na ni bdag gi @99b yul dang gtsug lag khang dang chos ston pa yang med do zhes dus nas /
translated: “We are going to travel to other countries to acquire wealth. If you go, then I will have no country, no temple, and no one to teach the Dharma.”🔽“Well then, elder sister, you should come with us.”

original: 'o na che zhe khyed cag kyang 'dong ngo zhes byas pa dang / de ltar mi gnang ba snyam mo zhes smras na /
analyzed: 'o na che zhe khyed cag kyang 'dong ngo zhes byas pa dang / de ltar mi gnang ba snyam mo zhes smras na /
translated: “I don’t think that is allowed.”

original: drug sde pos nam gang du ji skad du ma gnang zhes nas 'thams te /
analyzed: drug sde pos nam gang du ji skad du ma gnang zhes nas 'thams te /
translated: “What was not allowed? Where? How?”

original: drug sde po'i brgyags dang g-yar sus sbyor du bcug nas brgyags snga ma ni g-yar sus dang dro zan du zad par byas te song nas /
analyzed: drug sde po'i brgyags dang g-yar sus sbyor du bcug nas brgyags snga ma ni g-yar sus dang dro zan du zad par byas te song nas /
translated: The group of six made her carry their food and drink. They ate the food that was supposed to be for the next day and the food for the next day’s lunch.

original: phos mos rgan gzhon spel ta dong ba dang / skye bo rnams 'di ni 'di'i chung ma 'di ni 'di'i khyo'o zhes gzhan gyis dpyas na de dag na re de bzhin no zhes nas de dag gi zla la dge slong rgan zhugs shig song ba yang de dag ma rangs nas phyir log par dge slong de dag
analyzed: phos mos rgan gzhon spel ta dong ba dang / skye bo rnams 'di ni 'di'i chung ma 'di ni 'di'i khyo'o zhes gzhan gyis dpyas na de dag na re de bzhin no zhes nas de dag gi zla la dge slong rgan zhugs shig song ba yang de dag ma rangs nas phyir log par dge slong de dag
translated: A certain elder monk went to the men’s quarters, but they were displeased and sent him away.

original: la de lta bu'i gtam byas pa dang / snyan du bdas te dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang 'gror mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: la de lta bu'i gtam byas pa dang / snyan du bdas te dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang 'gror mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One decreed a training rule that they should not be allowed to go to the men’s quarters.

original: dus la bab pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma gcig mnyan du yod par 'gro ba na grogs med de dge slong rnams la bsdad na dge slong dag kyang 'grogs su ma btub nas dge slong ma rnams bcom pa dang de lta bu'i rkyen ni
analyzed: dus la bab pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma gcig mnyan du yod par 'gro ba na grogs med de dge slong rnams la bsdad na dge slong dag kyang 'grogs su ma btub nas dge slong ma rnams bcom pa dang de lta bu'i rkyen ni
translated: “Except in an emergency” means that if a nun has to go to Śrāvastī but has no companion and the monks are not allowed to accompany her, then the monks should be allowed to accompany her.

original: rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: In such a case, it is allowed.

original: des na rkyen byung ba dus yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na rkyen byung ba dus yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that when such an emergency occurs, it is the right time.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The monks are the group of six and others like them.

original: 'gron pa mang po 'dong ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni der mi nyung na 'gro bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'gron pa mang po 'dong ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni der mi nyung na 'gro bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: The road traveled by many travelers is a road where it is not possible to go if there are not many people.

original: 'jigs zhes bya ba ni rkun po dang g-yon can dang stag gzig la sogs pas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs zhes bya ba ni rkun po dang g-yon can dang stag gzig la sogs pas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fear is fear of thieves, rogues, tigers, leopards, and so on.

original: nyam nga ba ni sbrang bu chu rings dang / srin bu dang nyi ma tsha ba'o //
analyzed: nyam nga ba ni sbrang bu chu rings dang / srin bu dang nyi ma tsha ba'o //
translated: Danger is danger from gadflies, mosquitoes, and the hot sun.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong ma'i 'gron pa mang po dang lhan cig tu 'jug cing 'gron rgyang grags phyed phyed cing ni nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong ma'i 'gron pa mang po dang lhan cig tu 'jug cing 'gron rgyang grags phyed phyed cing ni nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault is that a monk enters with a large group of nuns, and there is a fault for every half league.

original: rgyang grags re re zhing ni ltung ba yang re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyang grags re re zhing ni ltung ba yang re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: For every league, there is a downfall.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad du 'jug pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad du 'jug pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in entering the noble path with eight branches.

original: dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang grug zhugs te chu 'byam du 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang grug zhugs te chu 'byam du 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story of not allowing a monk to board a boat with a group of nuns and travel on the water is in Śrāvastī.

original: drug sde dang dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde rnams te bcas pa snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyor cig / bye brag ni sngar lam du 'gro zhing 'gror mi gnang ba dang / phyis chu 'byam du dong ba dang / skye bo rnams 'phya ba dang /
analyzed: drug sde dang dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde rnams te bcas pa snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyor cig / bye brag ni sngar lam du 'gro zhing 'gror mi gnang ba dang / phyis chu 'byam du dong ba dang / skye bo rnams 'phya ba dang /
translated: The specific is that previously they were not allowed to go on the road and now they go on the water, and people criticize them.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms pas dge slong rnams la bsnyad nas snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms pas dge slong rnams la bsnyad nas snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks who go for alms told the monks, and they complained.

original: dge slong ma dang lhan cig gru'i nang du zhugs nas 'dong mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang lhan cig gru'i nang du zhugs nas 'dong mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: It is a training rule not to go in a boat with a nun.

original: thad kar 'gro ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na khyim @100a * //
analyzed: thad kar 'gro ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na khyim @100a * //
translated: Except when going directly, means in Śrāvastī there was a householder.

original: bdag gcig gis chu'i pha rol du gtsug lag khang zhig brtsigs nas dge 'dun sde gnyis bshos la spyan drangs pa dang / gru gcig gi nang du lhan cig 'gror mi gnang bas snga phyir dod pas gdugs tshod yol te kha cig zan gyi bar chad du gyur nas thad kar pha rol du 'gror gnang ngo zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gcig gis chu'i pha rol du gtsug lag khang zhig brtsigs nas dge 'dun sde gnyis bshos la spyan drangs pa dang / gru gcig gi nang du lhan cig 'gror mi gnang bas snga phyir dod pas gdugs tshod yol te kha cig zan gyi bar chad du gyur nas thad kar pha rol du 'gror gnang ngo zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: One of them built a monastery on the other side of the river. He invited the two groups of monks to a meal, but they would not go in the same boat. So they went one after the other, and the meal was delayed. Some of the monks did not get to eat. The Buddha allowed them to go directly across the river.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba dang dge slong ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba dang dge slong ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Monks” means as above.

original: gru gcig gi nang du zhes bya ba ni sho gam dang bsel gla dang grub cas gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gru gcig gi nang du zhes bya ba ni sho gam dang bsel gla dang grub cas gcig pa'o //
translated: “In the same boat” means the same ferry fare.

original: chu 'byam du thur du 'gro pa dang gyen du 'gro ba dang phar thad kar 'gro ba ni dngos su zad do //
analyzed: chu 'byam du thur du 'gro pa dang gyen du 'gro ba dang phar thad kar 'gro ba ni dngos su zad do //
translated: If the river is flowing straight down, or straight up, or straight across, it is a direct crossing.

original: chu 'byam du dong na rgyang grags phyed phyed cing nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu 'byam du dong na rgyang grags phyed phyed cing nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you go across the river, it is a minor infraction for every half league.

original: rgyang grags re re zhing ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyang grags re re zhing ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For every league, it is an offense.

original: dgon pa dang grong du 'gro na yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽chu 'gyur pa las 'byol lam /
analyzed: dgon pa dang grong du 'gro na yang gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro // chu 'gyur pa las 'byol lam /
translated: If you go to a monastery or a town, apply it as above.🔽If you are going by water, you should avoid the following:🔽a boat that is going to a place where there is danger,

original: rab mi bde ba las 'byol ba'am //
analyzed: rab mi bde ba las 'byol ba'am //
translated: a boat that is in bad condition,

original: skya ba dang gdos pa chag pa'am /
analyzed: skya ba dang gdos pa chag pa'am /
translated: a boat that is overloaded,🔽a boat that is not seaworthy,

original: mnyen pa nyan du ma btub pa'am //
analyzed: mnyen pa nyan du ma btub pa'am //
translated: or a boat that has a hole.

original: chu 'gram pha rol tshu rol na par chad brgyad la sogs pa yod pa ni chu 'byam du song yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chu 'gram pha rol tshu rol na par chad brgyad la sogs pa yod pa ni chu 'byam du song yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If there is a danger on the other side of the river or on this side, such as the eight life-threatening situations, there is no fault in crossing the river.

original: sa dben pa na de slong bud med dang 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng zhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: sa dben pa na de slong bud med dang 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng zhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: In a remote place, it is not permitted to stay with a woman who is a go-between.

original: de'i tshe na 'char ba snga dro sham thabs dang chos gos gyon te lhung bzed thogs nas grong du bsod snyoms blangs te /
