analyzed: de'i tshe na 'char ba snga dro sham thabs dang chos gos gyon te lhung bzed thogs nas grong du bsod snyoms blangs te /
translated: In Śrāvastī, at that time, at dawn, he put on his lower and upper robes, took his bowl, and went to the town to collect alms.

original: chung ma rnying pa sbed ma'i khyim du phyin te der stan bting ba la 'dug nas sngon ji ltar bsnyen pa dang / sbyar ba dran zhing gtam byed cing sa dbyen pa na stan la 'khod pa dge slong gzhan zhig der bsod snyoms la phyin pa de gnyis 'khod pa mthong nas sbed mas kyang de la zan byin te /
analyzed: chung ma rnying pa sbed ma'i khyim du phyin te der stan bting ba la 'dug nas sngon ji ltar bsnyen pa dang / sbyar ba dran zhing gtam byed cing sa dbyen pa na stan la 'khod pa dge slong gzhan zhig der bsod snyoms la phyin pa de gnyis 'khod pa mthong nas sbed mas kyang de la zan byin te /
translated: The former wife went to the house of Guptika. She sat on the seat that had been prepared for her and remembered how she had served and attended to him in the past.🔽When she was talking and laughing with him, a monk who was going for alms saw them sitting on the seat. Guptika gave him food,

original: slar lha khang du song ba dang / phyis 'char ba lha khang du 'ongs na bsod snyoms pa dang phrad pa dang khyod kyi sbed mas nga la bsod snyoms bzang du byin no zhes byas na 'char bas de ni ngas byin du bcug go //
analyzed: slar lha khang du song ba dang / phyis 'char ba lha khang du 'ongs na bsod snyoms pa dang phrad pa dang khyod kyi sbed mas nga la bsod snyoms bzang du byin no zhes byas na 'char bas de ni ngas byin du bcug go //
translated: and then they went back to the temple. Later, Udayin came to the temple and met the monk who had been begging for alms. He said, “Your Guptika gave me good alms.” Udayin said, “I made her give it to you.”

original: 'o na khyod gnyis po de ltar 'khong du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / de ni dbang yang rung mi dbang yang rung ste ngas ni 'dug pa bden zhes byas pa dang / dge slong dag ma dad de 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad de slan chad bud med dang lhan cig tu dben pa na 'dug tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: 'o na khyod gnyis po de ltar 'khong du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / de ni dbang yang rung mi dbang yang rung ste ngas ni 'dug pa bden zhes byas pa dang / dge slong dag ma dad de 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad de slan chad bud med dang lhan cig tu dben pa na 'dug tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The monks were not pleased and criticized him. After he was accused, he was reproached with many reasons and it was forbidden to stay alone with a woman in the future.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste /
translated: The one called monk is Udayi.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra pa'o //
translated: The others are similar to him.

original: bud med ces bya ba ni @100b mi tshangs par spyad pa'i chos bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba ni @100b mi tshangs par spyad pa'i chos bzod pa'o //
translated: The one called woman is one who endures the act of sexual intercourse.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gzhan med pa'o //
translated: The one called alone is where there is no man or woman.

original: stan gcig ces bya ba ni 'dom gang tshun chad do //
analyzed: stan gcig ces bya ba ni 'dom gang tshun chad do //
translated: The one called same seat is within an arm's reach.

original: skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni sa ba ma dang rtsig pa dang yel ba la sogs pas bskyabs pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni sa ba ma dang rtsig pa dang yel ba la sogs pas bskyabs pa'o //
translated: The one called screen is a screen made of cloth, wall, curtain, and so forth.

original: skyabs med pa na 'dug pa ni ltung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs med pa na 'dug pa ni ltung ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if one is in a place without a refuge.

original: sa dben pa na dge slong dge slong ma dang 'greng du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: sa dben pa na dge slong dge slong ma dang 'greng du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule that one should not stand and talk with a nun was in Śrāvastī.

original: khyim bdag gi chud ma sbed ma rab tu byung nas dge slong ma rnams kyis gtsug lag khang skyong du bskos pa na /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chud ma sbed ma rab tu byung nas dge slong ma rnams kyis gtsug lag khang skyong du bskos pa na /
translated: The householder’s daughter Saṅghā was fully ordained. The nuns appointed her to be the caretaker of the nunnery.

original: dge slong ma gzhan ni grong du khyim bdag gis mgron du bos te song ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: dge slong ma gzhan ni grong du khyim bdag gis mgron du bos te song ba'i tshe na /
translated: One day, the other nuns were invited to the house of a householder in town.

original: sbed ma 'ba' zhig lha khang nas phyag cing 'dug pa'i gan du tshe dang ldan pa 'char ba 'ongs nas khong gnyis sngon ji ltar rtsi zhing dga' ba dang / bag mar 'ongs pa'i tshe yan chad gyi gtam 'dzer cing 'greng 'greng nas phyis rmo na re 'phags pa dag ni bzhud ran no //
analyzed: sbed ma 'ba' zhig lha khang nas phyag cing 'dug pa'i gan du tshe dang ldan pa 'char ba 'ongs nas khong gnyis sngon ji ltar rtsi zhing dga' ba dang / bag mar 'ongs pa'i tshe yan chad gyi gtam 'dzer cing 'greng 'greng nas phyis rmo na re 'phags pa dag ni bzhud ran no //
translated: Only Saṅghā remained in the temple, sweeping. The venerable Udayī came to her and they stood and talked about how they had courted and how happy they had been when she came to live with him as his wife.🔽Later, Saṅghā said, “Noble one, it is time for you to leave.

original: dge slong ma dag kyang 'ong du nye /
analyzed: dge slong ma dag kyang 'ong du nye /
translated: The nuns are coming back.

original: bdag kyang phyag dar byi'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang phyag dar byi'o //
translated: I must sweep.”

original: de nas song ba'i 'og tu dge slong ma dag lhags nas khyod ci nyes te phyag ngar ma byas zhes byas na /
analyzed: de nas song ba'i 'og tu dge slong ma dag lhags nas khyod ci nyes te phyag ngar ma byas zhes byas na /
translated: Later, the nuns came and asked, “What is wrong? Why didn’t you sweep?”

original: deng ni phyags ma thabs cig kyang sa la ma bzhag go //
analyzed: deng ni phyags ma thabs cig kyang sa la ma bzhag go //
translated: “Today I didn’t even put down the broom once.”

original: zhes sbed mas smras pa dang / de gnyis gtam zer ba'i drung na nad pa gcig 'dug pas gtam ci zer ba kun thos pas /
analyzed: zhes sbed mas smras pa dang / de gnyis gtam zer ba'i drung na nad pa gcig 'dug pas gtam ci zer ba kun thos pas /
translated: The sick nun was lying near where they were talking. She heard everything they said.

original: de na re de yang mo zer ba bden mod kyi de'ang 'phags pa 'char pa dang gtam sha stag zer zhing 'greng 'greng ngo zhes byas pa las /
analyzed: de na re de yang mo zer ba bden mod kyi de'ang 'phags pa 'char pa dang gtam sha stag zer zhing 'greng 'greng ngo zhes byas pa las /
translated: “She is a woman, and what she says is true. But she stands there talking only about noble Udayi.”

original: dge slong ma rnams 'phya bar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis thos nas snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams 'phya bar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis thos nas snyan du bdas te /
translated: The nuns criticized her, and the monks heard about it. They reported it to the Blessed One.

original: 'char ba la rmas nas rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad de /
analyzed: 'char ba la rmas nas rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad de /
translated: He asked Udayi about it, and he admitted it. The Blessed One rebuked him,

original: 'dul ba la 'greng du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: 'dul ba la 'greng du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: and he prohibited standing and talking in the Vinaya.

original: gzhan ni gong na 'dug pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni gong na 'dug pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The rest is the same as the previous version.

original: bye brag ni lhan cig tu 'dom gang tshun chad 'greng na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag ni lhan cig tu 'dom gang tshun chad 'greng na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The particular is that if they stand together within an arm's reach, they will fall into a transgression.

original: dge slong mas ngos mgron sbyor du bcug pa'i zas zar mi gnang ba ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong mas ngos mgron sbyor du bcug pa'i zas zar mi gnang ba ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The Buddha did not allow the nuns to eat food that they had requested themselves.

original: de'i tshe mu ge byung nas dge slong rnams so so'i gnyen dang yon bdag tshol cig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe mu ge byung nas dge slong rnams so so'i gnyen dang yon bdag tshol cig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: At that time, a famine occurred, and the Buddha said, “Monks, you should seek out your own relatives and patrons.”

original: dge slong gnas brtan dag ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis bshos sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan dag ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis bshos sbyar ro //
translated: The elder monks were invited to meals by faithful brahmans and householders.

original: tshe dang ldan pa drug sde po rnams ni yon bdag med de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa drug sde po rnams ni yon bdag med de /
translated: But the Venerable Group-of-Six had no patrons.

original: bcu gnyis sde'i der bsong snyoms la song ngo //
analyzed: bcu gnyis sde'i der bsong snyoms la song ngo //
translated: So they went to beg from the Twelve

original: de rnams kyis 'phags pa zhal sus gsol cig ces byas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'phags pa zhal sus gsol cig ces byas na /
translated: They said, “Noble ones, who will serve you?”

original: deng khyed cag gis kyang byin sang sbyin pa med pas de bzhin du tshol @101a * //
analyzed: deng khyed cag gis kyang byin sang sbyin pa med pas de bzhin du tshol @101a * //
translated: “Today you will give, and tomorrow there will be no alms, so you should seek out your own patrons.”

original: ni mi gnang sring mo bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa rnams dge slong gnas brtan dag la 'tsho ba sbyin pa dag yong na de dag bdag cag gi yon bdag tu sgyur cig ces byas pa dang / de ltar bsgyur du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: ni mi gnang sring mo bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa rnams dge slong gnas brtan dag la 'tsho ba sbyin pa dag yong na de dag bdag cag gi yon bdag tu sgyur cig ces byas pa dang / de ltar bsgyur du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang /
translated: The nuns said, We are not allowed to do that. But if the faithful brahmins and householders give provisions to the elder monks, then make them our benefactors.🔽They asked, Do you have the power to do that?🔽They said, We are not allowed to do that.

original: gang du ma gnang sas ma gnang zhes byas pa dang / dge slong ma sbom dga' mos nang par mnyan du yod par bsod snyoms la zhugs pan cang shes koondi n+ya la sogs pa gnas brtan dag gi yon bdag rnams la khyod kyis sh'akya'i rigs las rab tu byung ba'i rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can sde snod
analyzed: gang du ma gnang sas ma gnang zhes byas pa dang / dge slong ma sbom dga' mos nang par mnyan du yod par bsod snyoms la zhugs pan cang shes koondi n+ya la sogs pa gnas brtan dag gi yon bdag rnams la khyod kyis sh'akya'i rigs las rab tu byung ba'i rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can sde snod
translated: The nun Chudapanthaka went for alms in Śrāvastī in the morning. She said to the benefactors of the elders such as Aśvajita Kauṇḍinya, You should give to those who have gone forth from the Śākya clan, who have reasoning and liberated eloquence, and who are skilled in the three baskets of the Dharma.

original: gsum gyi chos smra ba rnams la 'tsho ba sbyin na ci nyes zhes byas pa dang / de lta bu su yin zhes smras na 'phags pa dga' bo la sogs pa drug sde po rnams so zhes byas nas de nas der yang blangs so //
analyzed: gsum gyi chos smra ba rnams la 'tsho ba sbyin na ci nyes zhes byas pa dang / de lta bu su yin zhes smras na 'phags pa dga' bo la sogs pa drug sde po rnams so zhes byas nas de nas der yang blangs so //
translated: When asked, Who are they? he said, The group of six, the noble Nanda and so forth. Then he took it from there.

original: gnas brtan gzhan gyi yon bdag rnams yang bslangs pas drug sde rnams rnyed pa mang zhing mchan sgye'u gang zhing slar song ba dang / de nas gzhan dag gis de snyed ga la rnyed ces dris na /
analyzed: gnas brtan gzhan gyi yon bdag rnams yang bslangs pas drug sde rnams rnyed pa mang zhing mchan sgye'u gang zhing slar song ba dang / de nas gzhan dag gis de snyed ga la rnyed ces dris na /
translated: The elders' patrons also asked for alms, and the group of six, having obtained much wealth and filled their bags, returned. When asked, How did you get so much?

original: dge slong ma sbom dga' mo la sogs pa de dag gis de ltar byas te /
analyzed: dge slong ma sbom dga' mo la sogs pa de dag gis de ltar byas te /
translated: The nuns, Sthūlanandā and so forth, said, We did this.🔽 When asked, Are you able to ask for such things? they said, Why not? and Are we to sit here starving?

original: sring mo de dag gi bka' drin no zhes 'dzer ba dang / gzhan gyis de lta bu slong du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / cis mi dbang ngo zhes nged ltogs te 'khod dam zhes smras pa dang / dge slong rnams 'phya ste snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: sring mo de dag gi bka' drin no zhes 'dzer ba dang / gzhan gyis de lta bu slong du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / cis mi dbang ngo zhes nged ltogs te 'khod dam zhes smras pa dang / dge slong rnams 'phya ste snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks ridiculed them and spread it around.

original: slan chad dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: slan chad dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: “From now on, it is not permitted for a nun to eat food prepared by a monk,” the Buddha decreed.

original: sngar sbyor dum bcug pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag cig yod de /
analyzed: sngar sbyor dum bcug pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag cig yod de /
translated: “Except for what was prepared previously,” means: In Śrāvastī there was a householder.

original: de'i las ni zhing rmed cing tshong byed do //
analyzed: de'i las ni zhing rmed cing tshong byed do //
translated: His work was to plow fields and to trade.

original: des dgon pa'i gnas shig tu zhing zhig rmos te tshong la song ngo //
analyzed: des dgon pa'i gnas shig tu zhing zhig rmos te tshong la song ngo //
translated: He plowed a field in a remote place and then went to trade.

original: der slar 'khor te zhing legs sam ma legs byul ba dang zhing de'i drung na dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig spyil bo byas te gnas shing 'dug pas zhing de yang sngon dang mi 'dra bar nas dang ldan par 'gyur to //
analyzed: der slar 'khor te zhing legs sam ma legs byul ba dang zhing de'i drung na dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig spyil bo byas te gnas shing 'dug pas zhing de yang sngon dang mi 'dra bar nas dang ldan par 'gyur to //
translated: When he returned, he went to see if the field was good or not. Near the field, a monk who was a beggar had built a hut and was staying there. The field was now full of barley, unlike before.

original: zhing bdag des kyang bdag gi zhing legs pa ni dge slong de'i yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: zhing bdag des kyang bdag gi zhing legs pa ni dge slong de'i yin no snyam nas /
translated: The householder thought, “The field is good because of that monk.”

original: khyim du zan la mgron du gnyer to //
analyzed: khyim du zan la mgron du gnyer to //
translated: He invited the monk to his house for a meal.

original: de'i phyi de nyin mo dge slong ma sbom dga' mo yang khyim der bsod snyoms bslangs pa dang / khyim bdag des dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig der spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyi de nyin mo dge slong ma sbom dga' mo yang khyim der bsod snyoms bslangs pa dang / khyim bdag des dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig der spyan drangs te /
translated: The householder said, “I invited a monk to come for alms.🔽I hope he hasn’t missed his meal.” The nun said, “If I call the monk who is begging for alms and he comes, will you give to him?”

original: de zan chad par ma gyur grang zhes byas pa dang / dge slong ma de na re bsod snyoms pa de ngas bos te 'ong na nga la sbyin nam zhes @101b smras pa dang / gsol lo zhes nas dge slong ma de yang lam du bsgugs pa dang /
analyzed: de zan chad par ma gyur grang zhes byas pa dang / dge slong ma de na re bsod snyoms pa de ngas bos te 'ong na nga la sbyin nam zhes @101b smras pa dang / gsol lo zhes nas dge slong ma de yang lam du bsgugs pa dang /
translated: “I will,” he said. The nun waited on the road.

original: bsod snyoms pa dang phrad de /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa dang phrad de /
translated: She met the monk who was begging for alms.

original: 'phags pa khyim bdag 'dis mgron du gnyer ba ni khyod kyi yon tan bdag gis bsngags pas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyim bdag 'dis mgron du gnyer ba ni khyod kyi yon tan bdag gis bsngags pas so //
translated: “Noble one, this householder invited you because I praised your good qualities.”🔽“Did I tell you to praise my good qualities?” “I would rather not eat than to praise a downfall.”

original: zhes byas pa dang / ci nga'i yon tan khyod kyis sbrogs shig ces ngas bsgo'am zhes bdag ni ma zos kyang bla'i ltung ba dang bsngo ni mi phod ces slar song ngo //
analyzed: zhes byas pa dang / ci nga'i yon tan khyod kyis sbrogs shig ces ngas bsgo'am zhes bdag ni ma zos kyang bla'i ltung ba dang bsngo ni mi phod ces slar song ngo //
translated: She went back.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du gsol nas /
translated: When this had happened, she told the Blessed One.

original: de ni sngar pos pa ma gtogs so zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: de ni sngar pos pa ma gtogs so zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One said, Except as previously stated, it is permitted.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The monk refers to the group of six and others like them.

original: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The nun refers to one who has entered this Dharma.

original: zas sbyor du bcug ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zas sbyor du bcug ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: To have invited means there are two types:

original: tshul khrims dang thos pa'i sgo nas sbyor du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang thos pa'i sgo nas sbyor du bcug pa'o //
translated: to have invited through morality and learning.

original: zas zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: zas zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'o //
translated: Food refers to the five types of cooked food and the five types of uncooked food.

original: zos zhes bya ba ni mgrin par ming pa'o //
analyzed: zos zhes bya ba ni mgrin par ming pa'o //
translated: To have eaten means it has been swallowed.

original: nyes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the offense?🔽If many monks are invited to a house and a nun comes there and asks, What will you give to this monk? and they reply, We will give ground roasted grain, she says, Do not do that, give them ground roasted barley,

original: dge slong mang po khyim du 'bod pa las dge slong ma zhig der 'ongs nas khyod kyis dge slong 'di la ci sbyin zhes byas pa dang / 'bras brdos pa'i phye sbyin no zhes byas pa dang de ltar ma yin gyi de dag la nas brdos pa'i phye byin cig ce'am /
analyzed: dge slong mang po khyim du 'bod pa las dge slong ma zhig der 'ongs nas khyod kyis dge slong 'di la ci sbyin zhes byas pa dang / 'bras brdos pa'i phye sbyin no zhes byas pa dang de ltar ma yin gyi de dag la nas brdos pa'i phye byin cig ce'am /
translated: Many monks were invited to a house. A nun came there and asked, “What will you give to these monks?”🔽“We will give them flour mixed with chaff.”🔽“Do not do that. Give them flour mixed with barley.”

original: dge slong 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin gyi de dag la ra'i mar ma sbyin par 'bri 'am /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin gyi de dag la ra'i mar ma sbyin par 'bri 'am /
translated: If you say, This monk is a stream-enterer, and give him ghee from a cow, but do not give him ghee from a goat, and he eats it, then there is an offense.

original: ba'i mar byin cig ces byas te zos na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i mar byin cig ces byas te zos na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say, This monk is a stream-enterer, and give him ghee from a goat, but do not give him ghee from a cow, and he eats it, then there is an offense.

original: dge slong ma'i tshogs te bcu phung gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i tshogs te bcu phung gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: The third section for recitation of the chapter on groups of ten is finished.

original: // / yang yang zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul yangs pa can na ste /
analyzed: // / yang yang zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul yangs pa can na ste /
translated: The story of not allowing eating again and again: In the country of Shravasti,

original: khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge 'dun rnams khyim du bshos la spyan drangs pa na /
analyzed: khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge 'dun rnams khyim du bshos la spyan drangs pa na /
translated: the householder Chunda invited the Sangha to his house for a meal.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bslab pa bca' bar bzhed pa'i phyir gshegs su ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bslab pa bca' bar bzhed pa'i phyir gshegs su ma gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One did not allow it because he wanted to establish a training rule.

original: de nas / drug sde po rnams dge slong rga na zhugs shig dang 'grogs te /
analyzed: de nas / drug sde po rnams dge slong rga na zhugs shig dang 'grogs te /
translated: Then the group of six monks went with an old and sick monk.

original: lam du nye bar 'gro ba'i grong na shing aa smra'i khu ba mang du zos te dong ba dang / slad kyis khyim bdag drag shul can gyi der phyin te /
analyzed: lam du nye bar 'gro ba'i grong na shing aa smra'i khu ba mang du zos te dong ba dang / slad kyis khyim bdag drag shul can gyi der phyin te /
translated: On the way, in a village near the road, they ate a lot of mango juice and left. Later, the householder Chunda went there.

original: yon bdag gis khur ba bri mas pa dang / drug sde rnams khur ba mi za bar 'khod do //
analyzed: yon bdag gis khur ba bri mas pa dang / drug sde rnams khur ba mi za bar 'khod do //
translated: The lay donor was about to take the cake away, but the group-of-six monks said, “We haven’t eaten the cake.”

original: dge slong rgan zhugs de gral gyi tha ma na 'dug pa'i gam du khur ba 'drim pa'i mi rnams phyin te 'greng du sdod pa dang rgan zhugs kye rmi lam na bdag gis khur ba zos par shes pas mi 'drim gyis khong gis ma rmas pa snga nas🔽bdag gis bsu ste bya'o snyam nas khyim bdag bdag 'ba' zhig gis khur ba zos @102a * //
analyzed: dge slong rgan zhugs de gral gyi tha ma na 'dug pa'i gam du khur ba 'drim pa'i mi rnams phyin te 'greng du sdod pa dang rgan zhugs kye rmi lam na bdag gis khur ba zos par shes pas mi 'drim gyis khong gis ma rmas pa snga nas bdag gis bsu ste bya'o snyam nas khyim bdag bdag 'ba' zhig gis khur ba zos @102a * //
translated: The old monk was sitting at the end of the row. The man who was carrying the cake stood there, waiting. The old monk thought, “I dreamed that I ate the cake. The man is not going to give it to me. I’ll go and get it myself.”

original: pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pa ma yin gyi /
translated: He thought, “The lay donor is not the only one who has eaten the cake.🔽The group-of-six monks have eaten it too.”

original: dge slong drug sde rnams kyis kyang zos so zhes byas pa dang / de dag na re nga'i khyim na aa mra'i khur ba med snyam du dogs sam zhes khros so //
analyzed: dge slong drug sde rnams kyis kyang zos so zhes byas pa dang / de dag na re nga'i khyim na aa mra'i khur ba med snyam du dogs sam zhes khros so //
translated: The lay donor thought, “Do you suspect that there is no more cake in my house?” and he became angry.🔽After the monks had finished eating, they returned to the monastery.

original: de nas dge slong rnams zas zos zin nas phyir 'khor ba dang / dge slong rnams tshim par gyur tam /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams zas zos zin nas phyir 'khor ba dang / dge slong rnams tshim par gyur tam /
translated: “Are the monks satisfied?”

original: bde bar gsol tam zhes bkas rmas pa dang / bshos tshal ni bzang na khyim bdag ni 'di lta bu'i phyir 'khrugs so //
analyzed: bde bar gsol tam zhes bkas rmas pa dang / bshos tshal ni bzang na khyim bdag ni 'di lta bu'i phyir 'khrugs so //
translated: The Blessed One asked, Is the food good? and they replied, The food is good, but the householder is angry because of this and that.

original: zhes gsol pa dang / khyim bdag ni yus te rigs par khros so zhes bka' stsal nas drug sde rnams la rmas pa /
analyzed: zhes gsol pa dang / khyim bdag ni yus te rigs par khros so zhes bka' stsal nas drug sde rnams la rmas pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, The householder is proud and angry for no reason, and reprimanded the group of six in many ways.

original: rnam pa du mas smad de yang yang zer mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: rnam pa du mas smad de yang yang zer mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: He did not allow them to speak again, and established a rule for training in the Vinaya.

original: na ba dus ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong gcig cig nad kyis btab ste nyam chung nas sman pa la dris bas zhal sus zo shig dang sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ba dus ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong gcig cig nad kyis btab ste nyam chung nas sman pa la dris bas zhal sus zo shig dang sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Except in times of illness means that a certain monk was afflicted with illness and became weak. When he asked a doctor, he was told, Eat meat and you will recover.

original: zhes nas snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: zhes nas snyan du bdas te /
translated: Then he was carried by ear.

original: na ba dus ni der rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: na ba dus ni der rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: In times of illness, it is allowed.

original: na ba dus zhes bya ba ni dge slong zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: na ba dus zhes bya ba ni dge slong zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: In times of illness means a monk who cannot survive on one meal.

original: las dus ni dge slong gcig cig gtsug lag khang chag chag dang dkyil 'khor dang dri gtsang khang phyag dar byas nas ngal te nyal zhing 'dug pa dang de la gzhan dag gis 'phags pa ci'i slad du 'phres shing gzims /
analyzed: las dus ni dge slong gcig cig gtsug lag khang chag chag dang dkyil 'khor dang dri gtsang khang phyag dar byas nas ngal te nyal zhing 'dug pa dang de la gzhan dag gis 'phags pa ci'i slad du 'phres shing gzims /
translated: Others say to him, “Noble one, why are you lying down?”

original: bdag ni las ches te nyam chung zhing nyal zhing 'dug go //
analyzed: bdag ni las ches te nyam chung zhing nyal zhing 'dug go //
translated: He replies, “I am tired from work and am lying down.”🔽They say, “Noble one, who will do your work?”

original: 'phags pa 'o na zhal sus gsol cig ces pa dang / snyan du bdas nas las dus zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'o na zhal sus gsol cig ces pa dang / snyan du bdas nas las dus zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: He replies, “I will do it after I rest.” This is permitted as the time of work.

original: las dus ni dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyi yang rung ste las byas pa dang / tha na re lde tsam gyi sa phyags pa'am ba'i gnas mal tsam gyi skyang nul dkyil 'khor byas pa'o //
analyzed: las dus ni dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyi yang rung ste las byas pa dang / tha na re lde tsam gyi sa phyags pa'am ba'i gnas mal tsam gyi skyang nul dkyil 'khor byas pa'o //
translated: The time of work is when the Saṅgha or a stūpa has work, even if it is just sweeping the ground or smoothing the courtyard with a cow’s tail.

original: de la lam dus ni dge slong zhig lam du zhugs pa las lam gyis ngal te 'gro ma nus pa las snyan du bdas te zhal sus zar gnang ste lam gyi tshad ni dpag tshad gcig tu song ba dang / dpag tshad phyed nas slar log pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam dus ni dge slong zhig lam du zhugs pa las lam gyis ngal te 'gro ma nus pa las snyan du bdas te zhal sus zar gnang ste lam gyi tshad ni dpag tshad gcig tu song ba dang / dpag tshad phyed nas slar log pa'o //
translated: The time of the path is when a monk was on the path and could not go because he was tired. He was carried in the ear. The measure of the path is that he went one yojana and returned after half a yojana.

original: gos byin pa dus zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag cig gis dge slong rnams bshos dang gos phrugs re re gsol gyis spyon cig ces spyan drangs pa las bdag cag zas gnyis za ba spangs so zhes ma btub pa las /
analyzed: gos byin pa dus zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag cig gis dge slong rnams bshos dang gos phrugs re re gsol gyis spyon cig ces spyan drangs pa las bdag cag zas gnyis za ba spangs so zhes ma btub pa las /
translated: The time of giving cloth is when a householder in Śrāvastī invited the monks, saying, Please come for a meal and a set of robes. They said, We have abandoned eating two meals.

original: bdag cag gis zas dang gos kyis bstabs kyang 'ong du ma btub ces 'phya ba las gos dus so zhes rjes su gnang ste gos ni ras dang ras dang ras chen rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis zas dang gos kyis bstabs kyang 'ong du ma btub ces 'phya ba las gos dus so zhes rjes su gnang ste gos ni ras dang ras dang ras chen rnyed pa'o //
translated: We invited them with food and clothing, but they would not come. They criticized them. The Buddha allowed the time of cloth. The cloth is cotton, silk, and wool.

original: nyes pa ni gos @102b dang ldan pa'i khyim gnyis shig tu mgron du bos pa las gnyis ka zos na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gos @102b dang ldan pa'i khyim gnyis shig tu mgron du bos pa las gnyis ka zos na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is invited to two households that have clothing, and one eats at both.

original: sngar gos yod par bos la phyis gos med pa zhig tu bos na snga ma ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sngar gos yod par bos la phyis gos med pa zhig tu bos na snga ma ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If one is invited to a household with clothing, and later one is invited to a household without clothing, there is no offense in the first case,

original: phyi ma ni gzhan la sbyin par bya /
analyzed: phyi ma ni gzhan la sbyin par bya /
translated: but in the second case one must give the invitation to another.

original: ma byin te bdag kyang ma zos na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma byin te bdag kyang ma zos na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one does not give the invitation to another and does not eat at that household, there is no offense.

original: gos dang gos rin du byas pa zhig tu bos pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gos dang gos rin du byas pa zhig tu bos pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is invited to a household that has clothing or the price of clothing.

original: sngar gos med par bos la phyis gos yod par bos na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sngar gos med par bos la phyis gos yod par bos na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one is invited to a household without clothing, and later one is invited to a household with clothing, there is no offense.

original: gnas thun mong bar dge slong zhag lon par 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: gnas thun mong bar dge slong zhag lon par 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule that does not permit monks who have kept the rains retreat to stay in a common dwelling is as follows.

original: khyim bdag cig gis phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun dang phyi'i mu stegs pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa spyir gnas thun mong ba zhig brtsigs te /
analyzed: khyim bdag cig gis phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun dang phyi'i mu stegs pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa spyir gnas thun mong ba zhig brtsigs te /
translated: In Śrāvastī a householder built a common dwelling for the Saṅgha of the four directions and for non-Buddhist ascetics and brahmins.

original: gtsug lag khang der mu stegs pa'i dge sbyong gcer bu pa drug cu bos nas 'tsho ba dang yo byad sbyar te der bkod pa na /🔽khyim bdag de'i shag po yang chos la dad pa zhig pas gtsug lag khang de'i dge slong rnams la phyag 'tshal du song song ba dang / de na gnas pa dge 'dun ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang der mu stegs pa'i dge sbyong gcer bu pa drug cu bos nas 'tsho ba dang yo byad sbyar te der bkod pa na / khyim bdag de'i shag po yang chos la dad pa zhig pas gtsug lag khang de'i dge slong rnams la phyag 'tshal du song song ba dang / de na gnas pa dge 'dun ni ma yin gyi /
translated: He invited sixty naked ascetic tīrthikas to the temple and provided them with food and necessities.🔽The householder’s brother had faith in the Dharma, and he went to pay homage to the monks of that temple.

original: mu stegs pa sha stag nas /
analyzed: mu stegs pa sha stag nas /
translated: The residents were not members of the saṅgha, they were tīrthikas.

original: ae ma'o sa bon re bzang na zhing re ngan /
analyzed: ae ma'o sa bon re bzang na zhing re ngan /
translated: “Oh, if only the seeds were good, but the fields are bad.

original: ba tsha'i sa sdig pa'i sa ngan pa'o //
analyzed: ba tsha'i sa sdig pa'i sa ngan pa'o //
translated: The fields of the wicked are bad fields.”

original: 'o na zhing bzang ga la yod /
analyzed: 'o na zhing bzang ga la yod /
translated: “Well then, where are the good fields?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun te mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun te mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: “The saṅgha of the Bhagavān’s śrāvakas, in Śrāvastī.”

original: de nas yon bdag des yang drug sde rnams spyan drangs nas yo byad kyis mi brel bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas yon bdag des yang drug sde rnams spyan drangs nas yo byad kyis mi brel bar sbyar te /
translated: Then the benefactor invited the group of six, provided them with necessities, and did not let them be in want.

original: chung ma la zhal ta gyis shig ces bsgo nas khyim bdag de yang don gzhan zhig gi phyir ri brags kyi grong du song ba'i 'og tu chung mas zan 'dri ma pa'i tshe drug sde rnams bud med kyi yan lag nas smos shing 'phya'o //
analyzed: chung ma la zhal ta gyis shig ces bsgo nas khyim bdag de yang don gzhan zhig gi phyir ri brags kyi grong du song ba'i 'og tu chung mas zan 'dri ma pa'i tshe drug sde rnams bud med kyi yan lag nas smos shing 'phya'o //
translated: The householder said, Take care of my wife, and then went to a town in the mountains for another purpose. Later, when his wife was preparing food, the group of six monks spoke about the parts of a woman's body and ridiculed her.

original: de nas khyim bdag phyir 'ongs pa la chung mas byas na yid ma ches pas khyim bdag nyid gud du 'gro ba ltar byas te bgom na bden par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag phyir 'ongs pa la chung mas byas na yid ma ches pas khyim bdag nyid gud du 'gro ba ltar byas te bgom na bden par gyur te /
translated: Then, when the householder returned, his wife told him what had happened, but he did not believe her. The householder pretended to go away, but when he was gone, the truth became known.

original: khyim bdag gis kyang drug sde rnams bskrad pa'i thabs shig bya'i snyam nas nyi ma re re zhing khur ba re re phri nas gcer bu pa gcig gnas shing gcer bu pa gzhan rnams gud du dong ba la /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis kyang drug sde rnams bskrad pa'i thabs shig bya'i snyam nas nyi ma re re zhing khur ba re re phri nas gcer bu pa gcig gnas shing gcer bu pa gzhan rnams gud du dong ba la /
translated: The householder thought, I will devise a way to expel the group of six. He reduced the amount of food given to them by one portion each day. One naked ascetic remained, while the other naked ascetics went away.

original: yon bdag drug sde la ma dad pa skad du ma sbran nas /
analyzed: yon bdag drug sde la ma dad pa skad du ma sbran nas /
translated: The householder did not inform the group of six of the patrons' lack of faith.

original: gcer bu pa drug cu slar lhags te drug sde brdegs so //
analyzed: gcer bu pa drug cu slar lhags te drug sde brdegs so //
translated: The sixty naked ascetics returned and beat the group of six.

original: de dag kyang ma snad nas gcer bu pa ngal zhing 'khod pa la drug sde gcig gis kyang mi bcu bcu ste drug sde pos ma shi tsam du brdegs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang ma snad nas gcer bu pa ngal zhing 'khod pa la drug sde gcig gis kyang mi bcu bcu ste drug sde pos ma shi tsam du brdegs so //
translated: The naked ascetics were exhausted and sitting around. The group of six monks beat them with ten men each, until they were almost dead.

original: de nas drug sde po yang mnyan du yod par phyir 'ongs nas de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de nas drug sde po yang mnyan du yod par phyir 'ongs nas de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: Then the group of six returned to Śrāvastī. At that time, the venerable

original: @103a * // sh'a ri'i bus byang phyogs nas rgol du 'ongs pa'i mu stegs can grangs med pa btul nas bden pa la bkod do //
analyzed: @103a * // sh'a ri'i bus byang phyogs nas rgol du 'ongs pa'i mu stegs can grangs med pa btul nas bden pa la bkod do //
translated: Śāriputra subdued countless tīrthikas who had come to debate from the north and established them in the truth.

original: dge slong rnams kyi sa drug sde rnams la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus sems can gyi don 'di lta bu byas so zhes byas pa dang / drug sde rnams kyis de ni ngo mtshar ci che nged kyis kyang da bar gcer bu pa drug cu la dbyig pas chos bshad do /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi sa drug sde rnams la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus sems can gyi don 'di lta bu byas so zhes byas pa dang / drug sde rnams kyis de ni ngo mtshar ci che nged kyis kyang da bar gcer bu pa drug cu la dbyig pas chos bshad do /
translated: The monks said to the group of six, The venerable Śāriputra has performed such a benefit for sentient beings. The group of six said, What is so amazing about that? We have also explained the Dharma to sixty naked ascetics with a stick.

original: zhes byas pa dang / gzhan 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: zhes byas pa dang / gzhan 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: They were criticized by others and their reputation was ruined.

original: gnas thun mong bar zan za ba gcig las zar mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: gnas thun mong bar zan za ba gcig las zar mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: It is prescribed that one should not eat more than one meal a day in a common dwelling place.

original: na ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni yul de nyid du gtsug lag khang snga mar te /
analyzed: na ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni yul de nyid du gtsug lag khang snga mar te /
translated: Except when sick means that in that very place, in the original monastery,

original: der tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos 'chad par 'bod pa'i rigs par grogs po dad pa des bstan nas sh'a ri'i bu der pos te /
analyzed: der tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos 'chad par 'bod pa'i rigs par grogs po dad pa des bstan nas sh'a ri'i bu der pos te /
translated: the faithful friend who was worthy of being called to explain the Dharma to Venerable Shariputra taught, and Shariputra was called there.

original: der chos bshad pas na skye bo rnams kyang dad par gyur te /
analyzed: der chos bshad pas na skye bo rnams kyang dad par gyur te /
translated: Since the Dharma was explained there, the people also became faithful.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yang rlung zhugs te nad kyis btab nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yang rlung zhugs te nad kyis btab nas /
translated: Venerable Shariputra also had a wind disorder and was afflicted with illness.

original: gnas de nyid du bzhugs su gsol na ma gnang ste dong ba las mnyan du yod par phyin te skye bo mang pos sh'a ri'i bu'i slob ma la bde bar 'ongs sam zhes smras na /
analyzed: gnas de nyid du bzhugs su gsol na ma gnang ste dong ba las mnyan du yod par phyin te skye bo mang pos sh'a ri'i bu'i slob ma la bde bar 'ongs sam zhes smras na /
translated: When asked to stay in that very place, he did not allow it and left, and when he arrived in Shravasti, many people asked Shariputra's disciple, Did you come well?

original: sems can mang po'i don byas pa ni bde na mkhan po nad kyis btab pa ni mi bde'o zhes byas pa dang / snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: sems can mang po'i don byas pa ni bde na mkhan po nad kyis btab pa ni mi bde'o zhes byas pa dang / snyan du bdas te /
translated: When he said, It was good for the sake of many sentient beings, but it was not good for the preceptor who was afflicted with illness, they were distressed.

original: na ba dus te na ba la pus 'khyud 'chang ba'ang rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: na ba dus te na ba la pus 'khyud 'chang ba'ang rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: When one is sick, it is permitted to hold one’s knees.

original: gnas thun mong du zhag lon te zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa ni nyan thos kyi gnas su'o //
analyzed: gnas thun mong du zhag lon te zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa ni nyan thos kyi gnas su'o //
translated: “Having stayed together in the same place for one day” means that the naked ascetics stayed in the place of the Disciples.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang ngo //
translated: “The monks” refers to the group of six and others.

original: min zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu las dgongs te gnang ba'o //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu las dgongs te gnang ba'o //
translated: “Not” means that it is permitted by the intention of Śāriputra.

original: zan cig zo zhig ces bya ba ni de las lhag par zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zan cig zo zhig ces bya ba ni de las lhag par zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Eat one meal” means that if one eats more than that, there is a downfall.

original: nyes pa ni gnas de na gnas pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gnas de na gnas pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
translated: The offense is a minor offense when staying in that place.

original: lhag par zan zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par zan zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one eats more than that, there is a downfall.

original: de na gnas shing gud du zan gnas pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: de na gnas shing gud du zan gnas pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one stays elsewhere and eats elsewhere, there is a minor offense.

original: zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽gud du gnas shing gud du za ba ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro // gud du gnas shing gud du za ba ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If one eats, there is a downfall.

original: gud du gnas shing der za na gnas pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gud du gnas shing der za na gnas pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one stays elsewhere and eats there, there is no offense.

original: der za na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der za na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats there, there is a downfall.

original: mang po'i dang gnyen gyi dang / yon bdag na re 'dug shig ce na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mang po'i dang gnyen gyi dang / yon bdag na re 'dug shig ce na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if many people, relatives, or benefactors request one to stay.

original: phye la sogs pa ltung bzed gang ba gnyis gsum las len du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: phye la sogs pa ltung bzed gang ba gnyis gsum las len du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin of the prohibition against accepting more than two or three full begging bowls of grain, etc.🔽was that in Śrāvastī, six monks heard that merchants from the north were coming and they asked the merchants for clothes and food. The merchants became exhausted from carrying the loads and were harmed.

original: byang phyogs nas tshong pa lhags pa drug sde rnams kyis thos nas de dag la drug sdes gos dang zas dag bslangs te tshod ma zin pa las tshong pa dag brgyags chad de nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur @103b pa dang / phyis mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag gcig cig gnas pa des chung ma snga phyir lan bdun gyi bar du blangs na yang kun dus las 'das nas slad kyis chung ma dag blangs na su yang mi ster cing 'dug pa dar khyim bdag gzhan zhig gi bu
analyzed: byang phyogs nas tshong pa lhags pa drug sde rnams kyis thos nas de dag la drug sdes gos dang zas dag bslangs te tshod ma zin pa las tshong pa dag brgyags chad de nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur @103b pa dang / phyis mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag gcig cig gnas pa des chung ma snga phyir lan bdun gyi bar du blangs na yang kun dus las 'das nas slad kyis chung ma dag blangs na su yang mi ster cing 'dug pa dar khyim bdag gzhan zhig gi bu
translated: Later, in Śrāvastī, a householder who had taken seven wives in succession because they all died, took another wife, but no one would give him a daughter.

original: mo mig g-yas pa zhar ma zhig yod de /
analyzed: mo mig g-yas pa zhar ma zhig yod de /
translated: The daughter of another householder had a blind right eye.

original: de su la byin yang mi 'dod pa de chung ma shi ba'i mi de la sbyin par khyim mtshes rgan mo zhig 'dug pas smyan byas nas blang bar dus byas so //
analyzed: de su la byin yang mi 'dod pa de chung ma shi ba'i mi de la sbyin par khyim mtshes rgan mo zhig 'dug pas smyan byas nas blang bar dus byas so //
translated: The old neighbor woman who had been the go-between said, I will give it to whoever wants it.

original: de'i grogs po zhig gis bu mo g-yas zhar mo de ci rung len pa'i mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i grogs po zhig gis bu mo g-yas zhar mo de ci rung len pa'i mi rigs kyi /
translated: A friend of the man said, It is not right to take a girl who is a left-over.

original: gud na yugs sa mo zhig yod de /
analyzed: gud na yugs sa mo zhig yod de /
translated: There is a widow in another place.🔽 Take her and give up the former one.🔽 The man said, I will do that, and he gave up the former one.

original: de blang gis snga ma thong shig ces nas snga ma btang ba'i klan ka tshol ba'i bar du bag ma blang ba'i dus la bab ste zhag grangs tshang nas /
analyzed: de blang gis snga ma thong shig ces nas snga ma btang ba'i klan ka tshol ba'i bar du bag ma blang ba'i dus la bab ste zhag grangs tshang nas /
translated: The time came for the wedding, and the number of days was completed.

original: bu mo'i pha ma yang bu mo gtong ba'i bshos tshal dag shom zhing sbyor ba dang tshe dang ldan pa drug sde rnams lhags te /
analyzed: bu mo'i pha ma yang bu mo gtong ba'i bshos tshal dag shom zhing sbyor ba dang tshe dang ldan pa drug sde rnams lhags te /
translated: The parents of the girl were preparing the wedding feast and the gifts to be given with the girl when the group of six monks came and said,

original: che zhe bag mar 'gro ba'i zan ded la byin cig ce nas tshod ma zin te /
analyzed: che zhe bag mar 'gro ba'i zan ded la byin cig ce nas tshod ma zin te /
translated: Give us the food that is to be given to the bride, Chudapanthaka.

original: phye dang khur ba mang du blangs so //
analyzed: phye dang khur ba mang du blangs so //
translated: They took a lot of flour and cakes.

original: de'i rjes la dge slong ma bcu gnyis sdes kyang bslangs pas ston mo'i rgyu zad de /
analyzed: de'i rjes la dge slong ma bcu gnyis sdes kyang bslangs pas ston mo'i rgyu zad de /
translated: Then twelve nuns asked for a feast. The food for the feast was exhausted.

original: de dag gis mag pa la bshol bas dus byas na byin na ni snga ma'i dus bzhin du byin cig / de yang klan ka'i skabs rnyed de /
analyzed: de dag gis mag pa la bshol bas dus byas na byin na ni snga ma'i dus bzhin du byin cig / de yang klan ka'i skabs rnyed de /
translated: They said to the son-in-law, Wait, but he died. If you had given it, you would have given it as before. They found an opportunity to criticize him.

original: bu mo btang nas yugs sa mo blangs so //
analyzed: bu mo btang nas yugs sa mo blangs so //
translated: He sent away his daughter and took a widow.

original: de nas bu mo g-yas zhar mo yang su la byin yang ma 'dod do //🔽de ltar gyur pa khyim mtshes rnams 'phya ste /
analyzed: de nas bu mo g-yas zhar mo yang su la byin yang ma 'dod do // de ltar gyur pa khyim mtshes rnams 'phya ste /
translated: Then the daughter, who was a hunchback, was not wanted by anyone.

original: bu mo sus kyang mi 'dod pa las bag mar btang bar byas pa las /
analyzed: bu mo sus kyang mi 'dod pa las bag mar btang bar byas pa las /
translated: The neighbors ridiculed her, saying, She was given in marriage even though no one wanted her daughter.

original: drug sdes bar chad byas so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin no zhes bkas smad de /
analyzed: drug sdes bar chad byas so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas dge sbyong gi bya ba ma yin no zhes bkas smad de /
translated: They said, The group of six created an obstacle. They were criticized, saying, This is not the duty of ascetics.

original: slan chad khyim bdag dad pas bstabs kyang lhung ba zad gsum las len du mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: slan chad khyim bdag dad pas bstabs kyang lhung ba zad gsum las len du mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: They were reprimanded, saying, From now on, even if a faithful householder offers, you are not allowed to accept more than three mouthfuls.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The one called monk is the group of six, and others like them.

original: mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis yan chad la bya'o //
analyzed: mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis yan chad la bya'o //
translated: Many means two or more.

original: grong zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim mo //
analyzed: grong zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim mo //
translated: Village means the houses of Brahmins and householders.

original: dang bzhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la mngon sum du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang bzhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la mngon sum du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Together means facing the Three Jewels.

original: dus kyis bdar te 'dod ces bya ba ni dgos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyis bdar te 'dod ces bya ba ni dgos par gyur pa'o //
translated: In due time means when there is a need.

original: lhung bzed gsum long shig ces bya ba ni rab 'bring gsum ste chen po ni yul mnyam ka'i 'bras skam drug phul do'i chan dang tshod mar shong zhing kha ra na la mtheb mo'i ngos gang ma thug pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed gsum long shig ces bya ba ni rab 'bring gsum ste chen po ni yul mnyam ka'i 'bras skam drug phul do'i chan dang tshod mar shong zhing kha ra na la mtheb mo'i ngos gang ma thug pa'o //
translated: Take three alms bowls means the best, medium, and least. The large one can hold six measures of dry grain from the region, a full measure of cooked food, and vegetables, and its mouth does not touch the tip of the thumb.

original: chung ngu ni yul mnyam ka'i 'bras drug phul gang gi chan dang tshod mar shong ba'o //
analyzed: chung ngu ni yul mnyam ka'i 'bras drug phul gang gi chan dang tshod mar shong ba'o //
translated: The small one can hold six measures of dry grain from the region, a full measure of cooked food, and vegetables.

original: bar ma ni de gnyis kyi bar ma la @104a * //
analyzed: bar ma ni de gnyis kyi bar ma la @104a * //
translated: The medium one should be between those two.

original: bya'o // dge slong phyi rol kun dga' ra bar deng la dge slong 'khod pa la gos shig ces bya ba'i snga ma gzhi na 'khod pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: bya'o // dge slong phyi rol kun dga' ra bar deng la dge slong 'khod pa la gos shig ces bya ba'i snga ma gzhi na 'khod pa rnams la'o //
translated: Go to the outer courtyard and tell the monks who are there to come and take robes means to those who are already there.

original: nyes pa ni gsum char lhung bzed chen pos blangs nas dge slong ma'i tshe na nyes byas blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gsum char lhung bzed chen pos blangs nas dge slong ma'i tshe na nyes byas blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes the three faults with a large alms bowl, and then takes a fault when one is a nun, it becomes a downfall.

original: gnyis chen po gcig chung dus blangs na yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis chen po gcig chung dus blangs na yang ngo //
translated: If one takes two large and one small, it is also that.

original: gnyis chen po gcig ni 'bring dang yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis chen po gcig ni 'bring dang yang ngo //
translated: If one takes two large and one medium, it is also that.

original: gnyis ni 'bring po gcig ni chen pos na yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'bring po gcig ni chen pos na yang ngo //
translated: If one takes two medium and one large, it is also that.

original: dge slong gis 'bras skam drug phul phyed dang lnga'i chan las cung zad cing lhag par blangs na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis 'bras skam drug phul phyed dang lnga'i chan las cung zad cing lhag par blangs na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk takes more than five and a half handfuls of dry grain, it is a downfall in all cases.

original: zas spangs pa las lhag mar byas pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: zas spangs pa las lhag mar byas pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for not allowing the eating of food that has been left over from a meal is in Śrāvastī.

original: de na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi dge slong rnams la stan gcig par za ba ni bya ba nyung gnod pa nyung /
analyzed: de na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi dge slong rnams la stan gcig par za ba ni bya ba nyung gnod pa nyung /
translated: There the Blessed One said to the monks in the retinue, “Eating on a single seat is to be done. It has little activity and little harm.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas shing yon tan gyi tshogs kyang rig gis dge slong khyed rnams kyang stan gcig par zo shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas shing yon tan gyi tshogs kyang rig gis dge slong khyed rnams kyang stan gcig par zo shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, you should also eat in one sitting.

original: dge slong dag stan gcig par zan za ba'i tshe slob dpon dang mkhan po dang bla ma dag rgyu ba la langs shing phyag byas pas na zas spang bar gyur to snyam nas ma zos pas nyam chung zhing ring pas ma brtas par gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag stan gcig par zan za ba'i tshe slob dpon dang mkhan po dang bla ma dag rgyu ba la langs shing phyag byas pas na zas spang bar gyur to snyam nas ma zos pas nyam chung zhing ring pas ma brtas par gyur te /
translated: When the monks ate in one sitting, they stood up and bowed to their teachers, preceptors, and gurus when they came by. Thinking, I have given up my food, they did not eat. They became weak and emaciated.🔽The Buddha said, Do not stand up.

original: snyan du bdas nas ma ldang shig ces bka' stsal pa dang / yang zas phyi ma 'drin pa'i tshe chog ces spangs pas snga ma yang spangs par 'gyur ro snyam nas ma zos pas nyam chung zhing rid par gyur nas yang bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: snyan du bdas nas ma ldang shig ces bka' stsal pa dang / yang zas phyi ma 'drin pa'i tshe chog ces spangs pas snga ma yang spangs par 'gyur ro snyam nas ma zos pas nyam chung zhing rid par gyur nas yang bka' stsal pa /
translated: When they were served a second portion of food, they thought, I have already given up my food, and did not eat. They became weak and emaciated. The Buddha said,

original: phyi ma spangs kyang snga ma spangs par mi 'gyur gyi ci tsam 'dod kyi bar du zo zhig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sde rnams spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang 'dris par za bas na snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: phyi ma spangs kyang snga ma spangs par mi 'gyur gyi ci tsam 'dod kyi bar du zo zhig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sde rnams spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang 'dris par za bas na snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The group-of-six ate as much as they liked, whether they gave up the former practice or not.

original: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad de /
analyzed: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad de /
translated: They were criticized, saying, This is not the duty of a monk.

original: spangs pa'i zas za na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pa'i zas za na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you eat leftover food, you will be at fault.

original: zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: zhes 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: Thus, training in the Vinaya was established.

original: lhag mar gnang ba ni phyis khyim bdag cig gis dge slong dag mgron du bos na /
analyzed: lhag mar gnang ba ni phyis khyim bdag cig gis dge slong dag mgron du bos na /
translated: Later, a householder invited the monks to a meal.

original: dge slong nad pa mang ste /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa mang ste /
translated: There were many sick monks,

original: nad pa rnams kyi zan bring brang du mnos pa dang / za ma nus pa'i lhag ma rnams sa la bor ba dang / bya khyis thu ba'i sgra tsa rtsi thos pa snyan gyis gsan nas yon bdag dang pas byin pa'i zas chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir lhag mar bya ba'i cho gnas ngo //
analyzed: nad pa rnams kyi zan bring brang du mnos pa dang / za ma nus pa'i lhag ma rnams sa la bor ba dang / bya khyis thu ba'i sgra tsa rtsi thos pa snyan gyis gsan nas yon bdag dang pas byin pa'i zas chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir lhag mar bya ba'i cho gnas ngo //
translated: and the leftovers of the sick monks' food, which they could not eat, were thrown on the ground. The Buddha heard the sound of the birds and dogs fighting over it. In order that the monks not eat the food given by the householder, he established the ritual for leftovers.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The monks are the group of six and others like them.

original: zas zhes bya ba ni bza' ba @104b lnga dang bca' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: zas zhes bya ba ni bza' ba @104b lnga dang bca' ba lnga'o //
translated: The food is the five kinds of food and the five kinds of drink.

original: bca' ba lnga ni spang bar bya ba med do //
analyzed: bca' ba lnga ni spang bar bya ba med do //
translated: There is no prohibition of the five kinds of drink.

original: rtsa ba dang sdong po dang lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang / bza' bar bya ba lnga la spang bar bya ba yod de //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang sdong po dang lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang / bza' bar bya ba lnga la spang bar bya ba yod de //
translated: There is a prohibition of the five kinds of food, which are roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: gang zhe na 'bras chan dang / sran ma dang / zan dang / sha dang / khur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na 'bras chan dang / sran ma dang / zan dang / sha dang / khur ba la bya'o //
translated: What are the five kinds of food? They are boiled rice, soup, flour cakes, meat, and pastry.

original: bza' ba lnga yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The five kinds of drink are also prohibited.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / lag pa khur ba snum la reg pas phyi ma la rag pas phyi ma kun spangs so snyam pa la rnam pa lngas na spangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / lag pa khur ba snum la reg pas phyi ma la rag pas phyi ma kun spangs so snyam pa la rnam pa lngas na spangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: When the hand touches the oily pastry, the thought I will abandon all in the future arises. It should be understood that this is abandoned in five ways.

original: zas gnang ba dang / zas 'drim par gnang ba dang / zas 'drim par gzas par gnang ba dang / zas spangs par gnang ba dang / spyod lam las nyams par gnang ba'o //
analyzed: zas gnang ba dang / zas 'drim par gnang ba dang / zas 'drim par gzas par gnang ba dang / zas spangs par gnang ba dang / spyod lam las nyams par gnang ba'o //
translated: 1. Permission to eat, 2. Permission to serve food, 3. Permission to serve food that has been announced, 4. Permission to reject food, 5. Permission to deviate from proper conduct.

original: zas gnang ba ni bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga gnang ba'o //
analyzed: zas gnang ba ni bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga gnang ba'o //
translated: Permission to eat is to eat the five foods and five drinks.

original: zas 'drim pa ni skyes pa dang bud med gnang ba'o //
analyzed: zas 'drim pa ni skyes pa dang bud med gnang ba'o //
translated: Permission to serve food is to serve food to men and women.

original: 'drim par gzas pa ni nye 'khor na bza' ba lnga gnang ba'o //
analyzed: 'drim par gzas pa ni nye 'khor na bza' ba lnga gnang ba'o //
translated: Permission to serve food that has been announced is to serve the five foods in the vicinity.

original: zas spangs par gnang ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga gnang ba'o //
analyzed: zas spangs par gnang ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga gnang ba'o //
translated: Permission to reject food is to reject the five foods and five drinks.

original: spyod lam las nyams pa ni gang la stan 'dug pa de las langs pa ste /
analyzed: spyod lam las nyams pa ni gang la stan 'dug pa de las langs pa ste /
translated: Permission to deviate from proper conduct is to rise from the seat where one is sitting.

original: de lngas na zas spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lngas na zas spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these five, one should know that food is rejected.

original: de las ldog pa lngas na ma spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las ldog pa lngas na ma spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the opposite five, one should know that it is not rejected.

original: gzhan yang lhag ma lus pa'i tshig lngas na ma spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lhag ma lus pa'i tshig lngas na ma spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, by the five words with remainder, one should know that it is not rejected.

original: lhag ma med pa'i tshig lngas na spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i tshig lngas na spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the five words without remainder, one should know that it is rejected.

original: lhag ma lus pa'i tshig lngas lus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma lus pa'i tshig lngas lus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the remainder?

original: skad cig mi dgos so zhes byas pa dang / skad cig gzhan la byin cig ces byas pa dang / skad cig phyis zos so zhes byas pa dang / skad cig chog go zhes byas pa dang / skad cig sdod cig ces pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig mi dgos so zhes byas pa dang / skad cig gzhan la byin cig ces byas pa dang / skad cig phyis zos so zhes byas pa dang / skad cig chog go zhes byas pa dang / skad cig sdod cig ces pa byas pa ste /
translated: The five statements of remainder are: “I don’t need it right now,” “Give it to me at another time,” “I will eat it later,” “I am satisfied for now,” and “Wait a moment.”

original: de ltar na lhag ma lus pa'i tshig lnga'o //
analyzed: de ltar na lhag ma lus pa'i tshig lnga'o //
translated: Thus, there are five statements of remainder.

original: lhag ma med pa'i tshig lnga ni skad cig ces ma smos la gong ma las bzlog pa'i tshig lngas ni lhag ma med pa'i tshig lngar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i tshig lnga ni skad cig ces ma smos la gong ma las bzlog pa'i tshig lngas ni lhag ma med pa'i tshig lngar rig par bya'o //
translated: The five statements of no remainder are the opposite of the above, without the word “moment.”

original: zos na nyes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
analyzed: zos na nyes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
translated: “Eaten” means swallowed.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Downfall” is as above.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis spangs pa'i zas spangs par 'du shes pa bzhin du lhag mar ma byas pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis spangs pa'i zas spangs par 'du shes pa bzhin du lhag mar ma byas pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Fault” means that if a monk eats food that is to be discarded, thinking that it is to be discarded, and it is not leftover, he commits a downfall.

original: spangs pa ma byas par spangs par 'du shes na lhag mar ma byas pa zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pa ma byas par spangs par 'du shes na lhag mar ma byas pa zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one perceives what has been discarded as discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense.

original: spangs ba la spangs par 'du shes bzhin du lhag mar ma byas pa zos @105a * //
analyzed: spangs ba la spangs par 'du shes bzhin du lhag mar ma byas pa zos @105a * //
translated: If one perceives what has not been discarded as not discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,

original: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,

analyzed: spangs par ma byas par the tshom za bzhin du lhag mar ma byas pa zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skyo ma dang thug pa ni kha gzar bzhag na mi mthong ba dang / sor mo lnga'i rjes snang na spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyo ma dang thug pa ni kha gzar bzhag na mi mthong ba dang / sor mo lnga'i rjes snang na spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,

original: skom za ba la spang ba med do //
analyzed: skom za ba la spang ba med do //
translated: one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,🔽one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,

original: lhag mar byas pa ni dge slong bdag gis zan spangs pa phyis za 'dod na yang dge slong zan za zhing 'dug pa spyod lam ma nyams pa'i drung du sog la phyag rgyas la tsog tsog por 'dug ste /
analyzed: lhag mar byas pa ni dge slong bdag gis zan spangs pa phyis za 'dod na yang dge slong zan za zhing 'dug pa spyod lam ma nyams pa'i drung du sog la phyag rgyas la tsog tsog por 'dug ste /
translated: one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,

original: dge slong de la gsol te lhag mar gyis te zo zhing /
analyzed: dge slong de la gsol te lhag mar gyis te zo zhing /
translated: one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one is unsure whether or not it has been discarded, then if one eats what has not been left over,

original: dge slong gcig gis lhag mar byas na thams cad la zar rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis lhag mar byas na thams cad la zar rung ngo //
translated: If one monk has left over, it is suitable for all to eat.

original: zas lhag mar ma byas pa'i zas stobs su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: zas lhag mar ma byas pa'i zas stobs su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin of the prohibition against eating food that has not been left over was in Śrāvastī.

original: khyim bdag gcig cig longs spyod dag kyang 'grib par gyur nas dge slong zhig la gsol te rab tu phyung ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag gcig cig longs spyod dag kyang 'grib par gyur nas dge slong zhig la gsol te rab tu phyung ngo //
translated: A certain householder, whose wealth was diminishing, requested a monk to go forth.

original: rgan zhugs kyang dran pa nyams pa zhig pas rtag tu ltung ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgan zhugs kyang dran pa nyams pa zhig pas rtag tu ltung ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The old man had also lost his memory, so he was always committing downfalls.

original: de mkhan pos mdun du tsog tsog 'dug tu bcug nas de ltung ba bshags su bcug go //
analyzed: de mkhan pos mdun du tsog tsog 'dug tu bcug nas de ltung ba bshags su bcug go //
translated: The preceptor made him sit in front of him and made him confess his downfalls.

original: de yang rab tu khros nas slad kyis khyim bdag gis dge 'dun rnams spyan drangs so //
analyzed: de yang rab tu khros nas slad kyis khyim bdag gis dge 'dun rnams spyan drangs so //
translated: He became very angry and later the householder invited the saṅgha.

original: dge slong dag der bshos gsol ba'i 'og tu dge slong de gnyis kyang zas zos nas nye bar 'gro ba'i grong du song ste zan dag byin nas zan zos zhes byas na de dag gis lhag mar byos la khyer cig ces byas pa dang / de gnyis kyis blangs nas mnyan du yod par phyin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag der bshos gsol ba'i 'og tu dge slong de gnyis kyang zas zos nas nye bar 'gro ba'i grong du song ste zan dag byin nas zan zos zhes byas na de dag gis lhag mar byos la khyer cig ces byas pa dang / de gnyis kyis blangs nas mnyan du yod par phyin te /
translated: After the monks had eaten, the two monks also ate and then went to the village of Nyepu. When they gave out food and said, Eat, they said, Make leftovers and take them.🔽The two took the food and went to Śrāvastī.

original: rgan zhugs ni lhag mar byed du bcug / slob dpon ni chu 'tshag tu song nas slar 'ong ba dang / lhag mar byas sam zhes smras na lhag mar byas so zhes nas zos pa'i 'og tu slob dpon khyod ni lhag mar ma byas pa'i zas zos pas ltung ba byung ngo zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: rgan zhugs ni lhag mar byed du bcug / slob dpon ni chu 'tshag tu song nas slar 'ong ba dang / lhag mar byas sam zhes smras na lhag mar byas so zhes nas zos pa'i 'og tu slob dpon khyod ni lhag mar ma byas pa'i zas zos pas ltung ba byung ngo zhes byas pa dang /
translated: The old man made them make leftovers, and the master went to wring out his robes. When he returned, he asked, Did you make leftovers? They said, We made leftovers. After they ate, he said, Master, you have incurred an infraction by eating food that was not made into leftovers.

original: ngas ltung ba ma mthong ngo zhes byas pa las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: ngas ltung ba ma mthong ngo zhes byas pa las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: They said, I do not see an infraction. They argued back and forth.

original: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad nas /
translated: He disparaged them, saying, This is not the work of a monk.

original: da phyin chad lhag mar ma byas pa'i zas stobs su mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: da phyin chad lhag mar ma byas pa'i zas stobs su mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: and from now on, I undertake the training to not eat leftover food that has not been made pure.

original: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni rgan zhugs te /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni rgan zhugs te /
translated: “A monk” means an elder monk,

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: but it also refers to someone else who is similar.

original: shes zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis rig pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: shes zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis rig pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: “Knows” means that he himself is aware of it or that someone else tells him.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs so //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs so //
translated: “Monk” means someone who has entered this Dharma.

original: zan zos nas spangs par shes zhes bya ba ni 'grangs nas chog par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zan zos nas spangs par shes zhes bya ba ni 'grangs nas chog par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Having eaten, he has rejected” means that he has eaten until he is full.

original: lhag mar ma byas zhes bya ba ni lhag mar byas pa ste @105b bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mar ma byas zhes bya ba ni lhag mar byas pa ste @105b bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga pa'o //
translated: “Leftover food that has not been made pure” means leftover food that has not been made pure by one of the five ways of making it pure.

original: dus kyis stobs zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du stobs shing klan ka btsal te ltung ba dbyung bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyis stobs zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du stobs shing klan ka btsal te ltung ba dbyung bar bsams pa'o //
translated: “By force” means by repeatedly exerting force, looking for an opportunity, and thinking about how to bring about a downfall.

original: rkyen de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: “That very condition” means that it is not something else.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: dge slong mtshams kyi nang du 'dus shing zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong mtshams kyi nang du 'dus shing zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule against eating in a group within the boundaries of a monastery was at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong lha sbyin kun dga' ra ba'i mtshams kyi nang du dge slong mang shig 'dus shing zan za ba dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan ma ston pas dge slong dag 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong lha sbyin kun dga' ra ba'i mtshams kyi nang du dge slong mang shig 'dus shing zan za ba dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan ma ston pas dge slong dag 'phya ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad de /
translated: At that time, the monk Devadatta showed signs of disagreement with the many monks who were eating in a group within the boundaries of the monastery. The monks reported this to the Blessed One, who rebuked Devadatta in many ways and prohibited eating in a group.

original: 'dus shing zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: 'dus shing zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The rule was formulated: “Do not eat in a group.”

original: na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni slad kyis dge slong mang zhig na nas sman pa la dris na zhal su sa logs shig tu zos na phan no zhes nas nyan du gsol to //
analyzed: na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni slad kyis dge slong mang zhig na nas sman pa la dris na zhal su sa logs shig tu zos na phan no zhes nas nyan du gsol to //
translated: “When sick” means that later many monks became sick and asked a doctor, who said, “If you eat separately, it will help.” They asked the Blessed One, and he allowed them to eat separately.

original: na na logs shig tu bzar gnang ste dge slong nad pa za gcig gis mi 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: na na logs shig tu bzar gnang ste dge slong nad pa za gcig gis mi 'tsho ba'o //
translated: When sick, they should eat separately, because a sick monk cannot survive on one meal.

original: las dus ni dge slong dag cig phyag dar dang dkyil 'khor dag byas pas chad de nyal zhing 'dug pa snyan du bdas nas rjes su gnang ste /
analyzed: las dus ni dge slong dag cig phyag dar dang dkyil 'khor dag byas pas chad de nyal zhing 'dug pa snyan du bdas nas rjes su gnang ste /
translated: The time of work is when the monks are tired from sweeping and preparing the maṇḍala and are sleeping.

original: las mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi las byas pa'am /
analyzed: las mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi las byas pa'am /
translated: The work is the work of the stūpa and the saṃgha.

original: chung du na pa'i gnas ma la tsam gyi dkyil 'khor byas pa'o //
analyzed: chung du na pa'i gnas ma la tsam gyi dkyil 'khor byas pa'o //
translated: Or, at the very least, it is the maṇḍala of the size of a cow's footprint.

original: lam gyi dus ni dge slong zhig lam du zhugs pa las /
analyzed: lam gyi dus ni dge slong zhig lam du zhugs pa las /
translated: The time of the path is when a monk has set out on the path.

original: de dag lam gyis ngal zhing 'gro mi nus pa las rjes su gnang ste /
analyzed: de dag lam gyis ngal zhing 'gro mi nus pa las rjes su gnang ste /
translated: Because of the fatigue of the path, he is unable to go.

original: dpag tshad gcig tu song ba'am dpag tshad phyed nas slar 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad gcig tu song ba'am dpag tshad phyed nas slar 'khor ba'o //
translated: He goes for one yojana or half a yojana and returns.

original: grur zhugs pa ni chu 'byam du dong bas 'du mi khom pas dpag tshad phyed dang gcig tu song ba'o //
analyzed: grur zhugs pa ni chu 'byam du dong bas 'du mi khom pas dpag tshad phyed dang gcig tu song ba'o //
translated: Embarking on a boat is going for one and a half yojanas because of the inconvenience of gathering on the water.

original: dus ston zhes bya ba ni so so'i dus ston chen po'i 'dur mi khom pas so sor byin pa'o //
analyzed: dus ston zhes bya ba ni so so'i dus ston chen po'i 'dur mi khom pas so sor byin pa'o //
translated: Festival is when there is no opportunity to gather at the great individual festivals, so they are given individually.

original: dge sbyong gi zas dus zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu byung ba ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi zas dus zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu byung ba ste /
translated: The time of the food of the ascetic is when one has gone forth in the external maṇḍala.

original: kun du chos zan byin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun du chos zan byin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Giving the Dharma to the laity, and so on.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The downfall is as before.

original: dus ni de dag dang mthun pa ste rjes su gnang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dus ni de dag dang mthun pa ste rjes su gnang ba la bya'o //
