translated: The time is when it is permitted, and is in accordance with those.

original: nyes pa ni mtshams kyi nang la mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes dang the tshom du bcas te zos na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni mtshams kyi nang la mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes dang the tshom du bcas te zos na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault is that if one eats within the boundaries, thinking that one is within the boundaries, or if one is unsure of it, there is one downfall.

original: dge 'dun du ma lags sam bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas grangs su bskang ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma lags sam bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas grangs su bskang ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not a fully ordained monk, or if one is not counted in the assembly, there is an offense.

original: shang tse dang lan tshva kha gzar gang tsam yan man bsres pa'am /
analyzed: shang tse dang lan tshva kha gzar gang tsam yan man bsres pa'am /
translated: If one mixes in a little salt or a little vinegar, or

original: yon bdag gis so so'i gnas su phul ba ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yon bdag gis so so'i gnas su phul ba ni nyes pa med do //
translated: if the donor offers it to one’s place, there is no fault.

original: dus ma yin par kha zas bzar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dus ma yin par kha zas bzar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story of the prohibition against eating at improper times took place in Śrāvastī.

original: @106a * // de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bus au p'a li la sogs pa gzhon nu bcu bdun rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas da dag kyang snga dro bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang bud med dag gis mthong nas /
analyzed: @106a * // de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bus au p'a li la sogs pa gzhon nu bcu bdun rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas da dag kyang snga dro bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang bud med dag gis mthong nas /
translated: When they went for alms in the morning, women saw them and said,

original: ae ma'o ngo mtshar che btsas ma thag ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o ngo mtshar che btsas ma thag ste /
translated: “Oh, how wonderful!🔽Do you not know that as soon as they are born, they are put in salt and thrown into a well?”

original: kha lan tshas dgang zhing khron pa'i nang du zhugs kyang mi shes sam zhes byas pa dang / de dag kyang skyengs nas bdag cag zan chad pa bla'i 'di lta bu'i tshig ngan pa ni ma thos kyang rung ngo zhes nas /
analyzed: kha lan tshas dgang zhing khron pa'i nang du zhugs kyang mi shes sam zhes byas pa dang / de dag kyang skyengs nas bdag cag zan chad pa bla'i 'di lta bu'i tshig ngan pa ni ma thos kyang rung ngo zhes nas /
translated: They were ashamed and said, “It is better for us to starve than to hear such bad words.”

original: de dag kyang de'i nyin mo zan ma zos nas nus kyi bar du ni dge ba la spyod /
analyzed: de dag kyang de'i nyin mo zan ma zos nas nus kyi bar du ni dge ba la spyod /
translated: They did not eat that day, and they practiced virtue until the next morning.

original: ma nus nas 'phres shing nyal ba bsnyen dga' bos mthong nas khyed cag gzhan gyi zas zos nas de ltar nyal ba'i rigs sam zhes byas pa dang / nged kyis ma zos so zhes de ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: ma nus nas 'phres shing nyal ba bsnyen dga' bos mthong nas khyed cag gzhan gyi zas zos nas de ltar nyal ba'i rigs sam zhes byas pa dang / nged kyis ma zos so zhes de ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras so //
translated: “We did not eat it,” they said, and they told him what had happened.

original: de'i tshe grong khyer gyi mi dga' sde rnams zas skom bsdus nas dze ta'i tshal du dong ba bcu bdun sdes mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe grong khyer gyi mi dga' sde rnams zas skom bsdus nas dze ta'i tshal du dong ba bcu bdun sdes mthong ste /
translated: At that time the people of the city gathered food and drink and went to Jetavana. The group of seventeen saw them and said,🔽“If you give food and drink, it will be meritorious.”

original: zas skom sbyin na bsod nams su 'gyur ba dag smras pa dang / de rnams kyis kyang bcu bdun sde la zas skom byin no //
analyzed: zas skom sbyin na bsod nams su 'gyur ba dag smras pa dang / de rnams kyis kyang bcu bdun sde la zas skom byin no //
translated: They also gave food and drink to the group of seventeen.

original: de dag kyang zas skom zos nas 'grangs te /
analyzed: de dag kyang zas skom zos nas 'grangs te /
translated: They ate the food and drink and became full.

original: gnyis gnyis gsum gsum du bcad de kha ton 'don pa la zhugs pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos mthong ste /
analyzed: gnyis gnyis gsum gsum du bcad de kha ton 'don pa la zhugs pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos mthong ste /
translated: They divided the food into pairs and threes and began to recite the scriptures. Nanda saw them and said,🔽“Is it proper for you to lie down like this after eating the food of others?”

original: khyed cag da ci ni nyal na da ni brtson pa la zhugs sam zhes byas pa dang / kha zas sbyin pa ni yon tan lnga ste tshe byin pa dang mdog byin pa dang / stobs byin pa dang / bde ba byin pa dang / spobs pa byin pa ste /
analyzed: khyed cag da ci ni nyal na da ni brtson pa la zhugs sam zhes byas pa dang / kha zas sbyin pa ni yon tan lnga ste tshe byin pa dang mdog byin pa dang / stobs byin pa dang / bde ba byin pa dang / spobs pa byin pa ste /
translated: The five qualities of giving food are: giving life, giving complexion, giving strength, giving happiness, and giving eloquence.

original: bdag cag khyim bdag la kha zas bslangs te zos so zhes byas pa dang / ci khyed dus las 'das par zan zar gnang ngam zhes smras pa dang / bdag cag dus su ni zan ma rnyed de /
analyzed: bdag cag khyim bdag la kha zas bslangs te zos so zhes byas pa dang / ci khyed dus las 'das par zan zar gnang ngam zhes smras pa dang / bdag cag dus su ni zan ma rnyed de /
translated: They said, We asked the householder for food and ate it. He said, Did you eat food after the proper time? They said, We did not find food at the proper time.🔽 We could not bear to die of hunger.

original: ltogs te 'chi mi phod do zhes zer ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: ltogs te 'chi mi phod do zhes zer ba snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: Having heard this, he scolded them in many ways, saying, You should not eat after the proper time.

original: dus yol nas zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dus yol nas zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: He established the training rule, saying, One should not eat after the proper time.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The monks are the group of seventeen and others like them.

original: dus yol zhes bya ba ni dus gnyis te /
analyzed: dus yol zhes bya ba ni dus gnyis te /
translated: The proper time is the two periods.

original: nyi ma phyed yol phan chad dang / skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du dus ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed yol phan chad dang / skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du dus ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the time is not right after noon and before dawn.

original: na ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: na ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: But this does not apply to the sick.

original: zos zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang / bca' ba lnga mgrin par ming pa'o //🔽dus yol ba la yol bar 'du shes sam the tshom za na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang / bca' ba lnga mgrin par ming pa'o // dus yol ba la yol bar 'du shes sam the tshom za na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Eaten” means the five foods and the five drinks have been swallowed.🔽If it is past the right time, and the monk perceives it as such, or is unsure of it, he commits an offense.

original: dus ma yol ba la yol bar 'du shes sam the tshom za na nyes byas su @106b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus ma yol ba la yol bar 'du shes sam the tshom za na nyes byas su @106b 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is past the right time, but the monk perceives it as still being the right time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kha zas zhag lon pa bzar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: kha zas zhag lon pa bzar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong nag po zhes bya ba grong khyer dang grong rdal dag na gnas shing snga dro zan gyi phyir bsod snyom la 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong nag po zhes bya ba grong khyer dang grong rdal dag na gnas shing snga dro zan gyi phyir bsod snyom la 'jug go //
translated: At that time a monk named Kāla lived in towns and villages. In the morning he would go for alms.

original: bsod snyoms kyi zan gsher ba dang skam po rnyed na gsher ba ni 'phral du za /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi zan gsher ba dang skam po rnyed na gsher ba ni 'phral du za /
translated: If he received food—liquid or solid—for his alms, he would drink the liquid then and there.

original: skam po ni snod du bcu gnas /
analyzed: skam po ni snod du bcu gnas /
translated: He would put the solid food in his bowl and carry it with him.

original: nam char 'bab cing rlung ldang ba dang / nam rmus pa'i tshe chu'i nang du spangs shing bsod snyoms la mi 'jug par za'o //
analyzed: nam char 'bab cing rlung ldang ba dang / nam rmus pa'i tshe chu'i nang du spangs shing bsod snyoms la mi 'jug par za'o //
translated: When it rains or blows or is dark, he eats what he has stored up in the water, without going out for alms.

original: dus phyi zhig na bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang / nag po'i zas skam pa la gzigs nas su yin zhes rmas pa dang / dge slong nag po'i lags so zhes kun dga' bos gsol te /
analyzed: dus phyi zhig na bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang / nag po'i zas skam pa la gzigs nas su yin zhes rmas pa dang / dge slong nag po'i lags so zhes kun dga' bos gsol te /
translated: One day the Blessed One was walking through the monastery and saw the dry food of Kāla. He asked, “Whose is it?” Ānanda said, “It is Kāla’s, Blessed One.”

original: dge slong gis kha zas bzhag pa bza' ba'i mi rigs ma brtags pa'o zhes smad de /
analyzed: dge slong gis kha zas bzhag pa bza' ba'i mi rigs ma brtags pa'o zhes smad de /
translated: The Blessed One said, “It is not right for a monk to eat food that has been stored up without examining it.”

original: bzhag pa'i kha zas zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: bzhag pa'i kha zas zar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: He criticized Kāla and laid down a training rule prohibiting the eating of stored food.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nag po ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nag po ste /
translated: “A monk” means Kāla.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Others like him” means those who are similar to him.

original: bzhag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽snga dro byin len byas pa'i zas ni phyi 'phred kyi dus su bzhag par gyur to //
analyzed: bzhag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / snga dro byin len byas pa'i zas ni phyi 'phred kyi dus su bzhag par gyur to //
translated: “Stored” means two kinds of stored food:🔽food given in the morning is stored up until the afternoon;

original: phyi dro byin len byas pa ni srod kyi dus su bzhag par gyur to //
analyzed: phyi dro byin len byas pa ni srod kyi dus su bzhag par gyur to //
translated: food given in the afternoon is stored up until the next morning.

original: mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa dang dge slong gis bcos pa dang / byin gyis ma brlabs pa la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa dang dge slong gis bcos pa dang / byin gyis ma brlabs pa la yang sbyar ro //
translated: And if he spends the night inside the boundary, or if the monk has prepared it, or if it is not consecrated, he commits the same offense.

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba dang btung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du bzhag pa la bzhag par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na yang ltung ba re rar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba dang btung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du bzhag pa la bzhag par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na yang ltung ba re rar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Food, drink, and fresh foods” are as above. If he perceives that what has been set out has been set out, or if he is unsure of it, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma bzhag pa la bzhag par 'du shes pa dang the tshom ma zan nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bzhag pa la bzhag par 'du shes pa dang the tshom ma zan nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If he perceives that what has not been set out has been set out, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

original: lhung bzed bkru ba ma dag ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed bkru ba ma dag ste /
translated: If he eats fresh foods that have not been washed,

original: bzhag pa yod pa'am kha gzar dang tsha stegs na bzhag pa yod pa dang spags pa zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhag pa yod pa'am kha gzar dang tsha stegs na bzhag pa yod pa dang spags pa zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: if he eats fresh foods that have been set out, or that have been set out on a bench or on a table, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kha ma bkrus par btung ba 'thungs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha ma bkrus par btung ba 'thungs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he drinks water without washing his mouth after eating fresh foods, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bzhag pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu bzhag pa zos na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhag pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu bzhag pa zos na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats flowers or fruits that have been set out, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong byin len ma byas par zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong byin len ma byas par zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the prohibition against monks eating food that has not been offered is as follows.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong nag po yo byad dang 'tsho ba thams cad kyang dur khrod kyi ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong nag po yo byad dang 'tsho ba thams cad kyang dur khrod kyi ste /
translated: At one time, the monk Kāla had all his possessions and provisions from the charnel ground.

original: lhung bzad kyang dur khrod kyi rdza ma bor ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzad kyang dur khrod kyi rdza ma bor ba'o //
translated: His begging bowl was a discarded clay pot from the charnel ground.

original: gos kyang dur khrod kyi mi shi ba'i gos bor ba /
analyzed: gos kyang dur khrod kyi mi shi ba'i gos bor ba /
translated: His clothes were discarded clothes of dead people from the charnel ground.🔽He ate food that was discarded by relatives of the dead.

original: zas kyang mi shi ba'i phyir gnyen rnams kyis zan khengs pa bor ba za bas de'i tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po nam skye bo mang po shi ba'i @107a * //🔽tshe na lus kyang brtas shing bsod snyoms la yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: zas kyang mi shi ba'i phyir gnyen rnams kyis zan khengs pa bor ba za bas de'i tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po nam skye bo mang po shi ba'i @107a * // tshe na lus kyang brtas shing bsod snyoms la yang mi 'jug go //
translated: When many people died, the body of the venerable Mahākāla grew strong and he did not go for alms.

original: nam mi shing ba nyung ba na grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug lus kyang ma brtas par gyur pas na /
analyzed: nam mi shing ba nyung ba na grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug lus kyang ma brtas par gyur pas na /
translated: When the number of dead people decreased, he went for alms in the village.

original: yul mnyan du yod pa phyogs su tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po mi sha bza' bar kun du grags so //
analyzed: yul mnyan du yod pa phyogs su tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po mi sha bza' bar kun du grags so //
translated: Since his body did not grow strong, it became well known in the region of Śrāvastī that the venerable Mahākāla ate human flesh.

original: byin len byos la zo shig par bka' stsal pa las tshe dang ldan pa drug sde po rnams byin len mi byed par za bas na /
analyzed: byin len byos la zo shig par bka' stsal pa las tshe dang ldan pa drug sde po rnams byin len mi byed par za bas na /
translated: The group of six monks ate it without taking it.🔽The Blessed One thought, “All faults arise from not taking it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa thams cad kyang byin len ma byas pa las gyur to snyam nas dbang du bya zhing skye bo rnams yid ches par bya ba'i phyir byin len mi byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa thams cad kyang byin len ma byas pa las gyur to snyam nas dbang du bya zhing skye bo rnams yid ches par bya ba'i phyir byin len mi byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so
translated: In order to bring them under control and to make people believe, he established training in the Vinaya not to eat without taking it.

original: // dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: // dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Monks” means the group of six and others like them.

original: ma byin zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyis ma byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyis ma byin pa'o //
translated: “Without giving” means not given by men and women.

original: kha nas mid ces bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: kha nas mid ces bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga'o //
translated: “Swallowing it in the mouth” means the five foods and the five edibles.

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong dgon pa rnams chu dang so shing yang mi skyod pa las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong dgon pa rnams chu dang so shing yang mi skyod pa las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: “Except for water and tooth cleaners” means that monks in the wilderness should not move even water and tooth cleaners.

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs zhas rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs zhas rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: The exception is water and tooth sticks.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The downfall is accrued by the monk who eats the food.

original: byin len ma byas par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na yang ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin len ma byas par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na yang ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If the monk perceives the food to be unblessed and blessed, or is unsure of it, he incurs a downfall.

original: byin len byas pa la ma byas par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: byin len byas pa la ma byas par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
translated: If he perceives the food to be blessed and unblessed, or is unsure of it, he commits an offense.

original: spre'u dang glang po che dang cang shes dang / dred mo cang shes lta bus byin pa ni byin par chud do //
analyzed: spre'u dang glang po che dang cang shes dang / dred mo cang shes lta bus byin pa ni byin par chud do //
translated: If the food is blessed by a monkey, an elephant, a horse, or a bear, it is considered blessed.

original: smod pa can gyi yul na byin len ma byas pa zar yang rung ste /
analyzed: smod pa can gyi yul na byin len ma byas pa zar yang rung ste /
translated: In the land of the disparaged, it is permissible to eat food that is unblessed.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhag pa yang gyong gi sgra mi snyan lta bur bsngos te bza'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhag pa yang gyong gi sgra mi snyan lta bur bsngos te bza'o //
translated: If the food is placed on a mandala, it is considered blessed.

original: mi na bar zas bzang po gzhan gyi khyim nas slong zhing zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni grong khyer ser skya'i gnas na ste /
analyzed: mi na bar zas bzang po gzhan gyi khyim nas slong zhing zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni grong khyer ser skya'i gnas na ste /
translated: The Buddha did not allow the monks to beg for and eat fine food in the homes of the laity.

original: de'i tshe ni khyim bdag sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa dge 'dun rnams bshos la spyan drangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas par gshegs su gnang ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni khyim bdag sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa dge 'dun rnams bshos la spyan drangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas par gshegs su gnang ste /
translated: At that time, the householder Sakya-Mingchen invited the Blessed One and the Sangha to a meal, and the Blessed One and his retinue accepted the invitation.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa ming chen gyi khyim du gshegs te bshos gsol nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa ming chen gyi khyim du gshegs te bshos gsol nas /
translated: The Blessed One and his retinue went to Mingchen's house and had their meal.

original: khyim bdag la chos bstan gzengs bstod rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas slar gshegs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag la chos bstan gzengs bstod rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas slar gshegs so //
translated: After teaching the Dharma to the householder, uplifting him, and bringing him great joy, they left.

original: dge slong drug sde rnams nye bar 'gro ba'i grong na mar zan slong zhing thogs pas 'phyis te zan yang ma slebs gdan 'byam dag kyang bsdus pa'i 'og tu ming chen gyi khyim du lhags so //
analyzed: dge slong drug sde rnams nye bar 'gro ba'i grong na mar zan slong zhing thogs pas 'phyis te zan yang ma slebs gdan 'byam dag kyang bsdus pa'i 'og tu ming chen gyi khyim du lhags so //
translated: The group of six monks were late because they were begging for yogurt in a nearby town. They arrived at Mingchen's house after the meal and the seating arrangements had been completed.

original: der zan @107b dag bslangs pa dang / kha zas dag zad pas na ngan don zhig sbyar ba dang / de dag ma mgu nas gzhan dag gi khyim nas 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar dang / nya dang sha dang sha skam blangs te zos nas slar gtsug lag khang du dong ngo //
analyzed: der zan @107b dag bslangs pa dang / kha zas dag zad pas na ngan don zhig sbyar ba dang / de dag ma mgu nas gzhan dag gi khyim nas 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar dang / nya dang sha dang sha skam blangs te zos nas slar gtsug lag khang du dong ngo //
translated: When they asked for food, they were told, “The food is all gone.” So they prepared some bad food, and when the monks were not satisfied, they took milk, yogurt, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat from other people’s houses and ate it. Then they went back to the monastery.

original: de dag gtsug lag khang du lhags pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis khyed zan gar zos she na ming chen gyi der ro //
analyzed: de dag gtsug lag khang du lhags pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis khyed zan gar zos she na ming chen gyi der ro //
translated: When they arrived at the monastery, the monks asked, “Where did you eat?” “At Mahāpanthaka’s.”

original: 'o na nged kyis ma mthong na zhes byas pa dang / nged phyis lhags so //
analyzed: 'o na nged kyis ma mthong na zhes byas pa dang / nged phyis lhags so //
translated: “But we didn’t see you.” “We arrived later.”

original: der khyed kyis ci lta bu zhig zos zhes byas pa dang / 'o ma dang sha dang nya skam mo //
analyzed: der khyed kyis ci lta bu zhig zos zhes byas pa dang / 'o ma dang sha dang nya skam mo //
translated: “What did you eat there?” “Milk, meat, and dried fish.”

original: 'o na nged kyis ma zos na /
analyzed: 'o na nged kyis ma zos na /
translated: “But we didn’t eat that.”

original: khyed de lta bu slong du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / dbang yang rung mi dbang yang rung bdag cag gis zos so zhes byas pa dang / dge slong gzhan dag gis 'phyas pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: khyed de lta bu slong du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / dbang yang rung mi dbang yang rung bdag cag gis zos so zhes byas pa dang / dge slong gzhan dag gis 'phyas pa snyan du bdas te /
translated: Other monks heard about this and complained and criticized them,

original: kha zas bzang po dag gi phyir mi na bar gzhan gyi khyim nas bslangs te bzar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: kha zas bzang po dag gi phyir mi na bar gzhan gyi khyim nas bslangs te bzar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: It is not proper to beg from others' houses for good food when you are not sick.🔽The Buddha laid down a rule against this.🔽 The Buddha allowed sick monks to beg. A monk became sick and asked a doctor, Noble sir, what should I do?

original: na ba la gnang ba ni dge slong zhig nad kyis btab ste sman pa la dris pa dang / 'phags pa 'o ma dang sha dang nya skam gsol cig dang sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ba la gnang ba ni dge slong zhig nad kyis btab ste sman pa la dris pa dang / 'phags pa 'o ma dang sha dang nya skam gsol cig dang sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Noble sir, drink milk, eat meat, and eat dried fish. You will get well.

original: bdag la sus sbyin grong du slongs shig dang ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la sus sbyin grong du slongs shig dang ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Who will give them to me?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Buddha laid down a rule against this.

original: grong du slong du mi gnang ngo zhes pa la snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: grong du slong du mi gnang ngo zhes pa la snyan du bdas te /
translated: You are not allowed to beg in the village.🔽The monks heard about this and complained and criticized them,

original: na ba'i dus su zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: na ba'i dus su zhes rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: The Buddha allowed this in the case of sick monks.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Monks means those who have entered this Dharma.

original: gang bzang por gsungs zhes bya ba ni 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya dang sha dang sha skam mo //
analyzed: gang bzang por gsungs zhes bya ba ni 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya dang sha dang sha skam mo //
translated: “What is good” means milk, yogurt, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Any bhikṣu” means the group of six and others like them.

original: bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ma yin gyi bdag gi tshed du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ma yin gyi bdag gi tshed du byas pa'o //
translated: “For himself” means not for another, but for himself.

original: min zhes bya ba ni na ba ma gtogs te gnang ba'o //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni na ba ma gtogs te gnang ba'o //
translated: “Except if sick” means it is permitted if sick.

original: gzhan gyi grong na zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi grong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi grong na zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi grong ngo //
translated: “In a village” means in the village of brahmins and householders.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
translated: “Bhikṣu” means himself.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽mi na bar slong zhing zan slong ba'i tshe nyes byas zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no // mi na bar slong zhing zan slong ba'i tshe nyes byas zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Offense” is as before.🔽If one is not sick, and one begs and eats, then one commits an offense.

original: mi na ba'i tshe bslangs la na ba'i tshe zos na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi na ba'i tshe bslangs la na ba'i tshe zos na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas so //
translated: If one begs when one is not sick, and one eats when one is sick, then one commits an offense when one begs.

original: zos na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zos na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one eats, there is no offense.

original: na ba na bslangs la min pa la zos na slong ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na ba na bslangs la min pa la zos na slong ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one is sick, and one begs, and one eats when one is not sick, then there is no offense when one begs.

original: zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If he eats it, he has committed an offense.

original: na ba'i tshe bslangs shing na ba'i tshe zos na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na ba'i tshe bslangs shing na ba'i tshe zos na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he asks for it when he is sick and eats it when he is sick, there is no offense.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na 'phags pa ci bzhed ces bstabs @108a * //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na 'phags pa ci bzhed ces bstabs @108a * //
translated: When a monk is begging for alms, if someone asks, “Noble one, what do you want?”

original: pa las bslangs pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: pa las bslangs pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: and he asks for something, there is no offense.

original: zan gyi tshogs te ltung ba bzhi bcu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zan gyi tshogs te ltung ba bzhi bcu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The forty-first downfall is complete.

original: // / srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la shes bzhin du spyod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul koo sh'amb'i kun dga' ra ba na ste /
analyzed: // / srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la shes bzhin du spyod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul koo sh'amb'i kun dga' ra ba na ste /
translated: The origin story for the prohibition against intentionally using water that contains living beings took place in the Kóshô Ambia garden.🔽At that time, the venerable Módgalapána intentionally used water that contained living beings.🔽The monks who were celibate practitioners and wanted to help him said, “Venerable, do not use water that contains living beings.”

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / de la dge slong tshangs par spyod pa phan par 'dod pa rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa khyod srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu ma spyod cig ces bsgo na ngag mi nyan te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / de la dge slong tshangs par spyod pa phan par 'dod pa rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa khyod srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu ma spyod cig ces bsgo na ngag mi nyan te /
translated: But he did not listen to them.

original: tsing la de dag grangs kyis gtang ngam /
analyzed: tsing la de dag grangs kyis gtang ngam /
translated: “Should we expel him?”

original: lho byang shar nub kyi rgya mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang lteng ka dag tu ci'i phyir mi dong zhes zer ba dge slong gzhan rnams kyis thos te /
analyzed: lho byang shar nub kyi rgya mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang lteng ka dag tu ci'i phyir mi dong zhes zer ba dge slong gzhan rnams kyis thos te /
translated: The other monks heard this and said, Why don't you go to the oceans in the south, north, east, and west, and to the lakes and ponds?

original: 'phya bar gyur pa las snyan du bdas nas /🔽rnam grangs du mas smad de snying rje med pa'o zhes nas /
analyzed: 'phya bar gyur pa las snyan du bdas nas / rnam grangs du mas smad de snying rje med pa'o zhes nas /
translated: They reported this to the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One said, This is a bad thing, and after scolding him and giving a Dhamma talk, he addressed the monks, saying, You should not use water that contains living beings.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: I will lay down a training rule for you.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mos pa can te gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mos pa can te gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Monks, he said, if a monk, knowing that a living being is in the water, uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽 The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: Knowing means knowing by oneself or being told by another.

original: srog chags zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: srog chags zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Living being means of two kinds:

original: bltar snang ba dang mi snang ba chu tshags la chags pa'o //
analyzed: bltar snang ba dang mi snang ba chu tshags la chags pa'o //
translated: visible and invisible.

original: spyod ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyod ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Uses means of two kinds:

original: phyi'i spyod par bya ba dang / nang gi spyod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyi'i spyod par bya ba dang / nang gi spyod par bya ba ste /
translated: external use and internal use.

original: nang gi spyod par bya ba ni btung ba dang / kha lag bkru ba dang / lus kyi spyod pa ste zho dang rtsa ba mo dang shing tog srog chags dang ldan pa la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nang gi spyod par bya ba ni btung ba dang / kha lag bkru ba dang / lus kyi spyod pa ste zho dang rtsa ba mo dang shing tog srog chags dang ldan pa la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The inner use is for drinking, washing the face and body, and for the roots, milk, and fruit that contain living beings.

original: phyi rol gyi ni lhung bzed dang gos kyi bkru bshal dang / chag chag dang mandala la sogs pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni lhung bzed dang gos kyi bkru bshal dang / chag chag dang mandala la sogs pa bya ba'o //
translated: The outer use is for washing the begging-bowl and robes, and for sprinkling and cleaning the temple and so on.

original: de bzhin du sa dang rtsi shing dang me tog la sogs pa srog chags yod pa la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang rtsi shing dang me tog la sogs pa srog chags yod pa la yang sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, one should apply the case of living beings to earth, plants, flowers, and so on.

original: srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa las ci skad cig 'byung ba bzhin du sbyor cig / ltung ba gong ma las srogs chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa dang / bye brag ni ltung ba gong ma ni gtsug lag khang dang khang pa la sogs pa rtsig pa'i chur spyod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa las ci skad cig 'byung ba bzhin du sbyor cig / ltung ba gong ma las srogs chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa dang / bye brag ni ltung ba gong ma ni gtsug lag khang dang khang pa la sogs pa rtsig pa'i chur spyod pa la bya'o //
translated: Just as it is said in the case of the defeat of killing, one should apply it to the use of water containing living beings, as it is stated in the former downfall. The difference is that the former downfall refers to the use of water for the construction of temples and houses, etc.,

original: 'dir ni rang gi lus kyi phyi nang du spyad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rang gi lus kyi phyi nang du spyad pa la bya'o //
translated: while this refers to the use of water for one's own body.

original: srog chags yod pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags yod pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the being is alive and you perceive it as such or you are unsure of it, you commit an offense.

original: med pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang the tshom za na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If the being is not alive and you perceive it as such or you are unsure of it, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong smye ngan byed pa'i gnas su 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong smye ngan byed pa'i gnas su 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the prohibition against staying in a place where a monk is acting like a madman takes place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na tshe @108b dang ldan pa 'char ba po nang par sngar langs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe @108b dang ldan pa 'char ba po nang par sngar langs te /
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayin got up early in the morning,🔽washed his hands and feet, and went to a place for walking meditation.

original: kha lag bkrus nas bsod nyams la gshegs pa dang / mnyan du yod pa na tshong dus zhig yod pa de na tshong pa kha cig ni tshong dus su zong rnams bkram /
analyzed: kha lag bkrus nas bsod nyams la gshegs pa dang / mnyan du yod pa na tshong dus zhig yod pa de na tshong pa kha cig ni tshong dus su zong rnams bkram /
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a marketplace where some merchants had laid out their wares.

original: kha cig ni gdod 'ong na /
analyzed: kha cig ni gdod 'ong na /
translated: Some were just about to come.

original: spos 'tshong gi khye'u zhig gnas pa chung ma gsar du bslangs ma thag pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed de /
analyzed: spos 'tshong gi khye'u zhig gnas pa chung ma gsar du bslangs ma thag pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed de /
translated: A young incense seller who lived there had recently taken a new wife.

original: mi tshangs par spyod do snyam nas tshong khang gi sgo gcod cing 'dug pa 'char bas rig pa'i nor bu yod pa'i mthus tshor te /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod do snyam nas tshong khang gi sgo gcod cing 'dug pa 'char bas rig pa'i nor bu yod pa'i mthus tshor te /
translated: Thinking, He is unchaste, he would close the door of the shop and stay there.

original: ched du de'i bar chad du bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: ched du de'i bar chad du bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Because of the power of the jewel of awareness, he would sense, I will create an obstacle for him.

original: 'char pa sngar de'i chung ma'i gan du song nas chos 'chad cing 'dug pa dang / de'i khyo yang phyi bzhin du 'ongs nas /
analyzed: 'char pa sngar de'i chung ma'i gan du song nas chos 'chad cing 'dug pa dang / de'i khyo yang phyi bzhin du 'ongs nas /
translated: The one who was Arising previously went to his wife and was teaching the Dharma, and her husband also came after her.

original: chung ma la smras pa 'phags pa 'char ba bshos gsol la thong zhes byas pa dang 'char ba na re /
analyzed: chung ma la smras pa 'phags pa 'char ba bshos gsol la thong zhes byas pa dang 'char ba na re /
translated: He said to his wife, Noble Arising, please give him food and send him away.

original: nga bdag ni dge ba'i bar chad du gyur pa bzhin du khyed la chos ston du 'ongs na /
analyzed: nga bdag ni dge ba'i bar chad du gyur pa bzhin du khyed la chos ston du 'ongs na /
translated: Arising said, I have come to teach the Dharma to you, just as I would to one who creates obstacles to virtue.

original: khyod ci'i phyir chos mi nyan par 'dug chos nyon cig ces nas ma dad bzhin du chos bshad do //
analyzed: khyod ci'i phyir chos mi nyan par 'dug chos nyon cig ces nas ma dad bzhin du chos bshad do //
translated: Why do you not listen to the Dharma? Listen to the Dharma! And he taught the Dharma to her, though she had no faith.

original: 'char ba song gi 'og tu tshong pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: 'char ba song gi 'og tu tshong pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: After Arising left, the merchant said, How amazing!

original: bdag gi chung ma la mi dbang bar gyur ces 'phya ba las /
analyzed: bdag gi chung ma la mi dbang bar gyur ces 'phya ba las /
translated: My wife has become independent! and he ridiculed her.

original: dge slong dag gis thos pa snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad de /🔽da phyin chad de lta bu na 'dug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis thos pa snyan du bdas nas rnam grangs du mas smad de / da phyin chad de lta bu na 'dug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: saying, “How could a monk do such a thing?”🔽They told the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One said, “Monks, a monk should not sit in a private place with a woman.🔽If he does, he must acknowledge the offense.”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means Udayin or another such monk.

original: smye ngan byed ces bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis dbyen byed pa'o //
analyzed: smye ngan byed ces bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis dbyen byed pa'o //
translated: “Commits a sexual offense” means to separate a man and a woman.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim pa'i khyim mo //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim pa'i khyim mo //
translated: “A private place” means a place for brahmins or householders.

original: nan gyis 'then te 'dug ces bya ba ni rkub sa la bzhag pa tsam mo //
analyzed: nan gyis 'then te 'dug ces bya ba ni rkub sa la bzhag pa tsam mo //
translated: “To sit down” means to sit down on the ground.

original: mi shes na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mi shes na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he does not know, there is no offense.

original: dge slong smye ngan byed par 'greng du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong smye ngan byed par 'greng du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the rule that a monk who commits a sexual offense should not stand in a private place took place in Śrāvastī.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas snga ma bzhin du mi tshangs par spyod par rig nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas snga ma bzhin du mi tshangs par spyod par rig nas /
translated: The venerable Udayin, knowing that the monk was engaging in sexual activity as before,

original: de gnyis 'khrig pa la blta'o snyam nas phyi bzhin song ste /
analyzed: de gnyis 'khrig pa la blta'o snyam nas phyi bzhin song ste /
translated: thought, “I will watch them having sex,” and followed them.

original: sgo lkog na gab cing 'dug pa de gnyis 'khrig pa'i tshe chung mas mthong nas 'char ba 'dug gis ma byed ces smras na /
analyzed: sgo lkog na gab cing 'dug pa de gnyis 'khrig pa'i tshe chung mas mthong nas 'char ba 'dug gis ma byed ces smras na /
translated: The two who were hiding behind the door saw them copulating. The wife said, “He’s having sex with her. Don’t do it!”

original: 'phags pa 'char ba ni de tsam rnam par grol ba'i bsam gtan byed cing 'dug go //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'char ba ni de tsam rnam par grol ba'i bsam gtan byed cing 'dug go //
translated: “Noble Udayin is practicing concentration for the sake of liberation.”🔽“What do you want here?”

original: 'dir ci 'dod ces byas nas ma btu pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ci 'dod ces byas nas ma btu pa ste /
translated: “I’m not collecting alms.”

original: spyad zin nas bltas na 'char ba 'dug par mthong nas /
analyzed: spyad zin nas bltas na 'char ba 'dug par mthong nas /
translated: “I see you’re having sex.”

original: de dag smod cing mi snyan pa 'dzer pa dge slong gis thos @109a * //
analyzed: de dag smod cing mi snyan pa 'dzer pa dge slong gis thos @109a * //
translated: The monks heard the criticism and unpleasant rumors.

original: pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: pa snyan du bdas te /
translated: They reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: smye ngan byed pa'i gnas su 'greng zhing 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: smye ngan byed pa'i gnas su 'greng zhing 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One gave a teaching and instructed them, “Monks, you should not stand or sit in a place where people are having sex.”

original: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //🔽shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis shes pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o // shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis shes pa'am /
translated: “A monk” means Udayin or someone similar.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: “Knowingly” means knowing it oneself or being told by someone else.

original: smye ngan zhes bya ba ni gong ma dang 'dra /
analyzed: smye ngan zhes bya ba ni gong ma dang 'dra /
translated: “Having sex” is as above.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni khyim mo //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni khyim mo //
translated: “A place” means a house.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan skyes pa dang bud med med pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan skyes pa dang bud med med pa'o //
translated: Solitary means that no other men or women are present.

original: skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni yol ba dang / sab ma dang / rtsig pas bskyabs pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni yol ba dang / sab ma dang / rtsig pas bskyabs pa'o //
translated: Shelter means that a curtain, a screen, or a wall is used to provide shelter.

original: 'jigs pa dang rkyen byung ba'i tshe 'greng ba ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang rkyen byung ba'i tshe 'greng ba ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if a monk stands when a danger or an emergency arises.

original: gong ma las 'dir ni bye brag 'greng ba bzhag go //🔽dge slong gis gcer pu pa'am /
analyzed: gong ma las 'dir ni bye brag 'greng ba bzhag go // dge slong gis gcer pu pa'am /
translated: Here, the above rule is modified to allow standing.🔽A monk should not give food with his own hand to a naked ascetic or to a Jain ascetic.

original: gcer bu pa la rang gi lag nas zan sbyin du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: gcer bu pa la rang gi lag nas zan sbyin du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for this rule took place in Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das yul ko sa lar ljongs rgyu ba las mnyan du yod par byon pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul ko sa lar ljongs rgyu ba las mnyan du yod par byon pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Blessed One was traveling through the country of Kosala, he arrived in Śrāvastī.

original: mnyan du yod pa'i skyed mos tshal na khyim pa mo lnga brgya tsam zhig skud pa 'khal zhing 'khod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad nas bden pa la rab tu bkod do //
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa'i skyed mos tshal na khyim pa mo lnga brgya tsam zhig skud pa 'khal zhing 'khod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad nas bden pa la rab tu bkod do //
translated: In a park in Śrāvastī, five hundred women were sitting and spinning thread. The Blessed One taught them the Dharma and established them in the truths.

original: de nas bud med lnga brgya po de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la bshos gsol lo snyam nas rgyu je tsam gyis chog ces dris pa na kun dga' bos k'ar sh'a pa na lnga brgyas chog go zhes nas /
analyzed: de nas bud med lnga brgya po de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la bshos gsol lo snyam nas rgyu je tsam gyis chog ces dris pa na kun dga' bos k'ar sh'a pa na lnga brgyas chog go zhes nas /
translated: Then the five hundred women thought, “We will offer food to the Bhagavān.” When asked, “Is this much food sufficient?” they said, “It is sufficient.”🔽When asked, “Is five hundred kārṣāpaṇas sufficient?” they said, “It is sufficient.”🔽They offered five hundred kārṣāpaṇas to the venerable Ānanda and said, “Since we are women’s sons, we are not able to prepare the food. We do not have dishes.”

original: de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la k'ar sh'a pa na lnga brgya phul te bdag cag ni bud med kyi bu lags pas sbyor yang mi nus pas snod spyad kyang ma mchis zhes byas pa dang / kun dga' bos khyim bdag 'byor pa zhig la bcol cig ces byas pa dang /
analyzed: de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la k'ar sh'a pa na lnga brgya phul te bdag cag ni bud med kyi bu lags pas sbyor yang mi nus pas snod spyad kyang ma mchis zhes byas pa dang / kun dga' bos khyim bdag 'byor pa zhig la bcol cig ces byas pa dang /
translated: Ānanda said, “Give them to a wealthy householder.”

original: kun dga' bos kyang khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la bcol te /
analyzed: kun dga' bos kyang khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la bcol te /
translated: Ānanda gave them to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: 'drim pa'i tshe bud med rnams kyi grogs tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos kyang byas so //
analyzed: 'drim pa'i tshe bud med rnams kyi grogs tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos kyang byas so //
translated: When the food was served, the venerable Ānanda also served as the women’s companion.

original: de'i tshe gcer bu ma gnyis shig zan slong du lhags nas gral gyi mjug la bzhag pa dang / kun dga' bos ma bsams par khur ba 'drim pa'i tshe rgan mo la ni gcig / gzhon nu ma la gnyis byin pa dang / rgan mo na re gzhon nu khyod la kun dga' bo skugs kyis sta gon gyis shig byas pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcer bu ma gnyis shig zan slong du lhags nas gral gyi mjug la bzhag pa dang / kun dga' bos ma bsams par khur ba 'drim pa'i tshe rgan mo la ni gcig / gzhon nu ma la gnyis byin pa dang / rgan mo na re gzhon nu khyod la kun dga' bo skugs kyis sta gon gyis shig byas pa dang /
translated: The old woman said, “Young woman, prepare to gamble with Ananda.”

original: gzhon nu na re rgyal po'i sras las rab tu byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu na re rgyal po'i sras las rab tu byung ba ste /
translated: The young woman said, “The son of the king has gone forth.🔽He has abandoned many wives and concubines and gone forth. What does he expect from someone like me, who is defiled?”

original: btsun mo'i 'khor dang bzang mo mang du spangs te rab tu byung na nga lta bu dri ma can la 'dis ci zhig rer yod ces smras pa dang / 'on du zin @109b kyang skyes pa ji lta bu la dga' ston med byas pa dang /
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor dang bzang mo mang du spangs te rab tu byung na nga lta bu dri ma can la 'dis ci zhig rer yod ces smras pa dang / 'on du zin @109b kyang skyes pa ji lta bu la dga' ston med byas pa dang /
translated: “Even so, what man does not like a celebration?”

original: dge slong rnams kyis thos te snyan du bdas nas gcer bu ma la rang gis byin du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis thos te snyan du bdas nas gcer bu ma la rang gis byin du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The monks heard about this and reported it to the Buddha. The Buddha prohibited giving food to naked ascetics and laid down a training rule.

original: gcer bu zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa kha cig 'cho ba dang mi ldan te ltogs pa las dge slong rnams la slong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gcer bu zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa kha cig 'cho ba dang mi ldan te ltogs pa las dge slong rnams la slong ba'i tshe /
translated: Naked refers to some naked ascetics who, being hungry and lacking food, go to the monks to beg.

original: dge slong rnams kyis 'tsho ba sbyar cing byin pas na dge slong rnams la 'phya zhing mi snyan par 'dzer ba dang / nged dge slong gi sbyin gnas yin te /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis 'tsho ba sbyar cing byin pas na dge slong rnams la 'phya zhing mi snyan par 'dzer ba dang / nged dge slong gi sbyin gnas yin te /
translated: When the monks provide and give them sustenance, they mock the monks and speak unpleasantly, saying, We are the recipients of offerings for monks.

original: nged la yon sbyin no zhes spyoms pas /
analyzed: nged la yon sbyin no zhes spyoms pas /
translated: You should give us offerings!

original: rang gi lag pas sbyin du mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: rang gi lag pas sbyin du mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: Thus, they are prohibited from giving with their own hands.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni kun dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni kun dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Monks refers to Ananda and others like him.

original: gcer bu ma zhes bya ba ni gos med pa'o //
analyzed: gcer bu ma zhes bya ba ni gos med pa'o //
translated: Naked means without clothes.

original: kun du rgyu zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs so //
analyzed: kun du rgyu zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs so //
translated: Wanderers refers to non-Buddhist ascetics.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Downfall is as before.

original: na ba dang sdig par lta ba las dbral ba'i phyir sbyin pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: na ba dang sdig par lta ba las dbral ba'i phyir sbyin pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for giving in order to separate them from their sick and sinful views.

original: kha zas btung ba yang yin la rang gi lag gis kyang sbyin na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha zas btung ba yang yin la rang gi lag gis kyang sbyin na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives food and drink with one’s own hand, there is an infraction.

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga rung ba la yang ma yin la gzhan nas brgyud de byin na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga rung ba la yang ma yin la gzhan nas brgyud de byin na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one gives the five types of suitable food and drink, but not with one’s own hand, there is an infraction of wrongdoing.

original: dge slong dmag chas pa la bltar 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong dmag chas pa la bltar 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the prohibition against going to see an army in formation took place in Śrāvastī.🔽At that time, the king of Kosala was attacked by some hill people. He sent an army with its leader to subdue the hill people, but the army was defeated and returned. The king sent another army, but it too was defeated. The king then ordered all the soldiers in the country to go.

original: de'i tshe yul ko sa la'i rgyal po la ri brags kyi grong dag cig log ste bsngos nas rgyal pos ri brags kyi grong 'bebs par dmag dpon 'khor dang bcas te sngar bkye ba dang / phyis kyang snon ma zhig bkye na ma phebs te slar smas so zhes rgyal po'i steng du 'phar ma 'ongs nas rgyal pos yul na mtshon gyis 'tsho ba thams cad snon du dengs shig ces kun du bsgo nas dmag gi rta pa dang rkang thang la sogs te
analyzed: de'i tshe yul ko sa la'i rgyal po la ri brags kyi grong dag cig log ste bsngos nas rgyal pos ri brags kyi grong 'bebs par dmag dpon 'khor dang bcas te sngar bkye ba dang / phyis kyang snon ma zhig bkye na ma phebs te slar smas so zhes rgyal po'i steng du 'phar ma 'ongs nas rgyal pos yul na mtshon gyis 'tsho ba thams cad snon du dengs shig ces kun du bsgo nas dmag gi rta pa dang rkang thang la sogs te
translated: The king’s order was proclaimed everywhere: “All those who make a living with weapons should go.” The army included cavalry, infantry, and so on.

original: / lha khang gi sgo nas mar dong ba la drug sde rnams gsus po che'i dmag ltar 'dong ngo zhes sbran nas dmag chas pa la lta zhing bkren pa glang po che phag 'dra 'dis ri brags kyi grong phebs par ni mi 'gyur gyi khyed chas te 'dod du
analyzed: / lha khang gi sgo nas mar dong ba la drug sde rnams gsus po che'i dmag ltar 'dong ngo zhes sbran nas dmag chas pa la lta zhing bkren pa glang po che phag 'dra 'dis ri brags kyi grong phebs par ni mi 'gyur gyi khyed chas te 'dod du
translated: The group of six said to the people who were going out of the temple, The fat man is coming like a great army! They went out to see the army. They said to the people, This poor man, who is like an elephant or a pig, will not go to the village of the mountain.

original: yod kyi slar log tu ni med do zhes smras pas de dag kyang bag 'khums shing spa gong bas lam nas slar 'khor to //
analyzed: yod kyi slar log tu ni med do zhes smras pas de dag kyang bag 'khums shing spa gong bas lam nas slar 'khor to //
translated: You should go, but you cannot return! Because of that, they were embarrassed and frightened. They turned back on the road.

original: de nas rgyal pos ci'i phyir 'khor zhes byas pa dang / rgyal po khros nas snyan du gsol te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos ci'i phyir 'khor zhes byas pa dang / rgyal po khros nas snyan du gsol te /
translated: Then the king asked, Why did they turn back? They told the king what had happened.

original: dmag chas pa la bltar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dmag chas pa la bltar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The king was angry. He heard the case and laid down a training rule prohibiting looking at an army.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: The monk is one of the group of six.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: dmag chas zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo @110a * //🔽byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dmag chas zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo @110a * //🔽byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: Army means an army that wants to fight.

original: dmag ces bya ba ni yan lag gcig pa dang / yan lag gnyis pa dang / yan lag gsum pa dang / yan lag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dmag ces bya ba ni yan lag gcig pa dang / yan lag gnyis pa dang / yan lag gsum pa dang / yan lag bzhi pa'o //
translated: An army is one with one branch, two branches, three branches, or four branches.

original: yan lag gcig pa ni glang po che'i tshogs dang / yan lag gnyis pa ni rta pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yan lag gcig pa ni glang po che'i tshogs dang / yan lag gnyis pa ni rta pa'i tshogs so //
translated: One with one branch is an elephant division. One with two branches is a cavalry division.

original: yan lag gsum pa ni shing rta'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa ni shing rta'i tshogs so //
translated: One with three branches is a chariot division.

original: yan lag bzhi pa ni rkang thang pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa ni rkang thang pa'i tshogs so //
translated: One with four branches is an infantry division.

original: gtsug lag khang lam ka na 'dug pa'i lam ka nas 'dong ba dang / dmag nyid gtsug lag khang du 'ongs pa dang / rgyal po dang / blon po dang / dmag dpon dang / yul mi la sogs bkug pa'am /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang lam ka na 'dug pa'i lam ka nas 'dong ba dang / dmag nyid gtsug lag khang du 'ongs pa dang / rgyal po dang / blon po dang / dmag dpon dang / yul mi la sogs bkug pa'am /
translated: If the monastery is on the road, one may go by the road. If the army comes to the monastery, or if one is summoned by the king, a minister, a general, or the people of the country,

original: bar chad brgyad la sogs pa byung ste /
analyzed: bar chad brgyad la sogs pa byung ste /
translated: or if the eight kinds of disasters occur,

original: dmag mthong na ni nyes med do //
analyzed: dmag mthong na ni nyes med do //
translated: there is no fault in seeing the army.

original: zhag gnyis las lhag par dmag gi nang na lta zhing 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: zhag gnyis las lhag par dmag gi nang na lta zhing 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule that it is not permitted to stay and watch an army for more than two days is in Śrāvastī.

original: ri brags kyi grong de nyid kyang da rung ma phebs nas rgyal po yang phru ma de nyid du 'dug go //
analyzed: ri brags kyi grong de nyid kyang da rung ma phebs nas rgyal po yang phru ma de nyid du 'dug go //
translated: The king remained in that very city, not having gone to the village of the mountain tribe.

original: blon po rnams kyis gros btab ste /
analyzed: blon po rnams kyis gros btab ste /
translated: The ministers discussed the matter and said,

original: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin blo che la mthu che bas na khyim bdag bkug pa'i rigs par gsol ba dang / dgug par po nya gcig btang ste bkug go //
analyzed: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin blo che la mthu che bas na khyim bdag bkug pa'i rigs par gsol ba dang / dgug par po nya gcig btang ste bkug go //
translated: It is fitting to summon the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, who is wise and powerful. A messenger was sent to summon him, and he was brought.

original: de nas ring zhig lon kyang ma phebs nas /
analyzed: de nas ring zhig lon kyang ma phebs nas /
translated: But even after a long time, he did not return.

original: mgon med kyang mi dga' ba 'dran sa rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag bu smad dang bral ba mi dga' 'am /
analyzed: mgon med kyang mi dga' ba 'dran sa rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag bu smad dang bral ba mi dga' 'am /
translated: King Prasenajit, who was friendly with Anāthapiṇḍada, asked, Householder, are you unhappy to be separated from your wife and children?

original: ci nyes zhes rmas pa na bdag bu smad dang bral ba ni mi dga' ba med na 'phags pa dge slong dag med pas mi dga'o //
analyzed: ci nyes zhes rmas pa na bdag bu smad dang bral ba ni mi dga' ba med na 'phags pa dge slong dag med pas mi dga'o //
translated: What is the problem? He replied, I am not unhappy to be separated from my wife and children, but I am unhappy because the noble monks are not there.

original: zhes byas nas de'i phyir gyal pos dge slong dag 'dir shog shig par yi ge springs nas dge slong rgan po ni rgas te 'gro mi nus /
analyzed: zhes byas nas de'i phyir gyal pos dge slong dag 'dir shog shig par yi ge springs nas dge slong rgan po ni rgas te 'gro mi nus /
translated: Then the king sent a letter saying, Monks, come here! The elder monks were unable to go because of their old age.

original: gsar bu dag ni chos khrims dag ma lobs pas nyan cing 'bad pas ma btub kha cig ni na nas 'gro ma nus pa dang / drug sde rnams bdag cag rgyal po dang blon po rnams chos 'chad du 'dod ngo zhes khas blangs nas /
analyzed: gsar bu dag ni chos khrims dag ma lobs pas nyan cing 'bad pas ma btub kha cig ni na nas 'gro ma nus pa dang / drug sde rnams bdag cag rgyal po dang blon po rnams chos 'chad du 'dod ngo zhes khas blangs nas /
translated: The group of six said, “We promised the king and his ministers that we would teach the Dharma.”

original: drug sde rnams dmag gi nang du lhags te zhag du mar 'khod cing dmag brgyus pa las phar phul zhing kyal ka byed de /
analyzed: drug sde rnams dmag gi nang du lhags te zhag du mar 'khod cing dmag brgyus pa las phar phul zhing kyal ka byed de /
translated: The group of six went to the army and stayed there for many days. They were given the best food and drink and they joked around.

original: bkren pa khyed kyis glang po che phag 'dra ba /
analyzed: bkren pa khyed kyis glang po che phag 'dra ba /
translated: “You poor people! Your elephants are like pigs!”

original: rta bong bu 'dra ba zhes nas mjug ma nas bzung zhing bskor te /
analyzed: rta bong bu 'dra ba zhes nas mjug ma nas bzung zhing bskor te /
translated: “Your horses are like donkeys!” They grabbed the tails of the horses and rode around on them.🔽“You people are like grass!” They put their hands on the necks of the men and pushed them around.

original: mi la rtsva mi 'dra ba zhes byas shing gnya' ba na phul bas de dag bab 'khums mi dga' bar gyur nas sems shing 'khod pa las rgyal pos mthong ste /
analyzed: mi la rtsva mi 'dra ba zhes byas shing gnya' ba na phul bas de dag bab 'khums mi dga' bar gyur nas sems shing 'khod pa las rgyal pos mthong ste /
translated: The men became depressed and sat there thinking. The king saw them and asked, “What is the matter?”

original: dge slong dmag gi nang na yul ring du 'dug tu mi gnang bar gsol nas drug sde la bka' rmas te /
analyzed: dge slong dmag gi nang na yul ring du 'dug tu mi gnang bar gsol nas drug sde la bka' rmas te /
translated: The monks said, “We are not allowed to stay in the army for a long time.” The king reprimanded the group of six.

original: dge @110b sbyong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad nas dmag gi nang du zhag gnyis las 'dug tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dge @110b sbyong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad nas dmag gi nang du zhag gnyis las 'dug tu mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: Having criticized them, This is not the work of an ascetic, he established the rule that they should not stay in the army for more than two nights.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen cig gis zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang dmag dpon dang yul mis bos pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen cig gis zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang dmag dpon dang yul mis bos pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of such and such conditions means that they were summoned by the king, the general, and the people of the country.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //🔽dmag ces bya ba ni yan lag gcig la sogs te /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o // dmag ces bya ba ni yan lag gcig la sogs te /
translated: The phrase the monks refers to the group of six and others like them.

original: gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase the army means one with one branch and so on, as above.🔽The phrase if they go to see it means that they go with the desire to see it.

original: bltar 'gro na zhes bya ba ni lta 'dod pa'i phyir ro / zhag gnyis las 'das zhes bya ba ni dus las yol ba'o //
analyzed: bltar 'gro na zhes bya ba ni lta 'dod pa'i phyir ro / zhag gnyis las 'das zhes bya ba ni dus las yol ba'o //
translated: The phrase more than two nights means beyond the time.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽rgyal po dang blon pos 'dug shig ces bsgo ba'am /
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // rgyal po dang blon pos 'dug shig ces bsgo ba'am /
translated: The phrase offense is as above.

original: bar chad chen po brgyad byung ba'i dbang gis na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bar chad chen po brgyad byung ba'i dbang gis na ltung ba med do //
translated: If the king or minister orders them to stay, or if they stay because of the influence of a great obstacle, there is no offense.

original: zhag gnyis dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang g-yul bshams pa las dkrug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: zhag gnyis dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang g-yul bshams pa las dkrug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule that one should not stay in an army for more than two days is as follows.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ri brags grong log pa da rung ma phebs nas /
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ri brags grong log pa da rung ma phebs nas /
translated: King Prasenajit had not yet subdued the rebellious town of Kalinga.

original: mgon med zas sbyin kyang dge slong dag med pas ma dga' nas /
analyzed: mgon med zas sbyin kyang dge slong dag med pas ma dga' nas /
translated: Anāthapiṇḍada was unhappy because there were no monks there.

original: dge slong kha cig der thong shig par yi ge spring ngo //
analyzed: dge slong kha cig der thong shig par yi ge spring ngo //
translated: He sent a letter saying, “Let some monks go there.”

original: dge slong gzhan rnams ni snga ma bzhin du brel to //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan rnams ni snga ma bzhin du brel to //
translated: The other monks were as busy as before.

original: yang drug sde lhags so //
analyzed: yang drug sde lhags so //
translated: The group of six went.🔽Previously, they had not been allowed to stay for more than two days, but later, even when they stayed for two days, they stirred up the army of elephants and so forth, as before.

original: sngar zhag gnyis las ring du gnas su mi gnang ba dang / slad kyis zhag gnyis kyi tshe na yang glang po che'i tshogs la sogs g-yul bshams pa la snga ma bzhin du dkrugs nas khong bdag cag dgra'i logs su sngar dong nas nags tshang tshing na 'khod de /
analyzed: sngar zhag gnyis las ring du gnas su mi gnang ba dang / slad kyis zhag gnyis kyi tshe na yang glang po che'i tshogs la sogs g-yul bshams pa la snga ma bzhin du dkrugs nas khong bdag cag dgra'i logs su sngar dong nas nags tshang tshing na 'khod de /
translated: “We will go first to the enemy’s side and stay in the thick forest.”

original: dmag 'ong ba dang / drug sde rnga brdungs dung bus khus btab pa dang / gsal rgyal gyi dmag gis yang skrag par gyur te de dag gi snying lam na dgra byung snyam nas slar log ste bros so //
analyzed: dmag 'ong ba dang / drug sde rnga brdungs dung bus khus btab pa dang / gsal rgyal gyi dmag gis yang skrag par gyur te de dag gi snying lam na dgra byung snyam nas slar log ste bros so //
translated: The six seers were frightened by the sound of the drums, conches, and horns of the approaching army, and by the army of Prasenajit. Thinking that an enemy had come, they turned back and fled.

original: de nas yang mdun du brgyugs te /🔽bsgugs nas khyed ci'i phyir 'bros zhes byas nas /
analyzed: de nas yang mdun du brgyugs te / bsgugs nas khyed ci'i phyir 'bros zhes byas nas /
translated: Then they ran forward again.🔽They said, Why are you fleeing?

original: khyed kyis g-yul dkrugs pa'i phyir bros so zhe'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis g-yul dkrugs pa'i phyir bros so zhe'o //
translated: They said, We are fleeing because you are causing a disturbance in the battle.

original: ded kyis rtsed mo byas pa'i phyir yang skrag ste 'bros /
analyzed: ded kyis rtsed mo byas pa'i phyir yang skrag ste 'bros /
translated: They said, We are fleeing because we are afraid of playing games.🔽They said, How will we fight if an enemy comes?

original: dgra 'ongs na ji ltar rgol zhes byas pa dang / de dag gis rgyal po la gsol nas /
analyzed: dgra 'ongs na ji ltar rgol zhes byas pa dang / de dag gis rgyal po la gsol nas /
translated: They reported this to the king.

original: rgyal pos kyang snyan du gsal te /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang snyan du gsal te /
translated: The king also heard about it.

original: zhag gnyis dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang g-yul bshams pa dkrug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: zhag gnyis dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang g-yul bshams pa dkrug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: He said, Even when staying in the midst of the army for two days, they are not allowed to disturb the battle formations.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: The monks called the six are the six seers.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Others are similar to them.

original: dmag ces bya ba ni rta pa la sogs pa ste snga ma bzhin no //🔽bshams pa dkrugs @111a * //
analyzed: dmag ces bya ba ni rta pa la sogs pa ste snga ma bzhin no // bshams pa dkrugs @111a * //
translated: The word army refers to cavalry, etc., as before.🔽Arranged means

original: zhes bya ba ni g-yul gyi nang du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni g-yul gyi nang du 'jug pa'o //
translated: having entered the battlefield.

original: rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba ni seng ge dang chu srin dang / khyu mchog gi rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba ni seng ge dang chu srin dang / khyu mchog gi rgyal mtshan no //
translated: The word banner refers to the banners of the lion, crocodile, and bull.

original: g-yul bshams pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: g-yul bshams pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of battle formations:

original: 'bru'i phung po lta bu dang / shing rta dang / zla gam dang nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i phung po lta bu dang / shing rta dang / zla gam dang nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
translated: like a heap of grain, like a chariot, like a half-moon, and like the wings of a garuḍa.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as before.

original: nyes pa ni glang po che dang rta la sogs pa go bskon pa logs shig tu byung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni glang po che dang rta la sogs pa go bskon pa logs shig tu byung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault is that if the elephants, horses, etc., are equipped separately, there is an offense.

original: go ma bskon na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go ma bskon na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not equipped, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽 The origin story of not allowing monks to strike:

original: dge slong la rdeg tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong la rdeg tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: In Śrāvastī,

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bus au p'a li la sogs pa gzhon nu bcu bdun sde rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa de na de dag drug sde'i rgyus mi shes pas tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas bcu bdun sde gcig
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bus au p'a li la sogs pa gzhon nu bcu bdun sde rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa de na de dag drug sde'i rgyus mi shes pas tshe dang ldan pa 'char bas bcu bdun sde gcig
translated: Since they did not know the six groups, the venerable Udayi said to the group of seventeen,🔽If I ask you to do something, you are not my teacher or preceptor.

original: la las shig bcol na khyod nga'i slob dpon dang / mkhan po ni ma yin zhes ma btub pa dang des thal mo zhig bsnun pa dang sa la bsgyel te ngus pa dang thams cad kyang sa la 'gyel te ngus pa gzhan dag gis khyed kyi nang nas gcig brdegs na gzhan dag ci'i phyir du zhes byas pa
analyzed: la las shig bcol na khyod nga'i slob dpon dang / mkhan po ni ma yin zhes ma btub pa dang des thal mo zhig bsnun pa dang sa la bsgyel te ngus pa dang thams cad kyang sa la 'gyel te ngus pa gzhan dag gis khyed kyi nang nas gcig brdegs na gzhan dag ci'i phyir du zhes byas pa
translated: When he could not bear it, he slapped his palms and fell to the ground crying. When all of them fell to the ground and cried, others asked, Why do the others cry when one of you is beaten?

original: dang / bdag cag thams cad ma dus na kun kyang rdeg tu 'ong ngo zhes smras pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: dang / bdag cag thams cad ma dus na kun kyang rdeg tu 'ong ngo zhes smras pa snyan du bdas te /
translated: If we all cry, everyone will come to beat us.

original: dge slong la rdeg tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong la rdeg tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Thus, it was proclaimed to the ears of the Buddha, and he established a training rule in the Vinaya not to beat a monk.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ba ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Monk” means one who has been ordained, and so on as before.

original: brdegs zhes bya ba ni bsnun cing brgyab pa'o //
analyzed: brdegs zhes bya ba ni bsnun cing brgyab pa'o //
translated: “Beat” means to strike.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” is as before.

original: dge slong khros 'khrugs te rngam nas dge slong la thal mo dang / bu tshur gyis bsnun na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong khros 'khrugs te rngam nas dge slong la thal mo dang / bu tshur gyis bsnun na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, in anger, strikes a fellow monk with his hand or with a fist, he commits an offense.

original: sor mo lngas bsnun na yang ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sor mo lngas bsnun na yang ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If he strikes him with all five fingers, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

original: tha na rgya shug gi 'brum bu'am nyungs kar gyi 'brum bu lus la phog na ci rnyed phog pa ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na rgya shug gi 'brum bu'am nyungs kar gyi 'brum bu lus la phog na ci rnyed phog pa ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If he strikes him with any part of his body or with anything else that he is holding, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis thabs kyi sgo nas brdegs na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis thabs kyi sgo nas brdegs na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he strikes a monk with a weapon, he commits an offense.

original: dge slong la rdeg par gzar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong la rdeg par gzar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The supernumerary rule prohibiting striking a monk took place in Śrāvastī.

original: tshe dang ldan pa bcu bdun sde drug sde la bsnyen bkur byed pa na 'char pas yang las bcol pa dang / ma btub nas rdeg tu gnang bas rdeg par gzas te lag pa gzas pa las /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bcu bdun sde drug sde la bsnyen bkur byed pa na 'char pas yang las bcol pa dang / ma btub nas rdeg tu gnang bas rdeg par gzas te lag pa gzas pa las /
translated: When the Venerable Upāli was serving the group of seventeen monks, a monk named Aśvaka ordered him to work and when he could not do it, ordered him to be beaten.

original: kun dus ba snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: kun dus ba snyan du bdas te /
translated: He grabbed Upāli’s hand as he was about to strike him.

original: gzar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: gzar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Upāli cried out and the Buddha established a rule for training in the Monastic Law that forbade beating.

original: rdeg par gzas na tha na nyungs kar 'bru gcig gis kyang rung ste ltung @111b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdeg par gzas na tha na nyungs kar 'bru gcig gis kyang rung ste ltung @111b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one orders a beating, even with a single grain of sesame, one commits an offense.🔽The other should be applied in detail like the application of striking.

original: gzhan ni bsnun pa la sbyar ba bzhin du rgyas par sbyor cig / khyim pa yang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la rdeg par gzas kyang rung ste nyes byas su smad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni bsnun pa la sbyar ba bzhin du rgyas par sbyor cig / khyim pa yang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la rdeg par gzas kyang rung ste nyes byas su smad do //
translated: Even if a layperson orders a beating of one who has not completed the novitiate, it is reprehensible as a minor offense.

original: dge slong gis gnas ngan len 'chab tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis gnas ngan len 'chab tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule that a monk should not conceal misconduct was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dga' bos slob ma chos zhes bya ba cig yod de /
analyzed: dge slong dga' bos slob ma chos zhes bya ba cig yod de /
translated: A monk named Nanda had a student named Dharma.

original: de mang du dge ba la brtson pa zhig pas nyin par dge ba spyod pa'i sar stan khyer te 'gro ba las dga' bo dang phrad nas bsnyen dga' bo na re nga'i stan yang khyer te shog ces nas de gnyis kyang lhan cig nyin par dge ba spyod
analyzed: de mang du dge ba la brtson pa zhig pas nyin par dge ba spyod pa'i sar stan khyer te 'gro ba las dga' bo dang phrad nas bsnyen dga' bo na re nga'i stan yang khyer te shog ces nas de gnyis kyang lhan cig nyin par dge ba spyod
translated: Since he was very diligent in virtue, he took his seat with him during the day and went to a place where he practiced virtue.

original: pa'i sa na bsam gtan byed pa las /
analyzed: pa'i sa na bsam gtan byed pa las /
