translated: He met Nanda, who said, “Bring my seat and come.” The two of them went together to a place where they practiced virtue during the day.

original: bsnyen dga' bo ni sems rgod pas mgo g-yogs te bsam gtan byed na 'on kyang sems ma 'khrugs te /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bo ni sems rgod pas mgo g-yogs te bsam gtan byed na 'on kyang sems ma 'khrugs te /
translated: Nanda was agitated in mind, but he pretended to be in meditative concentration.

original: dge 'dun gyi shing thags la bu mo zhig shing rku zhing 'dug pa mthong nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi shing thags la bu mo zhig shing rku zhing 'dug pa mthong nas /
translated: He saw a girl stealing wood from the Sangha’s woodpile.🔽He said, “Throw her out!”🔽The teacher said, “Think about the Jataka collection.”

original: chos can la skrod cig ces byas pa dang / slob dpon rtog pha ma mang bar dze ta'i mdo sde la dgongs shig ces byas pa dang / blun po dge 'dun gyi bcva shing la ltos shig ces ma gsungs sam /
analyzed: chos can la skrod cig ces byas pa dang / slob dpon rtog pha ma mang bar dze ta'i mdo sde la dgongs shig ces byas pa dang / blun po dge 'dun gyi bcva shing la ltos shig ces ma gsungs sam /
translated: “ Didn’t the Buddha say, ‘Fools, look at the Sangha’s firewood!’

original: khyod kyis ma btub na nga rang skrod do zhes nas /
analyzed: khyod kyis ma btub na nga rang skrod do zhes nas /
translated: If you can’t do it, I will throw her out myself.”

original: bsnyen dga' bos bu mo bskrad na bu mo de yang phyir bgad pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos bu mo de bzung ste 'og cig byas so //
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bos bu mo bskrad na bu mo de yang phyir bgad pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos bu mo de bzung ste 'og cig byas so //
translated: Upasena took the girl and made her his wife.

original: de nas slar 'khor te chos can la khyod kyis ci mthong zhes smras pa dang / nang du zhugs pa gcig pu ma mthong gi gzhan ni thams cad mthong ngo zhes byas pa dang / 'o na su la yang ma smra shig ces byas pa na su dang ma phrad kyi bar du mi smra'o //
analyzed: de nas slar 'khor te chos can la khyod kyis ci mthong zhes smras pa dang / nang du zhugs pa gcig pu ma mthong gi gzhan ni thams cad mthong ngo zhes byas pa dang / 'o na su la yang ma smra shig ces byas pa na su dang ma phrad kyi bar du mi smra'o //
translated: Then they returned and asked Dharmasvamin, “What did you see?” He said, “I saw only one person enter, but I saw everyone else.” They said, “Don’t tell anyone else.” He said, “I won’t tell anyone I haven’t met.”

original: 'o na khyod kyi mkhan po dga' bo'i nyes pa byung na yang ngas rtag par bcab na nga'i yang khyod mi bcab bam zhes byas na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi mkhan po dga' bo'i nyes pa byung na yang ngas rtag par bcab na nga'i yang khyod mi bcab bam zhes byas na /
translated: They said, “If your preceptor Upasena commits a fault, I will always cover for him. Will you cover for me?”

original: des ma btub nas dge slong gzhan dag la byas pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: des ma btub nas dge slong gzhan dag la byas pa snyan du bdas te /
translated: He could not bear that, so he told the other monks.

original: bkas smad nas /
analyzed: bkas smad nas /
translated: They reported it to the Blessed One, who rebuked him.

original: dge slong gis gnas ngan len 'chab tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis gnas ngan len 'chab tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One established a training rule in the Monastic Law that monks should not conceal the faults of others.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o//
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o//
translated: “A monk” means Nanda, and so on.

original: gnas ngan len ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma las byung ba dang / phas pham pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma las byung ba dang / phas pham pa las byung ba'o //
translated: “Bad behavior” means that which arises from a partial defeat of the Saṅgha, or that which arises from a defeating offense.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis rig pa'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis rig pa'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: “Knows” means that he knows it himself, or that someone tells him.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Downfall” is as above.

original: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa bcabs na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa bcabs na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If he conceals a bad behavior, he commits an offense of wrong conduct until dawn breaks.

original: skya rengs shar na @112a * //
analyzed: skya rengs shar na @112a * //
translated: If dawn breaks,

original: ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa brjod na dge ba'i bar chad dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du gyur pa tsam gyi tshod na bcabs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa brjod na dge ba'i bar chad dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du gyur pa tsam gyi tshod na bcabs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If he conceals a bad behavior, but only to the extent that it would be an obstacle to his own virtue or to his celibate lifestyle, there is no offense.

original: ltung ba lnga bcu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ltung ba lnga bcu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fifty-first training rule is finished.🔽The origin of the prohibition against a sick monk refusing to treat his illness

original: // / nga gcig pu na bde'o zhes dge slong bra na gcod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: // / nga gcig pu na bde'o zhes dge slong bra na gcod du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: In Śrāvastī.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo'i nye gnas chos can 'gyod phong pa khrel yod pa des bsnyen dga' bo'i nyes pa thams cad smras pas na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo'i nye gnas chos can 'gyod phong pa khrel yod pa des bsnyen dga' bo'i nyes pa thams cad smras pas na /
translated: The disciple of the Venerable Nanda, who was virtuous, remorseful, and conscientious, confessed all of Nanda's faults.

original: da nas dga' bo khros te de la gnod pa zhig bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: da nas dga' bo khros te de la gnod pa zhig bya'o snyam nas /
translated: From then on, Nanda became angry and thought, I will harm him!🔽Nanda and Upasena were invited to a village, and when the disciple Dharmacārin was about to go for alms, the two said, Come after us and we will give you food.

original: dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis grong du bos pa dang / slob ma chos can bsod snyoms la 'gro bar chas pa dang / de gnyis kyis nged kyi phyi bzhin du shog shig dang zan sbyin no zhes nas slob ma yang dag gcog ma phod nas mkhan po'i phyi bzhin du song ngo //🔽de dag grong du phyin pa dang / dga' bo dang chos can ni sdod bsnyen dga' bo ni grong du zan pa song /
analyzed: dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis grong du bos pa dang / slob ma chos can bsod snyoms la 'gro bar chas pa dang / de gnyis kyis nged kyi phyi bzhin du shog shig dang zan sbyin no zhes nas slob ma yang dag gcog ma phod nas mkhan po'i phyi bzhin du song ngo // de dag grong du phyin pa dang / dga' bo dang chos can ni sdod bsnyen dga' bo ni grong du zan pa song /
translated: The disciple was unable to refuse and followed his preceptor.🔽When they reached the village, Nanda and Dharmacārin stayed behind while Upasena went to the village for food.

original: bsnyen dga' bo phyir 'ongs nas yang chos can dang gnyis sdod /🔽dga' bo ni grong du zan la song ngo //
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bo phyir 'ongs nas yang chos can dang gnyis sdod /🔽dga' bo ni grong du zan la song ngo //
translated: When Upasena returned, he and Dharmacārin stayed behind while Nanda went to the village for food.

original: phyi na chos can gyis bsnyen dga' bo da ni nyi ma yol gyi zas la 'dong zhes des yang dang yang du bskul na /
analyzed: phyi na chos can gyis bsnyen dga' bo da ni nyi ma yol gyi zas la 'dong zhes des yang dang yang du bskul na /
translated: The Buddha said, The time has passed for eating. Let us go to the dining hall.

original: nga ni gcig pu na bde'o zhes nas /
analyzed: nga ni gcig pu na bde'o zhes nas /
translated: But Upadhana said, I am happy to be alone.🔽 The Buddha said, Go where you like, and sent him away.

original: khyod nyid gar dga' bar song shig ces bskrad pa dang / lhung bzed khyer te ma 'ongs pas than bslang du med nas /
analyzed: khyod nyid gar dga' bar song shig ces bskrad pa dang / lhung bzed khyer te ma 'ongs pas than bslang du med nas /
translated: When Upadhana did not return with the alms bowl, the Buddha said, We will not have a meal.🔽 The Buddha went back to the monastery and lay down. Other monks saw him and asked, Why are you lying down?

original: slar lha khang du 'ongs nas nyal zhing 'dug pa de dge slong bsod snyoms pa gzhan dag gis mthong nas khyod ci'i phyir de ltar nyal zhes dris pa dang / de'i rgyus zhib tu smras pa las dge slong dag gis snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: slar lha khang du 'ongs nas nyal zhing 'dug pa de dge slong bsod snyoms pa gzhan dag gis mthong nas khyod ci'i phyir de ltar nyal zhes dris pa dang / de'i rgyus zhib tu smras pa las dge slong dag gis snyan du bdas te /
translated: When they heard the reason, the monks reported it to the Buddha.

original: rnam grangs du mas smad nas dge slong gi zan gcod du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab ba'i gnas bcas so //🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu bsnyen dga' bo ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas smad nas dge slong gi zan gcod du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab ba'i gnas bcas so // yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu bsnyen dga' bo ste /
translated: The Buddha rebuked Upadhana in many ways and established a rule that monks should not be sent away from meals.🔽A monk means a monk like Upadhana, a son of the Sakyans.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It also means a monk like him.

original: dge slong 'di zhes bya ba ni chos can te /
analyzed: dge slong 'di zhes bya ba ni chos can te /
translated: The monk named so-and-so is the subject.

original: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he is engaged in this Dharma.

original: grong du 'dong zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag dang bram ze'i khyim mo //
analyzed: grong du 'dong zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag dang bram ze'i khyim mo //
translated: Going to the village means to the houses of householders and brahmins.

original: khyod la zan sbyin no zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga sbyin par khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod la zan sbyin no zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang bca' ba lnga sbyin par khas blangs pa'o //
translated: Giving you food means promising to give five kinds of food and drink.

original: khyod dang lhan cig pa bde ba med kyis song zhig pa ni zan bcad par bsams nas bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: khyod dang lhan cig pa bde ba med kyis song zhig pa ni zan bcad par bsams nas bskrad pa'o //
translated: Since I am not happy with you, go away means to expel him, thinking to deprive him of food.

original: rkyen de nyid ces bya ba ni zan bcad par bsams pa de nyid rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rkyen de nyid ces bya ba ni zan bcad par bsams pa de nyid rkyen yin no //
translated: That very condition means that very condition of thinking to deprive him of food is the condition.

original: ched du bsams nas @112b thabs gang gis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ched du bsams nas @112b thabs gang gis kyang rung ste /
translated: Intentionally, by any means,

original: dge slong gi zan bcad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi zan bcad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if a monk deprives another monk of food, he commits an offense.

original: na ba'i tshe na sman pas bsgo ba la ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: na ba'i tshe na sman pas bsgo ba la ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This does not apply if the doctor orders it when one is sick.

original: dge slong me 'bud du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa nas rgyal po'i khab tu gshegs pa'i tshe ste /
analyzed: dge slong me 'bud du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa nas rgyal po'i khab tu gshegs pa'i tshe ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against monks making fires is when the Buddha was traveling from Śrāvastī to Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
translated: At that time, the Bhagavān was traveling through the countryside.

original: tshong pa phal po che dang 'grogs /
analyzed: tshong pa phal po che dang 'grogs /
translated: He was accompanied by a large group of merchants.

original: de'i nub mo 'brog dgon pa zhig tu phyin nas /
analyzed: de'i nub mo 'brog dgon pa zhig tu phyin nas /
translated: That evening they reached a remote wilderness.

original: nub mo dgongs mal yang rgan rims su gos shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: nub mo dgongs mal yang rgan rims su gos shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “At night, you should lie down in the order of seniority.”

original: de bzhin du bgos pa dang drug sde shing skom zhig gi drung du bab ste me btung ba dang / shing tshig cing dud pas bdugs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bgos pa dang drug sde shing skom zhig gi drung du bab ste me btung ba dang / shing tshig cing dud pas bdugs pas /
translated: They did as he said. The group of six monks came to a dry tree, built a fire, and sat around it.

original: shing gi nang na sbrul gdug pa zhig 'dug pa byung ste /
analyzed: shing gi nang na sbrul gdug pa zhig 'dug pa byung ste /
translated: A poisonous snake that was inside the tree came out.🔽It was about to fall down when the group of six monks saw it and cried out, “It’s falling!”🔽The merchants all fled.

original: lhung la thug cing shing gi yal ga la 'dug pa dang / drug sde dag gis mthong nas lhung lhung zhes byas pa dang / tshong pa rnams kyang kun bros pa las me 'bud pa las nyes dmigs su gyur pa dang / phyis rgyal po'i khab tu gshegs nas yang drug sde rnams kyis me'i mgal me 'khor lo ltar bskor zhing /
analyzed: lhung la thug cing shing gi yal ga la 'dug pa dang / drug sde dag gis mthong nas lhung lhung zhes byas pa dang / tshong pa rnams kyang kun bros pa las me 'bud pa las nyes dmigs su gyur pa dang / phyis rgyal po'i khab tu gshegs nas yang drug sde rnams kyis me'i mgal me 'khor lo ltar bskor zhing /
translated: Later, when they reached Rājagṛha, the group of six monks again spun firebrands in circles.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba lta bur byed rgyug rtse rtse bas na /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba lta bur byed rgyug rtse rtse bas na /
translated: They ran about like the sun and moon.

original: dge sbyong mgo reg 'di rnams dang / khyim par bye brag dang khyad par ci yod ces mu stegs rnams 'phya pa las me 'bud du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dge sbyong mgo reg 'di rnams dang / khyim par bye brag dang khyad par ci yod ces mu stegs rnams 'phya pa las me 'bud du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The tirthikas said, What is the difference between these shaven-headed ascetics and householders? and they would not allow them to light fires. Thus, the training in the Vinaya was established.

original: de ltar me 'bud du mi gnang ba'i dge slong dag me mar yang mi 'bud spos kyang ni sreg bla ma dang slob dpon la rim gro yang mi byed //
analyzed: de ltar me 'bud du mi gnang ba'i dge slong dag me mar yang mi 'bud spos kyang ni sreg bla ma dang slob dpon la rim gro yang mi byed //
translated: Thus, the monks who were not allowed to light fires did not light lamps, did not burn incense, and did not serve their gurus and masters.

original: lhung bzed dang / gos kyi kha dog mi bsgyur ba dang / dge slong gcig rung nad kyis btab nas sman pa la dris na me la zhugs na phan no zhes nas snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang / gos kyi kha dog mi bsgyur ba dang / dge slong gcig rung nad kyis btab nas sman pa la dris na me la zhugs na phan no zhes nas snyan du bdas nas /
translated: They did not dye their begging bowls and robes, and when a monk was afflicted by illness and asked a doctor, the doctor said, If you enter fire, it will help. They carried that to the Buddha.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni dus yin te gnang gis byin gyis rlob la gyis shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni dus yin te gnang gis byin gyis rlob la gyis shig ces gsungs so //
translated: Such times are permitted. He said, Light it and bless it.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Again, a monk refers to the group of six and others like them.

original: mi na zhes bya ba ni na ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: mi na zhes bya ba ni na ba ma gtogs so //
translated: “Not sick” means not being ill.

original: bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gi ched du'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gi ched du'o //
translated: “For oneself” means for one’s own sake.

original: reg gam zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg gam zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis reg pa'o //
translated: “Touch” means to touch oneself.

original: reg par byed du gzhug ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol ba'o //
analyzed: reg par byed du gzhug ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol ba'o //
translated: “Cause to touch” means to ask another to do it.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as before.

original: me thogs nas nyi ma dang zla ba lta bu dang rgyug cing rtse na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me thogs nas nyi ma dang zla ba lta bu dang rgyug cing rtse na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one touches fire, or if one runs and plays like the sun and moon, then for each offense one commits a minor offense.

original: mgal me bskor na ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽me 'bud dam gsod dam mgal pa bcug gam phyung ngam /
analyzed: mgal me bskor na ltung bar 'gyur ro // me 'bud dam gsod dam mgal pa bcug gam phyung ngam /
translated: If one twirls a firebrand, one commits an offense.🔽If one lights a fire, kills, inserts a firebrand, removes a firebrand,

original: mgal pa bsdus sam mgal pa @113a * //
analyzed: mgal pa bsdus sam mgal pa @113a * //
translated: collects firebrands,

original: sdud dam / me ma mur glongs ba'i tshe dus la bab po snyam du soms shig / de ltar ma byas na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdud dam / me ma mur glongs ba'i tshe dus la bab po snyam du soms shig / de ltar ma byas na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: or collects firebrands, and thinks, “The time has come to put the fire out,” then if one does not do it that way, one commits a minor offense for each offense.

original: dge 'dun chos bzhin byed pa las sngar dad pa phul nas de'i 'og tu dad pa mi sbyin no zhes smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun chos bzhin byed pa las sngar dad pa phul nas de'i 'og tu dad pa mi sbyin no zhes smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against saying, “I will not give offerings to the saṅgha who act according to the dharma,” is that after previously giving offerings, one later does not give offerings.

original: drug sde las na ba so so dang tha skar skyes ni shi /
analyzed: drug sde las na ba so so dang tha skar skyes ni shi /
translated: From among the group of six, the one born under the Pleiades died.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni dgra bcom /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni dgra bcom /
translated: The one called Śāriputra became an arhat.🔽The one called Upasena sat silently in Kauśāmbī.

original: mos pa can ni koo sh'amb'i na cang mi byed par 'dug / dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis ni rang bzhin du dge 'dun gyi nang na gnas ste /🔽de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa bcu bdun sde shin tu 'bad cing brtson pas dar nas de dag gis bgros pa /
analyzed: mos pa can ni koo sh'amb'i na cang mi byed par 'dug / dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis ni rang bzhin du dge 'dun gyi nang na gnas ste / de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa bcu bdun sde shin tu 'bad cing brtson pas dar nas de dag gis bgros pa /
translated: Nandaka and Upasena remained as usual in the saṅgha.

original: 'u bu la sngan chad drug sdes gtses pa lta bu sus kyang ma gcos te /
analyzed: 'u bu la sngan chad drug sdes gtses pa lta bu sus kyang ma gcos te /
translated: At that time the group of seventeen were very diligent and prosperous. They discussed, “No one has ever treated us as the group of six treated us.

original: de'i nang na yang bsnyen dga' bos gtses kyis spang ba'i las byas na /
analyzed: de'i nang na yang bsnyen dga' bos gtses kyis spang ba'i las byas na /
translated: Upasena treated us badly. If we do a procedure of demotion,

original: dga' bo shags mkhas kyis de mi 'ong ba'i thabs shig bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: dga' bo shags mkhas kyis de mi 'ong ba'i thabs shig bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Nandaka, who is skilled in debate, will find a way to prevent it.”

original: dga' bo gos ngan pa zhig gyon bzhin du 'dug pa gnas brtan gos ngan pa 'di ngas bkru'o zhes nas /
analyzed: dga' bo gos ngan pa zhig gyon bzhin du 'dug pa gnas brtan gos ngan pa 'di ngas bkru'o zhes nas /
translated: Nanda was wearing a poor quality robe. The elder said, “I will wash this poor quality robe.”

original: des gos thal ba'i nang du bsgres te byin no //
analyzed: des gos thal ba'i nang du bsgres te byin no //
translated: He put the robe in ashes and gave it to Nanda.

original: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi las bya'o zhes las kyi gand'i brdungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi las bya'o zhes las kyi gand'i brdungs te /
translated: Then he said, “After that, the saṅgha will do the rite.”

original: dga' bo la ni dad pa blangs nas bsnyen dga' bo dge 'dun gyi nang du bkug ste /
analyzed: dga' bo la ni dad pa blangs nas bsnyen dga' bo dge 'dun gyi nang du bkug ste /
translated: He took the faith of the saṅgha and brought Nanda into the saṅgha.🔽“Do you remember the past when you spread the Jeta Grove with the cloth of the group of seventeen?” He did the rite of expulsion.

original: khyod kyis sngon ded la bcu bdun sde'i rgyu mas dze ta'i tshal dkri ba la sogs pa dran nam zhes nas spang ba'i las byas pa dang / de yang du zhing dga' bo'i gan du song nas ci'i phyir du zhes smras na slob dpon gyis dad pa byin nas ci bya bdag ni spangs so zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: khyod kyis sngon ded la bcu bdun sde'i rgyu mas dze ta'i tshal dkri ba la sogs pa dran nam zhes nas spang ba'i las byas pa dang / de yang du zhing dga' bo'i gan du song nas ci'i phyir du zhes smras na slob dpon gyis dad pa byin nas ci bya bdag ni spangs so zhes byas pa dang /
translated: He cried and went to Nanda. “Why do you cry?” “The master gave me faith. What can I do? I have been expelled.”

original: khyod la spang ba'i las byed pa de grong dang grong khyer gyi spangs par shog shig / de dag gis nga mi shes te /
analyzed: khyod la spang ba'i las byed pa de grong dang grong khyer gyi spangs par shog shig / de dag gis nga mi shes te /
translated: “May the rite of expulsion that you did to me be expelled from the villages and cities.” “They do not know me.

original: nga ma 'dus par las byas pas las 'gal te dad pa slar blang ngo zhes so //
analyzed: nga ma 'dus par las byas pas las 'gal te dad pa slar blang ngo zhes so //
translated: Since I did not participate in the work, the work is invalid. I will take up faith again.

original: ngas ma shes kyis dad pa de yang slar byin cig ces smras pas /
analyzed: ngas ma shes kyis dad pa de yang slar byin cig ces smras pas /
translated: Since I did not know, give me that faith back.

original: dge 'dun tshogs pas chos bzhin du las byas pa las skyo zhing dkrugs te /
analyzed: dge 'dun tshogs pas chos bzhin du las byas pa las skyo zhing dkrugs te /
translated: The assembly of monks did the work according to the Dharma, but he was dissatisfied and agitated.

original: dge slong rnams 'phya bar gyur pa las snyan du bdas so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams 'phya bar gyur pa las snyan du bdas so //
translated: The monks criticized him, but he did not listen.

original: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin pa zhes smad nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi bya ba ma yin pa zhes smad nas /
translated: This is not the work of a monk, they scolded.

original: dad pa slar blang du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dad pa slar blang du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: Do not allow the taking up of faith again, and they established a training rule in the Vinaya.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu dga' bo ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu dga' bo ste /
translated: A monk refers to Nanda, the son of the Śākyas.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Others are similar to him.

original: dad pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun chos bzhin du las byed pa las mthun pa sbyin no //
analyzed: dad pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun chos bzhin du las byed pa las mthun pa sbyin no //
translated: Faith means giving consent to the Saṅgha doing the work according to the Dharma.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan no //
translated: After that means at another time.

original: 'di skad @113b kyang zer zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad @113b kyang zer zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //
translated: He also says this means he speaks like this.

original: dge slong slar byin khyed la dad pa mi sbyin no zhes bya'i tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong slar byin khyed la dad pa mi sbyin no zhes bya'i tshig go //
translated: The monk said, I will not give you faith!

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽dge slong gis dad pa sbyin nas de'i 'og tu bzlog cing dkrug pa'i tshul du byed de /
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // dge slong gis dad pa sbyin nas de'i 'og tu bzlog cing dkrug pa'i tshul du byed de /
translated: The term offense is as above.

original: khyod la dad pa mi sbyin gyis slar byin cig ces smras na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod la dad pa mi sbyin gyis slar byin cig ces smras na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk gives faith and then later says, You should not give faith to him, give it to me instead, it is an offense in all cases.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang khyim gcig gi nang du nyal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang khyim gcig gi nang du nyal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule against sleeping in the same room as an unordained person is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag khyim pa la rgyun du chos 'chad bar zhugs pa dang / tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la chos shod cig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyim pa la rgyun du chos 'chad bar zhugs pa dang / tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la chos shod cig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The monks were constantly giving Dharma teachings to laypeople, and the Buddha said, Give Dharma teachings on the eighth and fourteenth days of the month.

original: 'on kyang mtshan rangs par chos 'chad pas na nad zhugs par gyur nas nam phyed tshun chad tsam shod cig ces byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang mtshan rangs par chos 'chad pas na nad zhugs par gyur nas nam phyed tshun chad tsam shod cig ces byung ngo //
translated: However, because they gave Dharma teachings all night, people became ill. The Buddha said, Teach for only half the night.

original: nub gcig char 'bab pas khyim pa la chos bshad pa'i sa de nyid du nyal ba dang / me 'bar bas khyim pa dag gis gsod du ma ster to //
analyzed: nub gcig char 'bab pas khyim pa la chos bshad pa'i sa de nyid du nyal ba dang / me 'bar bas khyim pa dag gis gsod du ma ster to //
translated: The laypeople would not let him be killed because of the blazing fire.

original: de na rgan zhugs bsod snyoms pa zhig nyal ba'i rmi lam na bud med dang nyal bar rmis nas mi tshangs par spyod pa'i tshul smras pas /
analyzed: de na rgan zhugs bsod snyoms pa zhig nyal ba'i rmi lam na bud med dang nyal bar rmis nas mi tshangs par spyod pa'i tshul smras pas /
translated: An old man who was a bhikṣu and an alms-beggar dreamed that he slept with a woman, and he spoke of the way he had engaged in sexual misconduct.

original: khyim pa de dag grong du lhags nas 'phya bar gyur te /
analyzed: khyim pa de dag grong du lhags nas 'phya bar gyur te /
translated: Those laypeople came to the town and ridiculed him.

original: dge slong gzhan dag gis ni chos legs par bshad na rgan zhugs des ni ma legs par bshad do zhes snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag gis ni chos legs par bshad na rgan zhugs des ni ma legs par bshad do zhes snyan du bdas te /
translated: The other bhikṣus said, “If the Dharma is well explained, the old man did not explain it well.”

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang khyim gcig gi nang du nub gcig las lhag par nyal du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang khyim gcig gi nang du nub gcig las lhag par nyal du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: It was forbidden to sleep more than one night in the same house with a person who had not completed the novitiate.

original: zhag gnyis gnang du yod pa ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: zhag gnyis gnang du yod pa ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: It was allowed to sleep two nights in Śrāvastī.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin phyi rol du spyod du song ba'i phyi na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin phyi rol du spyod du song ba'i phyi na /
translated: The venerable Rāhula went out to walk about.

original: de'i gnas khang du dge slong gzhan bgos pas sgra gcan 'dzin gnas med de /
analyzed: de'i gnas khang du dge slong gzhan bgos pas sgra gcan 'dzin gnas med de /
translated: Another monk was assigned to live in his place. Rāhula had no place to stay.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi snam phyis na 'dug pa dang / de'i nub mo char chen po bab ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi snam phyis na 'dug pa dang / de'i nub mo char chen po bab ste /
translated: He stayed in the folds of the Bhagavān’s robe. That night a great rain fell.

original: snam phyis dang nye ba zhig na sprul gdug pa ma rung ba zhig gnas te /
analyzed: snam phyis dang nye ba zhig na sprul gdug pa ma rung ba zhig gnas te /
translated: Near the robe, there was a very dangerous poisonous snake.

original: snam phyi sar 'gro pas /
analyzed: snam phyi sar 'gro pas /
translated: It went to the robe.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin bzung ste shi na ma legs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin bzung ste shi na ma legs te /
translated: “If it seizes the venerable Rāhula and kills him, that would not be good.

original: sh'akya'i rigs la mi snyan par zer bar dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag brkyang nas /
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs la mi snyan par zer bar dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag brkyang nas /
translated: Thinking that it would be a bad report for the Śākya clan, the Bhagavān extended his hand.

original: sgra gcan 'dzin blangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas khang du bzhag nas /
analyzed: sgra gcan 'dzin blangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas khang du bzhag nas /
translated: He took Rāhula and placed him in the Bhagavān’s living quarters.

original: zhag gnyis bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang nyal du gnang ngo //
analyzed: zhag gnyis bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang nyal du gnang ngo //
translated: He allowed him to sleep with a person who had not completed the two-day preliminary part of the ordination.

original: slad kyis na ba dang nad g-yog zhag lon du mi bde ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: slad kyis na ba dang nad g-yog zhag lon du mi bde ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: Later, when he was sick, he allowed the sick person and the nurse to sleep together for more than two days, because it was not convenient for them to be separated.

original: nad pa dang nad g-yog gnyis ni gnang ngo //
analyzed: nad pa dang nad g-yog gnyis ni gnang ngo //
translated: He allowed the sick person and the nurse to sleep together.

original: de ltar zhag gnyis @114a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhag gnyis @114a * //
translated: Thus, for two days,

original: las nyal bar ma gnang ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo zhag gnyis las 'da' bar byed pa dang / don nyung du ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: las nyal bar ma gnang ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo zhag gnyis las 'da' bar byed pa dang / don nyung du ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: and not allowing him to sleep, and Venerable Nanda staying more than two nights, and the monks with few desires criticizing that,

original: bkas smad nas zhag gnyis las lhag par nyal du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni rgan zhugs dang bsnyen dga' bo ste /
analyzed: bkas smad nas zhag gnyis las lhag par nyal du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so // yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni rgan zhugs dang bsnyen dga' bo ste /
translated: the Blessed One rebuked him and prohibited staying more than two nights.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Any bhikṣu” means the elder and Nanda, and others like them.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong pha dang dge slong ma'o //
translated: “Together with a person who has gone forth” means together with a bhikṣu or bhikṣuṇī who has gone forth.

original: de ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Except for them, all others are not fully ordained.

original: zhag gnyis las lhag ces bya ba thal ba'o //
analyzed: zhag gnyis las lhag ces bya ba thal ba'o //
translated: “More than two nights” means more than two nights.

original: khyim gcig gi nang na nyal zhes bya ba ni khyim gang cher g-yogs la kun bskor bar gyur pa de lta bu'i nang du nyal na zhag gsum gyi skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim gcig gi nang na nyal zhes bya ba ni khyim gang cher g-yogs la kun bskor bar gyur pa de lta bu'i nang du nyal na zhag gsum gyi skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “In the same house” means in a house that is completely covered and enclosed. If one sleeps in such a place, one commits an offense if the third dawn arrives.

original: shing drung dang rtsig drung dang phug dang / shing gel ba'i drung du nyal na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing drung dang rtsig drung dang phug dang / shing gel ba'i drung du nyal na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sleeps at the foot of a tree, at the foot of a wall, in a cave, or at the foot of a bush, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nyes pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs par 'du shes kyi khyim gcig tu nyal na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs par 'du shes kyi khyim gcig tu nyal na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is a downfall if one sleeps in the same house as someone who has not completed the same number of rainy season retreats, and one perceives the other person in that way.

original: the tshom na yang ngo //
analyzed: the tshom na yang ngo //
translated: If one is unsure of the other person’s status, the offense is also a downfall.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'du shes dang the tshom na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'du shes dang the tshom na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one perceives the other person as having completed the same number of rainy season retreats, or if one is unsure of that, the offense is wrong conduct.

original: bar chad kyi chos su mi 'gyur ro zhes smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos su mi 'gyur ro zhes smrar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the prohibition against saying that one’s view is not an obstruction took place in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong aa ri ta nyes pa byed pa las /🔽dge slong dag gis bzlog na ma btub nas /
analyzed: dge slong aa ri ta nyes pa byed pa las / dge slong dag gis bzlog na ma btub nas /
translated: The monk Ariṣṭa committed an offense.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa ni ngas shes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa ni ngas shes te /
translated: When the other monks tried to stop him, he said, “I know what the Blessed One taught.

original: de ltar spyad kyang bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes log par lta ba'i phyir gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo na lta ba bzlog tu ma btub nas snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: de ltar spyad kyang bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes log par lta ba'i phyir gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo na lta ba bzlog tu ma btub nas snyan du bdas te /
translated: Because he had the wrong view that even if I act like that, it will not become an obstruction, he was admonished with a four-part formal procedure. When he could not be turned from his view, he was expelled.

original: lan gsum du sgo shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: lan gsum du sgo shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Buddha said, Admonish him three times.

original: lan gsum du bsgo ba las ma btub nas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bsgo ba las ma btub nas /
translated: When he could not be turned from his view even after being admonished three times,

original: rnam grangs du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: he was censured in many ways and the training rule was proclaimed.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni aa ri ta ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni aa ri ta ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The term monk refers to Ārita and others like him.

original: 'di skad du ces bya ba ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du ces bya ba ni smra ba'o //
translated: The phrase he said this means he spoke.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The term Blessed One refers to the Tathāgata.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The term Dharma refers to the teachings of the Buddha and his disciples.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni bsgrags pa'o //
translated: The term explained means proclaimed.

original: bar du gcod ces bya ba ni phas pham pa'i chos bzhi gnas bdun shin tu zhi ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod ces bya ba ni phas pham pa'i chos bzhi gnas bdun shin tu zhi ba'i bar du ste /
translated: The term obstruction refers to the four defeating offenses and the seven bases of settling disputes up to the very peaceful.

original: ltung ba ris lnga rnams spyad kyang bar du mi gcod ces smra ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ris lnga rnams spyad kyang bar du mi gcod ces smra ba'o //
translated: The five classes of downfalls are the five classes of offenses.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni aa ri ta'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni aa ri ta'o //
translated: The monk is the one who is called Ariṣṭa.

original: dge slong rnams zhes bya @114b ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams zhes bya @114b ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The monks are those who have entered this Dharma.

original: de skad du sgo shig ces bya ba ni tshig 'jam pos bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: de skad du sgo shig ces bya ba ni tshig 'jam pos bsgo ba'o //
translated: The tell him is to tell him with gentle words.

original: de ste yang dngos po de gtong ba lta na ni legs de ste yang mi gtong na lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo yang dag par bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis yang dag par bsgo ba la bya'o
analyzed: de ste yang dngos po de gtong ba lta na ni legs de ste yang mi gtong na lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo yang dag par bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis yang dag par bsgo ba la bya'o
translated: If he gives up that thing, it is good. If he does not give it up, he should be admonished up to three times.  Admonished means to admonish by the procedure of accusation and demotion.

original: // dang po bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshe na nyes byas so //
analyzed: // dang po bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshe na nyes byas so //
translated: If he says, I will not give it up, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshig 'jam po bsgo ste ma btub na yang nyes byas gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig 'jam po bsgo ste ma btub na yang nyes byas gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not give it up when admonished with gentle words, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct.

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsgo nas mi gtong na nyes byas gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsgo nas mi gtong na nyes byas gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not give it up when admonished by the procedure of accusation and demotion, he commits three offenses of wrong conduct.

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lan gnyis bsgo ste mi gtong na nyes byas bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis lan gnyis bsgo ste mi gtong na nyes byas bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not stop after being admonished twice, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chos ji lta ba dang 'dul ba ji lta ba dang ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du lan gsum rdzogs par byas kyang ma btub na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ji lta ba dang 'dul ba ji lta ba dang ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin du lan gsum rdzogs par byas kyang ma btub na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not stop after being admonished three times, in accordance with the Dharma, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: chos bzhin du bsgo yang ma tshogs na dge 'dun dang gang zag gnyis ka la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bzhin du bsgo yang ma tshogs na dge 'dun dang gang zag gnyis ka la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is not in a group, but admonishes in accordance with the Dharma, then both the group and the individual commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshogs la chos bzhin du ma bsgo na yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs la chos bzhin du ma bsgo na yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is not in a group, but admonishes in accordance with the Dharma, then there is no offense.

original: tshogs la chos kyi gzugs brnyan gyis bsgo ba dang / ma tshogs pa la chos kyi gzugs brnyan gyis bsgo ba ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: tshogs la chos kyi gzugs brnyan gyis bsgo ba dang / ma tshogs pa la chos kyi gzugs brnyan gyis bsgo ba ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If he admonishes in a group, but with a counterfeit Dharma, or if he admonishes individually, but with a counterfeit Dharma, there is no offense.

original: de ste dge slong de ltung ba rab tu 'gyod cing ma ba shags ma mthol na /
analyzed: de ste dge slong de ltung ba rab tu 'gyod cing ma ba shags ma mthol na /
translated: If that monk is remorseful about his offense, but does not confess it,

original: de phyin chad gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis nang du 'jug pa na thams cad du nyes byas so //
analyzed: de phyin chad gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis nang du 'jug pa na thams cad du nyes byas so //
translated: then, from then on, if he enters the monastery by means of a legal procedure consisting of a proclamation and a single question, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong spangs pa dang lhan cig gtam smra zhing khyim gcig gi nang du nyal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong spangs pa dang lhan cig gtam smra zhing khyim gcig gi nang du nyal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against speaking with a monk who has been ejected and sleeping in the same house as him is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong bud bu rdzi aa ri ta sdig pa can gyi lta ba gtong du ma btub nas dge 'dun rnams kyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis spangs pa'i las byas nas ngu zhing bsnyen dga' bo'i gan du song ba dang / de de dang phrad de /
analyzed: dge slong bud bu rdzi aa ri ta sdig pa can gyi lta ba gtong du ma btub nas dge 'dun rnams kyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis spangs pa'i las byas nas ngu zhing bsnyen dga' bo'i gan du song ba dang / de de dang phrad de /
translated: The monk Ariṣṭa was not able to relinquish his sinful view. The saṅgha performed the legal procedure of ejecting him after the announcement and the three requests. He cried and went to Upāli.

original: aa ri ta khyod ci'i du phyir du zhes byas nas /
analyzed: aa ri ta khyod ci'i du phyir du zhes byas nas /
translated: When they met, Upāli asked, “Ariṣṭa, why are you crying?”🔽“I have been ejected by the monks with black bowls.”

original: bdag ni lhung bzed nag po can gyis spangs so zhes byas pa dang / khyod la spong bar byed pa de dag grong dang grong khyer gyis spangs par shog shig ces nas /
analyzed: bdag ni lhung bzed nag po can gyis spangs so zhes byas pa dang / khyod la spong bar byed pa de dag grong dang grong khyer gyis spangs par shog shig ces nas /
translated: “May those who eject you be rejected by the towns and cities.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bos /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bos /
translated: The venerable Upāli said,

original: dge slong aa ri ta sdig pa'i lta ba ma spangs te dge 'dun gyis chad pas bcad cing spangs par shes bzhin du bsten cing gnas bca' ba dang / lung 'bogs pa dang gnas khang gcig tu zhag lon pa dang nyal zhing gtam smra bar byed pas dge @115a * //🔽slong dga' 'phya ba la snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: dge slong aa ri ta sdig pa'i lta ba ma spangs te dge 'dun gyis chad pas bcad cing spangs par shes bzhin du bsten cing gnas bca' ba dang / lung 'bogs pa dang gnas khang gcig tu zhag lon pa dang nyal zhing gtam smra bar byed pas dge @115a * // slong dga' 'phya ba la snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī. A monk named Ariṣṭa did not give up his sinful view. The Saṅgha imposed a penalty on him and expelled him. Knowing this, he associated with and stayed with him, recited the scriptures with him, stayed overnight in the same room, slept, and talked with him.🔽The monks reported this to the Buddha.

original: bkas smad de 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: bkas smad de 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Buddha reprimanded him and established a training rule for the monks.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means Nanda and others like him.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes pa 'am gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: “Knowing” means knowing oneself or being told by others.

original: 'di skad smra ba'i gang zag ces bya ba ni aa ri ta'o //
analyzed: 'di skad smra ba'i gang zag ces bya ba ni aa ri ta'o //
translated: “A person who speaks like this” means Ariṣṭa.

original: chos bzhin ma byas zhes bya ba ni de las ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos bzhin ma byas zhes bya ba ni de las ma gyur pa'o //
translated: “Not acting according to the Dharma” means not changing.

original: ma btang zhes bya ba ni sdig pa de lta bu'i lta bar gyur pa ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: ma btang zhes bya ba ni sdig pa de lta bu'i lta bar gyur pa ma btang ba'o //
translated: “Not giving up” means not giving up that kind of sinful view.

original: gtam zer zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtam zer zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase to speak means to recite the scriptures.

original: kun du smra zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa'i lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: kun du smra zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa'i lung ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase to converse means to give instruction to a friend.

original: gnas zhes bya ba gnas byin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba gnas byin pa'o //
translated: The phrase to stay means to give a place to stay.

original: kun du spyod ces bya ba ni de las bsnyen bkur nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: kun du spyod ces bya ba ni de las bsnyen bkur nyams su len pa'o //
translated: The phrase to act means to practice service.

original: de dang lhan cig khyim gcig na nyal zhing zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig zhag lon te skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig khyim gcig na nyal zhing zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig zhag lon te skya rengs shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase to sleep in the same room means to spend the night with him and to rise in the morning.

original: nyes pa ni de skad zer ba'i gang zag chos bzhin ma byas pa sdig pa'i lta ba ma spangs pa la gtam byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni de skad zer ba'i gang zag chos bzhin ma byas pa sdig pa'i lta ba ma spangs pa la gtam byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase to commit an offense means to converse with a person who has been spoken to in this way, who has not acted in accordance with the Dharma, and who has not given up his evil views.

original: kun du gtam byas na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽lhan cig gnas na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽lhan cig spyod na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun du gtam byas na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro // lhan cig gnas na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro // lhan cig spyod na yang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase to commit an offense also means to converse with him.🔽The phrase to commit an offense also means to stay with him.🔽The phrase to commit an offense also means to act with him.

original: 'dug na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dug na yang ngo //
translated: The phrase to commit an offense also means to sit with him.

original: na ba dang sdig pa'i lta ba spangs pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na ba dang sdig pa'i lta ba spangs pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person has given up his evil views.

original: dge sbyong spangs pa dang lhan cig bsten cing 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong spangs pa dang lhan cig bsten cing 'dug tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the Buddha not allowing the monks to associate with the renunciate Subhadra is as follows.

original: tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo la slob ma dge tshul tsher ma can dang / mchod pa can zhes bya ba gnyis shig yod de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bsnyen dga' bo la slob ma dge tshul tsher ma can dang / mchod pa can zhes bya ba gnyis shig yod de /
translated: The venerable Upali had two disciples, the novices Kshudra and Puja.🔽At that time, some monks who had not abandoned the afflictions and were not free from attachment tormented the two novices by laughing at them, taunting them, and running after them.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong nyon mongs pa ma spangs shing 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dag cig dge tshul de gnyis la tho 'tshams gad rgyangs byed dregs shing rgyug pa la sogs ba byed pa la dus phyi zhig na dge tshul gnyis me tog 'thu zhing 'khod
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong nyon mongs pa ma spangs shing 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dag cig dge tshul de gnyis la tho 'tshams gad rgyangs byed dregs shing rgyug pa la sogs ba byed pa la dus phyi zhig na dge tshul gnyis me tog 'thu zhing 'khod
translated: One day, the two novices were picking flowers.

original: 'khod pa las steng gi nam mkha' la gri ba ma zhig bab nas bltas na dge slong dag cig nam mkha' la dong ba mthong ste /
analyzed: 'khod pa las steng gi nam mkha' la gri ba ma zhig bab nas bltas na dge slong dag cig nam mkha' la dong ba mthong ste /
translated: While they were picking flowers, a vulture fell from the sky. They looked and saw some monks flying through the sky.

original: khyed su zhes smras na nged ming 'di dang 'di zhes bya'o zhes byas pa dang / khyed ni sngon drug sde dang bdag cag lhan cig tu gnas ngan len spyod spyod na da ci'i phyir khyed de ltar gyur ces byas na /
analyzed: khyed su zhes smras na nged ming 'di dang 'di zhes bya'o zhes byas pa dang / khyed ni sngon drug sde dang bdag cag lhan cig tu gnas ngan len spyod spyod na da ci'i phyir khyed de ltar gyur ces byas na /
translated: When asked, You and we used to live together, engaging in negative conduct. Why are you like this now?

original: nged kyis sdig pa'i chos de dag btang ste bshags par bya ba ni bshags /
analyzed: nged kyis sdig pa'i chos de dag btang ste bshags par bya ba ni bshags /
translated: They replied, We abandoned those negative actions and confessed them.

original: bsdam par bya ba ni bsdams te /
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba ni bsdams te /
translated: We restrained ourselves from what should be restrained.🔽 We exerted ourselves and became arhats.

original: 'bad bsgrims pas na dgra bcom par byas so zhes byas pa dang / dge tshul de gnyis na re gnas ngan len kun du @115b spyod pa de dag gis kyang dgra bcom pa thob pa la bltas na /
analyzed: 'bad bsgrims pas na dgra bcom par byas so zhes byas pa dang / dge tshul de gnyis na re gnas ngan len kun du @115b spyod pa de dag gis kyang dgra bcom pa thob pa la bltas na /
translated: When the two novice monks saw that they had attained arhatship through engaging in negative conduct,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa ni bar du gcod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa ni bar du gcod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they thought, Even the Buddha's statement that desire is an obstruction does not apply to obstructions.

original: zhes lta ba skyes nas /
analyzed: zhes lta ba skyes nas /
translated: Thus, they gave rise to that view.

original: de la dge slong rnams kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo yang lta ba ngan pa gtor du ma btub nas /
analyzed: de la dge slong rnams kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo yang lta ba ngan pa gtor du ma btub nas /
translated: Even though the monks spoke to them twice and three times, they were unable to abandon that wrong view.

original: dge 'dun gyi mig lam na yang mi snang bar byas te spangs pa bsnyen dga' bos bsten cing shed bskyed pa dang gnas dang yo byang byin zhing gnas 'char bcug pa dge slong rnams kyis thos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mig lam na yang mi snang bar byas te spangs pa bsnyen dga' bos bsten cing shed bskyed pa dang gnas dang yo byang byin zhing gnas 'char bcug pa dge slong rnams kyis thos te /
translated: The monks heard that Upacelā was supporting and encouraging the evil novice, giving him a place to stay and provisions, and allowing him to stay with her.

original: dge tshul sdig pa can mig lam na mi snang bar byas te spangs pa dang lhan cig tu gnas par byed do zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: dge tshul sdig pa can mig lam na mi snang bar byas te spangs pa dang lhan cig tu gnas par byed do zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: They criticized her, saying, “You are supporting and living with the evil novice who has been expelled and no longer appears in the community’s presence.”

original: gang zag chos bzhin du ma byas pas bsten du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: gang zag chos bzhin du ma byas pas bsten du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: She was reprimanded and the training rule was laid down in the Monastic Law, not allowing support of a person who does not act in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dge tshul ni tsher ma can dang ma chod pa can no //
analyzed: dge tshul ni tsher ma can dang ma chod pa can no //
translated: “The novice is one who has thorns and is one who has obstacles.”

original: 'di skad du zer zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: 'di skad du zer zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams so //
translated: “They say this” refers to the words that will be given below.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: “The Blessed One” is the Tathāgata.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: “The Dharma” is what is spoken by the Blessed One and the hearers.

original: bar du gcod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bya'o //
translated: “Obstacles” refers to the five sense pleasures.

original: bsten ces bya ba ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsten ces bya ba ni spyod pa'o //
translated: The term should attend means to practice.

original: bar du gcod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge spyod gir mi 'gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge spyod gir mi 'gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase will not be an obstacle means that he will not be a hindrance to the practice of virtue.

original: 'di skad smos shig ces bya ba ni tshig 'jam pos bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad smos shig ces bya ba ni tshig 'jam pos bsgo ba'o //
translated: The phrase should say this means to instruct with gentle words.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgo ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: The phrase up to the third time means to instruct by means of a legal procedure consisting of a proclamation of an act that needs to be confessed.

original: dge tshul chos bzhin du mi byed pa mig lam na mi snang bar spangs pa las bsten pa ni sh'akya'i bu bsnyen dga' bo ste /
analyzed: dge tshul chos bzhin du mi byed pa mig lam na mi snang bar spangs pa las bsten pa ni sh'akya'i bu bsnyen dga' bo ste /
translated: The phrase should not attend means that a novice monk who does not act in accordance with the Dharma should be dismissed and not allowed to remain in the community. The example of this is the Śākya youth Nandīpāla.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The phrase and others like him refers to others who are similar to him.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes pa'am /
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes pa'am /
translated: The phrase with full awareness means that he should know this himself,

original: gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgo ba'o //
translated: or that he should be instructed by others.

original: de ltar dge tshul mig lam na mi snang bar byas zhes bya ba ni tsher ma can dang mchod pa can no //
analyzed: de ltar dge tshul mig lam na mi snang bar byas zhes bya ba ni tsher ma can dang mchod pa can no //
translated: The phrase should not be allowed to remain in the community means that a novice monk should be dismissed and not allowed to remain in the community. The example of this is a novice monk who is a thorn and a burden.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The phrase and others like him refers to others who are similar to him.

original: gnas byin zhes bya ba ni de bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas byin zhes bya ba ni de bzhag pa'o //
translated: The phrase should give him a place to stay means that he should be allowed to stay.

original: yo byad byin zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad byin zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase should give him requisites means that he should be given a begging-bowl and so on.

original: lung 'bogs zhes bya ba ni gnas sbyin zhing kha don dang klog pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lung 'bogs zhes bya ba ni gnas sbyin zhing kha don dang klog pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving instruction means giving instruction in the scriptures, or giving instruction in reading.

original: khyim gcig tu nyal zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi nang du skya rengs kyis chod pa'o //
analyzed: khyim gcig tu nyal zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi nang du skya rengs kyis chod pa'o //
translated: Sleeping in the same room means sleeping in the same house, separated by the break of dawn.

original: nyes pa ni dge tshul mig lam na mi snang bar byas pa shes bzhin du gnas dang yo byad byin nam lhan cig khyim gcig tu gnas na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge tshul mig lam na mi snang bar byas pa shes bzhin du gnas dang yo byad byin nam lhan cig khyim gcig tu gnas na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is that if one knowingly gives a novice monk a place to stay or provisions, or if one stays in the same room as him, there is one offense.

original: na ba dang sdig par lta ba @116a * //
analyzed: na ba dang sdig par lta ba @116a * //
translated: If he is sick, or if he has a view of wrongdoing,

original: las bzlog pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: las bzlog pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: the opposite is not included.🔽The other should be applied like the offense of wearing a skirt.

original: gzhan ni ltung bgor ma bzhin du sbyor cig / gos kha dog ma bsgyur ba dang tshon chen po la btsos pa gyon du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni ltung bgor ma bzhin du sbyor cig / gos kha dog ma bsgyur ba dang tshon chen po la btsos pa gyon du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition on wearing undyed or brightly colored robes was in Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i yul khams na klu'i rgyal po ri bo dang dga' skyed ces bya ba gnyis shig gnas pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i yul khams na klu'i rgyal po ri bo dang dga' skyed ces bya ba gnyis shig gnas pas /
translated: At that time, in the realm of King Bimbisāra, there were two nāga kings named Giri and Nanda.

original: chu dron dang mtsho la sogs pa yang rgyas char yang dus dus su bab pas de'i yul na lo legs shing 'byor to //
analyzed: chu dron dang mtsho la sogs pa yang rgyas char yang dus dus su bab pas de'i yul na lo legs shing 'byor to //
translated: The hot springs and lakes were filled with water, and the rain fell in the proper season. The country was prosperous and the people were happy.

original: de gnyis klu dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis la zla bltas te /
analyzed: de gnyis klu dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis la zla bltas te /
translated: The two nāgas, Nanda and Upananda, were looking at the moon.

original: dus dus su bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byas pas 'khor 'phel te /
analyzed: dus dus su bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byas pas 'khor 'phel te /
translated: From time to time they served the Blessed One, and the retinue increased.

original: gnas med par rgya mtshor 'dod bar sangs rgyas la gsol na ma gnang ste /
analyzed: gnas med par rgya mtshor 'dod bar sangs rgyas la gsol na ma gnang ste /
translated: They wanted to go to the ocean, but the Buddha did not allow it.

original: khyed gnyis rgyal po'i yul na gnas pas na rgyal po la gsol cig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: khyed gnyis rgyal po'i yul na gnas pas na rgyal po la gsol cig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: He said, “You two live in the king’s realm, so ask the king.”

original: dus gzhan zhig na de gnyis khyim bdag gi cha lugs su sprul te /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na de gnyis khyim bdag gi cha lugs su sprul te /
translated: At another time the two of them emanated in the guise of householders.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga na de gnyis chos nyan cing 'dug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga na de gnyis chos nyan cing 'dug pa'i tshe /
translated: They sat in the presence of the Buddha listening to the Dharma.

original: rgyal po gzugs can snying po yang bdag der 'ongs nas de gnyis langs snyam nas de 'ongs pa dang / ma langs pas rgyal po yang khros te bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po la de'i chos kyang ma bshad do //
analyzed: rgyal po gzugs can snying po yang bdag der 'ongs nas de gnyis langs snyam nas de 'ongs pa dang / ma langs pas rgyal po yang khros te bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po la de'i chos kyang ma bshad do //
translated: King Bimbisara came there, thinking that the two Nagas would rise up, but they did not. The king became angry, and the Lord Buddha did not explain the Dharma to him.

original: rgyal pos ma shes te /
analyzed: rgyal pos ma shes te /
translated: The king did not understand.

original: klu gnyis bskrad pas de gnyis kyang mtsho chen por dong ngo //
analyzed: klu gnyis bskrad pas de gnyis kyang mtsho chen por dong ngo //
translated: He drove out the two Nagas, and they went to a great lake.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i yul phyogs su mtshe'u dang lteng ka dag kyang bskams char dag kyang dus dus su ma bab pas lo nyes so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i yul phyogs su mtshe'u dang lteng ka dag kyang bskams char dag kyang dus dus su ma bab pas lo nyes so //
translated: At that time, the ponds and pools in the king's realm dried up, and rain did not fall at the proper time, so there was a famine.

original: de nas rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar nongs pa zhus pa dang / rgyal pos klu khyim ba dag gnyis shig bskrad pa dran nam zhes bkas rmas na dran no zhes gsol pa dang / de gnyis klu'i rgyal po ri bo dang dga' skyed gnyis yin te de gnyis khros pas rgya mtshor dod bas so zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar nongs pa zhus pa dang / rgyal pos klu khyim ba dag gnyis shig bskrad pa dran nam zhes bkas rmas na dran no zhes gsol pa dang / de gnyis klu'i rgyal po ri bo dang dga' skyed gnyis yin te de gnyis khros pas rgya mtshor dod bas so zhes byas pa dang /
translated: Then the king asked the Lord Buddha how he had offended the Nagas, and the Buddha asked the king if he remembered driving out two householder Nagas. The king said he did, and the Buddha said that they were the Naga kings Riwo and Gakyed, and that because they were angry, they had gone to the ocean.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das bdag gi yul du ma rung mod ces gsol pa dang / bzod pa gsol ba'i dus dang phyis de gnyis dang phrad par dus bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad de //
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das bdag gi yul du ma rung mod ces gsol pa dang / bzod pa gsol ba'i dus dang phyis de gnyis dang phrad par dus bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad de //
translated: The Buddha made an appointment to meet with them both at a later time, when he would be able to reconcile them.

original: de gnyis dang gcig la gcig bzod par byas kyi 'og tu /
analyzed: de gnyis dang gcig la gcig bzod par byas kyi 'og tu /
translated: The two of them reconciled with each other.

original: klu'i rgyal po gnyis kyis phyir rgyal po'i yul du 'ong bar gsol ba btab na /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po gnyis kyis phyir rgyal po'i yul du 'ong bar gsol ba btab na /
translated: Later, the two nāga kings requested the Buddha to return to the king's country.

original: ded cag gnas pa'i gnas nyid du nged kyis g-yog cig bzhag gi /
analyzed: ded cag gnas pa'i gnas nyid du nged kyis g-yog cig bzhag gi /
translated: The Buddha said, I will leave a representative in the very place where we are staying.

original: de gnyis kyi khang pa brtsigs shig dus dus su 'ong ngo zhes dus byas so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi khang pa brtsigs shig dus dus su 'ong ngo zhes dus byas so //
translated: Build a house for them and I will come from time to time.

original: de gnyis spro ba'i rol mo byed pa'i tshe phyogs nas rol mo mkhan cig 'ongs pas /
analyzed: de gnyis spro ba'i rol mo byed pa'i tshe phyogs nas rol mo mkhan cig 'ongs pas /
translated: When they were performing music to entertain themselves, a musician came from another direction.

original: dge slong ma @116b bcu gnyis sde las byang chub spyod pa mdzad pa'i gar thabs bslabs te byas pas dad pa rnams ni dga' bar byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma @116b bcu gnyis sde las byang chub spyod pa mdzad pa'i gar thabs bslabs te byas pas dad pa rnams ni dga' bar byas so //
translated: He taught the dance techniques of the bodhisattva conduct to the twelve bhikṣuṇīs.

original: ma dad pa rnams dga' zhing mos par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams dga' zhing mos par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to please those with faith and to please and inspire those without faith,

original: tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can dang 'char ba lta bur bcos nas gcig gi mdun du gcig tsog tsog por 'dug nas gcig la gcig zas kyi lhag mar byas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mos pa can dang 'char ba lta bur bcos nas gcig gi mdun du gcig tsog tsog por 'dug nas gcig la gcig zas kyi lhag mar byas nas /
translated: They pretended to be like the venerable Nanda and Upananda. One sat in front of the other, and one ate the other’s leftovers.

original: thal ba gyo mo gang mgo bor bsnun cing drug sde po la dpyas pas ma dad pa rnams kyang dad par gyur /
analyzed: thal ba gyo mo gang mgo bor bsnun cing drug sde po la dpyas pas ma dad pa rnams kyang dad par gyur /
translated: They threw the ashes and potsherds at the heads of the group of six. The faithful became faithful.

original: drug sde ni mi dga' bar gyur nas /
analyzed: drug sde ni mi dga' bar gyur nas /
translated: The group of six became unhappy.

original: rol mo mkhan de la gnod bzhig bya bar bsams nas /
analyzed: rol mo mkhan de la gnod bzhig bya bar bsams nas /
translated: They thought, “We will harm that musician.”🔽They put on the costumes and clothes of the gods and the musician. They thought, “We will deceive them.”

original: lha dang rol mo mkhan gyi cha lugs 'dra bar yo byad dang gos dag sbyar nas la bzla bar bya'o zhes phyogs gcig tu byang chub spyod pa gar thabs sbyar bas /
analyzed: lha dang rol mo mkhan gyi cha lugs 'dra bar yo byad dang gos dag sbyar nas la bzla bar bya'o zhes phyogs gcig tu byang chub spyod pa gar thabs sbyar bas /
translated: They went to one place and performed the dance of the bodhisattvas.

original: rol mo mkhan rnams kyang drug sde po rnams yin no snyam du 'phrigs te /
analyzed: rol mo mkhan rnams kyang drug sde po rnams yin no snyam du 'phrigs te /
translated: The musicians thought, “The group of six are the group of six.”

original: dze ta'i tshal du bsgugs na bsnyen dga' bo'i gdong la sa tshon zhig 'dug pa mthong ste /
analyzed: dze ta'i tshal du bsgugs na bsnyen dga' bo'i gdong la sa tshon zhig 'dug pa mthong ste /
translated: They waited in Jetavana. They saw that Upāli’s face was covered with colored dust.

original: de phyin chad bsnyen dga' bo la gar mi bya ba dang 'phyas mi gdab par gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: de phyin chad bsnyen dga' bo la gar mi bya ba dang 'phyas mi gdab par gsol ba btab ste /
translated: From then on, the monks were not to dance for or insult Nanda.🔽They were to request him and, as a gift, to leave musical instruments with him. Later, whatever they received was to be given to the group of six.

original: rngan pa'i brdar rol mo'i cha byad bzhag ste phyis ci rnyed pa drug sde la byin pa dang / gar mkhan mi dga' zhing mi snyan par zer ba las /
analyzed: rngan pa'i brdar rol mo'i cha byad bzhag ste phyis ci rnyed pa drug sde la byin pa dang / gar mkhan mi dga' zhing mi snyan par zer ba las /
translated: The dancer was unhappy and spoke unpleasantly.

original: dge slong dag gis thos pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis thos pa snyan du bdas te /
translated: The monks heard this and reported it to the Blessed One.

original: drug sde la rmas te bkas smad nas de lta bas na nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa thams cad kyang chos gos kha dog ma bsgyur ba dang / tshon chen po las gyur pas na khyim pa'i ma brtags pa dang / tshon chen po'i gos gyon du mi gnang ba'i 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: drug sde la rmas te bkas smad nas de lta bas na nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa thams cad kyang chos gos kha dog ma bsgyur ba dang / tshon chen po las gyur pas na khyim pa'i ma brtags pa dang / tshon chen po'i gos gyon du mi gnang ba'i 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One reprimanded the group of six and said, “Therefore, since all of these faults arose from monks wearing robes that were not dyed and that were made of fine cloth, I establish a rule of training to be observed in the future: Monks should not wear robes that are not dyed and that are made of fine cloth.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /🔽gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste / gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Monks” means the group of six or others like them.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rgyu rnam pa bdun gsungs pa las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rgyu rnam pa bdun gsungs pa las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “Robes” means any of the seven types of robe-cloth.

original: gsar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “New” is of two kinds:

original: sar pas sar pa dang / gsar du rnyed pas gsar ba'o //
analyzed: sar pas sar pa dang / gsar du rnyed pas gsar ba'o //
translated: new in the sense of fresh, and new in the sense of newly acquired.

original: kha dog rnam pa gsum du bsgyur cing zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i kha dog rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog rnam pa gsum du bsgyur cing zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i kha dog rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “Having dyed it with one of three colors” means any of the colors that will be mentioned.

original: sngon po zhes bya ba ni rams kyis sngo ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po zhes bya ba ni rams kyis sngo ba'o //
translated: “Blue” means dyed with indigo.

original: dmar po zhes bya ba ni btsag go //
analyzed: dmar po zhes bya ba ni btsag go //
translated: “Red” means dyed with madder.

original: ngur smrig ces bya ba ni shing shun dang me tog gis bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: ngur smrig ces bya ba ni shing shun dang me tog gis bsgyur ba'o //
translated: “Saffron” means dyed with the bark of the kasha tree or with flowers.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as before.

original: nyes pa ni kha dog rnam pa gsum gang yang rung ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni kha dog rnam pa gsum gang yang rung ba ste /
translated: The fault is any of the three colors.

original: gcig tu ma bsgyur ba gyon na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu ma bsgyur ba gyon na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wears any of them without having dyed it, one commits an offense.

original: tha na lhung bzed kyi snod yan @117a * //
analyzed: tha na lhung bzed kyi snod yan @117a * //
translated: Even if it is only a small part, such as the edge of a begging bowl,

original: chad kyang kha dog ma ba sgyur bar spyod na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chad kyang kha dog ma ba sgyur bar spyod na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: if one uses it without having dyed it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshon chen po brgyad mi gnang ba ni rgya skyegs dang / btsod dang / ma tshal dang / gur gum dang / mthing shing dang / li khri dang / rma shing dang / le brgan tshon te de rnams ma brtags na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i //
analyzed: tshon chen po brgyad mi gnang ba ni rgya skyegs dang / btsod dang / ma tshal dang / gur gum dang / mthing shing dang / li khri dang / rma shing dang / le brgan tshon te de rnams ma brtags na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i //
translated: The eight great colors are not to be used without examination: lac, red mineral, turmeric, saffron, indigo, madder, red arsenic, and vermillion.

original: rin po che la rag tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: rin po che la rag tu mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the prohibition against using precious substances is as follows.

original: de'i tshe che dang ldan pa 'char kas yul mi'i byis pa rtsal dang rol mo slob cing sbyor ba'i sar song nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe che dang ldan pa 'char kas yul mi'i byis pa rtsal dang rol mo slob cing sbyor ba'i sar song nas /
translated: At one time the venerable Udayi went to the place where the children of the townspeople were learning skills and playing musical instruments.

original: de dag gi slob dpon gzhan du song ste mi 'dug pa'i phyi na slob ma rnams gtses te /
analyzed: de dag gi slob dpon gzhan du song ste mi 'dug pa'i phyi na slob ma rnams gtses te /
translated: The children's teacher had gone elsewhere and was not there.🔽Udayi tormented the children,

original: de dag la 'phong dang ral mo byed du bcug pa dang ma mgu ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'phong dang ral mo byed du bcug pa dang ma mgu ste /
translated: and they became displeased.

original: bzhin bsgyur cing mig btsums nas khyed kyi mkhan po yang mi mkhas na khyed lta ga la shes te khyed rnams ni phub ma 'phyar ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bzhin bsgyur cing mig btsums nas khyed kyi mkhan po yang mi mkhas na khyed lta ga la shes te khyed rnams ni phub ma 'phyar ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: They frowned, closed their eyes, and said, If your preceptor is not skilled, how can you know anything? You are like a pile of chaff.

original: 'bras bu med do zhes byas nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu med do zhes byas nas /
translated: He said, There is no result.🔽The venerable Udayi, having performed the dance and the music, the children were not pleased and remained regretful. When their teacher came, they said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas 'phong rtsa la dang gar thabs dag byas te la bzlas pas byis pa rnams kyang mi dga' nas 'gyod cing 'khod pa dang / de dag gi slob dpon 'ongs pa la bdag cag ni phub ma 'phyar ba dang 'dra ba'o zhes /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas 'phong rtsa la dang gar thabs dag byas te la bzlas pas byis pa rnams kyang mi dga' nas 'gyod cing 'khod pa dang / de dag gi slob dpon 'ongs pa la bdag cag ni phub ma 'phyar ba dang 'dra ba'o zhes /
translated: We are like a pile of chaff.🔽They said, It is the noble Udayi.

original: 'phags pa 'char ka zer ro zhes byas pa dang / 'di ni yus te 'phags pa 'char ka po ni byang chub sems dpa' rol mo'i tshe yang 'phong rtsal dang / rol mo mkhan gyi mchog yin pas de lta bu ni 'u bus mi lobs mod kyi 'on kyang ngas shes pa tsam slobs shig ces slob ma rnams la bsgo nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'char ka zer ro zhes byas pa dang / 'di ni yus te 'phags pa 'char ka po ni byang chub sems dpa' rol mo'i tshe yang 'phong rtsal dang / rol mo mkhan gyi mchog yin pas de lta bu ni 'u bus mi lobs mod kyi 'on kyang ngas shes pa tsam slobs shig ces slob ma rnams la bsgo nas /
translated: The teacher said, This is boasting. The noble Udayi is a bodhisattva. Even when playing music, he is the best at dance and music. Such things cannot be learned by a child. However, I will teach you just what I know. Having instructed his students,

original: slob dpon gyis 'char ba yang slan chad mi gtse bar gsol te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'char ba yang slan chad mi gtse bar gsol te /
translated: the teacher asked Udayi not to disturb them again.
