original: de'i rngan pa'i brdar rol mo dang rtsal gyi cha spyad bzhag pas byis pa rnams mi snyan par 'dzer cing 'phya bar gyur pa dang / slad kyis yangs pa'i grong khyer na li tstsha b'i'i byis pa rnams chu la 'khru ba'i tshe rgyan rnams bkrol te bzhag pa dge slong bsnyen dga' bos gnod sbyin gyi nor ro zhes blangs pa byis pa rnams kyis bsnyags te 'dren pa la /
analyzed: de'i rngan pa'i brdar rol mo dang rtsal gyi cha spyad bzhag pas byis pa rnams mi snyan par 'dzer cing 'phya bar gyur pa dang / slad kyis yangs pa'i grong khyer na li tstsha b'i'i byis pa rnams chu la 'khru ba'i tshe rgyan rnams bkrol te bzhag pa dge slong bsnyen dga' bos gnod sbyin gyi nor ro zhes blangs pa byis pa rnams kyis bsnyags te 'dren pa la /
translated: Later, when the Licchavi children of the city of Vaishali were bathing in the water, they removed their ornaments and left them there. The monk Nandaka took them, saying, They are the wealth of the yakshas. The children chased him and pulled him.

original: rgan po zhig gis mthong nas des byas te phyir byin pa dang / byis pas sas gtor ba dang / lha khang du phyin nas dge slong dag gis de la ci nyes zhes dris na /
analyzed: rgan po zhig gis mthong nas des byas te phyir byin pa dang / byis pas sas gtor ba dang / lha khang du phyin nas dge slong dag gis de la ci nyes zhes dris na /
translated: An old man saw this and said, He did it. Give it back. The children threw dirt at him and went to the temple. The monks asked him, What is wrong?

original: des kyang de bzhin du gtam byas te /
analyzed: des kyang de bzhin du gtam byas te /
translated: He told them what had happened.

original: de lta bu'i nyes pa'i dmigs kyang byung mod kyi de'i tshe 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas ma bcas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyes pa'i dmigs kyang byung mod kyi de'i tshe 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas ma bcas so //
translated: Although such faults occurred, at that time no training rule was established in the Vinaya.

original: slad kyis grong khyer yangs pa can na litstsha b'i'i skyed mos tshal sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i 'dres pa'i @117b tshal dang 'dra'o zhes sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa drug sde dag gis thos nas /
analyzed: slad kyis grong khyer yangs pa can na litstsha b'i'i skyed mos tshal sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i 'dres pa'i @117b tshal dang 'dra'o zhes sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa drug sde dag gis thos nas /
translated: Later, the Buddha praised the Litsavi garden in the city of Shravasti, saying, “It is like the mixed garden of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.”

original: de ci 'dra ba blta'o zhes nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba blta'o zhes nang du zhugs te /
translated: The group of six heard this and thought, “Let’s see what it’s like.”

original: khrus kyi rdzing dang rol mo'i cha spyad dag ma skyes dgra la sogs pa'i dgra cha'i rnga bo che yod de /
analyzed: khrus kyi rdzing dang rol mo'i cha spyad dag ma skyes dgra la sogs pa'i dgra cha'i rnga bo che yod de /
translated: They entered the garden and saw the bathing pools and musical instruments.

original: tshe dang ldan pa drug sde rnams kyis thog mar ni khrus byas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa drug sde rnams kyis thog mar ni khrus byas /
translated: The group of six monks first bathed.🔽Then they beat the drums. Ajatashatru thought, “The enemy is coming!”

original: de'i 'og tu rda brdungs pas ma skyes dgra'i dmag 'ong snyam ste li tstsha b'i kun skrag ste skyed mos tshal du lhags so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rda brdungs pas ma skyes dgra'i dmag 'ong snyam ste li tstsha b'i kun skrag ste skyed mos tshal du lhags so //
translated: The Litsavis were terrified and went to the garden.🔽The group of six said, “There is no enemy. We were just joking.”

original: drug sde na re dgra ni med kyi nged kyis ku re zhig byas so zhes byas pa dang / de kun ni rab tu skrag cing dkrugs na /
analyzed: drug sde na re dgra ni med kyi nged kyis ku re zhig byas so zhes byas pa dang / de kun ni rab tu skrag cing dkrugs na /
translated: “You are all so terrified and disturbed.

original: ci rtsed mo zhig ces mi snyan par zer ba las /
analyzed: ci rtsed mo zhig ces mi snyan par zer ba las /
translated: What kind of joke is that?”

original: rin po che dang nye ba'i rin po che ste rol mo dang dgra cha la sogs pa len cing spyod do zhes skye bo rnams mi snyan par zer ba snyan du bdas nas thug sde rnams la rmas ta /
analyzed: rin po che dang nye ba'i rin po che ste rol mo dang dgra cha la sogs pa len cing spyod do zhes skye bo rnams mi snyan par zer ba snyan du bdas nas thug sde rnams la rmas ta /
translated: The people said, They take and use precious things and semi-precious things, such as musical instruments and weapons.🔽Having driven away the unpleasant words, he asked the group of six, What is this?

original: rnam grangs du mas smad nas rin po che dang / rin po che lta bu la reg tu mi gnang ba'i 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas smad nas rin po che dang / rin po che lta bu la reg tu mi gnang ba'i 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Having rebuked them in many ways, he laid down a training rule that they should not touch precious things and things that resemble precious things.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: A monk means the group of six and others like them.

original: rin po che zhes bya ba ni nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / man shel dang / g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / gser dngul la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: rin po che zhes bya ba ni nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / man shel dang / g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / gser dngul la sogs pa'i //
translated: Precious things means jewels, pearls, beryl, crystal, right-spiraling conches, gold, silver, and so on.

original: rin po che lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo'i mtshon cha dang / rol mo'i cha spyad thams cad la rin po che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo'i mtshon cha dang / rol mo'i cha spyad thams cad la rin po che zhes bya'o //
translated: Things that resemble precious things means all weapons and musical instruments are called precious things.

original: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag gis blangs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag gis blangs pa'o //
translated: With one's own hands means taking them oneself.

original: gnas khang gi nang dang kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dug pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas khang gi nang dang kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dug pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except when he is in his own house or in a pleasure garden.

original: gtsug lag khang dang kun dga'i mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang kun dga'i mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'o //
translated: In the monastery or in the vicinity of the pleasure garden.

original: de yang ri dgas dgra'i ma sa ga bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal du 'ongs pa rko long du gyur du dogs nas rgyan rnams bkrol te sgo'i lkog tu bzhag pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos mthong nas stor du dogs pas blangs te snyan du zhus
analyzed: de yang ri dgas dgra'i ma sa ga bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal du 'ongs pa rko long du gyur du dogs nas rgyan rnams bkrol te sgo'i lkog tu bzhag pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos mthong nas stor du dogs pas blangs te snyan du zhus
translated: The mother of Mṛgāra, having come to worship the Blessed One, was afraid of being delayed, so she took off her ornaments and put them behind the door. The venerable Ānanda saw them and took them, fearing they would be lost.

original: pa las slan chad de lta bu de dag long la bdag po ma 'ongs na zhag drug gi bar du zhog cig / de ste yang ma 'ongs na dge 'dun gyi mdzod du brubs shig pa'o //
analyzed: pa las slan chad de lta bu de dag long la bdag po ma 'ongs na zhag drug gi bar du zhog cig / de ste yang ma 'ongs na dge 'dun gyi mdzod du brubs shig pa'o //
translated: He reported it to the Blessed One, who said, “From now on, if such things are found, keep them for six days. If the owner does not come, put them in the Saṅgha’s storehouse.”

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
translated: “Falling” means falling into the three lower realms.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis nor bu dang dung dang man shel dang / gser dang dngul dag blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis nor bu dang dung dang man shel dang / gser dang dngul dag blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Fault” means if a monk takes jewels, conches, crystals, gold, or silver, he commits a downfall.

original: rnga dang rol mo'i cha byad dang gzhu rgyud med pa spyad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnga dang rol mo'i cha byad dang gzhu rgyud med pa spyad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you play musical instruments without the drum, the musical instruments, the bow, and the strings, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhu rgyud dang bcas pa dang mda' mde'u can 'chang na yang ltung bar @118a * //
analyzed: gzhu rgyud dang bcas pa dang mda' mde'u can 'chang na yang ltung bar @118a * //
translated: If you play musical instruments with the strings and arrows, you commit an offense.

original: 'gyur ro // dung 'bud pa las blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // dung 'bud pa las blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you play a conch, you commit an offense.

original: sku gzugs ring bsrel dang bcas pa len na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku gzugs ring bsrel dang bcas pa len na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you take a statue with relics, you commit an offense.

original: ring bsrel med pa 'am ston par 'du shes skyed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring bsrel med pa 'am ston par 'du shes skyed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you take a statue without relics, or if you generate the perception that it is the Teacher, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: khrus byed du sngar mi gnang ste slad kyis tsha ba'i dus la dgongs nas gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i kha na ste /
analyzed: khrus byed du sngar mi gnang ste slad kyis tsha ba'i dus la dgongs nas gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i kha na ste /
translated: Bathing was not permitted at first, but later it was allowed in consideration of the hot season. The origin story is that of King Bimbisāra.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i yul na chu dron gsum bdog ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i yul na chu dron gsum bdog ste /
translated: At that time, in the country of King Bimbisāra, there were three hot springs.

original: gcig tu ni rgyal po nyid khrus byed /
analyzed: gcig tu ni rgyal po nyid khrus byed /
translated: In one, the king himself bathed.

original: gnyis par ni btsun mo'i tshogs rnams khrus byed /
analyzed: gnyis par ni btsun mo'i tshogs rnams khrus byed /
translated: In the second, the assembly of queens bathed.

original: gsum par ni 'bangs rnams khrus byed do //
analyzed: gsum par ni 'bangs rnams khrus byed do //
translated: In the third, the subjects bathed.

original: de nas rgyal pos bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos bsams pa /
translated: Then the king thought,

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi dge 'dun la cis kyang bstabs na chu dron gyis ma bstabs kyis dbul lo snyam nas rgyal pos sangs rgyas la chos nyan pa'i rjes la btsun mo 'khru ba ni dge 'dun mo rnams la 'bul /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi dge 'dun la cis kyang bstabs na chu dron gyis ma bstabs kyis dbul lo snyam nas rgyal pos sangs rgyas la chos nyan pa'i rjes la btsun mo 'khru ba ni dge 'dun mo rnams la 'bul /
translated: “I have offered everything to the Buddha’s saṅgha, but I have not offered hot water. I will offer that.” After the king listened to the Buddha’s dharma, he offered the queen’s bathing water to the saṅgha of nuns.

original: bdag rang 'khru ba'i rdzing ni dge 'dun la phul te /🔽bdag 'khru ba'i tshe ni dge 'dun gzhes /
analyzed: bdag rang 'khru ba'i rdzing ni dge 'dun la phul te / bdag 'khru ba'i tshe ni dge 'dun gzhes /
translated: He offered the bathing pool where he bathed himself to the saṅgha.🔽“When I bathe, the saṅgha will bathe.”

original: dge 'dun 'khru ba'i tshe ni bdag sdong ngo zhes nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'khru ba'i tshe ni bdag sdong ngo zhes nas /
translated: “When the saṅgha bathes, I will wait.”

original: de bzhin du gnang ba dang drug sde rnams kyis kyal ka bya bar bsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnang ba dang drug sde rnams kyis kyal ka bya bar bsams te /
translated: He gave his permission. The group of six thought, “We will play a trick.”

original: ring du thogs par bya ba'i tshe res kyis sbreng zhing khrus byed /
analyzed: ring du thogs par bya ba'i tshe res kyis sbreng zhing khrus byed /
translated: When they were delayed for a long time, they took turns bathing.

original: gcig 'khru ba'i tshe gcig grogs byed nas /
analyzed: gcig 'khru ba'i tshe gcig grogs byed nas /
translated: When one was bathing, the other helped.

original: rgyal po 'khrur 'ongs pa ring zhig tu bsdad na /
analyzed: rgyal po 'khrur 'ongs pa ring zhig tu bsdad na /
translated: When the king came to bathe, he waited a long time.

original: drug sde dag ring du thogs nas gdod skyo nas chu bcus te khrus byas so //
analyzed: drug sde dag ring du thogs nas gdod skyo nas chu bcus te khrus byas so //
translated: The group of six was delayed for a long time. Finally, they became tired and filled the pool with water and bathed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du song ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du song ste /
translated: Then they went to the Blessed One.

original: phyag byas nas kha rog ste slar song ngo //
analyzed: phyag byas nas kha rog ste slar song ngo //
translated: After they had made obeisance, they went away in silence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la smras pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One asked Ananda,

original: rgyal po 'di sngon ni phyag byas nas chos kyang mnyan na //
analyzed: rgyal po 'di sngon ni phyag byas nas chos kyang mnyan na //
translated: “Why did this king, who formerly made obeisance and listened to the Dharma,🔽go away without listening to the Dharma?”

original: da ni chos kyang ma mnyan pas slar song na ci nyes zhes rmas na drug sdes kyal ka 'di lta bu byas pas ma rangs pa 'dra'o zhes gsol nas phyin chad 'khrur mi gnang ngo zhes bcas pa las /
analyzed: da ni chos kyang ma mnyan pas slar song na ci nyes zhes rmas na drug sdes kyal ka 'di lta bu byas pas ma rangs pa 'dra'o zhes gsol nas phyin chad 'khrur mi gnang ngo zhes bcas pa las /
translated: “The group of six monks did this kind of joke, so he was displeased,” he replied. “From now on, I will not allow bathing.”

original: phyis dge slong dag dri mche zhing mnam nas /
analyzed: phyis dge slong dag dri mche zhing mnam nas /
translated: Later, the monks smelled bad and stank.

original: khyim pa dag 'phya zhing khyed dri mas grol thar tam zhes 'phya ba las phyin chad zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus byed par gnang ngo ;
analyzed: khyim pa dag 'phya zhing khyed dri mas grol thar tam zhes 'phya ba las phyin chad zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus byed par gnang ngo ;
translated: The householders ridiculed them, saying, “Are you liberated from defilements?” Because of this, it was allowed to bathe every half-month.

original: / dpyid tsha ba'i zla ba gsum ni 'khrur gnang ngo //
analyzed: / dpyid tsha ba'i zla ba gsum ni 'khrur gnang ngo //
translated: For the three months of the hot season in spring, bathing was allowed.

original: slan chad na ba dang rlung dang char gyi tshe dus la ma bab par yang 'khrur gnang ngo //
analyzed: slan chad na ba dang rlung dang char gyi tshe dus la ma bab par yang 'khrur gnang ngo //
translated: From now on, he should bathe at other times, too, when he is ill, or when there is wind or rain.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus gyis shig ces bya ba ni dpyid tsha ba'i dus te zla ba phyed kyi rjes la gnang ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus gyis shig ces bya ba ni dpyid tsha ba'i dus te zla ba phyed kyi rjes la gnang ba'o //
translated: “You should bathe every half-month” means that in the hot season of spring, he is allowed to bathe after half a month.

original: sangs rgyas ni dngos su zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni dngos su zad do //
translated: The Buddha has finished.

original: de dang 'gal bar byas @118b na dus la bab pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dus ni 'di yin te /🔽dpyid smad kyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed dang gnyis na dbyar tshul du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal bar byas @118b na dus la bab pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dus ni 'di yin te / dpyid smad kyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed dang gnyis na dbyar tshul du 'jug pa'o //
translated: “If you do it at other times, except at the right time,” means that the right time is this:🔽“The last half-month of spring” means that after half a month, the rainy season begins.

original: dbyar gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni tshul du zhugs nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du ste /
analyzed: dbyar gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni tshul du zhugs nas zla ba phyed kyi bar du ste /
translated: “The rainy season” means that after the rainy season has begun, for half a month.

original: zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni rab tu tsha ba'i dus so //
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni rab tu tsha ba'i dus so //
translated: These three and a half months are the hot season.

original: lhag ma na ba dus zhes bya ba ni dge slong nad kyis btab pa khrus ma byas na 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma na ba dus zhes bya ba ni dge slong nad kyis btab pa khrus ma byas na 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “The rest of the time is the time of illness” means that if a monk who is ill does not bathe, he will not survive.

original: las dus zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun nam mchod rten gyi las te /
analyzed: las dus zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun nam mchod rten gyi las te /

original: phyag dar dang dkyil 'khor ba ko tsam byas na 'khrur gnang ngo //🔽lam dus zhes bya ba ni dpag tshad phyed dam /

translated: If you wash your feet just after sweeping the courtyard or the temple, there is no offense.

original: gcig tsam nas slar 'khor ba'i //
analyzed: gcig tsam nas slar 'khor ba'i //
translated: “Time of travel” means when you are traveling a half or one league.

original: rlung dus zhes bya ba ni tha na rlung gis chos gos kyi tha ma bzlog pa'am //
analyzed: rlung dus zhes bya ba ni tha na rlung gis chos gos kyi tha ma bzlog pa'am //
translated: “Time of wind” means when even a slight breeze moves the edge of your robe,

analyzed: lus la char gyi thigs pa gcig gnyis phog pa tsam yang ngo //
translated: or when a single drop of rain falls on your body.

original: dus yin zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dus yin zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: “Time” also means when the circumstances are appropriate.

original: dge slong khrus byed na dus la bab po snyam du sems la khrus kyis shig ma bsams par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong khrus byed na dus la bab po snyam du sems la khrus kyis shig ma bsams par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk thinks, “It is time to wash,” and then washes, there is no offense. If he does not think this, but does it anyway, he commits an offense.

original: dge slong klung chu dang 'bab chu dang / rdzing bu gang yang rung bas khrus byed na lte ba khung gi bar ma phyin gyi bar du ni nyes byas so //

translated: If a monk washes in a river, a stream, or a pond, he commits an offense as soon as he enters the water up to his navel.

original: phyin na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he enters the water beyond his navel, he commits an offense.

original: gzhan ni skabs gzhan nas 'byung ba dang sbyor cig / ltung ba drug cu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzhan ni skabs gzhan nas 'byung ba dang sbyor cig / ltung ba drug cu pa rdzogs so /

analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis byol song kyi skye gnas su gyur pa la /
translated: The offense is for a monk who, with the intention to kill an animal,

translated: strikes it with even a single jujube fruit or mustard seed, and it dies.

analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la 'gyod pa bskyed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the rule not to cause regret for a monk took place in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong bcu bdun sde dag drug sde dag gis rgyus mi shes kyi bar du de dag la gnas 'cha' zhing bsnyen bkur byed do //
analyzed: dge slong bcu bdun sde dag drug sde dag gis rgyus mi shes kyi bar du de dag la gnas 'cha' zhing bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: The group of seventeen monks lived with the group of six and served them until the group of six knew their lineage.

original: de'i tshe 'char kas gcig la las shig bcol na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'char kas gcig la las shig bcol na /
translated: At that time, when Udayı asked one of them to do something,🔽he said, “You are not our teacher.” Udayı was unable to do anything and drove them away.

translated: They discussed their problem: “We know that he despises us, but we are not able to do anything because he despises us.” They went to another monk to study and to recite.

translated: Then Upali asked, “Where did those children go?” Udayı said, “They were not able to do anything, so I drove them away.” Upali said, “That was not good. It is like waking a sleeping snake. Why did you drive them away?”

original: bdag cag la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes byas pa dang / 'char ka na re de ngag gi bar chad bya bar ngas nus so zhes nas de dag gi gan du song ste byis pa khyed rnams ci byed ces smras pa dang / nged ni thos pa tshol lo //
analyzed: bdag cag la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes byas pa dang / 'char ka na re de ngag gi bar chad bya bar ngas nus so zhes nas de dag gi gan du song ste byis pa khyed rnams ci byed ces smras pa dang / nged ni thos pa tshol lo //
translated: We will be harmed.🔽Udayi said, I can stop their speech. He went to them and said, Children, what are you doing?🔽They said, We are seeking learning.

original: thos pas ci bya dbang po smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos pas ci bya dbang po smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: He said, What will you do with learning? Our faculties will ripen.

original: des ci zhig bya zag pa med pa'i shes rab bskyed do //
analyzed: des ci zhig bya zag pa med pa'i shes rab bskyed do //
translated: What will you do with that? We will generate uncontaminated wisdom.

original: des ci bya mya ngan las 'da' ba mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: des ci bya mya ngan las 'da' ba mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: What will you do with that? We will actualize nirvana.

analyzed: 'char ka na re khyod kyis thos pa ni ma thos ma thos pa ni thos te /
translated: Udayi said, You have heard what has not been heard and have not heard what has been heard.

analyzed: khyed rnams lo nyi shu ma lon par bsnyen bar rdzogs pas na /
translated: Since you have not completed twenty years,🔽you have not completed your novitiate.

analyzed: khyed rnams kyang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la dge slong dag kyang 'das pa dang bcas pa'o zhes ma gsungs sam /
translated: Have I not said that monks who have not completed their novitiate are guilty of a downfall?

analyzed: khyed dge slong du ma gyur na mnyan te ci phan zhes byas pas de dag sems khong du chud de 'gyod cing 'khod pa dang / de dag gi slob dpon 'ongs te khyed ci'i phyir sems shing 'khod ces byas pa dang / 'char ka na re 'di skad zer ro zhes zhib tu smras pa dang /
translated: When their teacher came, they asked, Why are you sitting here? They told him in detail what Udayin had said.

analyzed: slob dpon na re las dang po la nyes pa med ces gsungs pas na khyed la nyes pa med de /
translated: The teacher said, There is no fault for a beginner. Therefore, there is no fault for you.

original: the tshom ma byed cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: the tshom ma byed cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Do not doubt it. He advised them.

original: dge slong rnams ci'i phyir dge slong la 'gyod pa bskyed du gzhug ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams ci'i phyir dge slong la 'gyod pa bskyed du gzhug ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks said, Why should a monk be made to regret? They criticized him and reported it to the Blessed One.

original: bkas rmad de dge slong la 'gyod pa bskyed du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: bkas rmad de dge slong la 'gyod pa bskyed du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One said, It is not allowed to make a monk regret. It is prescribed as training.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: As for a monk, it refers to Udayin and others like him.

original: ched du bsams zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bya bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bsams zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bya bar sems pa'o //
translated: As for intentionally, it means thinking to do it with the mind.

original: skad cig mi dga' bar bya bar bsams nas 'gyod pa bskyed na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig mi dga' bar bya bar bsams nas 'gyod pa bskyed na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thinks, “I will make him unhappy for a moment,” and generates regret, then a downfall is accrued in all cases.

original: dge slong ma yin pa phas pham pa la sogs pas dge slong 'gyod pa bskyed bcug na 'gyod pa skyes kyang rung ma skyes kyang rung bzhad gad kyi phyir yang rung ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma yin pa phas pham pa la sogs pas dge slong 'gyod pa bskyed bcug na 'gyod pa skyes kyang rung ma skyes kyang rung bzhad gad kyi phyir yang rung ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a non-monk causes a monk to generate regret through a defeating offense, and so on, then whether or not regret is generated, and even if it is done for the sake of a joke, a downfall is accrued.

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis nyi ma dang zla ba spyang kis zin pa dang / tshong dpon dang de dpon dang nor can de lta bu dag dran nam mi dran zhes smras pa las /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis nyi ma dang zla ba spyang kis zin pa dang / tshong dpon dang de dpon dang nor can de lta bu dag dran nam mi dran zhes smras pa las /
translated: If one says to a monk, “Venerable, do you remember the sun and moon being seized by the demon Rāhu, or the merchants and their captain, or the rich man and his wife?”

original: mi dran no zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: mi dran no zhes smras pa la /
translated: and he replies, “I do not remember,”

original: 'on kyang khyod kyis bsnyen par ma rdzogs so zhes 'gyod pa bskyed na thams cad du ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyod kyis bsnyen par ma rdzogs so zhes 'gyod pa bskyed na thams cad du ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: then if one says, “Nevertheless, you have not completed your novitiate,” and causes him to generate regret, then a downfall is accrued in all cases.

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod ni mkhan po dang slob dpon mi rigs pa las bsnyen @120a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod ni mkhan po dang slob dpon mi rigs pa las bsnyen @120a * //
translated: If one says to a monk, “Venerable, your preceptor and master are not suitable to be a preceptor and master,

original: par rdzogs pas na dge slong gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba'i 'gyod pa bskyed na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par rdzogs pas na dge slong gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba'i 'gyod pa bskyed na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one generates regret, thinking, “I do not have the status of a fully ordained monk,” one commits an offense.

original: sdig par lta ba las bzlog pa 'am bcos pa'i phyir ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sdig par lta ba las bzlog pa 'am bcos pa'i phyir ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one turns away or corrects a sinful view.

original: mdzub mos ga ga tshil byed du mi gnang ba'i gling gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: mdzub mos ga ga tshil byed du mi gnang ba'i gling gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against snapping one’s fingers is in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe bcu bdun sde rnams gcig las su bskos na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcu bdun sde rnams gcig las su bskos na /
translated: At that time, when one of the group of seventeen was appointed to do something,

analyzed: kun bsdongs shing grogs byed do //
translated: all of them gathered and helped.

original: phyis gcig la gtsug lag khang skyong gi res la bab nas /
analyzed: phyis gcig la gtsug lag khang skyong gi res la bab nas /

original: des kyang chos 'chad pa'i stan kun bting nas /
analyzed: des kyang chos 'chad pa'i stan kun bting nas /

original: bdag gcig pu gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab pa dang / phyag dar dang gtsug lag khang rgyan gyis brgyan pa la sogs pa kun byas te /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab pa dang / phyag dar dang gtsug lag khang rgyan gyis brgyan pa la sogs pa kun byas te /

original: de'i nub mo gcig gis kyang grogs ma byas te sha zang ngo //
analyzed: de'i nub mo gcig gis kyang grogs ma byas te sha zang ngo //
translated: That night, none of the others helped him, and he was exhausted.

analyzed: bcu bdun po gcig la gcig ltos ltos pa las sus kyang grogs ma byas te /

original: gcig pus mtshan gcig lus pas nang par de khros pa la kun gyis zan zos kyi bar du bzod par gsol na ma btub nas /
analyzed: gcig pus mtshan gcig lus pas nang par de khros pa la kun gyis zan zos kyi bar du bzod par gsol na ma btub nas /
translated: Since he was alone, he was able to hold out until morning. In the morning, they all begged his pardon until he was satisfied.

original: gcig gis ga ga tshil byas na de yang dgod pa dang / thabs de rung ngo zhes kun gyis byas pa dang / rlung gis subs te dus las 'das so //
analyzed: gcig gis ga ga tshil byas na de yang dgod pa dang / thabs de rung ngo zhes kun gyis byas pa dang / rlung gis subs te dus las 'das so //
translated: One of them burped. He laughed and said, “That’s the right way.” They all did that, and since the fire was extinguished by the wind, he died.

original: de nas de rnams ngu zhing 'khod pa las dge slong dag gis mthong ste 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de nas de rnams ngu zhing 'khod pa las dge slong dag gis mthong ste 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /

original: ga ga tshil byed du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: ga ga tshil byed du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: They were offended and the rule against burping was made.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde'o //
translated: “A monk” means the group of seventeen.

original: ga ga tshil byed ces bya ba ni g-ya' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ga ga tshil byed ces bya ba ni g-ya' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Burping” means itching.

original: chags bzhin du ga ga tshil byas na sor mo dus reg pa ltung ba yang de snyed do //
analyzed: chags bzhin du ga ga tshil byas na sor mo dus reg pa ltung ba yang de snyed do //
translated: If one burps while lustful, it is a downfall to touch the penis.

original: rma dang mdze dang sme ba dang / spu 'khril ba la sogs pa bstan cing 'phrug pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rma dang mdze dang sme ba dang / spu 'khril ba la sogs pa bstan cing 'phrug pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in showing a wound, leprosy, a birthmark, or a swirl of hair and scratching it.

original: chu la dga' zhing rtser mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: chu la dga' zhing rtser mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /

analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong bcu bdun sde'i nang na au p'a li zhes bya ba las nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: At that time, in the group of seventeen monks, the one named Upāli abandoned all afflictive emotions and manifested arhatship.

original: des grogs po dag 'dul bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: des grogs po dag 'dul bar 'dod nas /
translated: He wanted to tame his friends.

original: chu bo khyim ldan zhes bya ba'i nang na khrus byed pa'i tshe rtse zhing 'khod do //
analyzed: chu bo khyim ldan zhes bya ba'i nang na khrus byed pa'i tshe rtse zhing 'khod do //
translated: When they were bathing in the river called Householder, they played and stayed there.

original: tshe dang ldan pa au p'a li ni skam la 'dug go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa au p'a li ni skam la 'dug go //
translated: The venerable Upāli stayed on dry land.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po gsal rgyal dang / btsun mo phreng ldan ma gnyis khang pa'i yang thog na 'khod pa bcu bdun sde gcer bur byung nas chu'i nang nas mdzes par rtse zhing 'khod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po gsal rgyal dang / btsun mo phreng ldan ma gnyis khang pa'i yang thog na 'khod pa bcu bdun sde gcer bur byung nas chu'i nang nas mdzes par rtse zhing 'khod par mthong ngo //
translated: At that time, King Prasenajit and Queen Mālādhara were on the roof of the palace. They saw the group of seventeen nakedly emerge from the water and beautifully play and stay there.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal na re btsun mo la khyod @120b kyi sbyin gnas kyi mdzes pa la ltos zhes byas pa dang / btsun mon re de dag ni na gzhon pa rtse ba ni ngo mtshar mi che /
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal na re btsun mo la khyod @120b kyi sbyin gnas kyi mdzes pa la ltos zhes byas pa dang / btsun mon re de dag ni na gzhon pa rtse ba ni ngo mtshar mi che /
translated: The queen said, “Those young people playing are not so wonderful.

original: rgyal po bgres po nyid kyang da rung rtsad mo mi gtong na zhes byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po bgres po nyid kyang da rung rtsad mo mi gtong na zhes byas so //
translated: Even the old king is still playing.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa au p'a lis bdag cag chu la rtse ba la mi dag mi dga' ba med grang zhes ting nge 'dzin du zhugs te brtags na /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa au p'a lis bdag cag chu la rtse ba la mi dag mi dga' ba med grang zhes ting nge 'dzin du zhugs te brtags na /
translated: Then the venerable Upāli thought, “Are people displeased with our playing in the water?” He entered into meditative absorption and examined the situation.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal ma dad par mthong nas /
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal ma dad par mthong nas /
translated: He saw that King Prasenajit had lost faith.

original: rgyal po dga' zhing dad par bya ba'i phyir dge slong gzhan dag chos gos la 'jur bcug ste /
analyzed: rgyal po dga' zhing dad par bya ba'i phyir dge slong gzhan dag chos gos la 'jur bcug ste /
translated: In order to make the king happy and faithful, the other monks wrung out their robes and,

original: steng gi nam mkha' las rgyal po'i steng na mar lding ste dong ba las btsun mos grib ma zhig mthong ste bltas na /
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' las rgyal po'i steng na mar lding ste dong ba las btsun mos grib ma zhig mthong ste bltas na /
translated: flying through the air above the king, went off. The queen saw a shadow and looked.

original: au p'a li la sogs pa bcu bdun sde rnams te /
analyzed: au p'a li la sogs pa bcu bdun sde rnams te /
translated: They were the seventeen, Upāli and so forth.

original: btsun mo dga' nas rgyal po la ngan bu'i sbyin gnas mdzes pa la gzigs zhes byas pa dang / rgya la po na re de dag dgra bcom pa thob kyang rtsed mo ma btang na /
analyzed: btsun mo dga' nas rgyal po la ngan bu'i sbyin gnas mdzes pa la gzigs zhes byas pa dang / rgya la po na re de dag dgra bcom pa thob kyang rtsed mo ma btang na /
translated: The queen was pleased and said to the king, “Look at the beauty of the one who is worthy of gifts.”🔽The king said, “What is beautiful about them if they do not stop playing even though they have attained arhatship?”

original: ci mdzes zhes 'phya ba las btsun mos snyan du gsol nas /
analyzed: ci mdzes zhes 'phya ba las btsun mos snyan du gsol nas /
translated: The queen appealed to him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis smad nas chu la rtser mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis smad nas chu la rtser mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One reprimanded them and laid down a training rule prohibiting playing in water.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means the group of seventeen and others like them.

original: chu la rtse zhes bya ba ni rtse bar bsams nas gang lus kyi las dang lus kyi byed pa dang / lus kyis bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: chu la rtse zhes bya ba ni rtse bar bsams nas gang lus kyi las dang lus kyi byed pa dang / lus kyis bskyod pa'o //
translated: “Playing in water” means, intending to play, any physical action, any physical movement.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as before.

original: nyes pa ni dgu ste dga' ba dang dga' bar byed du 'jug pa dang / rtse ba dang rtser 'jug pa dang / mgu pa dang mgu bar byed du 'jug pa dang / 'phyar ba dang snyegs pa dang / lus la 'jog par byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dgu ste dga' ba dang dga' bar byed du 'jug pa dang / rtse ba dang rtser 'jug pa dang / mgu pa dang mgu bar byed du 'jug pa dang / 'phyar ba dang snyegs pa dang / lus la 'jog par byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: There are nine faults: delighting in, causing others to delight in, playing in, causing others to play in, enjoying, causing others to enjoy, being arrogant, chasing, and causing others to place on the body.

original: dge slong chu la rtse bar bsams nas gos phud de chu'i nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: dge slong chu la rtse bar bsams nas gos phud de chu'i nang du zhugs te /
translated: If a monk, thinking to play in the water, removes his robes and enters the water,

original: chu'i nang du byi'u zul byas sam /
analyzed: chu'i nang du byi'u zul byas sam /
translated: if he dives in the water,

original: stang du byung ngam /
analyzed: stang du byung ngam /
translated: if he emerges from the water,

original: pha rol tshu rol gyi 'gram du'am /
analyzed: pha rol tshu rol gyi 'gram du'am /
translated: if he goes from one bank to the other,

analyzed: chur rnga brdung ngam chu'i nang du sbal skad 'byin pa la sogs pa byed na thams cad du ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: if he beats the water with his hands or feet, or if he makes the sound of a frog in the water, then in all cases he commits an offense.

original: chu la bem rdol gyis bsnun ta ma /
analyzed: chu la bem rdol gyis bsnun ta ma /
translated: If he strikes the water with his palm,

original: tshod ma'i khu ba dang / 'bras kyi khu ba la ri mo 'dri zhing rtse na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshod ma'i khu ba dang / 'bras kyi khu ba la ri mo 'dri zhing rtse na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: if he draws pictures in the water with the juice of vegetables or rice, and plays, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sim zhing bsil bar bya ba dang / rkyal slob pa la nyes med do //
analyzed: sim zhing bsil bar bya ba dang / rkyal slob pa la nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is cooling himself or learning to swim.

original: bud med dang khyim gcig tu nyal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: bud med dang khyim gcig tu nyal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the prohibition against sleeping in the same room with a woman is as follows.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la brten te 'bad rtsol bas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //🔽bcom ldan 'das @121a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la brten te 'bad rtsol bas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so // bcom ldan 'das @121a * //
translated: At that time, the venerable Aniruddha, relying on the teachings of the Blessed One, made efforts and actualized arhatship.🔽He thought, “How can I repay the kindness of the Blessed One?

analyzed: kyi bka' drin bsab cing lan glon pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la ljongs rgyu zhing song ba las nub mo grong zhig tu phyin nas / dgongs mal med nas grang mi bsten te /
translated: ” For the sake of sentient beings, he went wandering. One evening he arrived at a town.🔽Since there was no place to sleep, he went to a house where a young man was staying.

original: khye'u spyi brtol can gyi khyim du nyol zhes byas pa dang / khye'u spyi brtol can gyis dge slong ma 'gags pa khrid de song nas nub mo der bsnyal ba dang / dge slong yang de na nyal lo zhes sgra kun du grags so //
analyzed: khye'u spyi brtol can gyi khyim du nyol zhes byas pa dang / khye'u spyi brtol can gyis dge slong ma 'gags pa khrid de song nas nub mo der bsnyal ba dang / dge slong yang de na nyal lo zhes sgra kun du grags so //
translated: The young man said, “Venerable Aniruddha, sleep here,” and the young man led the monk to his house and put him to sleep there for the night. The monk also slept there. The sound of this became well-known.

original: de'i nub mo khye'u de'i mas dge slong la zan dang rkang pa bsku ba'i mar gyis bstabs shing /
analyzed: de'i nub mo khye'u de'i mas dge slong la zan dang rkang pa bsku ba'i mar gyis bstabs shing /
translated: That night the mother of the child served the monk food and oil for his feet.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa rngod na /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa rngod na /
translated: “If you are going to have sex,

original: dge slong de yang ma btub bo //
analyzed: dge slong de yang ma btub bo //
translated: then the monk will not be able to stay.”

original: bud med de yang 'dod chags kyis kun du gnod pas nam phyed na dge slong la bsnyen cing gzung bar byas pa dang / 'phags pa des steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags te /
analyzed: bud med de yang 'dod chags kyis kun du gnod pas nam phyed na dge slong la bsnyen cing gzung bar byas pa dang / 'phags pa des steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags te /
translated: The woman was tormented by desire, so at midnight she went to the monk and tried to seduce him.

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul bstan pa dang de yang dad par gyur te /
translated: The noble one rose up into the sky and displayed miracles and wonders. She became faithful.

analyzed: zan gyis bstabs pa dang / de yang sgo chod cig dang nang par bza'o zhes nas /

analyzed: 'phags pa de yang sgo gcod cing nang na 'dug pa dang / bud med de'i ming po gcig cig kyang khyim mtshes gzhan dag dang rtsod cing 'thabs pas na /
translated: While the noble one was closing the door and sitting inside, a brother of the woman was arguing and fighting with a neighbor.

original: khyod kyi sring mos dge slong dag kyang ma shor to byas pa dang de gnyis kyang khros te /
analyzed: khyod kyi sring mos dge slong dag kyang ma shor to byas pa dang de gnyis kyang khros te /

analyzed: dge slong dang sring mo gnyi ga bsad do zhes ral gri thogs te song ba dang / yul gyi ltad mo la yang mang du lhags nas de sgo phye ste bltas pa dang / 'phags pa ma 'gags pas nam mkha' la rdzu 'phrul byas pa dang /
translated: Many people had gathered to see the spectacle, and when they opened the door and looked in, they saw that the noble Aniruddha had performed a miracle in the sky.

original: skye bo dag kyang dad par byas so //
analyzed: skye bo dag kyang dad par byas so //
translated: The people were filled with faith.🔽When he returned, he converted five hundred bandits on the road and then went back to Śrāvastī.

original: de slar log nas mi rgod lnga brgya lam du btul nas phyir mnyan du yod par phyin pa dang / dge slong dag gis tshe dang ldan pa bde bar 'ongs sam zhes dris na sems can gyi don byas pa ni bde mod kyi /
analyzed: de slar log nas mi rgod lnga brgya lam du btul nas phyir mnyan du yod par phyin pa dang / dge slong dag gis tshe dang ldan pa bde bar 'ongs sam zhes dris na sems can gyi don byas pa ni bde mod kyi /
translated: When the monks asked him, Venerable One, did you come back safely? he replied, I did what was necessary for sentient beings and so I am well.🔽However, the two brothers of the mother of that conceited boy said, 'We killed Hadapa.'

original: khye'u spyi brtol can gyi ma'i ming po gnyis kyis had por de'u bsad do zhes byas pa dang / dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas bud med dang khyim gcig gi nang du nyal du mi gnang ba'i 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: khye'u spyi brtol can gyi ma'i ming po gnyis kyis had por de'u bsad do zhes byas pa dang / dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas bud med dang khyim gcig gi nang du nyal du mi gnang ba'i 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The monks reported this to the Buddha, and he established a rule of training that women and men should not sleep in the same house.

analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni ma 'gags pa ste /

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //

translated: The rest is as above.
