analyzed: bud med ces bya ba ni gang bud med gzhon nu ma mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bzod pa'o //
translated: “A woman” means a young woman who can tolerate sexual intercourse.

original: lhan cig ces bya ba ni dge slong dang bud med lhan cig tu 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba ni dge slong dang bud med lhan cig tu 'dug pa'o //
translated: “Together” means a monk and a woman sitting together.

original: khyim zhes bya ba ni mthar bskor ba dang steng g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim zhes bya ba ni mthar bskor ba dang steng g-yogs pa'o //
translated: “A house” means a house that is enclosed and covered.

original: ltung ba ni @121b sreg pa dang btso ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni @121b sreg pa dang btso ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as above.

original: dge slong steng khang na nyal na bud med 'og khang du nyal la /
analyzed: dge slong steng khang na nyal na bud med 'og khang du nyal la /
translated: If a monk is sleeping in an upper room and a woman is sleeping in a lower room,🔽the monk should remove the ladder, or close the door, or place a monk there as a guard.

original: dge slong des skas phyung shig yang na sgo gtan chug shig yang na bsrung ba'i dge slong zhog shig / de ltar ma byas na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du ni nyes byas shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong des skas phyung shig yang na sgo gtan chug shig yang na bsrung ba'i dge slong zhog shig / de ltar ma byas na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du ni nyes byas shar na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not do that, then until dawn breaks it is an offense of wrong conduct; when dawn breaks it is an offense entailing suspension.

original: dge slong gcig la gcig sdangs par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gcig la gcig sdangs par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against frightening one another is as follows:🔽At that time, the group of seventeen lived in dependence on the group of six.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa bcu bdun sde rnams drug sde rnams la gnas 'cha' zhing bsten pa'i tshe 'char kas gcig la las bcol na ma btub pa las 'char bas bskrad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa bcu bdun sde rnams drug sde rnams la gnas 'cha' zhing bsten pa'i tshe 'char kas gcig la las bcol na ma btub pa las 'char bas bskrad do //
translated: When Udayı ordered one of them to do something, he was unable to do it.

original: de dag kyang bdag cag thos pa 'dzin du dong ngo zhes klog pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag cag thos pa 'dzin du dong ngo zhes klog pa la zhugs so //
translated: They said, We will go to learn the scriptures. They began to study.

original: 'char bas de ltar thos pa 'dzin to zhes bsnye na dga' bo la gtam byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo na re de ni ma legs te bdag cag la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'char bas de ltar thos pa 'dzin to zhes bsnye na dga' bo la gtam byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo na re de ni ma legs te bdag cag la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When Udayı heard that they were learning the scriptures, he said to Nanda, They are learning the scriptures. Nanda said, That is not good. It will harm us.

original: 'char kas bsnyen dga' bo langs de dag sngar lobs pa ni brjed la phyi ma la ni mi lobs par bya nus so zhes nas la ba spun mo zhig ba zlog ste gyon nas bcu bdun sde me mar dag bus nas klog pa la zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: 'char kas bsnyen dga' bo langs de dag sngar lobs pa ni brjed la phyi ma la ni mi lobs par bya nus so zhes nas la ba spun mo zhig ba zlog ste gyon nas bcu bdun sde me mar dag bus nas klog pa la zhugs pa dang /
translated: Udayı said to Nanda, I can make them forget what they have learned before and unable to learn what they will learn later. He then put on a new pair of trousers, lit some lamps, and began to study.

original: 'char kas la ba gyon nas 'byung po 'byung po zhes bsdigs pas de dag skrag pas klog pa btang ste 'khod pa dang / de dag gis slob dpon 'ongs pa la byas nas de dag gis 'char ka yin par 'phrigs nas phyi de nub mo gra bzhir mar me bzhi bus te bkab ste bzhag nas 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: 'char kas la ba gyon nas 'byung po 'byung po zhes bsdigs pas de dag skrag pas klog pa btang ste 'khod pa dang / de dag gis slob dpon 'ongs pa la byas nas de dag gis 'char ka yin par 'phrigs nas phyi de nub mo gra bzhir mar me bzhi bus te bkab ste bzhag nas 'dug pa dang /
translated: Udayin came wearing his blanket and threatening the spirits. They were frightened and stopped reading. They sat down and said, “The master has come.” They were convinced it was Udayin. The next night they lit four lamps in the four corners, covered them, and sat down.

original: yang 'char ka 'ongs te snga ma bzhin du 'byung po 'byung po zhes byas pa dang / de dag gis sgo bcad de mar me phyung ste bzung nas brdegs so //
analyzed: yang 'char ka 'ongs te snga ma bzhin du 'byung po 'byung po zhes byas pa dang / de dag gis sgo bcad de mar me phyung ste bzung nas brdegs so //
translated: Again Udayin came and said, “Spirits, spirits!” They closed the door, extinguished the lamps, and caught him. They beat him.

original: de na re nga ni 'char ka po yin zhes smras na /
analyzed: de na re nga ni 'char ka po yin zhes smras na /
translated: He said, “I am Udayin.”

original: de dag na re 'char ka po ni de ltar rnam par grol ba'i bsam gtan la 'dug na 'dir ci 'dod ces brdegs nas shin tu snad do //
analyzed: de dag na re 'char ka po ni de ltar rnam par grol ba'i bsam gtan la 'dug na 'dir ci 'dod ces brdegs nas shin tu snad do //
translated: They said, “Udayin is sitting in concentration liberated from attachment. What do you want here?” They beat him until he was badly injured.

original: nang par lus mar gyis skud cing mnye ba las dge slong gzhan dag gis ci nyes zhes dris nangs de bzhin du bsdigs pa las khong gis brdegs de snad do zhes byas pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ste ci'i phyir dge slong gis dge slong la sdang par byed ces 'phya ba las bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: nang par lus mar gyis skud cing mnye ba las dge slong gzhan dag gis ci nyes zhes dris nangs de bzhin du bsdigs pa las khong gis brdegs de snad do zhes byas pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ste ci'i phyir dge slong gis dge slong la sdang par byed ces 'phya ba las bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The next morning, after the monk had been anointed with oil and massaged, the other monks asked him what was wrong. He said, “I was threatened in that way, and he beat me up.”🔽The monks who had few desires criticized him, “How can a monk threaten another monk?” They told the Blessed One, and the Blessed One decreed a training rule.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means the monk Udayī, and so on.

original: dge slong 'di zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'di zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “This monk” means one who has entered this Dharma.

original: sdangs par byed ces bya ba ni bdag @122a * //🔽gis byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdangs par byed ces bya ba ni bdag @122a * // gis byed pa'o //
translated: “Threaten” means to do it oneself.

original: byed du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
analyzed: byed du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
translated: “Cause to be done” means to have another do it.

original: tha na rtsed mor bsams zhes bya ba ni rtsed mo yang ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: tha na rtsed mor bsams zhes bya ba ni rtsed mo yang ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: “Even in jest” means that even in jest it is an offense.

original: dge slong gis sdangs par bya bar bsams nas yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs srin mo 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis sdangs par bya bar bsams nas yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs srin mo 'dra ba'am /
translated: If a monk intends to threaten, and he shows an unpleasant form such as a rākṣasī,

original: yi dags dang sha za dang grul bum dang / lus srul po lta bu'am /
analyzed: yi dags dang sha za dang grul bum dang / lus srul po lta bu'am /
translated: or like hungry ghosts, or flesh eaters, or swamp spirits, or skin eaters,🔽

original: stag gzig dang 'phar spyang lta bu'am /
analyzed: stag gzig dang 'phar spyang lta bu'am /
translated: Or if he frightens a fully ordained monk by means of a ghost, a hungry ghost, a flesh-eating ghost, a goblin, a demon, a tiger, a leopard, a wolf, a jackal, or a bear;

original: kha dog yid du mi 'ong zhing sgra mi snyan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: kha dog yid du mi 'ong zhing sgra mi snyan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: or if he frightens him by means of an unpleasant color or an unpleasant sound,

original: dge slong la sdangs par byed dam byed du 'jug na yang thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong la sdangs par byed dam byed du 'jug na yang thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then in all cases he commits an offense.

original: dge slong gis dge slong la sdangs par bya bar bsams nas yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rgyal po dang blon po dang khyim bdag dang tshong dpon dang / nor can dang lha dang klu dang / nam mkha' lding gi gzugs lta bur ston cing de dag khyod la gsod par byed do zhes smras pa las /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la sdangs par bya bar bsams nas yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rgyal po dang blon po dang khyim bdag dang tshong dpon dang / nor can dang lha dang klu dang / nam mkha' lding gi gzugs lta bur ston cing de dag khyod la gsod par byed do zhes smras pa las /
translated: If a fully ordained monk, intending to frighten a fully ordained monk, displays an unpleasant form such as a king, a minister, a householder, a merchant, a money-lender, a god, a nāga, or a garuḍa, and says, “They will kill you,”

original: dge slong 'jigs par gyur kyang rung /
analyzed: dge slong 'jigs par gyur kyang rung /
translated: then whether the fully ordained monk is frightened

original: ma gyur kyang rung ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma gyur kyang rung ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: or not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i gtam dang byol song dang yi dags dang lha dang mi'i gtam smras pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i gtam dang byol song dang yi dags dang lha dang mi'i gtam smras pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in speaking about the realms of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans.

original: dge slong gi yo byad dang gos sbed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi yo byad dang gos sbed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against hiding a monk’s possessions and robes was in Śrāvastī.

original: mood gal gyi bus au p'a li la sogs pa rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bus au p'a li la sogs pa rab tu byung ste /
translated: Maudgalyāyana gave the going forth to Upāli and others,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: and he gave them full ordination.🔽The group of six monks had taken up residence with them and were being served.

original: drug sde rnams la gnas 'cha' zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa de na khyim bdag cig gis bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa dge 'dun rnams bshos la spyan drangs te /
analyzed: drug sde rnams la gnas 'cha' zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa de na khyim bdag cig gis bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa dge 'dun rnams bshos la spyan drangs te /
translated: A householder invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to a meal.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa grong du chos ston la sngar gshegs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa grong du chos ston la sngar gshegs /
translated: The Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks went to the town to give a Dharma teaching.

original: drug sde dang bcu bdun sde ni phyi na mar dben bzhin du 'brangs pa las /
analyzed: drug sde dang bcu bdun sde ni phyi na mar dben bzhin du 'brangs pa las /
translated: The group of six monks and the group of seventeen monks followed behind, pretending to be in seclusion.

original: lam gyi bar du gang na rdzing bu zhig chus gang zhig 'dug pa'i gan du phyin pa dang / drug sdes bcu bdun sde la ku re bya bar bsams nas drug sdes smras pa kye bcu bdun sde khyed rnams ni nged cag la shin tu bsngo bar byed na /
analyzed: lam gyi bar du gang na rdzing bu zhig chus gang zhig 'dug pa'i gan du phyin pa dang / drug sdes bcu bdun sde la ku re bya bar bsams nas drug sdes smras pa kye bcu bdun sde khyed rnams ni nged cag la shin tu bsngo bar byed na /
translated: The group of six said, “Hey, group of seventeen, you are very devoted to us.🔽Let’s all get in the water and see who can hold their breath the longest.”🔽The group of seventeen said, “Let’s do that.”

original: chu 'di'i nang du 'u bu cag zhugs la sus chu'i nang du dbugs ring du thub pa lta'o zhes byas pa dang / bcu bdun sdes kyang de bzhin du bya'o zhes nas de dag thams cad chu'i gting du zhugs pa dang bsnyen dga' bo de ma thag tu slar byung nas bcu bdun sde'i gos thams cad bsdus nas shing drung gcig tu sbas te bzhag nas /
analyzed: chu 'di'i nang du 'u bu cag zhugs la sus chu'i nang du dbugs ring du thub pa lta'o zhes byas pa dang / bcu bdun sdes kyang de bzhin du bya'o zhes nas de dag thams cad chu'i gting du zhugs pa dang bsnyen dga' bo de ma thag tu slar byung nas bcu bdun sde'i gos thams cad bsdus nas shing drung gcig tu sbas te bzhag nas /
translated: They all got in the water. Upatiṣya immediately came up out of the water. He collected all the clothes of the group of seventeen and hid them under a tree.

original: @122b drug sde rnams ring shing myur bar rdzing nas byung nas bros so //
analyzed: @122b drug sde rnams ring shing myur bar rdzing nas byung nas bros so //
translated: The group of six came up out of the water quickly and ran off.

original: de nas bcu bdun sde rnams steng du byung ste bltas na gcig kyang mi snang bar bdag cag pham du dogs nas slar yang chu'i nang du zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcu bdun sde rnams steng du byung ste bltas na gcig kyang mi snang bar bdag cag pham du dogs nas slar yang chu'i nang du zhugs so //
translated: Then the group of seventeen came up and looked, but they did not see anyone. Fearing that they had been defeated, they again entered the water.

original: slad kyis bltas na drug sde dang gos bcas par mi snang nas tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag la drug sde dag gis ni kyal ka zhig byas so zhes nas gos med de chu'i nang du 'khod pa las de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal
analyzed: slad kyis bltas na drug sde dang gos bcas par mi snang nas tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag la drug sde dag gis ni kyal ka zhig byas so zhes nas gos med de chu'i nang du 'khod pa las de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal
translated: Later, they looked and did not see the group of six with the robes. They said, “Venerables, the group of six has played a trick on us.” They were naked and entered the water. At that time, the venerable Maudgalyāyana

original: gyi bu dang sh'a ri'i bu gnyis yul rgyu zhing song bas bcu bdun sde rnams gcer bur chu'i nang du 'khod pa mthong nas sh'a ri'i bus mood gal gyi bu la khyod kyi slob ma mdzes pa la ltos zhes byas so //
analyzed: gyi bu dang sh'a ri'i bu gnyis yul rgyu zhing song bas bcu bdun sde rnams gcer bur chu'i nang du 'khod pa mthong nas sh'a ri'i bus mood gal gyi bu la khyod kyi slob ma mdzes pa la ltos zhes byas so //
translated: and Śāriputra were traveling in the country. They saw the group of seventeen naked and in the water. Śāriputra said to Maudgalyāyana, “Look at your beautiful disciples.”

original: de nas mood gal gyi bus ting nge 'dzin du zhugs te brtags na /
analyzed: de nas mood gal gyi bus ting nge 'dzin du zhugs te brtags na /
translated: Then Maudgalyāyana entered into meditative absorption and investigated.

original: drug sdes gos rnams shing tshang tshing zhig gi nang na sbas pa rnyed do //
analyzed: drug sdes gos rnams shing tshang tshing zhig gi nang na sbas pa rnyed do //
translated: He found that the group of six had hidden the robes in a thicket of trees.

original: slob ma dag la byin nas zan la dong ba dang dge slong dag zan zos te /
analyzed: slob ma dag la byin nas zan la dong ba dang dge slong dag zan zos te /
translated: The monks gave it to their students and went to eat.

original: grong nas slar log pa dang lam du phrad nas /
analyzed: grong nas slar log pa dang lam du phrad nas /
translated: The monks had eaten and were returning from the village when they met the group of six on the road.

original: khyed cag gar ji ltar thogs thogs zhes smras nas /
analyzed: khyed cag gar ji ltar thogs thogs zhes smras nas /
translated: “Where have you been? What have you been doing?”🔽The group of six told them what they had done.

original: drug sdes ji ltar byas pa'i gtam byas pa dang / dge slong dag dge slong gis gos sbed ces mi snyan par 'dzer ba snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: drug sdes ji ltar byas pa'i gtam byas pa dang / dge slong dag dge slong gis gos sbed ces mi snyan par 'dzer ba snyan du bdas te /
translated: The monks spread the word that the monks were hiding their robes.

original: bkas smad nas gos sbed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: bkas smad nas gos sbed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One reprimanded them and established a rule in the monastic code that prohibits hiding robes.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means Nanda and others like him.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “A monk” means someone who has entered this Dharma.

original: dge slong ma dang dge tshul la sogs pa ming gis smos pa rnams kyi yo byad sbas na nyes par 'gyur gyi gzhan mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang dge tshul la sogs pa ming gis smos pa rnams kyi yo byad sbas na nyes par 'gyur gyi gzhan mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that if one hides the belongings of nuns, novices, and so on, who are mentioned by name, one commits an offense, but not if it is anyone else.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa yo byad smos pa rnams dge slong 'chang du dbang ba'i yo byad sbas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa yo byad smos pa rnams dge slong 'chang du dbang ba'i yo byad sbas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one hides the requisites that are allowed to be used by a fully ordained monk, such as the begging bowl and the three robes, one commits an offense.

original: 'chad du mi dbang ba sbas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'chad du mi dbang ba sbas na nyes byas so //
translated: If one hides what is not allowed to be used, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbed dam zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
analyzed: sbed dam zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
translated: “Hides” means “I hide.”

original: sbed du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
analyzed: sbed du bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la'o //
translated: “Causes to hide” means “causes another to hide.”

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na dge slong gcig la dge slong gcig gis chos gos dag cig bcol ba las /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na dge slong gcig la dge slong gcig gis chos gos dag cig bcol ba las /
translated: “Except in extenuating circumstances” means that in Śrāvastī a fully ordained monk entrusted some Dharma robes to another fully ordained monk.

original: dge slong de yang rkyen cig byung nas yul gzhan du bos te 'gro ba'i tshe gos sbas nas song ba las slad kyis ltung bar gyur tam ma gyur snyam du the tshom za ba las snyan du bdas nas /🔽gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i sems med de rkyen byung ba'i tshe sbed pa ni rjes @123a * //
analyzed: dge slong de yang rkyen cig byung nas yul gzhan du bos te 'gro ba'i tshe gos sbas nas song ba las slad kyis ltung bar gyur tam ma gyur snyam du the tshom za ba las snyan du bdas nas / gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i sems med de rkyen byung ba'i tshe sbed pa ni rjes @123a * //
translated: When that monk was summoned to another country due to an extenuating circumstance, he hid the robes and left. Later he wondered whether he had committed an offense or not.

original: su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: su gnang ba'o //
translated: When he asked the Blessed One, the Blessed One said, “If there is no intention to harm another, and one hides the robes due to extenuating circumstances, it is permitted.”

original: mi rgod pa dang rkun pos phrogs su dogs pa lta bu dang / gos stor zhing chus khyer du ngogs pa las sbas pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi rgod pa dang rkun pos phrogs su dogs pa lta bu dang / gos stor zhing chus khyer du ngogs pa las sbas pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if you hide your robes for fear of thieves or wild animals stealing them, or if you hide them for fear of losing them or having them carried away by water.

original: dge slong gis gos gdeng med par gyon du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis gos gdeng med par gyon du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The Story of the Monk Who Was Not Allowed to Wear His Robe Without Tying It is set in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni dgra bcom pa thob /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni dgra bcom pa thob /
translated: At that time, Venerable Udayī had attained arhatship.

original: mos pa can ni koo sh'amb'i na 'dug / tha skar skyes dang nab so ni shi /
analyzed: mos pa can ni koo sh'amb'i na 'dug / tha skar skyes dang nab so ni shi /
translated: Bhadrika was in Kauśāmbī, while Punarvasu and Revata had died.

original: dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis ni mnyan du yod pa na dge 'dun gyi nang na gnas te /
analyzed: dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis ni mnyan du yod pa na dge 'dun gyi nang na gnas te /
translated: Nanda and Upananda were staying in the saṅgha in Śrāvastī.

original: de yang rgas 'khogs pas nye gnas rnams kyang tshig nyan du ma btub nas /
analyzed: de yang rgas 'khogs pas nye gnas rnams kyang tshig nyan du ma btub nas /
translated: Because they were old and decrepit, their attendants would not listen to them.

original: gos kha dog bsgyur zhing 'tshed par yang mi nus pas thabs shig bya'o snyam nas gnas 'cha' ba rnams gos byin pa ltar byas te /
analyzed: gos kha dog bsgyur zhing 'tshed par yang mi nus pas thabs shig bya'o snyam nas gnas 'cha' ba rnams gos byin pa ltar byas te /
translated: They were unable to dye their robes or wash them, so they thought, “We must do something.” They acted as if they were giving robes to the residents of the monastery.

original: gos kha dog bsgyur zhing 'tshed du bcug pa dang / de dag gis kyang bden par byin snyam nas /
analyzed: gos kha dog bsgyur zhing 'tshed du bcug pa dang / de dag gis kyang bden par byin snyam nas /
translated: Thinking that they had been given the truth,

original: gos rnying pa thams cad bkrus /
analyzed: gos rnying pa thams cad bkrus /
translated: they washed all their old robes,🔽dyed them, sewed them, and put them on.

original: kha dog bsgyur drubs nas 'chang zhing 'khod pa las dus phyi zhig na /
analyzed: kha dog bsgyur drubs nas 'chang zhing 'khod pa las dus phyi zhig na /
translated: Later,

original: bcom ldan 'das yul gzhan du ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa'i tshe de dag kyang zha 'bring du 'gro bar chad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul gzhan du ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa'i tshe de dag kyang zha 'bring du 'gro bar chad de /
translated: when the Blessed One was traveling through other lands, they were unable to go with him.🔽They entrusted their robes to Upasena and left.

original: gos rnams phyir bsnyen dga' bo nyid la gtams nas dong ngo / de dag song ba'i 'og tu bsnyen dga' bos gos de dag kun gyon te /
analyzed: gos rnams phyir bsnyen dga' bo nyid la gtams nas dong ngo / de dag song ba'i 'og tu bsnyen dga' bos gos de dag kun gyon te /
translated: After they had gone, Upasena put on all their robes

original: rnyings par byas so //
analyzed: rnyings par byas so //
translated: and wore them out.

original: de nas de dag phyir 'ongs nas gos bltas na dri ma can du gyur te gos sngon dang mi 'dra'o zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo bsnyon to //
analyzed: de nas de dag phyir 'ongs nas gos bltas na dri ma can du gyur te gos sngon dang mi 'dra'o zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo bsnyon to //
translated: Later, when they returned and saw the robes, they said, “The robes are dirty. They are not like the old ones.”🔽Upasena denied it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das yang yul gzhan du ljongs rgyur gshegs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das yang yul gzhan du ljongs rgyur gshegs pa'i tshe /
translated: Later, when the Blessed One was traveling through other lands,

original: de dag gis gos ngan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag gos ngan na ci'i phyir zhes smras pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos sngar gos byin te de'i gdeng med par de ltar gyon no zhes zhib tu gsol ba dang / dge slong gi chos ma yin zhes smad de gdeng med par gos gyon du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de dag gis gos ngan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag gos ngan na ci'i phyir zhes smras pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos sngar gos byin te de'i gdeng med par de ltar gyon no zhes zhib tu gsol ba dang / dge slong gi chos ma yin zhes smad de gdeng med par gos gyon du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One rebuked them, and then he decreed a training rule:

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //🔽dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o // dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “‘Monks’ means those who have gone forth, as in the case of Nanda and others.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni chos gos gsum po gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni chos gos gsum po gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: ‘Robes’ means any of the three Dharma robes.

original: byin zhes bya ba ni sngar byin pa'o //🔽gdeng med ces bya ba ni sngar byin pa'am /
analyzed: byin zhes bya ba ni sngar byin pa'o // gdeng med ces bya ba ni sngar byin pa'am /
translated: ‘Given’ means given before.🔽‘Without permission’ means without permission to wear what was given before.

original: brnyar byin te bgo ba la sogs pa spyad par ma byin pa'o //
analyzed: brnyar byin te bgo ba la sogs pa spyad par ma byin pa'o //
translated: ‘Wearing’ means wearing what was given with contempt.

original: gos gyon pas dga' bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'am /
analyzed: gos gyon pas dga' bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'am /
translated: ‘Thinking, “I will be happy wearing this robe,” or

original: mdza' bo rnam pa gsum lta bu'i gos spyad pa ni nyes pa med @123b do //
analyzed: mdza' bo rnam pa gsum lta bu'i gos spyad pa ni nyes pa med @123b do //
translated: There is no offense if one uses a robe like the three types of friends.

original: dge slong la rtsa ba med par dge 'dun lhag mas skur du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste /
analyzed: dge slong la rtsa ba med par dge 'dun lhag mas skur du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste /
translated: The origin of the prohibition against a fully ordained monk accusing a fully ordained nun of a root downfall without a basis is as follows.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: At one time in Rājagṛha, the nun Utpalavarnā bowed down to the Buddha.

original: gyad bu nor bya rgod spungs pa'i ri la 'dug pa'i gan du phyag 'tshal du song ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gyad bu nor bya rgod spungs pa'i ri la 'dug pa'i gan du phyag 'tshal du song ba'i tshe /
translated: Then she went to pay homage to Upāli, who was staying at Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: gyad bu nor gyi chos gos drung gis bdas pa /
analyzed: gyad bu nor gyi chos gos drung gis bdas pa /
translated: Upāli was fanning himself with his Dharma robe.

original: autpa la'i mdog gi mgo la reg pa mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis de'i nye 'khor na phyag dar khrod 'khru zhing 'dug pas mthong nas /
analyzed: autpa la'i mdog gi mgo la reg pa mdza' bo dang sa can gnyis de'i nye 'khor na phyag dar khrod 'khru zhing 'dug pas mthong nas /
translated: The two friends, Utpalavarnā and Bhūmija, who were nearby washing rags, saw him touch the top of Utpalavarnā’s head with his robe.

original: sa can na re cod pan la reg na lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: sa can na re cod pan la reg na lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: Bhūmija said, “If you touch the top of her head, it is a downfall.”

original: da ni gleng ba'i dus la bab po zhes byas pa dang / mdza' bo na re sngar kyang bdag cag gis skur pa btab pa las do spangs na /
analyzed: da ni gleng ba'i dus la bab po zhes byas pa dang / mdza' bo na re sngar kyang bdag cag gis skur pa btab pa las do spangs na /
translated: His friend said, “Previously, we were slandered, but now we are not.🔽Do you want to be slandered again?”

original: da yang ci spangs par 'dod dam zhes pa dang / sa can na re sngon ni mi bden pas so //
analyzed: da yang ci spangs par 'dod dam zhes pa dang / sa can na re sngon ni mi bden pas so //
translated: The monk said, “Previously, it was not true.🔽Now, it is true.”

original: da ni bden yang rung zhes glengs pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan dag gis dam du smos shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: da ni bden yang rung zhes glengs pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan dag gis dam du smos shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The elder monks said, “Speak carefully!”🔽The elder monks spoke carefully, and they admitted, “It is true that we were slandered.”

original: dge slong gnas brtan dag gis zhib tu smras pa dang / bdag cag gis skur pa btab pa bden no zhes khas blangs pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan dag gis zhib tu smras pa dang / bdag cag gis skur pa btab pa bden no zhes khas blangs pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The monks who had few desires criticized them, saying, “How can they slander and then admit it?”🔽They told the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One decreed that training rule:

original: rtsa ba med pa'i lhag mas skur du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa'i lhag mas skur du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: “Monks, you should not slander without a basis.”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can te /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang sa can te /
translated: “A monk” means a friend and a monk who lives in the same monastery.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It also refers to others like them.

original: zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang ma spangs pa'o //
translated: “One who is angry” means one who has not abandoned anger.

original: khros zhes bya ba ni yi ma rangs pa'o //
analyzed: khros zhes bya ba ni yi ma rangs pa'o //
translated: “One who is enraged” means one who is displeased.

original: dge slong gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gyad bu nor te zhes gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gyad bu nor te zhes gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A pure monk” means Yaśas, son of a wealthy family, and others like him.

original: rtsa ba med ces bya ba ni rtsa ba gsum ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba med ces bya ba ni rtsa ba gsum ste /
translated: “Without a basis” means without the three kinds of bases:

original: mthong ba'i rtsa ba dang / dogs pa'i rtsa ba dang / thos pa'i rtsa ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rtsa ba dang / dogs pa'i rtsa ba dang / thos pa'i rtsa ba med pa'o //
translated: the basis of seeing, the basis of suspicion, and the basis of hearing.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A serious offense” means

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu gsum po'i nang nas gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu gsum po'i nang nas gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: any of the thirteen serious offenses.

original: skur ces bya ba ni klang btab pa'o //
analyzed: skur ces bya ba ni klang btab pa'o //
translated: “To accuse” means to charge.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
translated: “A downfall” means the three lower realms.

original: nyes pa ni phas pham par gyur pa lhag mar gyur pa las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du 'dir yang sbyor cig /
analyzed: nyes pa ni phas pham par gyur pa lhag mar gyur pa las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du 'dir yang sbyor cig /
translated: “A fault” means a serious offense, as it is explained in the case of a defeating offense.

original: skyes pa med par bud med dang lhan cig 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: skyes pa med par bud med dang lhan cig 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the rule not to travel with a woman without a male escort took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na thag pa zhig gnas pa de mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa'i bu mo chung mar blangs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na thag pa zhig gnas pa de mnyan du yod pa na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa'i bu mo chung mar blangs so //
translated: At that time, a weaver lived in Rājagṛha. He married the daughter of a householder in Śrāvastī.

original: de yang khro zhing gtum pa zhig pas /
analyzed: de yang khro zhing gtum pa zhig pas /
translated: She was also very angry and violent.

original: rtag tu brdegs pas bros te 'gro'o snyam @124a * //
analyzed: rtag tu brdegs pas bros te 'gro'o snyam @124a * //
translated: She always beat him, so he thought, “I will run away.”

original: nas / khyim mtshes rgan mo zhig la byas pa dang / rgan mo na re bu mo ma bros shig dang / ngas thag pa la ma brdegs shig par bsgo'o zhes nas de'i tshe ma bros so //
analyzed: nas / khyim mtshes rgan mo zhig la byas pa dang / rgan mo na re bu mo ma bros shig dang / ngas thag pa la ma brdegs shig par bsgo'o zhes nas de'i tshe ma bros so //
translated: He told an old neighbor woman, and the old woman said, “Daughter, don’t run away. I will ask him not to beat you.” Because of that, she did not run away.

original: slad kyis tha ga pa yang ra ro ste /
analyzed: slad kyis tha ga pa yang ra ro ste /
translated: Later, the weaver also became drunk.

original: chang srin can zhig pas brdegs pa dang / bu mo de yang mnyan du yod par bros te song ngo //
analyzed: chang srin can zhig pas brdegs pa dang / bu mo de yang mnyan du yod par bros te song ngo //
translated: When he beat her, the daughter ran away to Śrāvastī.

original: tha ga pas kyang phyi bzhin du bsnyags pa dang / dge slong zhig mnyan du yod par 'gro ba dang 'grogs te song ba mthong nas /
analyzed: tha ga pas kyang phyi bzhin du bsnyags pa dang / dge slong zhig mnyan du yod par 'gro ba dang 'grogs te song ba mthong nas /
translated: The weaver also chased after her. He saw a monk going to Śrāvastī and accompanied him.

original: 'phral du gzung du ni bdag gcig pu /
analyzed: 'phral du gzung du ni bdag gcig pu /
translated: He said, “I will catch her right away.

original: khong ni gnyis pas bdag gis mi gzung ngo snyam nas de thag pa'i grong nas thag pa rnams la nga'i chung ma sh'akya'i dge sbyong gis 'phrogs kyis grogs gyis shig ces byas pa dang / tha ga pa rnams ni yong gis kyang blo rtsing bas /
analyzed: khong ni gnyis pas bdag gis mi gzung ngo snyam nas de thag pa'i grong nas thag pa rnams la nga'i chung ma sh'akya'i dge sbyong gis 'phrogs kyis grogs gyis shig ces byas pa dang / tha ga pa rnams ni yong gis kyang blo rtsing bas /
translated: The weavers were simple-minded and violent.

original: dge slong de bzung nas shin tu brdegs nas lhung bzed dang / khar gsil ni bcag chos gos ni dral te de'u shi ba las /
analyzed: dge slong de bzung nas shin tu brdegs nas lhung bzed dang / khar gsil ni bcag chos gos ni dral te de'u shi ba las /
translated: They caught the monk, beat him severely, broke his alms bowl and water filter, tore his Dharma robes, and left him for dead.

original: tha ga pa dag gis bzod pa gsol te dge slong mnyan du yod par phyin pa dang / dge slong gzhi pa rnams kyis bde bar 'ongs sam zhes byas pa dang / lan du de lta'i phyir brdegs te de'u shi'o zhes byas pa dang / ci'i phyir bud med dang gzhan du 'grogs shing 'gro zhes dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: tha ga pa dag gis bzod pa gsol te dge slong mnyan du yod par phyin pa dang / dge slong gzhi pa rnams kyis bde bar 'ongs sam zhes byas pa dang / lan du de lta'i phyir brdegs te de'u shi'o zhes byas pa dang / ci'i phyir bud med dang gzhan du 'grogs shing 'gro zhes dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The weavers begged his forgiveness and the monk went to Śrāvastī. The resident monks asked, Did you arrive safely? He replied, I was beaten like this and almost died. They scolded him, Why did you go with a woman and stay elsewhere? and the monks rebuked him. Then the Buddha established a training rule.

original: skyes pa med ces bya ba ni skyes pa gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa med ces bya ba ni skyes pa gzhan med pa'o //
translated: “No man” means no other man.

original: bud med ces bya ba ni rgya rna ru bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba ni rgya rna ru bzod pa'o //
translated: “A woman” means a human female.

original: lam du zhugs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lam du zhugs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: “On the road” means on a path.

original: tha na grong bar phyin par zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de song ba'o //🔽nyes pa ni rgyang grags re re zhing ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na grong bar phyin par zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de song ba'o // nyes pa ni rgyang grags re re zhing ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “At least to the next village” means from one town to the next.🔽The offense is a downfall for every half-league.

original: rgyang grags phyed phyed cing nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyang grags phyed phyed cing nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is a minor offense for every half-league.

original: bud med kyi bsel byas pa dang lam mtshon byas pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bud med kyi bsel byas pa dang lam mtshon byas pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the woman is a relative and the monk is merely pointing out the way.

original: ltung ba bdun cu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ltung ba bdun cu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventy-second downfall.

original: // / dge slong mgron pa zhig rkun ma dang lhan cig 'grogs shing 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: // / dge slong mgron pa zhig rkun ma dang lhan cig 'grogs shing 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The monks were not allowed to travel with thieves.🔽A monk had entered the rains retreat in Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe dge slong zhig rgyal po'i khab na dbyar zla ba gsum tshul du zhugs nas dbyar zla ba gsum 'das nas tshul nas byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong zhig rgyal po'i khab na dbyar zla ba gsum tshul du zhugs nas dbyar zla ba gsum 'das nas tshul nas byung ste /
translated: After the three months had passed, he left.

original: mnyan du yod par 'gro ba'i grogs med de grogs chol ba las /🔽tshong pa shog ma las 'byol ba dag cig mnyan du yod par 'gro ba dang phrad nas de dag dang 'grogs te gseb lam du zhugs te dong ba dang / dge slong dag tshong ba de @124b dag pas zung zad sngar song ba dang / shog gam dag gis tshor nas sngar mdun du bsgugs te /
analyzed: mnyan du yod par 'gro ba'i grogs med de grogs chol ba las / tshong pa shog ma las 'byol ba dag cig mnyan du yod par 'gro ba dang phrad nas de dag dang 'grogs te gseb lam du zhugs te dong ba dang / dge slong dag tshong ba de @124b dag pas zung zad sngar song ba dang / shog gam dag gis tshor nas sngar mdun du bsgugs te /
translated: He had no companions on the way to Śrāvastī, so he went with some merchants who were traveling there.

original: dge slong de mdun nas dpags te 'gro ba de dag gis mthong nas /
analyzed: dge slong de mdun nas dpags te 'gro ba de dag gis mthong nas /
translated: The merchants went ahead of the monk, and the thieves, who were following behind, saw him.

original: sngan chad kyang dge slong des lam drangs so zhes nas shin tu brdegs nas chos gos kyang dral lhung bzed kyang bcag go //
analyzed: sngan chad kyang dge slong des lam drangs so zhes nas shin tu brdegs nas chos gos kyang dral lhung bzed kyang bcag go //
translated: They thought, “This monk has led us to the merchants.” They beat him severely, tore his robes, and broke his alms bowl.

original: de nas dge slong de mnyan du yod par bde bar 'ongs sam zhes dge slong de dag gis smras na /
analyzed: de nas dge slong de mnyan du yod par bde bar 'ongs sam zhes dge slong de dag gis smras na /
translated: When the monk arrived in Śrāvastī, the monks asked him, “Did you get here safely?”

original: de ltar gyur pa zhib tu byas pa dang / dge slong dag ci'i phyir 'gron pa rkun ma dang 'grogs zhes dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa zhib tu byas pa dang / dge slong dag ci'i phyir 'gron pa rkun ma dang 'grogs zhes dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks, having heard the details of what had happened, ridiculed the monks, saying, “Why did you travel with thieves?”

original: bkas smad de 'gron pa rkun ma dang 'gro mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: bkas smad de 'gron pa rkun ma dang 'gro mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One rebuked them and laid down a training rule that prohibits traveling with thieves.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa ste /
translated: “Monks” means those who have entered this Dharma.

original: rgyal po'i khab nas mnyan du yod par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab nas mnyan du yod par 'gro ba'o //
translated: “From Rājagṛha to Śrāvastī” means from Rājagṛha to Śrāvastī.

original: rkun po zhes bya ba ni sho gam lam byol ba'o //
analyzed: rkun po zhes bya ba ni sho gam lam byol ba'o //
translated: “Thieves” means those who evade customs duties.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni dgon pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni dgon pa'i lam mo //
translated: “Road” means a road through the wilderness.

original: nyes pa ni rgyang grags re re zhing ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni rgyang grags re re zhing ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Fault” means a downfall for each krośa.

original: phyed phyed cing nyes byas so //
analyzed: phyed phyed cing nyes byas so //
translated: “Halfway” means a minor offense.

original: lo nyi shu ma lon pa'i gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: lo nyi shu ma lon pa'i gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for not allowing a person who is less than twenty years old to be fully ordained took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe mood gal gyi bus bcu bdun sde lo nyi shu ma lon par rab tu phyung shing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa dang / de dag nub mo zan ma byin pa dang grang ba dang / bkres pa dang rlung dang / bru bas gzir bas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe mood gal gyi bus bcu bdun sde lo nyi shu ma lon par rab tu phyung shing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa dang / de dag nub mo zan ma byin pa dang grang ba dang / bkres pa dang rlung dang / bru bas gzir bas na /
translated: They cried and wailed at night because they had not been given food, and they were cold, hungry, and tormented by wind and hunger.

original: kun dga' ra ba'i nang na ngu zhing ca co 'don pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i nang na ngu zhing ca co 'don pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The sound of their crying and wailing reached the ears of the Buddha.🔽He asked, “Who are they?”

original: de dag su yin zhes smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bus bcu bdun sde lo nyi shu ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pas byis pa gzhon nu glang ba dang / bkres pa mi bzod pas ngu'o zhes gsol ba dang /
analyzed: de dag su yin zhes smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bus bcu bdun sde lo nyi shu ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pas byis pa gzhon nu glang ba dang / bkres pa mi bzod pas ngu'o zhes gsol ba dang /
translated: The venerable Maudgalyāyana replied, “The group of seventeen cried because I gave them full ordination before they were twenty years old, and they cried because they were young, and they could not bear hunger.”🔽The Buddha criticized him, saying, “Is it suitable for a monk to give full ordination to a person who is not twenty years old?”

original: ci dge slong gis gang zag lo nyi shu ma lon par dge slong gi dngos po byed dam zhes smad nas slan chad mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: ci dge slong gis gang zag lo nyi shu ma lon par dge slong gi dngos po byed dam zhes smad nas slan chad mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Buddha laid down a training rule in the Monastic Code that this should not be done again.

original: dge slong zhes bye ba ni mood gal gyi bu ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bye ba ni mood gal gyi bu ste /
translated: “A monk” means Maudgalyāyana.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: And it is the same for the other [cases].

original: lo nyi shu ma len zhes bya ba ni lo nyi shu ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: lo nyi shu ma len zhes bya ba ni lo nyi shu ma tshang ba'o //
translated: “Twenty years old” means not less than twenty years old.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis so //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis so //
translated: “Full ordination” means by means of the four requests and the seven-limbed ceremony.

original: gang zag de yang bsnyen par rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag de yang bsnyen par rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: “That person is not fully ordained” means that person is not a fully ordained monk.

original: dge slong 'di dag smad pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong 'di na 'khod pa na bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa rnams so dge slong gi lo nyi shu ma @125a * //
analyzed: dge slong 'di dag smad pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong 'di na 'khod pa na bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa rnams so dge slong gi lo nyi shu ma @125a * //
translated: “These monks are to be despised” means these monks who are present here are to be despised for giving full ordination.

original: lon pa'i gang zag lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes pa dang / the tshom za na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lon pa'i gang zag lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes pa dang / the tshom za na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If a person who is not twenty years old thinks he is twenty years old, or if he is doubtful, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

original: lo nyi shu lon nam ma lon zhes dris shig / dris te ma lon zhes zer ba bsnyen par rdzogs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo nyi shu lon nam ma lon zhes dris shig / dris te ma lon zhes zer ba bsnyen par rdzogs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Ask whether he is twenty years old or not. If you give full ordination to someone who says he is not twenty years old, you commit an offense.

original: dge 'dun la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you give full ordination to someone who is not twenty years old, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: da nas bsnyen par rdzogs zin pa'i 'og tu lo nyi shu ma tshang bar dran na ma'i mngal tshun chad rtsis shig / de ste yang ma tshang na phob shig de nas slad kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par gyis shig / de ltar ma byas na gang zag de
analyzed: da nas bsnyen par rdzogs zin pa'i 'og tu lo nyi shu ma tshang bar dran na ma'i mngal tshun chad rtsis shig / de ste yang ma tshang na phob shig de nas slad kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par gyis shig / de ltar ma byas na gang zag de
translated: If you do not do this, that person

original: rkun gnas su gyur pa yin gyis dge 'dun gyis nang na gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rkun gnas su gyur pa yin gyis dge 'dun gyis nang na gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: will be a monastic criminal. Do not let him stay in the community.

original: lo nyi shu chang la nyi shu tshang bar 'du shes pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lo nyi shu chang la nyi shu tshang bar 'du shes pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If he thinks that he has completed twenty years when he has not, there is no offense.

original: dge slong sa rgor mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong sa rgor mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin of the prohibition against digging the earth:🔽At that time the group of six monks dug the earth themselves and had others dig it, and they made ditches and had others make them.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po rnams rang gis sa rko zhing rkor 'jug / yur ba byed byed du 'jug pas mu stegs can rnams kyis khyim pa dang bye brag ci yod ces 'phya' ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong drug sde po rnams rang gis sa rko zhing rkor 'jug / yur ba byed byed du 'jug pas mu stegs can rnams kyis khyim pa dang bye brag ci yod ces 'phya' ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The tīrthikas said, “What is the difference between us and householders?” They spread the word around.

original: bkas smad de sa rkor mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: bkas smad de sa rkor mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One condemned this, and established a training rule to prohibit digging the earth.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: “A monk” means the group of six, and so on as before.

original: sa rko zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
analyzed: sa rko zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
translated: “Digs the earth” means to dig it oneself.

original: rkor 'jug ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol ba'o //
analyzed: rkor 'jug ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol ba'o //
translated: “Has it dug” means to ask someone else to do it.

original: sa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Earth” is of two kinds:

original: 'thas pa dang ma 'thas pa'o dge slong gis sa 'thas pa brkos na ltung bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: 'thas pa dang ma 'thas pa'o dge slong gis sa 'thas pa brkos na ltung bar 'gyur ro//
translated: hard and soft. If a monk digs the hard kind, he commits an offense.

original: sa la bris sam sa la brkos sam /
analyzed: sa la bris sam sa la brkos sam /
translated: If he draws on the earth, digs the earth,

original: sa las blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa las blangs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or takes earth from it, he commits an offense.

original: sa la phur ba btab pa dang / yur ba drangs pa dang / sa bkogs pa dang / rtsig pa la phur ba btab na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la phur ba btab pa dang / yur ba drangs pa dang / sa bkogs pa dang / rtsig pa la phur ba btab na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he plants a peg in the earth, digs a trench, or digs up the earth, or if he plants a peg in a wall, he commits an offense.🔽If he draws a picture on a wall,

original: rtsig pa la ri mo bris sam /
analyzed: rtsig pa la ri mo bris sam /
translated: Or is it painted on a wall?🔽🔽

original: rtsig ngogs tsan zos pa'i sa bud pa dang / 'dam rdzab gyi nang ril ba bzhag pa phyung ba dang / sa gram pa can brkos na thams cad du nyes byas re re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsig ngogs tsan zos pa'i sa bud pa dang / 'dam rdzab gyi nang ril ba bzhag pa phyung ba dang / sa gram pa can brkos na thams cad du nyes byas re re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats the earth that is on the wall, or if one takes out the potsherd that is in the mud, or if one digs up the earth that has cracks, in all cases there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bye ma mang po la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: bye ma mang po la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If there is a lot of sand, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skar ma'i cho ga la bab pa las sar byed pa'i dge slong des rung bar byed pa'i mi med na sa sor bzhi yan chad phur bas btab pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: skar ma'i cho ga la bab pa las sar byed pa'i dge slong des rung bar byed pa'i mi med na sa sor bzhi yan chad phur bas btab pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If the monk who is making the ground is not able to get a man to make it suitable, then there is no offense if he stakes the ground more than four fingerbreadths deep with a peg.

original: dge slong zla ba bzhir mgron du byas pa las ring du gnas su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni grong khyer ser skya'i gnas na ste /
analyzed: dge slong zla ba bzhir mgron du byas pa las ring du gnas su mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni grong khyer ser skya'i gnas na ste /
translated: The origin of the rule that a monk who is invited for four months may not stay longer is in Kapilavastu.

original: de'i tshe na sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams zla ba bzhir bshos dang gzims cha la sogs pa sbyar nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams zla ba bzhir bshos dang gzims cha la sogs pa sbyar nas /
translated: At that time, Mahānāman the Śākya invited the Blessed One and the assembly of disciples for four months to food, bedding, and so forth.

original: mgron du gnyer cing zhal zas kyis bstabs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mgron du gnyer cing zhal zas kyis bstabs pa'i tshe /
translated: When he invited them and served them food,

original: drug sde po @125b rnams zla ba bzhi las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir thabs su sbyar nas /
analyzed: drug sde po @125b rnams zla ba bzhi las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir thabs su sbyar nas /
translated: The group of six monks devised a way to stay for more than four months.

original: res kyis na zhing res kyis nad g-yog byed de /
analyzed: res kyis na zhing res kyis nad g-yog byed de /
translated: Sometimes they pretended to be sick and sometimes they nursed the sick.

original: zla ba bzhi tshang nas mjug gcod kyis gyes ston byas nas /
analyzed: zla ba bzhi tshang nas mjug gcod kyis gyes ston byas nas /
translated: When the four months were complete, they celebrated the end of the retreat.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong rnams dong ba'i 'og tu drug sde rnams nad g-yog rnams ma thob ste skal ba 'dod do zhes byas pa dang / khyim bdag rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong rnams dong ba'i 'og tu drug sde rnams nad g-yog rnams ma thob ste skal ba 'dod do zhes byas pa dang / khyim bdag rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: After the Blessed One and the monks had left, the group of six monks said to the attendants, “We did not get our share of the offerings.”

original: de dag kun gyis te tshogs kyang bshig nas /
analyzed: de dag kun gyis te tshogs kyang bshig nas /
translated: The householders said, “They all took it. The group of six monks has also been dispersed.🔽We have no reason to stay for four months.”

original: zla ba bzhi ste rgyu med do zhes byas pa dang / drug sde po dag khros nas ci sh'akya ming chen gyis ming tsam mgron du byas pas chog gam /
analyzed: zla ba bzhi ste rgyu med do zhes byas pa dang / drug sde po dag khros nas ci sh'akya ming chen gyis ming tsam mgron du byas pas chog gam /
translated: The group of six monks became angry and said, “Is it enough that the great Śākya has been invited just for his name?

original: de tsam gyis chog na ni nged kyis kyang nyi ma re re sbyor nus so zhes nas med du mi rung bar bslangs pas khyim bdag dag 'phya zhing mi dga' bar gyur ba las zla ba bzhi las slong zhing 'dug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab
analyzed: de tsam gyis chog na ni nged kyis kyang nyi ma re re sbyor nus so zhes nas med du mi rung bar bslangs pas khyim bdag dag 'phya zhing mi dga' bar gyur ba las zla ba bzhi las slong zhing 'dug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab
translated: The householder was ridiculed and became unhappy. He was not allowed to stay for more than four months. He was trained in the precepts.

original: pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The rule was established.

original: zla ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi las ring du mi 'da' ba'o //🔽dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
analyzed: zla ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi las ring du mi 'da' ba'o // dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /
translated: Four months means not staying longer than four months.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The term bhikṣu refers to the group of six, and also to others like them.

original: mgron du zhes bya ba ni mgron du gnyer zhing bos pa'o //
analyzed: mgron du zhes bya ba ni mgron du gnyer zhing bos pa'o //
translated: The term invited means invited and called.

original: bdag gir gyis shig ces bya ba ni zla ba bzhi'i bar du khas blangs pas bdag gir bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gir gyis shig ces bya ba ni zla ba bzhi'i bar du khas blangs pas bdag gir bya'o //
translated: The term accept means to accept for the period of four months.

original: de las 'das na zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'das na zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi las lhag pa'o //
translated: The term exceeding means more than four months.

original: so sor mgron du byas pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni so sor mgron du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor mgron du byas pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni so sor mgron du byas pa yin te /
translated: The term except for individual invitations means individual invitations.

original: zla ba bzhi las yol yang dge slong kha cig so sor tha dad par bos pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba bzhi las yol yang dge slong kha cig so sor tha dad par bos pa'o //
translated: The four months are the four months of the rainy season. Some monks means some monks who are not related.

original: yang dang yang mgron du byas pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni de ltar dge slong de dag yang dang yang mgron du byas pa'o //🔽rtag tu mgron du byas pa ni dge slong dag la yon bdag gis rtag tu mgron du byas shing bstabs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang mgron du byas pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni de ltar dge slong de dag yang dang yang mgron du byas pa'o // rtag tu mgron du byas pa ni dge slong dag la yon bdag gis rtag tu mgron du byas shing bstabs pa'o //
translated: Except when invited again and again means that if the monks are invited again and again, it is not a downfall.🔽If the monks are invited regularly, it means that the patrons have invited the monks regularly and served them.

original: de ni dus so zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de ni dus so zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: The proper time means the time when the monks are not on retreat.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
translated: The downfall means the three lower realms.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong la mi zhim pa'i zas shig bstabs pa las zhim po zhig bslangs na slong ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong la mi zhim pa'i zas shig bstabs pa las zhim po zhig bslangs na slong ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk is served unappetizing food and asks for something appetizing, it is a fault to ask.

original: zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats it, it is a downfall.

original: dge slong la zhim po zhig bstabs pa las mi zhim pa zhig bslangs pa ni nyes so //
analyzed: dge slong la zhim po zhig bstabs pa las mi zhim pa zhig bslangs pa ni nyes so //
translated: If a monk is served appetizing food and asks for unappetizing food, it is a fault.

original: zos na nyes med do //
analyzed: zos na nyes med do //
translated: If he eats it, there is no fault.

original: ci 'dod ces bstabs pa las bslangs pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: ci 'dod ces bstabs pa las bslangs pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If he is served whatever is available and asks for something else, there is no fault.

original: dge slong gis dge slong la bslab pa 'di la slobs shig ces bsgo ba las bslab pa 'di la mi slob po zhes pa'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste /🔽sngon chad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos dge slong pha dang ma rnams kyi spyir @126a * //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la bslab pa 'di la slobs shig ces bsgo ba las bslab pa 'di la mi slob po zhes pa'i gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste / sngon chad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos dge slong pha dang ma rnams kyi spyir @126a * //
translated: The basis for the statement, “The monk should not be told, ‘Train in this precept,’ but ‘Do not train in this precept,’” is in Rājagṛha.

original: 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa na spyir bsogs nas tshogs pa la 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa na spyir bsogs nas tshogs pa la 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Previously, when the Blessed One established the basis for training in the vinaya for the general body of śrāvaka monks and nuns, he established the basis for training in the vinaya for the general assembly.

original: zla ba bzhir mgron du gnyer ba las 'dar mi gnang ba las /
analyzed: zla ba bzhir mgron du gnyer ba las 'dar mi gnang ba las /
translated: He did not allow them to be invited for four months.

original: dge 'dun sde gnyis phyir 'phya ba yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun sde gnyis phyir 'phya ba yin te /
translated: The two groups of saṅgha criticized each other.

original: bslab pa 'di la 'phya ba'i tshe dge slong rnams ma 'dus nas bsgor 'gro ba'i tshe drug sde la bsgo na /
analyzed: bslab pa 'di la 'phya ba'i tshe dge slong rnams ma 'dus nas bsgor 'gro ba'i tshe drug sde la bsgo na /
translated: When they criticized this precept, the monks did not assemble. When they went to tell the group of six,

original: glen pa khyod kyi tshig gis ded mi slob po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: glen pa khyod kyi tshig gis ded mi slob po zhes zer ro //
translated: they said, “You fools! We will not train in your words.”

original: de nas dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde la bsgo na yang mi slob po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde la bsgo na yang mi slob po zhes zer ro //
translated: Then when they told the group of twelve nuns, they said, “We will not train.”

original: skye dgu'i bdag mo goo ta m'i la bsgo na /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag mo goo ta m'i la bsgo na /
translated: The Blessed One said, If you order the mother of all living beings, Gautami,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ni gus par spyi bos nod do zhes mnos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ni gus par spyi bos nod do zhes mnos so //
translated: to do so, she will respectfully accept the Blessed One's word on her head.

original: lam bstan phyir 'khor nas kun dga' bos bsgo'am zhes dris nas /
analyzed: lam bstan phyir 'khor nas kun dga' bos bsgo'am zhes dris nas /
translated: When asked, Did you order the assembly to teach the path?

original: bsgo ni bsgo na glen pa'i mi zhes khur blangs so //
analyzed: bsgo ni bsgo na glen pa'i mi zhes khur blangs so //
translated: he said, I ordered her, but she said, 'You are a fool.'🔽When asked, What is wrong?

original: ci nyes zhes smras na drug sde dang bcu gnyis sde ni glen pa khyod kyi tshig gis slobs shig pa ni mi nyan to zhes 'dzer to //🔽de skad zar ba dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: ci nyes zhes smras na drug sde dang bcu gnyis sde ni glen pa khyod kyi tshig gis slobs shig pa ni mi nyan to zhes 'dzer to // de skad zar ba dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: the group of six and the group of twelve said, We will not listen to the words of a fool like you.

original: drug sde rnams la bkas smad de /
analyzed: drug sde rnams la bkas smad de /
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One, who reprimanded the group of six.

original: de skad smrar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de skad smrar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: He did not allow them to say such things and established a training rule in the Monastic Code.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: A monk means a monk from the group of six, and so on.

original: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: The monks means those who have entered this Dharma.

original: bslab pa 'di la slobs shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bslab pa 'di la slobs shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Train in this training means

original: phyis bslab par bya ba'i chos de la byas te slobs shig par bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: phyis bslab par bya ba'i chos de la byas te slobs shig par bsgo ba'o //
translated: The latter is the Dharma that is to be learned, and the order is to learn it.

original: byis pa mi mkhas zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: byis pa mi mkhas zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The phrase foolish, unskilled means unclear.

original: mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo mi shes /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo mi shes /
translated: The phrase unskilled means not knowing the sūtras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā.

original: nyes pa ni bslab pa 'di la slobs shig ces bsgo ba las byis pa mi mkhas mi gsal ba zhes zer zhing slob tu mi btub na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bslab pa 'di la slobs shig ces bsgo ba las byis pa mi mkhas mi gsal ba zhes zer zhing slob tu mi btub na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is that if one says, Learn this training, and the other replies, Foolish, unskilled, unclear, and does not submit to learning, then there is a downfall in all cases.

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i chos kyis slobs shig par bsgo ba las mi nyan na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i chos kyis slobs shig par bsgo ba las mi nyan na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one does not listen to the order to learn by means of the Dharma that is in accord with the vinaya, then there is a downfall.

original: mdo dang ma mo lta bus bsgo ba las mi nyan na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdo dang ma mo lta bus bsgo ba las mi nyan na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not listen to the order to learn by means of the sūtras and the mātṛkā, then there is an offense.

original: glen zhing mi mkhas pa byis pa lta bu ni nyes med do //
analyzed: glen zhing mi mkhas pa byis pa lta bu ni nyes med do //
translated: If one is stupid, unskilled, and like a child, then there is no offense.

original: dge slong 'thab mo byed pa la nyen du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'thab mo byed pa la nyen du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule not to allow quarrelsome monks to stay in the same place was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong drug sde po rnams sde zhig nas cang mi smra bar 'khod pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: dge slong drug sde po rnams sde zhig nas cang mi smra bar 'khod pa'i tshe na /
translated: When the group of six monks were defeated, they sat in silence.

original: bcu bdun sde rnams dar te kha cig ni mdo sde 'dzin kha cig ni 'dul ba 'dzin kha cig ni ma mo 'dzin to //
analyzed: bcu bdun sde rnams dar te kha cig ni mdo sde 'dzin kha cig ni 'dul ba 'dzin kha cig ni ma mo 'dzin to //
translated: The group of seventeen prospered. Some of them became holders of the sutras, some of them became holders of the vinaya, and some of them became holders of the mātṛkā.🔽They discussed among themselves, “No one has ever harmed us as much as the group of six has.

original: de dag nang bgros pas bdag cag la drug sdes gtses pa ltar sus kyang ma gtses de'i nang nas yang bsnyen dga' bos gtses kyis /
analyzed: de dag nang bgros pas bdag cag la drug sdes gtses pa ltar sus kyang ma gtses de'i nang nas yang bsnyen dga' bos gtses kyis /
translated: Among them, Upāli has harmed us the most.

original: bsnyen dga' bo @126b spang ba'i las bya'o zhes gros byed pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo yang 'jab cing nyan te /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bo @126b spang ba'i las bya'o zhes gros byed pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo yang 'jab cing nyan te /
translated: We should perform a procedure of banishing Upāli.”

original: de dag khang pa'i nang na gros byed na bsnyen dga' bo yang sgo na nyan /
analyzed: de dag khang pa'i nang na gros byed na bsnyen dga' bo yang sgo na nyan /
translated: When they discussed this in the house, Upāli listened at the door.

original: gtsug lag khang du gros byed na skar khung na nyan pa dang / de dag gros byed pa bsnyen dga' bos thos nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du gros byed na skar khung na nyan pa dang / de dag gros byed pa bsnyen dga' bos thos nas /
translated: When they discussed it in the temple, he listened through a window.

original: khyed 'dra bas nga la spang ba las glang po che bcings pas ni glang po che gsod nus kyis /
analyzed: khyed 'dra bas nga la spang ba las glang po che bcings pas ni glang po che gsod nus kyis /
translated: When Upāli heard their discussion, he said, “You are like those who, instead of killing an elephant by binding it, kill a mosquito.

original: gres thag gis ni glang po che bcing bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gres thag gis ni glang po che bcing bar mi nus te /
translated: The elephant trainer said, An elephant cannot be bound with a rope.

original: btang na ni btang du zad mi btang na nan thur cher bya'o zhes byas pa dang / de dag gis kyang spang ma nus nas nged gros byed pa khyed ji ltar thos zhes byas pa dang / ci'i phyir dge slong 'jab cing nyan ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas bkas smad de nyan du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: btang na ni btang du zad mi btang na nan thur cher bya'o zhes byas pa dang / de dag gis kyang spang ma nus nas nged gros byed pa khyed ji ltar thos zhes byas pa dang / ci'i phyir dge slong 'jab cing nyan ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas bkas smad de nyan du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: If you let it go, it will just go away. If you don't let it go, you must be very persistent. They also could not stop it. They said, How did you hear that we were discussing this? He said, Why are you slandering the monks by listening and hearing secretly? He was reprimanded and it was not allowed to listen.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
translated: The one who is called a certain monk is Nanda.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Others are similar to him.

original: dge slong rnams zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who is called the monks is those who have entered this Dharma.

original: 'thab pa dang rtsod pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs tha dad du 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa dang rtsod pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs tha dad du 'khod pa'o //
translated: It is said, There will be disputes, arguments, and disagreements, meaning that their own positions and others' positions are set apart.

original: cang mi smra bar bzhabs te nyan cing 'dug ces bya ba ni cang mi zer bar 'jab pa'o //
analyzed: cang mi smra bar bzhabs te nyan cing 'dug ces bya ba ni cang mi zer bar 'jab pa'o //
translated: It is said, Sitting silently, listening, meaning sitting silently and listening.

original: de dag ci zer nyan nas de lta de lta bur sta gon bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga nas bsams shing sbyar ro snyam mo //
analyzed: de dag ci zer nyan nas de lta de lta bur sta gon bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga nas bsams shing sbyar ro snyam mo //
translated: Having listened to what they say, one should prepare oneself in such and such a way. This is what is meant by having previously considered and applied oneself.

original: rkyen de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase just that condition means no other.

analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o // nyes pa ni dge slong bar khang ngam sgo khang ngam /
translated: The phrase downfall into the lower realms means into the three lower realms.

original: khyams sam dga'am yang thog kyang rung ste /
analyzed: khyams sam dga'am yang thog kyang rung ste /
translated: The phrase offense means whether in the monks' quarters, in the gateway, in the courtyard, in the assembly hall, or on the roof of the monastery,

original: dge slong gros byed pa mthong na /
analyzed: dge slong gros byed pa mthong na /
translated: if a monk sees other monks discussing something,🔽that monk should make a noise with his feet or snap his fingers, or make a noise by clearing his throat.

original: dge slong des rkang pa'i sgra'am se gol gyi sgra gtogs shig / yang na mgul pa bsal ba'i sgra phyung shig / se gol dang / mgul pa bsal ba'i sgra ma phyung la de dag gi sgra thos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong des rkang pa'i sgra'am se gol gyi sgra gtogs shig / yang na mgul pa bsal ba'i sgra phyung shig / se gol dang / mgul pa bsal ba'i sgra ma phyung la de dag gi sgra thos na nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not make a noise with his feet or clear his throat, but the other monks hear him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: don khong du chud na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don khong du chud na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they understand the meaning, he commits a serious offense.

original: 'khrugs par bya ba ma yin la zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'ong ba ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'khrugs par bya ba ma yin la zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'ong ba ni ltung ba med do //

analyzed: dge slong gros byed pa las cang mi smra bar 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the rule that a monk who is discussing something should not leave without permission was in Śrāvastī.🔽At that time, Nanda and Upananda were sitting in the midst of the saṅgha.

original: de'i tshe drug sde po las dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo gnyis dge 'dun gyi nang na 'dug pa dang / bcu bdun sde la sngan chad gtses pas /

analyzed: bsnyen dga' bo bcu bdun sdes spangs pa'i las byas na /

analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong mang zhig 'dun khang du 'dus nas /

analyzed: zhes dge slong dag rtsod pa zhi ba'i las byed pa'i tshe /
