analyzed: ba lang nyal gyi bu dge slong nag po zhes bya ba dge 'dun chos bzhin du smra ba la nyan du mi btub /
translated: the monk named Kāla, the son of a cowherd, was not willing to listen to the Saṅgha speaking in accordance with the Dharma.

original: kho bo 'ba' zhig gis dge 'dun la las byar rung ngo zhes bzlog / dge 'dun gyis chos bzhin ma byas so zhes kha ngan zer /
analyzed: kho bo 'ba' zhig gis dge 'dun la las byar rung ngo zhes bzlog / dge 'dun gyis chos bzhin ma byas so zhes kha ngan zer /
translated: The Sangha said, You do not act in accordance with the doctrine.🔽 When other learned monks advised him, he interrupted them before they had finished speaking.🔽 When they would not listen, he said, You are not respectful.

original: dge slong mkhas pa gzhan dag gis bsgo na yang tshig ma rdzogs par slar bzlog / nyan du mi btub na gus par mi byed pas na don nyung ngu ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas nag po la bkas smad nas mi gus su
analyzed: dge slong mkhas pa gzhan dag gis bsgo na yang tshig ma rdzogs par slar bzlog / nyan du mi btub na gus par mi byed pas na don nyung ngu ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas nag po la bkas smad nas mi gus su
translated: Because he was a monk with few concerns, they scolded him, saying, You are a troublemaker.🔽 The Buddha reprimanded him and said, You are not respectful.

original: mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: He established a training rule for the Sangha.

original: mi gus zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi gus zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Not being respectful is of two types:

original: dge 'dun dang gang zag la'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dang gang zag la'o //
translated: not being respectful to the Sangha and not being respectful to individuals.

original: de la dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun te /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun te /
translated: The Sangha is the community of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: de dag gis bsgo ba la mi nyan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bsgo ba la mi nyan pa'o //
translated: Not listening to their advice is not being respectful to the Sangha.

original: gang zag ni slob dpon dang mkhan pos bsgo ba las mi nyan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni slob dpon dang mkhan pos bsgo ba las mi nyan pa'o //
translated: Not listening to the advice of a preceptor or teacher is not being respectful to individuals.

original: de la nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi las byed pas 'dug shig ces bsgo ba las mi 'dug na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de la nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi las byed pas 'dug shig ces bsgo ba las mi 'dug na ltung ba'o //
translated: The fault is that if one does not sit when ordered to do so by the one who is doing the act of the community, there is a downfall.

original: song shig bsgo ba @127b las 'dug na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: song shig bsgo ba @127b las 'dug na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one sits when ordered to go, there is a downfall.

original: gnas khang dang mal cha ma len cig ces bsgo ba las len na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas khang dang mal cha ma len cig ces bsgo ba las len na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes a dwelling place and bedding when ordered not to do so, there is a downfall.

original: ji ltar las khyed pas bsgo ba la ma gus pa bzhin du slob dpon dang / mkhan po la ma gus na yang nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar las khyed pas bsgo ba la ma gus pa bzhin du slob dpon dang / mkhan po la ma gus na yang nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as there is a downfall for not respecting the order of the one who is doing the act, so there is a minor offense for not respecting the order of the preceptor and the master.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
translated: The downfall is in the three lower realms.

original: chang 'thung du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: chang 'thung du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the prohibition against drinking alcohol took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na yul sbal dkar can na khyim bdag rtogs ldan zhes bya ba zhig yod de de la bu chung zhig btsas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul sbal dkar can na khyim bdag rtogs ldan zhes bya ba zhig yod de de la bu chung zhig btsas te /
translated: At that time, in the country of Pañcāla, there was a householder named Pañcaśika. He had a young son.

original: khye'u'i ming yang legs 'ongs su btags so //
analyzed: khye'u'i ming yang legs 'ongs su btags so //
translated: The child was named Supuṣpacandra.

original: nam legs 'ongs btsas pa'i tshe na pha dang ma dang / gnyen bshes dang bran g-yog kun kyang dus las 'das te /
analyzed: nam legs 'ongs btsas pa'i tshe na pha dang ma dang / gnyen bshes dang bran g-yog kun kyang dus las 'das te /
translated: When he was born, his father, mother, relatives, and servants all died.

original: kha cig ni bros nor phyugs dang longs spyod dag kyang 'gribs te med par gyur to //
analyzed: kha cig ni bros nor phyugs dang longs spyod dag kyang 'gribs te med par gyur to //
translated: Some ran away, and his wealth and possessions dwindled and disappeared.

original: legs 'ongs yang mu to ba byed de slong mo spyod pa'i tshe mu to ba gzhan rnams kyis kyang mi 'dod cing brdegs so //
analyzed: legs 'ongs yang mu to ba byed de slong mo spyod pa'i tshe mu to ba gzhan rnams kyis kyang mi 'dod cing brdegs so //
translated: Supriya became a beggar. When he went begging, the other beggars did not want him and beat him.

original: de yang 'khyams 'khyams pa las sangs rgyas dang phrad de /
analyzed: de yang 'khyams 'khyams pa las sangs rgyas dang phrad de /
translated: He wandered around and around until he met the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lhung bzed kyi lhag ma yang byin /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lhung bzed kyi lhag ma yang byin /
translated: The Blessed One gave him the remainder of his begging bowl.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang rab tu phyung ngo //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang rab tu phyung ngo //
translated: He was also ordained in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de yang 'bad btson pas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de yang 'bad btson pas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: He also attained arhatship through striving and exertion.

original: de'i tshe na yul sbal dkar can na klu aam bha zhes bya ba mu stegs can yul te phyogs kyi skye bo mang po la gtse zhing gnod pa mi sha za ba zhig gnas pa de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul sbal dkar can na klu aam bha zhes bya ba mu stegs can yul te phyogs kyi skye bo mang po la gtse zhing gnod pa mi sha za ba zhig gnas pa de /
translated: At that time, in the land of Pañcāla, there was a nāga named Ambha who was a tīrthika. He harmed and injured many people in the region and ate human flesh.

original: thul cig par legs 'ongs la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: thul cig par legs 'ongs la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas /
translated: bhūti, Subdue him!🔽Since Su-bhūti subdued that nāga, the Blessed One went to that country in order to spread the fame of Su-bhūti's good qualities in his own country.

original: legs 'ongs kyis kyang klu de btul bas na yul phyogs rang gi yul du legs 'ongs kyi yon tan grags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das legs 'ongs dang / yul de phyogs su gshegs pa dang yul de'i bram ze dang skye bo mang pos /
analyzed: legs 'ongs kyis kyang klu de btul bas na yul phyogs rang gi yul du legs 'ongs kyi yon tan grags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das legs 'ongs dang / yul de phyogs su gshegs pa dang yul de'i bram ze dang skye bo mang pos /
translated: The brahmins and many people of that country

original: bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa la bshos gsol te tshim par byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa la bshos gsol te tshim par byas so //
translated: offered food to the Blessed One and so forth, and satisfied them.

original: legs 'ongs kyi pha dang mdza' ba'i bram ze zhig gis zan byin nas /
analyzed: legs 'ongs kyi pha dang mdza' ba'i bram ze zhig gis zan byin nas /
translated: A brahmin who was a friend of Su-bhūti's father gave him food.

original: zan zhu bar bya ba'i phyir glang po la blud pa'i chang gi nang du mdzub mos smyugs te phabs dang bsres pa byin pas na de yang srang gi grib ma yol gyi bar du sa la ma 'gyel to //
analyzed: zan zhu bar bya ba'i phyir glang po la blud pa'i chang gi nang du mdzub mos smyugs te phabs dang bsres pa byin pas na de yang srang gi grib ma yol gyi bar du sa la ma 'gyel to //
translated: In order to digest the food, he mixed yeast with beer and poured it into an elephant's trunk, and gave it to him. Even though the sun's shadow had passed, he did not fall to the ground.

original: nam grib ma med de thang la byung ba de na nyi mas lus la phog pa dang chang gi mthus sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: nam grib ma med de thang la byung ba de na nyi mas lus la phog pa dang chang gi mthus sa la 'gyel to //
translated: When the sun's shadow was gone and he was on the plain, the beer's potency caused him to fall to the ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lo ma'i spyil bo zhig byas te de'i steng du bzhag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lo ma'i spyil bo zhig byas te de'i steng du bzhag go //
translated: The Blessed One made a hut of leaves and placed it on top.

original: 'khor gyi dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said to the monks in the retinue:

original: dge slong legs 'ongs klu aam bha 'dul nus @128a * //
analyzed: dge slong legs 'ongs klu aam bha 'dul nus @128a * //
translated: The monk Supāraga is able to tame the nāga Ambha,🔽but he is not able to tame the snake and frog there.🔽After he was summoned, the Blessed One asked, What is wrong with you? He replied, I was careless.

original: pa da der sbrul gyi phru gu dang sbal pa yang 'dul mi nus so zhes nas legs 'ongs bslangs nas khyod ci nyes zhes bka' stsal pa dang / bdag ni ma brtags pas so zhes gsol pa dang / de bas na dge slong dag nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa ni chang 'thungs pa las gyur pas na /
analyzed: pa da der sbrul gyi phru gu dang sbal pa yang 'dul mi nus so zhes nas legs 'ongs bslangs nas khyod ci nyes zhes bka' stsal pa dang / bdag ni ma brtags pas so zhes gsol pa dang / de bas na dge slong dag nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa ni chang 'thungs pa las gyur pas na /
translated: Therefore, monks, since the cause of faults arises from drinking alcohol,

original: dge slong chang 'thung du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong chang 'thung du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: monks are not allowed to drink alcohol. A rule of training in the Vinaya was established.

original: 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni 'bru las gyur pa dang phye las gyur pa ste phabs dang bsres pa'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni 'bru las gyur pa dang phye las gyur pa ste phabs dang bsres pa'o //
translated: Alcohol made from grain means that made from grain or flour, mixed with yeast.

original: 'bras bu'i chang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba las gyur pa dang / sdong bu las gyur pa dang / me tog dang lo ma las gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i chang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba las gyur pa dang / sdong bu las gyur pa dang / me tog dang lo ma las gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i chang zhes bya'o //
translated: “Fruit wine” means that which is made from roots, stems, flowers, and leaves.

original: 'thung ba zhes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
analyzed: 'thung ba zhes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
translated: “To drink” means to swallow it.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
translated: “To fall” means to fall into the three lower realms.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis chang gi kha dog dang / chang gi dri dang chang gi khu ba 'thungs te myos par gyur na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis chang gi kha dog dang / chang gi dri dang chang gi khu ba 'thungs te myos par gyur na ltung ba'o //
translated: “To commit a downfall” means that if a monk drinks the color, smell, or essence of alcohol, he will commit a downfall.

original: ma smyos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma smyos na nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not become intoxicated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis 'bras bu'i chang gi dri dang chang gi khu ba 'thungs te myos par gyur na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis 'bras bu'i chang gi dri dang chang gi khu ba 'thungs te myos par gyur na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk drinks the smell or essence of fruit wine, he will commit a downfall.

original: myos par ma gyur na nyes byas so //
analyzed: myos par ma gyur na nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not become intoxicated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chang gi kha dog lta bu dang / tsha lta bu la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chang gi kha dog lta bu dang / tsha lta bu la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the color or smell of alcohol is similar to alcohol.

original: chang gi snyigs ma dang gar po 'thungs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chang gi snyigs ma dang gar po 'thungs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he drinks the dregs or the lees of alcohol, he commits a downfall.

original: phabs zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phabs zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats yeast, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong dus ma yin par grong du 'gro bar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong dus ma yin par grong du 'gro bar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the time when monks were not allowed to go to town at the wrong time took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag zhig la bu mo zhig yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag zhig la bu mo zhig yod de /
translated: At that time a certain householder had a daughter.

original: de yang pha'i phyi bzhin du 'brangs shing gtsug lag khang du song ba las /
analyzed: de yang pha'i phyi bzhin du 'brangs shing gtsug lag khang du song ba las /
translated: She followed her father and went to the monastery.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bu mo de bzung nas 'o byas pa las bu mos pha la sbran te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bu mo de bzung nas 'o byas pa las bu mos pha la sbran te /
translated: The venerable Udayī seized the girl and kissed her. The girl cried out to her father.

original: de gnyis kyis 'char kas mi tshangs par spyad pa skad du bram ze kun sbran nas /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis 'char kas mi tshangs par spyad pa skad du bram ze kun sbran nas /
translated: Both of them accused Udayī of sexual misconduct.

original: bram ze'i dmag gis bskor te /🔽'char ka rgyal po gsal rgyal dang / btsun mo'i gan du shags la khrid pa dang / rgyal pos btsun mo phreng ldan ma la 'char kas nyes sam ma nyes rtog tu bcug pa las /
analyzed: bram ze'i dmag gis bskor te / 'char ka rgyal po gsal rgyal dang / btsun mo'i gan du shags la khrid pa dang / rgyal pos btsun mo phreng ldan ma la 'char kas nyes sam ma nyes rtog tu bcug pa las /
translated: A group of brahmins surrounded him.🔽Udayī was taken to King Prasenajit and the queen to be judged. The king ordered Queen Mallikā to investigate whether Udayī was guilty or not.

original: btsum mo dang blon pos brtags na 'char kas ma nyes par gyur te /
analyzed: btsum mo dang blon pos brtags na 'char kas ma nyes par gyur te /
translated: When the queen and the ministers investigated, it turned out that Udayī was not guilty.

original: lhag ma tsam zhig byung bar zad pas bu mo dang / pha dang bram ze rnams ni 'phral la chad pas bcad do //
analyzed: lhag ma tsam zhig byung bar zad pas bu mo dang / pha dang bram ze rnams ni 'phral la chad pas bcad do //
translated: The rest of the people, the girl, the father, and the brahmans, were immediately punished.🔽The queen told Udayana, “From now on, it is not right for you to act so carelessly.”

original: btsun mos 'char ka la bsgo ba slan chad de lta bu'i bag med pa mdzad pa mi rigs so zhes bsgo ba dang / 'char ka yang de'i mdo la ngo tsha nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du 'gro ma nus te /
analyzed: btsun mos 'char ka la bsgo ba slan chad de lta bu'i bag med pa mdzad pa mi rigs so zhes bsgo ba dang / 'char ka yang de'i mdo la ngo tsha nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gan du 'gro ma nus te /
translated: Udayana was ashamed of his indiscretion and could not go before the Bhagavān.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i sras po'i gan du song nas sngar nyes pa byung @128b ba rnams bshags shing 'gyod de bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung yang nyes pa sha stag byung ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i sras po'i gan du song nas sngar nyes pa byung @128b ba rnams bshags shing 'gyod de bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung yang nyes pa sha stag byung ste /
translated: He went to the venerable Śāriputra and confessed his previous faults, feeling remorse. “I went forth in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, but I committed nothing but faults.

original: da ni 'khor bas skyo nas /
analyzed: da ni 'khor bas skyo nas /
translated: Now I am weary of saṃsāra.

original: da slan chad 'khor bar mi skye ba'i thabs cig gnang zhes gsol nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang 'char ba la chos bshad pas 'char kas kyang 'bad cing brtson pas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: da slan chad 'khor bar mi skye ba'i thabs cig gnang zhes gsol nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang 'char ba la chos bshad pas 'char kas kyang 'bad cing brtson pas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Then Venerable Śāriputra taught Dharma to Udayana, and Udayana made effort and actualized arhatship.

original: de nas 'char kas bsams pa bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' drin lan glan pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la 'gro'o snyam nas /
analyzed: de nas 'char kas bsams pa bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' drin lan glan pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la 'gro'o snyam nas /
translated: Then Udayana thought, In order to repay the kindness of the Bhagavān, I will go to benefit sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don mang zhig ni byas so //🔽dus phyi zhig na mnyan du yod pa na bud med gtum mo zhes bya ba zhig yod de de'i bu 'char ka dang mdza' bas rtag tu der 'gro zhing chos 'chad do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mang zhig ni byas so // dus phyi zhig na mnyan du yod pa na bud med gtum mo zhes bya ba zhig yod de de'i bu 'char ka dang mdza' bas rtag tu der 'gro zhing chos 'chad do //
translated: He did much to benefit sentient beings.🔽Later, in Śrāvastī there was a woman named Caṇḍakālī. Because her son Udayana and Udayana were friends, he always went there and taught Dharma.

original: phyi zhig na gtum mo'i bu yul gzhan du song ba'i 'og tu 'char ka yang de'i chung ma'i gan du 'gro zhing chos 'chad do //
analyzed: phyi zhig na gtum mo'i bu yul gzhan du song ba'i 'og tu 'char ka yang de'i chung ma'i gan du 'gro zhing chos 'chad do //
translated: Later, after Caṇḍakālī’s son had gone to another country, Udayana went to his wife and taught Dharma.

original: de'i chung ma de mi rgod dpon po dang nyal ba 'char kas tshor na khyo la byas su dogs pas na de sod cig ces mi rgod rbad na /
analyzed: de'i chung ma de mi rgod dpon po dang nyal ba 'char kas tshor na khyo la byas su dogs pas na de sod cig ces mi rgod rbad na /
translated: When Udayana saw that his wife was sleeping with the leader of the bandits, he thought, She will betray me to her husband, and he ordered the bandits to kill her.

original: mi rgod na re dge slong mthu dang ldan pa rgyal pos sras kyi thabs byin pas gsang du mi rung ngo zhes byas na /
analyzed: mi rgod na re dge slong mthu dang ldan pa rgyal pos sras kyi thabs byin pas gsang du mi rung ngo zhes byas na /
translated: The bandits said, This monk has great power. The king gave him his daughter in marriage. It is not right to kill her.

original: dgra bcom pa yang ma dgongs kyi bar du ye shes mthong ba mi 'jug ces zer gyis thabs shig bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yang ma dgongs kyi bar du ye shes mthong ba mi 'jug ces zer gyis thabs shig bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Udayana thought, It is said that arhats do not see things until they are enlightened. I will find a way to kill her.

original: mo na ba ltar byas te nyal ba dang / bran mo sbron du btang nas 'ongs pa dang sgo'i steng nas 'jab ste /
analyzed: mo na ba ltar byas te nyal ba dang / bran mo sbron du btang nas 'ongs pa dang sgo'i steng nas 'jab ste /
translated: He pretended to be sick and lay down. He sent for his servant and said, When she comes, sneak up on her from above the door.

original: ral gris 'char ka'i mgo bcad de bsad do //
analyzed: ral gris 'char ka'i mgo bcad de bsad do //
translated: Kill her with your sword!

original: de'i nub mo bco lnga'i gos sbyong la bab nas 'char ka ma 'dus te gar song zhes smra na /
analyzed: de'i nub mo bco lnga'i gos sbyong la bab nas 'char ka ma 'dus te gar song zhes smra na /
translated: That night was the fifteenth day of the month when the monks wash their robes. Udayana was not present. They asked, “Where is Udayana?”🔽“He has not come.” They did not investigate further.

original: khungs mi phyin te slad de nyid la bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas te 'char ka'i mgo phyag dar khung nas phyung ste /
analyzed: khungs mi phyin te slad de nyid la bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas te 'char ka'i mgo phyag dar khung nas phyung ste /
translated: Later, the Blessed One and his retinue came. Udayana’s head was pulled out of the dust heap by the Blessed One.

original: dge slong la nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa ni dus ma yin par grong du 'gro ba las byung ngo zhes nas /
analyzed: dge slong la nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa ni dus ma yin par grong du 'gro ba las byung ngo zhes nas /
translated: The monk’s offense was that he went to the village at the wrong time.

original: dus ma yin par grong du 'jug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dus ma yin par grong du 'jug tu mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, in order to train monks, laid down a training rule that prohibits going to the village at the wrong time.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means Śrīgupta and others like him.

original: dus ma yin zhes bya ba ni dus la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dus ma yin zhes bya ba ni dus la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “At the wrong time” means there are two times:

original: skya rengs ma shar ba dang nyi ma yol phan chad do //
analyzed: skya rengs ma shar ba dang nyi ma yol phan chad do //
translated: before dawn and after sunset.

original: grong zhes bya ba ni srang dang sum mdo dang bzhi mdo gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: grong zhes bya ba ni srang dang sum mdo dang bzhi mdo gang la yod pa'o //
translated: “Village” means a street, a crossroads, or a gathering place.

original: 'jug ces bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug ces bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: “To enter” means to go.

original: 'khod pa'i dge slong la smros shig ces bya ba ni gzhi na dge slong su 'khod pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'khod pa'i dge slong la smros shig ces bya ba ni gzhi na dge slong su 'khod pa rnams la'o //
translated: “Tell the monks who are staying there” means tell the monks who are staying in the place.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong gcig @129a * //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong gcig @129a * //
translated: “Except in special circumstances” means if a monk

original: cig lhung bzed dang chos gos grong du gtams pa la me thar te /
analyzed: cig lhung bzed dang chos gos grong du gtams pa la me thar te /
translated: leaves his alms bowl and Dharma robes in the village, and a fire breaks out.

original: chos gos dag mes tshig par gyur te / dge slong brel ba dang / dge slong nad pa dag sman grong du mi len pa dang / dge 'dun gyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad grong du mi tshol ba las thugs rjer dgongs te de lta bu'i phyir gnang nas gzhan ni ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: chos gos dag mes tshig par gyur te / dge slong brel ba dang / dge slong nad pa dag sman grong du mi len pa dang / dge 'dun gyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad grong du mi tshol ba las thugs rjer dgongs te de lta bu'i phyir gnang nas gzhan ni ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: The Buddha, out of compassion, allowed this for such reasons, but otherwise it is a downfall.

original: nyes pa dus ma yin pa la dus ma yin par 'du shes bzhin du 'gro na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dus ma yin pa la dus ma yin par 'du shes bzhin du 'gro na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the wrong time, and you perceive it as such, and you go out, it is a downfall.

original: the tshom na yang ngo //
analyzed: the tshom na yang ngo //
translated: If you are unsure of it, it is also a downfall.

original: dus yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes sam the tshom yang nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes sam the tshom yang nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the right time, but you perceive it as the wrong time, or are unsure of it, you have committed an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba brgyad cu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ltung ba brgyad cu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eighty-fourth downfall.

original: // / zas dang bcas pa'i snga rol du gud du 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: // / zas dang bcas pa'i snga rol du gud du 'gror mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the prohibition against going out separately before the meal is set out in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na bsnyen dga' bos khyim bdag gzhan zhig la chos bshad nas dad par byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bsnyen dga' bos khyim bdag gzhan zhig la chos bshad nas dad par byas te /
translated: At that time, Upāli explained the Dharma to another householder and inspired him with faith.

original: khyim bdag des bsnyen dga' bo'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la bshos gsol bar khas blangs nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag des bsnyen dga' bo'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la bshos gsol bar khas blangs nas /
translated: The householder agreed to offer a meal to the Buddha for the sake of Upasena.

original: dge 'dun bsnyen dga' bos spyan drangs nas nang par khyim du zhal ta byed du song pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos khyim bdag la nga ma 'ongs kyi bar du bshos ma 'drim par sdod cig ces byas nas grong gzhan du 'phyin du song ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun bsnyen dga' bos spyan drangs nas nang par khyim du zhal ta byed du song pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos khyim bdag la nga ma 'ongs kyi bar du bshos ma 'drim par sdod cig ces byas nas grong gzhan du 'phyin du song ngo //
translated: Upasena invited the Sangha, and when he went to the house to prepare the meal, he said to the householder, “Don’t serve the meal until I get there.” Then he went to another village.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa khyim der gshegs nas gdan la bzhugs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa khyim der gshegs nas gdan la bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One and his retinue went to the house and sat down.

original: zan brims shig ces byas na bsnyen dga' bo 'ongs sam zhes sam //
analyzed: zan brims shig ces byas na bsnyen dga' bo 'ongs sam zhes sam //
translated: “Serve the meal,” he said. “Has Upasena come?”

original: lan du mar byas kyang 'drim du ma btub nas kun dga' bo la brims shig ces bka' stsal nas kun dga' bos brims nas gdugs tshod yol nas /
analyzed: lan du mar byas kyang 'drim du ma btub nas kun dga' bo la brims shig ces bka' stsal nas kun dga' bos brims nas gdugs tshod yol nas /
translated: They did this several times, but no one dared to serve the meal. Finally the Blessed One said, “Serve the meal to Ānanda.” Ānanda served the meal, but by the time he was finished, it was past noon.

original: dge slong gnas brtan kha cig ni zan chad do //
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan kha cig ni zan chad do //
translated: Some of the senior monks had missed their meal.

original: kha cig ni 'drim bzhin du bcad de zad pa dang bsnyen dga' bo yang 'ongs nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'drim bzhin du bcad de zad pa dang bsnyen dga' bo yang 'ongs nas /
translated: Some were cut off while being distributed.🔽When Upasena came, the monks were remorseful. He asked the layman, “Why did you not distribute the food before?”

original: dge 'dun rnams kyis 'gyod pa dang / des kyang khyim bdag la sngar 'drim na ci nyes zhes bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag gis kyang khyod na re ma 'ongs kyi bar du ma 'drim shig ces mi zer ram zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo yang skyengs nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun rnams kyis 'gyod pa dang / des kyang khyim bdag la sngar 'drim na ci nyes zhes bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag gis kyang khyod na re ma 'ongs kyi bar du ma 'drim shig ces mi zer ram zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo yang skyengs nas /
translated: The layman replied, “Didn’t you say, ‘Do not distribute the food until I come’?”🔽Upasena was embarrassed.

original: dge slong gzhan dong yang phyi na khyim bdag gi khyim na thal byung 'dug go //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dong yang phyi na khyim bdag gi khyim na thal byung 'dug go //
translated: The other monks had gone, but the layman was still in the house.

original: de'i tshe gso sbyong gi dus la ba nas bsnyen dga' bo dad pa ma blangs par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gso sbyong gi dus la ba nas bsnyen dga' bo dad pa ma blangs par gyur te /
translated: At that time it was the day for the confession ceremony. Upasena did not take part in the ceremony.

original: dge 'dun rnams kyis de sdod sdod nas dge 'dun rnams kyang mi dga' par gyur te bsnyen dga' bos snga dro ni zas kyis mnar @129b to zhes dge slong dag mi snyen par zer ba snyen du bdas nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun rnams kyis de sdod sdod nas dge 'dun rnams kyang mi dga' par gyur te bsnyen dga' bos snga dro ni zas kyis mnar @129b to zhes dge slong dag mi snyen par zer ba snyen du bdas nas /
translated: The monks waited for him, and the monks became displeased. Upasena said, “The monks did not come because I said, ‘The morning was taken up with food.’”

original: phyin chad zas kyi snga rol dang / zas zos kyi 'og tu grong rgyu zhing 'gror mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
analyzed: phyin chad zas kyi snga rol dang / zas zos kyi 'og tu grong rgyu zhing 'gror mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so // yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste /
translated: He established the rule that henceforth they should not go to town before a meal or after a meal.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A certain monk” means Nanda, but it could also be someone else.

original: zas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gar bos pa'o //
analyzed: zas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gar bos pa'o //
translated: “With food” means with a meal.

original: khyim zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim mo //
analyzed: khyim zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim mo //
translated: “House” means the house of a brahman or householder.

original: mgron du bos zhes bya ba ni zas la'o //
analyzed: mgron du bos zhes bya ba ni zas la'o //
translated: “Invited” means invited for a meal.

original: zas kyi snga rol zhes bya ba ni snga dro ste khyim gnyis las 'das na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas kyi snga rol zhes bya ba ni snga dro ste khyim gnyis las 'das na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Before the meal” means in the morning. If he goes to two houses, he commits an offense.

original: zas zos kyi 'og ces bya ba ni phyi dro ste /
analyzed: zas zos kyi 'og ces bya ba ni phyi dro ste /
translated: “After the meal” means in the afternoon.

original: khyim gsum las 'das par gyur na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim gsum las 'das par gyur na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he goes to three houses, he commits an offense.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: “To go” means to go.

original: khyim pa 'dug pa la ma sgo zhes bya ba ni khyim de na khyim pa gang 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug pa la ma sgo zhes bya ba ni khyim de na khyim pa gang 'khod pa'o //
translated: “Without informing the householder” means without informing the householder who is present in the house.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as before.

original: rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong nad pa dang nad g-yogs dang zhal ta ba rnams ma 'byor par gyur pa las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong nad pa dang nad g-yogs dang zhal ta ba rnams ma 'byor par gyur pa las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The phrase except in the case of an emergency refers to the case where a monk is sick, or where the monk who is the attendant to the sick, or the monk who is the manager of the monastery, is absent.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen byung ba ni dus te gnang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen byung ba ni dus te gnang ngo //
translated: If such an emergency arises, then the time is right, and it is permitted.

original: nyes pa ni zas kyi sngon rol du khyim gnyis pa las 'das sam zas zos kyi 'og tu khyim gsum las 'das shing rgyu na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni zas kyi sngon rol du khyim gnyis pa las 'das sam zas zos kyi 'og tu khyim gsum las 'das shing rgyu na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is that if one goes to more than two houses before the meal, or to more than three houses after the meal, then one commits an offense.

original: mgron du ma bos pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: mgron du ma bos pa ni nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is invited.

original: dge slong rengs ma shar bar rin po che ma bsdus par rgyal po'i sgo gtan las 'dar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong rengs ma shar bar rin po che ma bsdus par rgyal po'i sgo gtan las 'dar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The story of the monk who was not allowed to cross the threshold of the king's palace took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi nu bo nag po dang / khyim bdag bzang sbyin la sangs rgyas kyis chos bshad pa'i tshe de dag ni chos mkhas pas yang nas yang du 'dri zhing lan gsol to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi nu bo nag po dang / khyim bdag bzang sbyin la sangs rgyas kyis chos bshad pa'i tshe de dag ni chos mkhas pas yang nas yang du 'dri zhing lan gsol to //
translated: At that time, when the Buddha was teaching the Dharma to King Prasenajit's brother Kāla and the householder Bhadradatta, they were skilled in the Dharma, so they asked questions again and again and gave answers.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal kyang der 'dus te 'dug go //
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal kyang der 'dus te 'dug go //
translated: King Prasenajit was also there.

original: rgyal po ni chos mi shes pas 'dri rtog kyang ma nus nas 'dug go //
analyzed: rgyal po ni chos mi shes pas 'dri rtog kyang ma nus nas 'dug go //
translated: The king, not knowing the Dharma, was unable to question them.

original: khyim bdag gnyis chos 'dri rtog pa la rgyal po yi rangs nas btsun mo la bzlas pa dang / rgyal pos kyang gsan par rigs so zhes byas pa dang / nga ni nyin par rgyal srid kyi bya bas brel gyi nub mo zhing khyed la nyan to //
analyzed: khyim bdag gnyis chos 'dri rtog pa la rgyal po yi rangs nas btsun mo la bzlas pa dang / rgyal pos kyang gsan par rigs so zhes byas pa dang / nga ni nyin par rgyal srid kyi bya bas brel gyi nub mo zhing khyed la nyan to //
translated: The two householders were very learned in the Dharma. The king was pleased and asked the queen to listen to them. The queen said, “The king is busy with his royal duties during the day. I will listen to them at night.”

original: zhes nas btsun mo na re bdag cag gis mnyan te /
analyzed: zhes nas btsun mo na re bdag cag gis mnyan te /
translated: The queen said, “We will listen.

original: rgyal po la gsol to zhes nas /
analyzed: rgyal po la gsol to zhes nas /
translated: We will request the king.”

original: phreng ldan ma'i slob dpon du ni 'char ka /
analyzed: phreng ldan ma'i slob dpon du ni 'char ka /
translated: The teacher of Mallikā was Udayana,

original: btsun mo dbyar byed kyi ni sh'a ri'i bu yis gsol nas de gnyis kyang slob dpon du gnang ngo //
analyzed: btsun mo dbyar byed kyi ni sh'a ri'i bu yis gsol nas de gnyis kyang slob dpon du gnang ngo //
translated: and the teacher of queen Ārtava was Śāriputra. They both agreed to be teachers.

original: der sh'a ri'i bu ni dus dus su 'gro'o //🔽'char ka ni bab bab tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: der sh'a ri'i bu ni dus dus su 'gro'o // 'char ka ni bab bab tu 'gro'o //
translated: Śāriputra went from time to time,🔽but Udayana went again and again.

original: dus gcig na rgyal po yul gzhan zhig tu 'gro ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na rgyal po yul gzhan zhig tu 'gro ste /
translated: One time the king went to another country.

original: nam ma langs par rta dang @130a * //🔽glang po che'i sgra dang skye bo mang po'i ca co thon pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni rmi lam na nam langs snyam nas btsun mo'i gan du nang du song ba dang / btsun mo nyal zhing rin po che'i sgron ma dang bcas pa'i gan du phyin nas se gol gyis bslangs pa dang /
analyzed: nam ma langs par rta dang @130a * // glang po che'i sgra dang skye bo mang po'i ca co thon pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ni rmi lam na nam langs snyam nas btsun mo'i gan du nang du song ba dang / btsun mo nyal zhing rin po che'i sgron ma dang bcas pa'i gan du phyin nas se gol gyis bslangs pa dang /
translated: Before dawn, the sounds of horses and elephants and the chatter of many people arose, and Venerable Udayī, thinking it was dawn, went to the queen’s quarters.🔽The queen was asleep, so he went to her and snapped his fingers to wake her up.

original: btsun mo yang brtabs bzhin du langs te gos brjes bzhin du zhu ba dang / lung 'bogs pa byas nas 'char ka'i lhung bzed zas kyis bkang ste byin nas 'char ka slar song ba dang / sh'a ri'i bu chur 'ongs pa dang gnyis lam du phrad nas /
analyzed: btsun mo yang brtabs bzhin du langs te gos brjes bzhin du zhu ba dang / lung 'bogs pa byas nas 'char ka'i lhung bzed zas kyis bkang ste byin nas 'char ka slar song ba dang / sh'a ri'i bu chur 'ongs pa dang gnyis lam du phrad nas /
translated: The queen jumped up in a fright and, while changing her clothes, requested instruction and was given it. Then she filled Udayī’s alms bowl with food and gave it to him. Udayī left, and Śāriputra came to get water. The two met on the road.

original: sh'a ri'i bus 'char ka la de lta bus kyang zag pa zad dam zhes byas nas 'char ka lha khang du phyin nas gar phyin ces dge slong gzhan dag gis dris na rgyal po'i pho brang du'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus 'char ka la de lta bus kyang zag pa zad dam zhes byas nas 'char ka lha khang du phyin nas gar phyin ces dge slong gzhan dag gis dris na rgyal po'i pho brang du'o //
translated: Śāriputra asked Udayin, Is it by such means that you have exhausted the impurities? Udayin went to the temple and when the other monks asked him where he had been, he said, To the king's palace.

original: ci tsam na phyin ces byas nas nam ma longs par ro //
analyzed: ci tsam na phyin ces byas nas nam ma longs par ro //
translated: They asked, How long were you there? and he replied, Until dawn.

original: 'o na de ltar dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / mi dbang yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / mi dbang yang rung ste /
translated: They asked, Did you enter by magic? and he replied, I did not enter by magic, but by the king's order.🔽 They asked, Did you take anything? and he replied, I did not take anything, but look at my alms-bowl!

original: lhung bzed gang ba ltos zhes bya pa dang / dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: lhung bzed gang ba ltos zhes bya pa dang / dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The monks criticized him, saying,

original: phyin chad nam ma langs rin po che'i sgron ma dang / sku srung gi mtshon cha ma bsdus par rgyal po'i sgo gtan las 'dar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: phyin chad nam ma langs rin po che'i sgron ma dang / sku srung gi mtshon cha ma bsdus par rgyal po'i sgo gtan las 'dar mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: From now on, you should not go to the king's palace before dawn, without a precious lamp and a bodyguard's weapon, and without permission to open the king's door.

original: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong zhes bya ba ni 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Again, a monk means Udayin, and so on.

original: nam ma langs zhes bya ba ni nam ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: nam ma langs zhes bya ba ni nam ma zad pa'o //
translated: Before dawn means before dawn.

original: skya rengs ma shar zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: skya rengs ma shar zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: The phrase before dawn means before the break of dawn.

original: skya rengs rnam pa gsum yod de yod de sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po'o //
analyzed: skya rengs rnam pa gsum yod de yod de sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po'o //
translated: There are three types of dawn: blue, yellow, and red.

original: skya rengs sngon po zhes bya ba ni dang po sngo bar snang ba'o //🔽de'i 'og tu ser bar snang ba ni skya rengs ser po'o //
analyzed: skya rengs sngon po zhes bya ba ni dang po sngo bar snang ba'o // de'i 'og tu ser bar snang ba ni skya rengs ser po'o //
translated: The blue dawn is the first appearance of light.🔽After that, the appearance of yellow is the yellow dawn.

original: de'i 'og tu yud tsam dmar bar snang ba ni skye rengs dmar po ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yud tsam dmar bar snang ba ni skye rengs dmar po ste /
translated: After that, the brief appearance of red is the red dawn.

original: skabs der ni dmar po nyid mtshan mar bzung ngo //🔽rin po che zhes bya ba ni nor rin po che dang bee d'urya dang / mu tig la sogs pa nyal ba la 'od snang bar byed pa ni rin po che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skabs der ni dmar po nyid mtshan mar bzung ngo // rin po che zhes bya ba ni nor rin po che dang bee d'urya dang / mu tig la sogs pa nyal ba la 'od snang bar byed pa ni rin po che zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, the red is taken as the sign.🔽The phrase precious refers to precious wealth, such as beryl, pearls, and so on, which shine when placed on a cushion.

original: rin po che lta bu zhes bya ba ni ral gri dang mda' dang / mdung dang / rol mo'i cha spyad thams cad dang / dgra cha'i mtshon cha thams cad ni rin po che lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che lta bu zhes bya ba ni ral gri dang mda' dang / mdung dang / rol mo'i cha spyad thams cad dang / dgra cha'i mtshon cha thams cad ni rin po che lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase like precious refers to swords, arrows, spears, all musical instruments, and all weapons, which are like precious things.

original: ma bsdus zhes bya ba ni de dag btsun srungs rnams kyis ma bsdus pa'o //🔽rgyal po rgya rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / bud med gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: ma bsdus zhes bya ba ni de dag btsun srungs rnams kyis ma bsdus pa'o // rgyal po rgya rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / bud med gang yang rung ste /
translated: “Not gathered” means that they are not gathered by those who guard the rules of the monastic community.

original: rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: “A king who is a member of the kṣatriya class and has been consecrated on the head” means a member of the kṣatriya class, the vaiśya class, the śūdra class, or a woman who has been consecrated with the royal consecration.

original: sgo gtan zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sgo gtan zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: “A door bolt” means one of three kinds:

original: rgyal po'i sgo'i gtan pa dang / btsun mo'i sgo'i gtan @130b pa dang grong khyer gyi sgo'i gtan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i sgo'i gtan pa dang / btsun mo'i sgo'i gtan @130b pa dang grong khyer gyi sgo'i gtan pa'o //
translated: the door bolt of the king’s palace, the door bolt of the queen’s palace, and the door bolt of the city.

original: rgyal po dang btsun mo'i sgo'i gtan pa las 'das na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dang btsun mo'i sgo'i gtan pa las 'das na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one passes the door bolt of the king’s palace or the door bolt of the queen’s palace, one commits an offense.

original: rgyal po dang btsun mo'i gnas su 'gro ba las grong khyer gyi sgo'i gtan pa las phar 'das na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dang btsun mo'i gnas su 'gro ba las grong khyer gyi sgo'i gtan pa las phar 'das na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one passes the door bolt of the city on the way to the king’s palace or the queen’s palace, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽“Except in extenuating circumstances” means in order to convert a king who lacks faith or a queen who lacks faith,

original: rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ma dad pa dang / btsun mo ma dad pa 'dul ba 'am /
analyzed: rkyen ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ma dad pa dang / btsun mo ma dad pa 'dul ba 'am /
translated: Except for the conditions means that the king or queen is to be disciplined if they are not faithful.

original: btsun mo dang blon pos bkug pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: btsun mo dang blon pos bkug pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for when summoned by the king or queen or a minister.

original: dge slong nam ma langs pa la langs par 'du shes pa dang / the tshom bzhin du rgyal po dang btsun mo'i sgo gtan la skya rengs ma shar bar 'das na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong nam ma langs pa la langs par 'du shes pa dang / the tshom bzhin du rgyal po dang btsun mo'i sgo gtan la skya rengs ma shar bar 'das na ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If the monk has the perception that it is dawn when it is not yet dawn, or if he has doubt, and he passes over the threshold of the king’s or queen’s door before dawn, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nam langs pa la ma langs par 'du shes pa dang / the tshom bzhin du 'das na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam langs pa la ma langs par 'du shes pa dang / the tshom bzhin du 'das na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is dawn, but he perceives it as not being dawn, or if he has doubt, and he passes over the threshold, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bar chad chen po brgyad kyis bskal te sgo'i gtan pa las 'das pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bar chad chen po brgyad kyis bskal te sgo'i gtan pa las 'das pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If he passes over the threshold because of a serious obstacle, there is no offense.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe gdod thos so zhes zer du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe gdod thos so zhes zer du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the rule that prohibits saying, “I just heard it at the time of the recitation of the Prātimokṣa” took place in Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa bshad par thon cig ces bka' stsal pas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa bshad par thon cig ces bka' stsal pas na /
translated: The Blessed One had instructed the monks to recite the Prātimokṣa every half month.

original: dge slong drug sde rnams so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dge slong drug sde rnams so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe /
translated: When the group of six monks recited the Prātimokṣa,

original: ri mor byas shing chos mi nyan bla mar mi byed sems ba tud cing rna ba blags te mi nyan pas /
analyzed: ri mor byas shing chos mi nyan bla mar mi byed sems ba tud cing rna ba blags te mi nyan pas /
translated: They did not listen to the Dharma, did not revere the guru, did not listen with a focused mind, and did not listen with ears pricked up.

original: slad kyis so sor thar pa 'don pa'i tshe drug sde dag na re tshig 'di dag so so thar pa las 'byung bar gdod shes zhes sngan chad ma thos pa skad zer na /
analyzed: slad kyis so sor thar pa 'don pa'i tshe drug sde dag na re tshig 'di dag so so thar pa las 'byung bar gdod shes zhes sngan chad ma thos pa skad zer na /
translated: Later, when they recited the pratimokṣa, the group of six said, “We only now know that these words are found in the pratimokṣa. We have never heard them before.”

original: dge slong dag na re sngon chad kyang gso sbyong gi sar lan ga nyis lan gsum gyi bar du 'dug na 'di dag ma thos zhes bya ba yang gus par nyan pa'i phyir ro zhes dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: dge slong dag na re sngon chad kyang gso sbyong gi sar lan ga nyis lan gsum gyi bar du 'dug na 'di dag ma thos zhes bya ba yang gus par nyan pa'i phyir ro zhes dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The monks said, “In the past, when they were present at the confession ceremony, they said, ‘We have not heard these words.’ This is because they did not listen respectfully.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dag ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dag ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: The monks criticized them, and the Blessed One rebuked them, saying, “Venerables, you have not found the essence.🔽You have not found it well.”

original: legs par ma rnyed pa'o zhes rnams grangs du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: legs par ma rnyed pa'o zhes rnams grangs du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: He censured them with many synonyms and established a rule for training in the vinaya.

original: yang dge slong gan zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gan zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” refers to the group of six and others like them.

original: zla ba phye phyed ces bya ba ni gso sbyong gi dus kyi tshe'o //🔽so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa'i chos bzhi nas /
analyzed: zla ba phye phyed ces bya ba ni gso sbyong gi dus kyi tshe'o // so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa'i chos bzhi nas /
translated: “At the time of the fortnightly confession” means at the time of the confession ceremony.

original: rtsod pa zhi ba'i bar du ltung ba ris lnga rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhi ba'i bar du ltung ba ris lnga rnams la bya'o //
translated: “The Prātimokṣa Sūtra” refers to the five classes of offenses, from the four defeats up to the rules for settling disputes.

original: mdo bshad pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bkod pa 'am mdo bshad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mdo bshad pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bkod pa 'am mdo bshad pa la bya'o //
translated: “The explanation of the sūtra” means the correct arrangement or explanation of the sūtra.

original: 'don pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: 'don pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsgrags pa'o //
translated: “When it is being recited” means when it is being proclaimed.

original: 'di skad zer ces bya ba ni smras pa'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis da gdod shes so @131a * //
analyzed: 'di skad zer ces bya ba ni smras pa'o // tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis da gdod shes so @131a * //
translated: “They say this” means they speak this.

original: zhes bya ba ni da lta la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni da lta la bya'o //
translated: “Venerable, I have just now understood” means “now.”

original: ji ltar chos 'di mdo'i nang du chud ces bya ba ni ji ltar chos 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i mdo'i nang du klag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chos 'di mdo'i nang du chud ces bya ba ni ji ltar chos 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i mdo'i nang du klag par bya'o //
translated: “How is this Dharma included in the sūtras?” means “How is this Dharma to be read in the sūtras spoken by the Blessed One?”

original: de ste de dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang de na 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: de ste de dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang de na 'khod pa'o //
translated: “If that monk” means any monk who is present there.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sngon 'di na 'dug ces bya ba ni de dag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sngon 'di na 'dug ces bya ba ni de dag gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The one who was called so-and-so in the past” refers to the one who was the monk in that life.

original: gso sbyong gi las lan gnyis lan gsum zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las lan gnyis lan gsum du ston pa'i tshe yod pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi las lan gnyis lan gsum zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las lan gnyis lan gsum du ston pa'i tshe yod pa'o //
translated: “The poṣadha ceremony is performed twice or three times” means that it is performed when the Prātimokṣa Sūtra is recited twice or three times.

original: mi shes pas thar par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi shes pas mi grol thar pa med pas na mi shes su mi rung ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi shes pas thar par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi shes pas mi grol thar pa med pas na mi shes su mi rung ba'i don to //
translated: “One does not become liberated through ignorance” means that one does not become liberated through ignorance, because there is no liberation through ignorance.

original: ltung ba ni sems can dmyal ba bar ro //
analyzed: ltung ba ni sems can dmyal ba bar ro //
translated: “A downfall” means a downfall to the hells.

original: chos la bsti stang dang ri mo dang gus par mi byed nas /
analyzed: chos la bsti stang dang ri mo dang gus par mi byed nas /
translated: “One does not respect, revere, and venerate the Dharma” means that one does not respect, revere, and venerate the Dharma.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo lan gnyis lan gsum du thos pa las phas pham pa nas rtsod pa zhi ba'i bar du gdod thos so //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo lan gnyis lan gsum du thos pa las phas pham pa nas rtsod pa zhi ba'i bar du gdod thos so //
translated: “One hears the Prātimokṣa Sūtra twice or three times” means that one hears it from the time of the defeating offenses up to the settling of disputes.

original: zhes smra na thams cad du ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes smra na thams cad du ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: “One says, ‘I have heard it all’” means that one says, “I have heard it all.”

original: mi shes yang dag pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mi shes yang dag pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: “One does not commit a downfall through ignorance” means that one does not commit a downfall through ignorance.

original: rva dang rus pa las khab ral byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: rva dang rus pa las khab ral byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The source story of the prohibition against making needles and awls from horns and bones is this.

original: de'i tshe na ba so dang rva 'dus pa'i khab ral mang du byas nas 'chang ba dge slong kun gyis kyang gla rngan nam zan byin pa ni med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na ba so dang rva 'dus pa'i khab ral mang du byas nas 'chang ba dge slong kun gyis kyang gla rngan nam zan byin pa ni med de /
translated: At that time, many needles and awls were made from a combination of ivory and horn. Although all the monks kept them, no one gave them wages or food.

original: kun gyis kyang bslangs pa zad par gyur te /
analyzed: kun gyis kyang bslangs pa zad par gyur te /
translated: Since everyone asked for them, they were used up.

original: rgyags zong med pas na dbul por gyur pas mu stegs can rnams ba so mkhan sngon nged la dad pa'i tshe ni phyug da ni sh'akya'i dge sbyong rnams la dad pas dbul por gyur to zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: rgyags zong med pas na dbul por gyur pas mu stegs can rnams ba so mkhan sngon nged la dad pa'i tshe ni phyug da ni sh'akya'i dge sbyong rnams la dad pas dbul por gyur to zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: Since they had no provisions, they became poor. The tīrthikas said, “When we had faith in ivory workers before, we were rich. Now we are poor because we have faith in the Śākya monks.”

original: mgu mi myong ba chog mi shes pa'o zhes bkas smad do //
analyzed: mgu mi myong ba chog mi shes pa'o zhes bkas smad do //
translated: They were scolded, “You are not satisfied. You are insatiable.”

original: rva las khab ral byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: rva las khab ral byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The prohibition against making needles and awls from horns is a rule for training in the vinaya.

original: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A monk” means many monks, and also others like them.

original: ba so zhes bya ba ni so nyid do //
analyzed: ba so zhes bya ba ni so nyid do //
translated: “A tooth” means a tooth itself.

original: khab ral zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: khab ral zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Needle and awl” means two things:

original: khag pa can dang dong bur can no //
analyzed: khag pa can dang dong bur can no //
translated: a needle and an awl.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: “To break” means to break by oneself or to have someone else break.

original: bcag nas zhes bya ba ni bcag pa'i 'og tu gdod ltung ba bshags pa'o //
analyzed: bcag nas zhes bya ba ni bcag pa'i 'og tu gdod ltung ba bshags pa'o //
translated: “Having broken” means having broken and then confessing the downfall.

original: ltung ba ni sems can dmyal bar ro //
analyzed: ltung ba ni sems can dmyal bar ro //
translated: “Downfall” means a hell being.🔽“In front of whom” means in front of whom the downfall is confessed.

original: gang gi mdun du ltung ba bshags pa des kyang khab ral khyod kyis bcag gam ma bcag ces dris shig ma dris par dngos po de bshags na bshags pa dang nyan pa gnyis ka nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du ltung ba bshags pa des kyang khab ral khyod kyis bcag gam ma bcag ces dris shig ma dris par dngos po de bshags na bshags pa dang nyan pa gnyis ka nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: “Should ask” means “Should ask, ‘Have you broken the needle and awl or not?’” If one confesses that thing without asking, then both the one who confesses and the one who listens commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba de yang bshags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba de yang bshags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That downfall also is not confessed.

original: khri'i rkang pa thung ngu dang ha cang ring po la nyal du mi gnang ba'i glang gzhi ni mnyan du yod @131b pa na ste /
analyzed: khri'i rkang pa thung ngu dang ha cang ring po la nyal du mi gnang ba'i glang gzhi ni mnyan du yod @131b pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against lying down on a bed with short or long legs is Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig khri rkang pa thung ngu zhig gi steng na 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig khri rkang pa thung ngu zhig gi steng na 'dug ste /
translated: At that time a monk who was an alms-goer was sitting on a bed with short legs.

original: rkang pa bkrus nas sgo khang gi grib ma la khri'i steng na bsam gtan byed cing 'dug pa dang / sbrul tsha bas gdungs pa zhig nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bkrus nas sgo khang gi grib ma la khri'i steng na bsam gtan byed cing 'dug pa dang / sbrul tsha bas gdungs pa zhig nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: A snake, tormented by the heat, came near,

original: chu'i nang na 'khyil zhing nyal ba dang dge slong lam gyis ngal bas khri'i steng na 'chag pa dang / khri 'tshigs pa'i sgras sbrul khros te /
analyzed: chu'i nang na 'khyil zhing nyal ba dang dge slong lam gyis ngal bas khri'i steng na 'chag pa dang / khri 'tshigs pa'i sgras sbrul khros te /
translated: and, as it was lying in the water, the monk, tired from his journey, walked on the bed. The noise of the bed breaking made the snake angry.

original: dge slong de'i dpral bar zin nas dge slong de yang dus las 'das te sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i khams su skyes so //
analyzed: dge slong de'i dpral bar zin nas dge slong de yang dus las 'das te sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i khams su skyes so //
translated: It seized the monk on the forehead, and the monk died. He was reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.🔽Because of this fault, the Buddha said, “Do not sleep on a bed with short legs.”🔽The group of six made a bed with twelve legs and slept on it, using a ladder to get up.

original: de lta bu'i nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa dang / khri'i rkang pa thung ngu la ma nyal cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sde rnams khri rkang pa bcu gnyis pa byas nas skas btsugs te nyal ba dang / de nyid nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur te slan chad khru gang las ring bar byed du mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur pa dang / khri'i rkang pa thung ngu la ma nyal cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / drug sde rnams khri rkang pa bcu gnyis pa byas nas skas btsugs te nyal ba dang / de nyid nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur te slan chad khru gang las ring bar byed du mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: Because of this fault, the Buddha prohibited beds longer than a cubit.

original: phyis 'char ka lus ring bas khri la dku rten bcas pa dang pus mo dang ko skor reg pas bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs te /
analyzed: phyis 'char ka lus ring bas khri la dku rten bcas pa dang pus mo dang ko skor reg pas bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs te /
translated: Later, because Udayi was tall, he put his elbows on the bed and his knees on the bed frame, and inserted himself into the hole.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad ces bya ba ni khru tshad ma gang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad ces bya ba ni khru tshad ma gang ngo //
translated: The expression eight finger-widths of the Sugata is one-fourth of a cubit.

original: khru gang gzhug pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni gnang ba'o //
analyzed: khru gang gzhug pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni gnang ba'o //
translated: The expression except for inserting one cubit is the allowance.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'o //
translated: The expression from that is the past.

original: bcad nas ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ring ba de bcad nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bcad nas ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ring ba de bcad nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: The expression having cut, confess the downfall means that having cut the long object, one should confess the downfall.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
translated: The expression downfall means the three lower rebirths.

original: gang gi mdun du bshags pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam ma bcad ces dris shig ma dris par byas na gnyi ga la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du bshags pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam ma bcad ces dris shig ma dris par byas na gnyi ga la nyes byas so //
translated: The expression Whoever confesses in front of you should ask, 'Have you cut that object or not?' means that if one does not ask, there is an offense of wrong conduct for both.

original: ltung ba de yang bshags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba de yang bshags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The expression that downfall is not confessed means that the downfall is not confessed.

original: dge 'dun gyi khri la shing bal brdal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri la shing bal brdal du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story of not allowing the spreading of cotton on a saṅgha bed is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge 'dun gyi mal stan bgos zin pa'i 'og tu de'i nub mo dge slong bsod snyoms pa rgan pa zhig glo bur du 'ongs pa des mal ma thob nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mal stan bgos zin pa'i 'og tu de'i nub mo dge slong bsod snyoms pa rgan pa zhig glo bur du 'ongs pa des mal ma thob nas /
translated: After the monks had distributed the bedding, a senior monk who was a beggar came unexpectedly that evening and did not get any bedding.🔽The senior monk Udayin said, “Give the bedding of the senior monk to the beggar.”

original: dge 'dun rnams kyi nang na bsnyen dga' bo gzhon pas na de'i mal stan bsod snyoms pa la byin cig ces byas pa dang / des ku re sbyar te khri g-yogs kyi nang tshangs shing bal bton te /
analyzed: dge 'dun rnams kyi nang na bsnyen dga' bo gzhon pas na de'i mal stan bsod snyoms pa la byin cig ces byas pa dang / des ku re sbyar te khri g-yogs kyi nang tshangs shing bal bton te /
translated: He joked, “Take out the cotton from the inside of the mattress.”

original: khri la brdal nas ras kyis g-yogs te bzhag go //
analyzed: khri la brdal nas ras kyis g-yogs te bzhag go //
translated: He spread it on the bed and covered it with a cloth.

original: nam sros pa dang ras bshus te /
analyzed: nam sros pa dang ras bshus te /
translated: When night fell, he removed the cloth.

original: nyal du bcug pas /
analyzed: nyal du bcug pas /
translated: He made the beggar lie down on it.

original: nang par lus kun shing bal gyis gos pa las dge slong gzhan rnams kyis khyod ci 'bras kyi yul na nyal nyal lam zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos de ltar @132a * //
analyzed: nang par lus kun shing bal gyis gos pa las dge slong gzhan rnams kyis khyod ci 'bras kyi yul na nyal nyal lam zhes byas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bos de ltar @132a * //
translated: In the morning, the beggar’s entire body was covered with cotton. The other monks said, “What did you sleep on in the land of cotton?”🔽Udayin said, “I was joking.”

original: ku re byas so zhes smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ste /
analyzed: ku re byas so zhes smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ste /
translated: The monks who had few concerns ridiculed him.

original: ci'i phyir dge 'dun gyi khri la shing bal brdal zhes mi snyan par 'dzer bsnyan du bdas nas dge slong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge 'dun gyi khri la shing bal brdal zhes mi snyan par 'dzer bsnyan du bdas nas dge slong gi bya ba ma yin zhes smad de /
translated: Why did you spread cotton on the saṅgha’s seat? ” and they reviled him, saying, “This is not the work of a monk.

original: khri la shing bal brdal du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: khri la shing bal brdal du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa bcas so //
translated: ” They did not allow the spreading of cotton on seats, and they added a training rule to the monastic code.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyan dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyan dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Any monk” means Śyenamati, and so on.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos so //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos so //
translated: “Saṅgha” means the Bhagavān’s disciples.

original: khri dang khri'u ni dngos su zad do //
analyzed: khri dang khri'u ni dngos su zad do //
translated: “Seats and benches” are self-explanatory.

original: shing bal ni rnam pa lnga po las gang rung ste ka sha dang / bu ka dang sha ma li dang / ka sha dang / bal ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: shing bal ni rnam pa lnga po las gang rung ste ka sha dang / bu ka dang sha ma li dang / ka sha dang / bal ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Cotton” is any of the five types: kaśa, bṛha, śāṇa, kṣauma, and wool.

original: bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol ba'o //
analyzed: bcug ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol ba'o //
translated: “To put” means to do it oneself or to have someone else do it.

original: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense is as before.

original: nyes pa gang gi mdun du bshags pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bsdus sam zhes dris shig / ma dris par bshags sam nyams su blangs na gnyig la nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes pa gang gi mdun du bshags pa des khyod kyis dngos po de bsdus sam zhes dris shig / ma dris par bshags sam nyams su blangs na gnyig la nyes byas so //
translated: If you confess or practice without asking, there is an offense for both of you.🔽Also, that downfall is not confessed, so confess it again.

original: ltung ba de yang ma bshags pa yin gyis slar shogs shig / gding ba tshad las lhag par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: ltung ba de yang ma bshags pa yin gyis slar shogs shig / gding ba tshad las lhag par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The basis for the prohibition against making a mat that exceeds the right size was in Śrāvastī.🔽The Blessed One said to the monks, “Make a mat according to the right size in order to make the saṅgha’s path good to walk on.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la gding ba dge 'dun gyi lam stan bzang bar bya ba'i phyir gding ba tshad bzhin du gyis shig ces bka' stsal ba dang / dge slong mang po rnams kyis tshad las 'das par byas pa dang don nyung ngu ba'i dge slong dag 'phya zhing mi snyan par zer bsnyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la gding ba dge 'dun gyi lam stan bzang bar bya ba'i phyir gding ba tshad bzhin du gyis shig ces bka' stsal ba dang / dge slong mang po rnams kyis tshad las 'das par byas pa dang don nyung ngu ba'i dge slong dag 'phya zhing mi snyan par zer bsnyan du bdas nas /
translated: Many monks made mats that exceeded the right size. Monks who had few desires criticized and complained and spread it about,

original: chog mi shes pa mgu mi myong ba zhes bkas smad de gding ba'i tshad srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa mgu mi myong ba zhes bkas smad de gding ba'i tshad srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do //
translated: The Blessed One criticized the monk Aśiṃṣa, saying, “You are insatiable and difficult to please.” He then established a rule:🔽“Make a sitting mat the length of two of the Sugata’s hand-spans and half a hand-span wide.”

original: zheng du mtho phyed dang do'i thang du gyis shig ces bslab pa bcas pa dang / phyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka po lus ring bas gding bas ma slebs nas mal steng nyes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir rkang pa logs su lo mas btud cing nyal ba /
analyzed: zheng du mtho phyed dang do'i thang du gyis shig ces bslab pa bcas pa dang / phyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka po lus ring bas gding bas ma slebs nas mal steng nyes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir rkang pa logs su lo mas btud cing nyal ba /
translated: Later, the venerable Udayī, who was tall, was unable to sit on the sitting mat. In order to avoid the fault of not having a sitting mat, he slept with his feet outside the monastery.

original: phyis bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang nyul ba'i tshe gzigs nas /
analyzed: phyis bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang nyul ba'i tshe gzigs nas /
translated: Later, when the Blessed One was inspecting the monastery, he saw this.

original: de ci yin zhes dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gding ba'i tshad sngar gnang bas 'char ka'i lus ring ste ma slebs so zhes gsol pa dang / de ltar na srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis srings shig par gnang ngo //
analyzed: de ci yin zhes dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gding ba'i tshad sngar gnang bas 'char ka'i lus ring ste ma slebs so zhes gsol pa dang / de ltar na srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis srings shig par gnang ngo //
translated: He asked, “What is this?” They replied, “The Blessed One previously allowed a sitting mat the length of two of the Sugata’s hand-spans. Since Udayī is tall, he is unable to sit on it.” The Blessed One said, “In that case, make it the length of two and a half of the Sugata’s hand-spans.”

original: gding ba zhes bya ba ni stan no //
analyzed: gding ba zhes bya ba ni stan no //
translated: A sitting mat is a mat.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po dang 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po dang 'char ka ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Monk” refers to a monk, or to Upāli, or to others like them.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gang gis byas kyang rung ste'o //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gang gis byas kyang rung ste'o //
translated: “To make” means to make oneself or to have someone else make.

original: tshad bzhin du byos shig ces bya ba ni gding @132b ba'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshad bzhin du byos shig ces bya ba ni gding @132b ba'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: “According to the right measurements” means that the right size for a sitting mat is this:

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do //🔽zheng du mtho phyed dang do'o //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho do // zheng du mtho phyed dang do'o //
translated: In length, it is the size of the Tathagata’s outstretched hand.🔽In width, it is half a handspan less than that.

original: srid du yang mtho gang gis snon cig /'di ni gding ba'i tshad do //
analyzed: srid du yang mtho gang gis snon cig /'di ni gding ba'i tshad do //
translated: In length, it is increased by a handspan. This is the right size for a sitting mat.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho zhes bya ba ni ston pa la bya ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho zhes bya ba ni ston pa la bya ste /
translated: “The Tathagata’s outstretched hand” refers to the Teacher.

original: de'i mtho do la khru tshad gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i mtho do la khru tshad gsum mo //
translated: His handspan is three cubits.

original: phyis mtho gang bsnan pas na de ltar srid du khru phyed dang lnga'o //
analyzed: phyis mtho gang bsnan pas na de ltar srid du khru phyed dang lnga'o //
translated: Since a handspan is added to that, in length it is four and a half cubits.

original: zheng zhes bya ba ni thad kar ro //
analyzed: zheng zhes bya ba ni thad kar ro //
translated: “In width” means across.

original: mtho phyed dang do zhes bya ba ni khru tshad ma do dang / sor drug go //
analyzed: mtho phyed dang do zhes bya ba ni khru tshad ma do dang / sor drug go //
translated: “Half a handspan less” means two cubits and six fingerbreadths.

original: de las lhag par byed ces bya ba ni tshad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par byed ces bya ba ni tshad las 'das pa'o //
translated: “To make one that is larger” means to make one that exceeds the right size.

original: bcad nas ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po bcad nas ltung ba phyis bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bcad nas ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po bcad nas ltung ba phyis bshags par bya'o //
translated: The downfall that is incurred by cutting off is a downfall that is incurred by cutting off a living thing. It is confessed later.
